[action] Exhaust Alchemical Transmutation, spend 1 charge: Test [willpower] (1). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 3). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, take 1 damage.
Name: Alchemical Transmutation

Description: Play a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] card from your hand, reducing its resource cost by 3.
Flavor:
The power seized her, made her shudder and spasm.
Its energy united with hers, and then,
she opened her eyes
Name: Uncage the Soul

Description: Move. Move to any revealed location and reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, you must discard an [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you control (if you cannot, take 1 damage).
Flavor: Extradimensional travel had its risks, he knew. But who could resist the frontiers beyond time and space?
Name: Astral Travel

Description: [free] During a skill test on a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Spirit Athame: You get +2 skill value for this test. [action] Exhaust Spirit Athame: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack.
Name: Spirit Athame

Description: [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. [action] Discard Lantern: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Lantern

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Gravedigger's Shovel: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: I knew I should have, but I couldn't stop digging.
Name: Gravedigger's Shovel

Description: Fast. Attach Hiding Spot to any location. Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at attached location gains aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if a ready enemy is at attached location: Discard Hiding Spot.
Flavor: One Mississippi, two Mississippi
Name: Hiding Spot

Description: If this skill test is successful, choose a [survivor] card not named Resourceful in your discard pile. Add the chosen card to your hand.
Name: Resourceful

Description: Revelation - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. That card gains surge.
Flavor: "Don't worry, I have this completely under control!"
Name: Overzealous

Description: Revelation - Put Drawing the Sign into play in your threat area. Your maximum hand size is reduced by 5. [action] [action]: Discard Drawing the Sign.
Name: Drawing the Sign

Description: Spawn - Location farthest from you. Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. Forced - When The Thing That Follows would be defeated: Instead shuffle it into its bearer's deck.
Flavor: To the ends of the earth, and back.
Name: The Thing That Follows

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you have 3 or more horror on you). [cultist] [tablet] [elder_thing]: -4. If your location has at least 1 horror on it, take 1 horror (from the token pool). If your location has no horror on it, place 1 horror on it instead.
Name: Curtain Call

Flavor: The theatre is eerily silent. The old wooden floor creaks beneath your feet, and a light rain gently patters on the roof as you explore the auditorium. There are more rotting corpses among the seats, and the rest of the crowd has vanished
Name: The Third Act

Description: Forced - After Royal Emissary is added to the victory display: Remove all doom from play and reset the agenda deck to agenda 1a. Then, place 3 doom on that agenda.
Flavor: The creatures song echoes relentlessly throughout the halls of the theatre. The melody repeats again and again, yet somehow, never the same note twice.
Name: Encore

Flavor: You pinch yourself to see if you are dreaming, and sure enough, your skin stings and reddens. You take a few deep breaths and try to think rationally. Whatever is going on, you must explore the theatre to learn the truth of thematter.
Name: Awakening

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from <u>The King in Yellow</u> might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from <u>The King in Yellow</u> might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from <u>The King in Yellow</u> might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: While The Man in the Pallid Mask is not in play, the Lobby gains: "[action]: Resign." Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 horror on each location with no horror that is connected to a location with horror. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: The Stranger must know the way out. You have to follow him!
Name: Curtain Call

Flavor: To say that the theatre is in disarray would be a profound understatement. The walls and seats, previously polished to a shine, are cracked and caked with dirt. The curtains are tattered, and the set is stained with old blood. You aren't sure what's worse: the smell of rot or the nagging feeling that you've been asleep for a very long time.
Name: Theatre

Description: Forced - When Lobby is revealed: Put 2 of the set-aside Lobby Doorway locations into play, at random. [action] [action]: Draw 3 cards.
Flavor: The wide doors that led to the streets of Arkham are somehow gone, as if they were never there.
Name: Lobby

Description: Forced - After you perform a move action during which you move from the Balcony to the Theatre: Take 2 damage.
Flavor: To your disappointment, the balcony sections are much like the ground floor below, although every now and then you think you spot a figure moving silently in the aisles.
Name: Balcony

Description: Forced - When Backstage is revealed: Put 2 of the set-aside Backstage Doorway locations into play, at random. While you are at Backstage, each hidden treachery in your hand counts as 3 cards instead of 1 for the purposes of counting your hand size.
Name: Backstage

Description: While you are in the Lighting Box, increase the resource cost of each card in your hand by 2.
Flavor: At the top of a narrow, claustrophobic staircase, you find the lighting crew's closet-like booth, stationed above the balcony. Expensive lighting equipment and several heavy spotlights dominate the cramped room.
Name: Lighting Box

Description: [action]: Gain 5 resources. Remember that you "stole from the box office." (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: Raindrops pelt your clothing as you step into the box office. It takes you a moment before you remember you purchased your ticket indoors, and you realize it is somehow raining through the roof of the hall.
Name: Box Office

Description: [action] Investigate. You get +3 [intellect] for this investigation. After this skill test ends, discard each card in your hand.
Flavor: This green room is supposed to be a relaxing lounge for tense performers, but you imagine anyone trying to find a moment's rest in this cluttered pigsty would come up shortchanged.
Name: Green Room

Description: [action] [action] [action]: Heal 3 horror.
Flavor: The cast's dressing room is filled with all manner of costumes and accessories, but it's the tattered yellow robe at the far end of the room that catches your attention. It looks too torn and disheveled to be worn, yet it is enticing all the same.
Name: Dressing Room

Description: Forced - After you succeed by 2 or more while investigating the Rehearsal Room: Take 1 horror.
Flavor: As you enter this room, silently confronting you is a giant symbol torn into the wallpaper. You cannot tell whether the wall was deliberately vandalized or the material peeled away in the strange pattern on its own.
Name: Rehearsal Room

Description: Forced - After you reveal the Trap Room: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy of Swarm of Rats and put it into play engaged with you (2 copies instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched.
Flavor: Clearly, nobody has cleaned out the prop area beneath the stage in months
Name: Trap Room

Description: Spawn - Location farthest from all investigators. Aloof. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets +2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, defeat The Man in the Pallid Mask.
Flavor:
"Indeed its time. We have all laid aside disguise but you." - Robert W. Chambers, "The Mask,"
The King in Yellow
Name: The Man in the Pallid Mask

Description: Prey - Lowest [willpower]. Massive. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Royal Emissary's location or a connecting location takes 1 horror.
Name: Royal Emissary

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on a [[Possessed]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -X. X is the shroud value of your location.
Name: The Last King

Flavor: As you pull up to the manor, you notice that something is wrong. A trail of blood leads up the porch steps, and the front door is smashed. Muted music comes from within the house, its warped and discordant notes painful to your ears. Has the madness of <u>The King in Yellow</u> already made its way here?
Name: Fashionably Late

Description: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and randomly resolve one of the Sickening Reality cards underneath the scenario reference card. If there are no cards underneath the scenario reference card, advance to agenda 2b instead.
Flavor: More and more, this place continues to fall into madness, transforming before your very eyes
Name: The Terrifying Truth

Description: Forced - When an investigator is eliminated (by defeat or resignation): Place each of that investigator's clues on this act, instead of placing them at his or her location. Objective - Find as many clues as you can, then get out of this awful place!
Flavor: This isnt a party: its a mad house. But for some reason, the guests are too deluded to notice. Very few of them are sane, and many are themselves horrors to your eye. Perhaps you can talk to them to learn more about <u>The King in Yellow</u>.
Name: Discovering the Truth

Description:
Hunter.
While Constance Dumaine is exhausted, she gets +3 fight.
Flavor: "What's wrong? Aren't you enjoying yourself?"
Name: Constance Dumaine

Description: Hunter. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: Heal 1 damage from Jordan Perry.
Flavor: Cigar smoke permeates the room, causing you to cough and wheeze.
Name: Jordan Perry

Description: Hunter. Forced - After you deal damage to Ishimaru Haruko by an effect other than an attack: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.
Flavor: "Doesn't this dress look gorgeous on me?"
Name: Ishimaru Haruko

Description:
Hunter. Retaliate.
Sebastien Moreau's attacks cannot be canceled.
Flavor: "Want to be in our next performance?"
Name: Sebastien Moreau

Description:
Hunter.
Each investigator at Ashleigh Clarke's location does not draw cards during the upkeep phase.
Flavor:
"Songs that the Hyades shall sing,
Where flap the tatters of the King,
Must died unheard in Dim Carcosa."
Name: Ashleigh Clarke

Description: [action]: Resign. Having found valuable information about the production, you depart and plan your next move. (If each undefeated investigator has resigned, proceed to "if no resolution was reached" in the Campaign Guide.)
Name: Foyer

Description: [reaction] After you perform a parley action in the Ballroom: Gain 2 resources. (Group limit once per phase.)
Flavor: Narrow yellow eyes watch the dancers hungrily from the darkness outside. When you try to warn the other guests, they smile politely, comment about wild animal sightings around Arkham, and go back to dancing.
Name: Ballroom

Description: [reaction] After you perform a parley action in the Living Room: Draw 1 card. (Group limit once per phase.)
Flavor: How many fireplaces does this place have?
Name: Living Room

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at the Gallery: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on the Gallery.
Flavor: Somehow, the guests in the gallery are still interested in the art on display, even though someone has vandalized all of the paintings and statues.
Name: Gallery

Description: Forced - After you enter the Courtyard: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, draw it.
Flavor: What was first a wave of relief upon exiting the manor turns to dread. Dozens of yellow eyes stare at you from the building's rooftops, and shapes loom in the clouds above.
Name: Courtyard

Description: [action]: Heal 1 horror. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, take 1 horror and place 1 doom on the Dining Room.
Flavor: The sight of the guests scarfing down the awful feast, mouthful after mouthful, makes your stomach turn.
Name: Dining Room

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to ask Constance about the play. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Constance Dumaine. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Constance Dumaine: Flip this card over and resolve its text.
Flavor: "Can I offer you a glass of champagne?"
Name: Constance Dumaine

Description: [action] If you have 10 or more resources: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to fraternize with Jordan. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Jordan Perry. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Jordan Perry: Flip this card over and resolve its text.
Flavor: Time is money, and Mr. Perry has all the time in the world.
Name: Jordan Perry

Description: [action] If you have 6 or more cards in your hand: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to question Haruko about the play. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Ishimaru Haruko. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Ishimaru Haruko: Flip this card over and resolve its text.
Flavor: "My, what a bold choice of dress."
Name: Ishimaru Haruko

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to get information about the production from Sebastien. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Sebastien Moreau. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Sebastien Moreau: Flip this card over and resolve its text.
Flavor: Hes a visionary, but you wouldnt want to be in his visions.
Name: Sebastien Moreau

Description: [action] [action]: Parley. You listen to Ashleigh perform. Take control of 1 of the clues on Ashleigh Clarke. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Ashleigh Clarke: Flip this card over and resolve its text.
Flavor:
Her voice is beautiful and full of passion.
If only you knew what the lyrics meant
Name: Ashleigh Clarke

Description: Aloof. Each investigator at Dianne Devine's location cannot discover or take control of clues. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: Find the [[Bystander]] asset with the fewest clues on it. Move Dianne Devine to that asset's location, if able.
Name: Dianne Devine

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either place 1 of your clues on a [[Bystander]] asset in play or take 1 horror and 1 damage.
Flavor: You dont want to arouse suspicion, but you really dont want to eat that.
Name: Fine Dining

Description: Revelation - Put Tough Crowd into play next to the agenda deck. Each investigator must spend 1 additional action to parley. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Tough Crowd.
Name: Tough Crowd

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Dismay) to your hand. You cannot commit skill cards to skill tests. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Dismay) from your hand.
Name: Whispers in Your Head

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Dread) to your hand. You cannot move more than once each turn. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Dread) from your hand.
Name: Whispers in Your Head

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Anxiety) to your hand. You cannot trigger [free] abilities. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Anxiety) from your hand.
Name: Whispers in Your Head

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Doubt) to your hand. You cannot play events. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Doubt) from your hand.
Name: Whispers in Your Head

Description: Surge. Revelation - If you have at least 3 horror on you, lose 1 action.
Flavor: She froze, and her throat clenched. Her eyes began to water. Her vision spiraled and blurred. Then, at long last, she finally understood.
Name: Descent into Madness

Description: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Swift Byakhee would move via the hunter keyword: Instead, move it (one location at a time) until it enters its prey's location. If it moved more than one location by this effect, it does not attack this phase.
Name: Swift Byakhee

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). If you fail, reveal the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is the amount you failed by. If at least 1 [[Byakhee]] enemy is revealed by this effect, choose and draw 1 of them. If at least 1 [[Omen]] treachery is revealed by this effect, take 1 horror. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Hunted by Byakhee

Description:
Massive.
While assigning damage and horror from Beast of Aldebaran's attack, you must assign as much damage and horror as possible to a single card before assigning it to another card.
Name: Beast of Aldebaran

Description: Prey - Most horror. Retaliate. Forced - After you successfully evade Spawn of Hali by 2 or less: Take 1 horror.
Name: Spawn of Hali

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda or take 1 horror for each point you failed by. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.
Flavor: It blotted out entire galaxies within its dark shape.
Name: Black Stars Rise

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location, then place 2 doom on that location. If there is no doom on attached location, discard Spires of Carcosa. [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues here, remove 1 doom from attached location.
Name: Spires of Carcosa

Description: Revelation - If there is no doom in play, Twisted to His Will gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of doom in play. If you fail, discard 2 cards from your hand at random.
Name: Twisted to His Will

Description: Cannot be damaged except by [[Spell]], [[Relic]], or encounter cards. [action] Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to attempt to banish the geist. If you succeed, deal it 1 damage.
Name: Poltergeist

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you leave attached location: You must either take 1 horror or lose 1 action. [action] Place 1 of your clues on attached location: Discard Spirit's Torment.
Name: Spirit's Torment

Description: Forced - After Maniac engages you: Take 1 damage and deal 1 damage to Maniac.
Flavor: "Get out! Get out! Get out of my head!"
Name: Seer of the Sign

Description: Forced - After Young Psychopath engages you: You must either take 1 horror, or Young Psychopath gets +3 fight until the end of the investigation phase.
Flavor: Her eyes widened, and she picked up the knife.
Name: Puppet of Hastur

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Possessed]] enemies in play, Dance of the Yellow King gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, the nearest [[Possessed]] enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, engages you, and makes an immediate attack.
Name: Dance of the Yellow King

Description: Spawn - Revealed location with the most clues. Forced - After Fanatic enters play: Move 1 clue from Fanatic's location to Fanatic. Forced - When you defeat Fanatic: Take control of all of its clues.
Name: Fanatic

Description: Prey - Most clues. Hunter. Forced - After Agent of the King attacks you: Move 1 of your clues to Agent of the King. Forced - When you defeat Agent of the King: Take control of all of its clues.
Name: Agent of the King

Description: Revelation - For each [[Cultist]] enemy in play, move 1 clue from that enemy's location to that enemy. Until the end of the round, each [[Cultist]] enemy in play gets +1 fight for each clue and/or doom on it. If no clues are moved by this effect, The King's Edict gains surge.
Name: The King's Edict

Description: Revelation - Put Ooze and Filth into play next to the act deck. Each location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Ooze and Filth.
Name: Ooze and Filth

Description: Revelation - Discard [[Item]] assets from your play area and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of your location. If no cards are discarded by this effect, Corrosion gains surge.
Flavor: You suddenly drop the object on the ground and watch as it erodes and turns to dust before your eyes.
Name: Corrosion

Description: X is the shroud value of Roach Swarm's location.
Flavor: A mass of skittering roaches completely covers the floor, leaving a trail of sticky brown ooze in its wake.
Name: Roach Swarm

Description: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 2 horror. If The Man in the Pallid Mask is in play, horror dealt by this effect is considered direct horror, and this test has +2 difficulty.
Name: Marked by the Sign

Description: Revelation - If The Man in the Pallid Mask is in play, he attacks each investigator in player order, regardless of his current location. If The Man in the Pallid Mask is not in play, search his bearer's deck and discard pile for him, draw him, and shuffle his bearer's deck (resolve this effect even if his bearer is currently eliminated, searching all out-of-play areas).
Name: The Pale Mask Beckons

Description:
Jenny Barnes deck only. Replacement.
[free] Spend up to 3 resources and exhaust Green Man Medallion: Place those resources on it, as offerings.
[reaction] When you resign or the game ends: For every 6 offerings on Green Man Medallion, reduce the experience cost of the next card you purchase before the next scenario by 1.
Name: Green Man Medallion

Description: Jenny Barnes deck only. Replacement. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Jenny Barnes cannot gain resources via card effects.
Flavor: Thick limbs like wet branches yearned skyward, high above the platform. They swayed, whether in agony or exaltation Jenny could not tell. - Dave Gross, Hour of the Huntress
Name: Sacrificial Beast

Description:
Fast. Play when a non-[[Elite]] enemy would attack another investigator at your location.
Engage that enemy and resolve its attack against you instead. Then, deal it 1 damage.
Name: Heroic Rescue

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Combat Training before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Combat Training

Description:
Fast. Play during any investigator's turn. Play only if you have 5 or more remaining sanity.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Until the end of the active investigator's turn, that enemy gets -2 fight and -2 evade.
Flavor: They are just animals like any other. Or so we thought.
Name: Anatomical Diagrams

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Scientific Theory before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Scientific Theory

Description: [action]: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage. The attacked enemy gains retaliate for this attack.
Flavor:
Up close and personal:
just the way Naomi liked it.
Name: Knuckleduster

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Moxie before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Moxie

Description:
While David Renfield has at least 1 doom on him, you get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust David Renfield: You may place 1 doom on David Renfield. Gain 1 resource for each doom on David Renfield.
Name: David Renfield

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Grounded before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] During a skill test on a [[Spell]] card, spend 1 resource: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Grounded

Flavor: Mr. Pawterson always told Wendy things would turn out okay. But then again, Mr. Pawterson was a teddy bear, and he didn't know any better.
Name: Cherished Keepsake

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Plucky before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Plucky

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit to a skill test only if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
Name: Say Your Prayers

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit to a skill test only if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
Name: Desperate Search

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit to a skill test only if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
Name: Reckless Assault

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit to a skill test only if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
Name: Run For Your Life

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on an enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, discard a random card from your hand.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail and there is an enemy at your location, take 1 horror.
Name: Echoes of the Past

Description: Skip the 'Place 1 doom on the current agenda' step of the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
Flavor: Surprisingly, the front doors of the Historical Societys Georgian manor are cracked halfway open when you arrive. Who else could be here at this hour?
Name: The Truth is Hidden

Description: Skip the 'Place 1 doom on the current agenda' step of the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
Flavor: Though the whispering has ceased, the sounds of rummaging and furniture shifting is unmistakable. Whoever is here, theyre searching just as thoroughly as you are...
Name: Ransacking the Manor

Description: Skip the 'Place 1 doom on the current agenda' step of the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
Flavor: Whoever these people are, they must be involved with the conspiracy behind The King in Yellow. You cant let them find whatever it is theyre looking for!
Name: Secrets Better Left Hidden

Flavor: Each of the Historical Societys many rooms contains records and documents that may aid you in your search for answers about The King in Yellow. There must be something here that can guide you toward the truth.
Name: Race for Answers

Flavor: Somewhere in the manor is a "hidden library" where you might be able to find more information about The King in Yellow. You must find the way in if you are to continue your investigation.
Name: Mistakes of the Past

Description: Locations with the [[Passageway]] trait are connected to one another. Objective - Only investigators in the Hidden Library may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: "This building is very old, and filled with all manner of secret passageways," Mr.Peabody explains. "Perhaps one of them will lead to this library youre looking for."
Name: The Oath

Description: Entry Hall is connected to each other [[Ground Floor]] location. [action]: Resign. You flee, leaving the mysteries of the past to the mysterious cultists.
Name: Entry Hall

Description: [action] Exhaust an [[Ally]] asset: Discover a clue at this location. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor: One of the chairs is knocked over, and a hole is torn in the ceiling above. What could possibly have created such damage?
Name: Historical Society

Description: Each enemy at this location gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Flavor: This confined room contains numerous files that might have been helpful to your investigation were it not for the thick, awful sludge filling the file cabinet drawers.
Name: Historical Society

Description: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be increased.
Flavor: Most of the objects on display here are from the early 18th century, spanning Arkham's colonization and early history.
Name: Historical Society

Description: Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Second Floor]] location. [action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls (from the token bank).
Name: Quiet Halls

Description: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be increased.
Flavor: Most of the objects on display here are from the early 18th century, spanning Arkham's colonization and early history.
Name: Historical Society

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate this location, take 2 horror: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Limit once per round).
Flavor: The sheer number of books in the Historical Society's library is overwhelming. Even if you had weeks to spend researching, you couldn't hope to sort through all of them.
Name: Historical Society

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, choose an enemy with doom on it. Take 1 of that enemy's doom, flip it to its clue side, and place it on your investigator. (Group limit once per round).
Flavor: From the flickering lamplight and open books, you can tell that someone was reading in here recently.
Name: Historical Society

Description: Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Third Floor]] location. [action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls (from the token bank).
Name: Quiet Halls

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate this location, take 2 horror: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Limit once per round).
Flavor: The sheer number of books in the Historical Society's library is overwhelming. Even if you had weeks to spend researching, you couldn't hope to sort through all of them.
Name: Historical Society

Description: While an investigator at this location controls Mr. Peabody, this location gets -2 shroud.
Flavor: This office must belong to somebody important within the Historical Society.
Name: Historical Society

Description: Each enemy at this location gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Flavor: This confined room contains numerous files that might have been helpful to your investigation were it not for the thick, awful sludge filling the file cabinet drawers.
Name: Historical Society

Description: While an enemy is moving, Hidden Library gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
Flavor: The space was a small reading room, carpeted with cobwebs and dust. Filled bookshelves lined the walls, but a few books lay scattered on the floor as though their readers had abandoned them in a hurry. - Lisa Farrell, The Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Hidden Library

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Cannot be damaged during act 1 or act 2. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: The investigators must either ready Possessed Oathspeaker or place 1 doom on it. Objective - If Possessed Oathspeaker is defeated: (R3)
Name: Possessed Oathspeaker

Description: [action] Exhaust Mr. Peabody: Choose a location. Until Mr. Peabody readies, that location gets -1 shroud and gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
Flavor: "This building contains many secrets. I will show you some, but even I dont know them all..."
Name: Mr. Peabody

Description: While Clasp of Black Onyx is in your hand, increase the cost of each other card in your hand by 1.
Flavor: It was neither Arabic nor Chinese, nor as I found afterwards did it belong to any human script. - Robert W. Chambers, "The Yellow Sign," The King in Yellow
Name: Clasp of Black Onyx

Description:
You get -1 sanity.
You get +1 [willpower], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility] while you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
Name: The Tattered Cloak

Description: Spawn - Any empty Historical Society location. Aloof. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Move 1 clue from Seeker of Carcosa's location to Seeker of Carcosa (if you cannot, place 1 doom on Seeker of Carcosa, instead).
Name: Seeker of Carcosa

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 of your clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance).
Name: Led Astray

Description: Revelation - If there is a [[Cultist]] enemy in play with doom on it, move all doom from each [[Cultist]] enemy to the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance). If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play with doom on them, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).
Name: The Cult's Search

Description: Engage actions you perform do not provoke attacks of opportunity. [action]: Fight. You get +X [combat] for this attack. X is the number of enemies engaged with you.
Flavor: Its seen more violence than most people see in a lifetime.
Name: Trench Knife

Description: Attach to your location. If there are no investigators at attached location, discard Ambush. Forced - After an enemy spawns at attached location: Deal 2 damage to that enemy and discard Ambush.
Name: Ambush

Description:
You may spend resources to pay for [[Item]] assets played by other investigators at your location.
[free] Exhaust Charles Ross, Esq.: Reduce the cost of the next [[Item]] asset played by an investigator at your location by 1.
Name: Charles Ross, Esq.

Description:
Fast. Play when you draw a non-weakness treachery card.
Place 1 of your clues on your location. Then, cancel that card's revelation effect.
Flavor: Knowing is half the battle.
Name: Forewarned

Description:
While you have 10 or more resources, you get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are no enemies at your location, exhaust Dario El-Amin: Gain 2 resources.
Name: Dario El-Amin

Description: Deal 2 damage to an enemy not engaged with you at your location.
Name: Sneak Attack

Description: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. If you succeed, instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 2 damage to each enemy at the attacked enemy's location (any additional damage is dealt to the attacked enemy). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed during this attack, deal 1 damage to each investigator at the attacked enemy's location.
Name: Storm of Spirits

Description: [action] Exhaust Book of Shadows and spend 1 resource: Add 1 charge to a [[Spell]] asset you control.
Name: Book of Shadows

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of the round, you get +X [combat] and +X [agility], where X is the amount of horror on you.
Name: Fight or Flight

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Exile A Test of Will.
Flavor: With or without hope, all you can do is resist.
Name: A Test of Will

Description:
Fast. Play when you are dealt damage and/or horror.
Cancel up to 10 damage and/or horror just dealt to you. Exile Devil's Luck.
Flavor: "That was my favorite hat!"
Name: Devil's Luck

Description: Choose an [[Ally]] asset you control and return it to your hand. Then, search the top 9 cards of your deck for an [[Ally]] asset and play it, reducing its cost by X. X is the cost of the [[Ally]] asset returned to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "Operator, Im gonna need you to hang up."
Name: Calling in Favors

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1. If you fail, randomly choose an enemy from among the set-aside [[Monster]] enemies and place it beneath the act deck without looking at it.
[cultist]: -X. X is the amount of horror on you.
[tablet]: -X. X is the base shroud value of your location.
[elder_thing]: 0. Either randomly choose an enemy from among the set-aside [[Monster]] enemies and place it beneath the act deck without looking at it, or this test automatically fails instead.
Name: The Unspeakable Oath

Flavor: The patient wing of the asylum is far quieter and lonelier than you had expected. The hall reeks of chemicals and body odor. As soon as you are escorted inside, the doors behind you are closed and locked tight.
Name: Locked Inside

Flavor: The longer you spend in this hellish place, the more you want to leave. Already it has felt like days. You fear that if you are stuck here much longer, you will become like the patients: a husk of your former self, unruly, and dangerous.
Name: Torturous Descent

Description: Forced - When you would place an enemy beneath the act deck: Shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck, instead.
Flavor:
Flee.
Flee while you still can.
Name: His Domain

Flavor: Aside from the few patients giving you a wide berth, there arent any orderlies or doctors around to speak with. Looks like youll have to find Mr. Chesterfield on your own.
Name: Arkham Asylum

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)
Flavor: Daniel is somewhere in the secured basement where the most dangerous patients are kept. Now that you have the key, you can explore this area of the asylum.
Name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. I)

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)
Flavor: Daniel is somewhere in the secured basement where the most dangerous patients are kept. Now that you have the key, you can explore this area of the asylum.
Name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. II)

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]]locations. Objective - If investigators have performed 4 of the following, you must advance. - "Know the guards' patrols." - "Set a fire in the kitchen." - "Incited a fight amongst the patients." - "Released a dangerous patient." - "Recalled the way out." - "Distracted the guards."
Flavor: With or without Daniel, you have to get out of this place as soon as you can.
Name: Planning the Escape

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of Arkham Asylum locations. Garden gains: "[action] If there is no ready enemy in the Garden: Resign. Finally, a way out!" Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: All hell has broken loose.
Name: No Asylum

Description: [reaction] After you defeat a [[Possessed]] enemy at this location: Draw 1 card.
Flavor:
As they walked through the meandering stone halls of the sanatorium, Carolyn began to feel uneasy. It seemed like it would be very easy to get lost.
- Mallory O'Meara, The Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Asylum Halls

Description: Each [[Possessed]] enemy at this location gets +1 horror value.
Flavor:
As they walked through the meandering stone halls of the sanatorium, Carolyn began to feel uneasy. It seemed like it would be very easy to get lost.
- Mallory O'Meara, The Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Asylum Halls

Description: [action] Take 1 horror: Evade. Automatically evade a [[Possessed]] enemy at this location.
Flavor:
As they walked through the meandering stone halls of the sanatorium, Carolyn began to feel uneasy. It seemed like it would be very easy to get lost.
- Mallory O'Meara, The Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Asylum Halls

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at this location: Take 1 horror and gain 2 resources.
Flavor:
As they walked through the meandering stone halls of the sanatorium, Carolyn began to feel uneasy. It seemed like it would be very easy to get lost.
- Mallory O'Meara, The Investigators of Arkham Horror
Name: Asylum Halls

Description: [action] If there are no clues on the Kitchen: Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, remember that you "set a fire in the kitchen."
Flavor: Dirty dishes fill the sinks and cover the countertops. An unidentifiable sludge boils on the stove.
Name: Kitchen

Description: Forced - After you successfully investigate the Mess Hall: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Flavor: Rows of tables are covered in dirty dishes and stale food. You get the feeling they took "mess" too literally here.
Name: Mess Hall

Description: [action]: Heal 1 damage and take 1 direct horror, or heal 1 horror and take 1 direct damage. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor: Our methods are proven.
Name: Infirmary

Description:
While you are investigating the Yard, it gets +1 shroud for each horror on you.
[action] If there are no clues on Yard, take 1 damage: Remember that you "incited a fight amongst the patients."
Name: Yard

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Garden: Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, remember that you "distracted the guards."
Flavor: Two guards in white uniforms stand by the gate to the garden, keeping watch.
Name: Garden

Description: Forced - After the Basement Hall is revealed: Put the 4 set-aside Patient Confinement locations into play.
Flavor: A cramped stone staircase leads deep underground, to the basement level of the asylum. Cries and howls of anguish torment you from behind the hall's many iron doors. You can't imagine what it would be like to live your days in this place.
Name: Basement Hall

Description: Forced - After Patient Confinement is revealed: Advance to act 2b.
Flavor: Daniel's windowless cell is hopelessly dank and grim. The walls are covered in erratic scribbling, which upon further inspection appears to be passages from <u>The King in Yellow</u>.
Name: Patient Confinement

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (2) to release the patient here from his bonds. If you succeed, he howls like a wolf and tears off through the basement; remember that you "released a dangerous patient."
Name: Patient Confinement

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to speak to the patient here. If you succeed, you are able to interpret her ravings; remember that you "know the guards' patrols."
Flavor: A chill gloom envelops this windowless cell. Being locked in here for a day would be torturous, let alone for months.
Name: Patient Confinement

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of horror on you. If you succeed, you recognize the room; remember that you "recalled the way out."
Name: Patient Confinement

Description: Prey - Highest [combat]. [action] If you control Clasp of Black Onyx: Parley. You show Daniel the clasp, and he staggers backward, collapsing into a motionless husk. Add him to the victory display.
Name: Daniel Chesterfield

Description: Spawn - Basement Halls. Hunter. Asylum Gorger cannot make attacks of opportunity, and cannot attack during the same phase it moved from its hunter keyword.
Name: Asylum Gorger

Description: Spawn - Nearest Asylum Halls. Prey - Most remaining sanity. Forced - When you attack Mad Patient: Take 1 horror.
Flavor: Sometimes the most terrifying of foes is ones own mind.
Name: Haunted Patient

Description: Revelation - If there is no copy of Straitjacket in your threat area, put Straitjacket into play in your threat area as an asset that takes up a body slot and 2 hand slots. Return each asset in those slots to your hand. This card cannot leave play except by the ability below. [action] [action]: Discard Straitjacket.
Flavor: "What are you doing? Im not crazy!"
Name: Straitjacket

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Gift of Madness (Pity) to your hand. You cannot attack [[Possessed]] enemies. [action]: Randomly choose 1 enemy from among the set-aside [[Monster]] enemies and place it beneath the act deck without looking at it. Discard Gift of Madness (Pity) from your hand.
Name: Gift of Madness

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Gift of Madness (Misery) to your hand. You cannot trigger [action] abilities on locations. [action]: Randomly choose 1 enemy from among the set-aside [[Monster]] enemies and place it beneath the act deck without looking at it. Discard Gift of Madness (Misery) from your hand.
Name: Gift of Madness

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, you must either take 1 horror for each point you failed by, or randomly choose 1 enemy from among the set-aside [[Monster]] enemies and place it beneath the act deck without looking at it.
Name: Walls Closing In

Description:
Norman Withers deck only. Replacement.
[action]: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
[free] Exhaust Split the Angle and discard the top card of your deck: Discard the top card of the encounter deck.
Flavor: ...another spell, likewise rendered phonetically, for "splitting the angle" and walking through time in the flesh.
Name: Split the Angle

Description: Norman Withers deck only. Replacement. Prey - Norman Withers. While Vengeful Hounds is engaged with you, you cannot draw or reveal cards via player card effects.
Flavor: "On those rare occasions when a man escapes the Hounds, he doesn't always stay escaped. Sooner or later, they're apt to come after him." - Richard Lee Byers, Ire of the Void
Name: Vengeful Hound

Description: Each non-[[Elite]] enemy engaged with you is defeated. You are defeated and suffer 1 physical trauma. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: He flicked open the lighter and made his peace.
Name: "I'll see you in hell!"

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. Ignore the retaliate keyword for this attack.
Name: .45 Automatic

Description:
Play only if you have at least 1 clue.
Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator either heals 2 horror or discards a [[Terror]] card from his or her threat area.
Flavor:
"I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing."
- Plato, <u>The Republic</u>
Name: Logical Reasoning

Description: Researched. Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. For every 2 points you succeed by, discover 1 additional clue at your location.
Name: Archaic Glyphs

Description: Researched. Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. If you succeed, you may automatically evade an engaged enemy. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Archaic Glyphs

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, automatically evade the attacked enemy.
Flavor: "Aim for the eyes," they told me.
Name: Cheap Shot

Description:
Fast.
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Pickpocketing: Draw 1 card or gain 1 resource. If you succeeded by 2 or more, do both instead.
Name: Pickpocketing

Description: Shuffle your discard pile into your deck and draw 1 card. Remove Quantum Flux from the game.
Name: Quantum Flux

Description: Choose a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location and reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, discard the chosen asset. Otherwise, add 3 charges to the chosen asset.
Name: Recharge

Description:
[free] If you have no cards in your hand, exhaust Madame Labranche: Draw 1 card.
[free] If you have no resources, exhaust Madame Labranche: Gain 1 resource.
Name: Madame Labranche

Description: Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Forced - After a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters attached location: Exhaust that enemy, disengage it from all investigators, and attach Snare Trap to it. Forced - When attached enemy would ready: Instead, discard Snare Trap.
Name: Snare Trap

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the amount of doom in play (max 5).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, move each unengaged [[Byakhee]] in play once toward the nearest investigator.
[tablet]: -3. Cancel the effects and icons of each skill card committed to this test.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, lose 1 resource for each point you failed by.
Name: A Phantom of Truth

Description: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."
Flavor: As you step off the train in Gare dOrsay, the sun sinks below the Paris skyline. You cannot waste any time. If Nigel Engram is somewhere in Paris, you have to find him and wring the answers from him one way or another.
Name: The First Night

Description: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."
Flavor: The city stirs as cold shadows embrace the streets. There is danger all around you. Danger that you cannot escape. Danger that will follow you to the ends of the earth. When will this waking nightmare end?
Name: The Second Night

Description: While you have more Conviction than Doubt, this agenda gains: "When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it."
Flavor: On the evening of your third night in Paris, a desperate resolve stirs within you. This cat and mouse game cannot go on any longer. One way or another, this night will end it.
Name: The Third Night

Description: Objective - Spend the requisite number of clues to advance. Objective - At the end of the round, if there are 3 or more doom in play, advance.
Flavor: You pass the Church of St. Barnab辿 as you exit the train station and cannot help but overhear the organ playing. Is there a sermon this late in the evening? You marvel at the wild and strange chords for a moment before continuing. Paris is a big city, and you have very few leads
Name: The Parisian Conspiracy (v. I)

Description: Objective - Spend the requisite number of clues to advance. Objective - At the end of the round, if there are 3 or more doom in play, advance.
Flavor: You pass the Church of St. Barnab辿 as you exit the train station and cannot help but overhear the organ playing. Is there a sermon this late in the evening? You marvel at the wild and strange chords for a moment before continuing. Paris is a big city, and you have very few leads
Name: The Parisian Conspiracy (v. II)

Description: [reaction] After you successfully attack The Organist: An investigator at your location may place 1 of his or her clues on The Organist. (Group limit 1 [per_investigator] times per round.) Objective - If there are 3 [per_investigator] clues on The Organist, advance.
Flavor: The chords that echo in your mind, the infernal man whose organ-playing intrigues and terrifies you Perhaps there is a connection between this shadowy presence and <u>The King in Yellow</u>?
Name: Pursuing Shadows

Description: [free] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or automatically evade The Organist. (Group limit once per round.) Objective - Survive three nights. (Do not advance until you are instructed.)
Flavor:
I knew that every time I met him brought him nearer to the accomplishment of his purpose and my fate. And still I tried to save myself.
-Robert W. Chambers, "In the Court of the Dragon," <u>The King in Yellow</u>
Name: Stalked by Shadows

Description: [free] Discard a card from your hand: Gain resources equal to the number of [willpower] icons on the discarded card. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Montparnasse

Description: [action]: Reveal the top card of each investigator's deck. You may play an asset revealed by this effect (paying its cost), under your control. Shuffle each investigator's deck. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: Cold rain pelts the street. Every alleyway you pass is another hiding place for something sinister.
Name: Montmartre

Description: [action] Spend 1 resource: Add 1 supply or ammo token to a card you control. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor: Cold rain pelts the street. Every alleyway you pass is another hiding place for something sinister.
Name: Montmartre

Description: Forced - After you reveal Grand Guignol: You must either take 2 horror, or shuffle all non-weakness cards from your hand into your deck, then draw an equal number of cards.
Flavor: It seems the theatre is performing a show about insanity. You wonder if they have ever performed <u>The King in Yellow</u>.
Name: Grand Guignol

Description: While you are investigating Op辿ra Garnier, double the number of skill icons committed to this skill test.
Flavor: A trail of blood leads up the grand staircase. Deep, cold mist envelops the room. You get the unmistakable feeling that there is something inhuman in the opera house
Name: Op辿ra Garnier

Description: While you are investigating Op辿ra Garnier, double the base value of your skill.
Flavor: A trail of blood leads up the grand staircase. Deep, cold mist envelops the room. You get the unmistakable feeling that there is something inhuman in the opera house
Name: Op辿ra Garnier

Description: [action] Spend 1 resource: Move to any [[Rail]] location.
Flavor: You'd expect the station to be bustling, but it is eerily abandoned, save for a few passengers who wander the station in slow, meandering steps.
Name: Gare d'Orsay

Description: Forced - After you successfully investigate P竪re Lachaise Cemetery: You cannot leave P竪re Lachaise Cemetery until the end of the round.
Flavor: Paths of stone wind through rows of graves and countless mausoleums. The dense, twisting cemetery has you trapped in a state of melancholy, surrounded by death on all sides.
Name: P竪re Lachaise Cemetery

Description: [reaction] After you evade an enemy at Canal Saint-Martin: Move that enemy to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Canal Saint-Martin

Description: [reaction] When your turn begins, if you are in Le Marais: Draw 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: Throughout this region, you cannot shake the feeling that you are being watched. Something along the rooftops ducks just out of sight each time you peer upward.
Name: Le Marais

Description: Forced - After you enter Le Marais: For the remainder of the round, you cannot leave Le Marais.
Flavor: Throughout this region, you cannot shake the feeling that you are being watched. Something along the rooftops ducks just out of sight each time you peer upward.
Name: Le Marais

Description:
Each enemy at Notre-Dame gets -1 fight and +1 evade.
[action]: Test [willpower] (6). If you succeed, either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or remove 1 doom from the current agenda. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Notre-Dame

Description: While a [[Byakhee]] enemy is moving, if there is an investigator at Gardens of Luxembourg, that enemy's location is considered to be connected to Gardens of Luxembourg.
Name: Gardens of Luxembourg

Description: Aloof. Cannot be damaged. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: If The Organist is unengaged, move it 1 location away from the nearest investigator (to a location with no investigators, if possible). If it is engaged, disengage it instead.
Flavor: I was creeping along, my feet almost refusing to move. -Robert W. Chambers, "In the Court of the Dragon," <u>The King in Yellow</u>
Name: The Organist

Description:
Hunter.
While Stealthy Byakhee is exhausted, it gets -3 fight.
Flavor: If you can hear the beating of its leathery wings, its already too late.
Name: Stealthy Byakhee

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, you must either remove 1 doom from the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.
Flavor: The implication spoils what would otherwise be a lovelysunset.
Name: Twin Suns

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. You must either draw that enemy, or that enemy attacks you (from the discard pile). If no enemy is discarded, take 1 horror instead.
Name: Deadly Fate

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). If you fail, put Torturous Chords into play in your threat area, with 1 resource on it for each point you failed by. Each time you play a card, increase the cost of that card by 1 and remove 1 resource from Torturous Chords. If Torturous Chords has no resources, discard it.
Name: Torturous Chords

Description: Revelation - Put Frozen in Fear into play in your threat area. The first time you perform one of the following actions (move, fight, or evade) each round, it costs 1 additional action. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Frozen in Fear.
Name: Frozen in Fear

Description: Revelation - Check Campaign Log. - If you have more (or equal) Doubt than Conviction, test [intellect] (X), where X is your [willpower]. If you fail, take 2 damage. - If you have more Conviction than Doubt, test [willpower] (X), where X is your [intellect]. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Name: Lost Soul

Description: If this skill test is successful, ready an [[Ally]] asset at your location and heal 1 damage or 1 horror from it.
Flavor: "Anderson's a hard-ass, sure. Always locking up the rum and waking us up at the crack of dawn. But out here in the middle of nowhere, he's definitely the one I want taking point."
Name: Inspiring Presence

Description:
Play only as your first action.
Deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Mano a Mano

Description:
Uses (4 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset in your location.
Name: First Aid

Description: If this skill test is successful, the investigator performing this test searches the top 3 cards of his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles his or her deck.
Name: Eureka!

Description: Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to your location. Attached location gains: "[free] Exhaust Shortcut: Move (to a connecting location). Any investigator at this location may trigger this ability."
Flavor: You know this town like the back of your hand.
Name: Shortcut

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing. As an additional cost to commit "Watch this!" to a skill test, spend up to 3 resources.
If you succeed by 1 or more, gain twice that many resources.
Flavor: Show-off.
Name: "Watch this!"

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. Once per turn, if you succeed by 3 or more, you may take an additional action this turn.
Name: .41 Derringer

Description:
As an additional cost to commit Torrent of Power to a skill test, spend up to 3 charges from among assets you control.
For each charge spent in this way, Torrent of Power gains [willpower] [wild].
Name: Torrent of Power

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[free] Exhaust Scrying and spend 1 charge: Look at the top 3 cards of any investigator's deck, or the encounter deck. Return them to the top of that deck, in any order. If a [[Terror]] or [[Omen]] card is among the looked-at cards, take 1 horror.
Name: Scrying

Description: Choose an exhausted non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you succeed, defeat that enemy.
Flavor: "Is is it over?" Her hands shook, and she fell to her knees. "Is it finally over?"
Name: Waylay

Description: Choose an [[Ally]] asset with printed resource cost X in any player's discard pile. Put that asset into play under your control.
Name: A Chance Encounter

Description: Gain 4 resources or place 4 supply tokens among assets controlled by investigators at your location, or any combination thereof.
Flavor: You can never be too prepared.
Name: Emergency Cache

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of locations away from the starting location you are (max 5).
[cultist]: -2. If this token is revealed during an attack, and this skill test is successful, this attack deals 1 less damage.
[tablet]: -2. If there is a ready [[Ghoul]] or [[Geist]] enemy at your location, it attacks you (if there is more than one, choose one).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Ghoul]] or [[Geist]] enemy and draw it.
Name: The Pallid Mask

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it.
Flavor: The dank, chill air of the catacombs penetrates your clothes and causes you to shiver. Everywhere you look, the remains of the dead greet you - a grim reminder of your own mortality.
Name: Empire of the Dead

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it.
Flavor: All around you, the eyes of skulls glow with an otherworldly hue. A ghostly voice echoes throughout the labyrinthine catacombs. You sense a threatening presence looming around you. It is just outside of your vision, past the dim fog that permeates through the catacombs, around everycorner
Name: Empire of the Undead

Description: Objective - Find The Man in the Pallid Mask. He is somewhere in the Catacombs. (Do not advance until you are instructed.)
Flavor: At the end of the long tunnel next to you, the Stranger steps through the darkness, his pale mask glinting in the candlelight. "Wait!" you call out. He glances your way before vanishing into the shadows. Once more, you are forced to track him down to find answers
Name: Through the Catacombs

Description: Objective - "Tell us how to stop the path from opening!" If The Man in the Pallid Mask is defeated, advance. Objective - "What is he trying to show us?" Investigators in the Tomb of Shadows may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: The shadows cast along the bone walls shift into the shapes of several figures, acting out a macabre parody of <u>The King in Yellow</u>.
Name: The Path is Barred

Description: Forced - At the end of the round, if The Gate to Hell is in play: Discard the location that is farthest from The Gate to Hell. Move each investigator and enemy that was at that location to a connecting location and deal 2 damage to each of them. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at The Gate to Hell, advance.
Flavor: Bones rattle to the floor, dislodged by the shaking and crumbling of the caverns around you. The Stranger grabs a skull from within the flames in the center of the chamber and flees.
Name: The Way Out

Description: Ignore the Forced ability on Blocked Passage. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Blocked Passage, advance.
Flavor: The shadows along the walls of the tomb begin to coalesce. Strange runic symbols twist into the image of a building with a tall tower, its spire reaching up toward the ceiling. Then the Stranger beckons for you to follow, and disappears through the stone archway behindyou.
Name: Leading the Way

Description: Forced - When The Gate to Hell is revealed: Put the top 2 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above and below The Gate to Hell.
Flavor:
ARRETE!
C'EST ICI L'EMPIRE DE LA MORT
Name: The Gate to Hell

Description: Ignore the text on unrevealed locations adjacent to Stone Archways. Forced - When Stone Archways is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play to the right of Stone Archways.
Name: Stone Archways

Description: Crypt of the Sepulchral Lamp is investigated using [willpower] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt. Forced - When Crypt of the Sepulchral Lamp is revealed: Put the top 2 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above and to the right of Crypt of the Sepulchral Lamp.
Name: Crypt of the Sepulchral Lamp

Description: While you are investigating Bone-Filled Cavern, you have 1 fewer hand slot. Forced - When Bone-Filled Cavern is revealed: Put the top 2 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play below and to the right of Bone-Filled Cavern.
Name: Bone-Filled Caverns

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at Well of Souls: You must either take 1 direct horror or discard 2 random cards from your hand. Forced - When Well of Souls is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, or to the right of Well of Souls.
Name: Well of Souls

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (3) to read an ancient sign. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of any Catacombs location in play. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - When Candlelit Tunnels is revealed: Put the top 2 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play to the left and right of Candlelit Tunnels.
Name: Candlelit Tunnels

Description: Forced - When Labyrinth of Bones is revealed: Put the top 3 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, and to the right of Labyrinth of Bones.
Flavor: A pillar of bones dominates the center of this circular chamber. Several dark passages lead in multiple directions.
Name: Labyrinth of Bones

Description: Forced - When you would move from Narrow Shaft to an unrevealed location: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and cancel the effects of the move. Forced - When Narrow Shaft is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above or to the right of Narrow Shaft.
Name: Narrow Shaft

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at Shivering Pools: You must either take 1 direct damage or lose 5 resources. Forced - When Shivering Pools is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play below or to the right of Shivering Pools.
Name: Shivering Pools

Description: Forced - When you reveal Blocked Passage: Take 2 damage. You cannot leave Blocked Passage this round.
Flavor: A stack of human remains blocks the candlelit corridor. This gives new meaning to the phrase "dead end."
Name: Blocked Passage

Description: Forced - When Tomb of Shadows is revealed: Advance to act 1b. While The Man in the Pallid Mask is at the Tomb of Shadows, he gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be defeated by his [action] ability.
Name: Tomb of Shadows

Description: Spawn - Nearest unrevealed location. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to interpret the guide's ravings. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of any Catacombs location in play. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: "Arent these catacombs absolutely fascinating?"
Name: Catacombs Docent

Description: Spawn - Discard a [[Humanoid]] enemy at any location and spawn Corpse Dweller at that location (if there are no [[Humanoid]] enemies in play, discard Corpse Dweller and it gains surge instead). Hunter. Retaliate.
Name: Corpse Dweller

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. When assigning horror from this effect, it must be divided as evenly as possible among eligible cards.
Name: Eyes in the Walls

Description: Revelation - Put The Shadow Behind You into play in your threat area. Limit 1 per investigator. [action]: You look behind you. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not perform the above [action] ability: You must either discard all of your resources or discard all cards in your hand. Then, discard The Shadow Behind You.
Name: The Shadow Behind You

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location if there is no copy of The Pit Below attached (if there is, discard The Pit Below and it gains surge instead). Attached location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location takes 3 damage. Discard The Pit Below.
Name: The Pit Below

Description: Fast. Play when you would draw an encounter card during the mythos phase. Instead, search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy, spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location), and shuffle the encounter deck. If you cannot, draw the top card of the encounter deck.
Name: On the Hunt

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 3 different [[Tactic]] and/or [[Supply]] events, and attach them facedown to Stick to the Plan. Shuffle your deck.
Cards attached to Stick to the Plan may be played as if they were in your hand. As an additional cost to play an attached card, exhaust Stick to the Plan.
Name: Stick to the Plan

Description: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take his or her turn this round. That investigator may take an additional action during his or her turn this round.
Name: Guidance

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[free] While an investigator is taking his or her turn, spend 1 charge: Your location gets -2 shroud until the end of this turn. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Arcane Insight

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against you.
Cancel that attack. You get +2 skill value for the next skill test you perform this turn.
Flavor: "Next time, I'm driving!"
Name: Narrow Escape

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Exhaust Suggestion: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 charge from Suggestion. [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would attack you, spend 1 charge: Cancel that attack.
Name: Suggestion

Description:
You get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], and -2 sanity.
[reaction] When you would be defeated by horror, discard St. Hubert's Key: Immediately heal 2 horror.
Name: St. Hubert's Key

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at any location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, take 1 horror.
Name: Ward of Protection

Description: Forced - After Arcane Initiate enters play: Place 1 doom or 2 horror on it. [free] Exhaust Arcane Initiate: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Arcane Initiate

Description:
Commit to a skill test only if you are engaged with an enemy.
For each enemy engaged with you, "Not without a fight!" gains [willpower] [combat] [agility].
Name: "Not without a fight!"

Description: Return 3 [[Innate]] skills from your discard pile to your hand.
Name: True Survivor

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest amount of doom on an agenda in play.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against an enemy with doom on it, this skill test automatically fails instead.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on each agenda.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Byakhee]] enemy and draw it.
Name: Black Stars Rise

Description: [free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: Your boat docks at Porte de lAvanc辿e, but with the rising tide and torrential rain flooding the street, the boats captain isnt keen on sticking around. He tells you he will come back for you in the morning. You tell him not to bother; you probably wont be around by then.
Name: The Tide Rises

Description:
Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: The angry sea continues to barrage the island. Waves crash against the walls, and rain pelts the rooftops. Is the rising sea the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to let the storm rage on
Name: Let The Storm Rage

Description:
Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: The angry sea continues to barrage the island. Waves crash against the walls, and rain pelts the rooftops. Is the rising sea the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to let the storm rage on
Name: Let The Storm Rage

Description: Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.
Flavor: The water level continues to rise. The outer walls cannot stop the tide from swallowing the island. The streets flood with ice cold water, and powerful waves demolish buildings where they stand. If you do not act soon, the path will be forever lost, and nobody will be able to prevent Hasturs agents from releasing his bonds.
Name: The City Floods

Description: [free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: Dark storm clouds swirl overhead. A vortex of eldritch energy rages in the center of the storm. The ritual has begun. The gate may appear above the abbey, or below it. You must choose which route to pursue and reach the gate before Hasturs agents do.
Name: The Ritual Begins

Description:
Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: The whirlwind over the island continues to rage. Blinding flashes of lightning and deafening thunder assault your senses. Is the vortex above the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to beckon the entity closer
Name: The Entity Above

Description:
Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: The whirlwind over the island continues to rage. Blinding flashes of lightning and deafening thunder assault your senses. Is the vortex above the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to beckon the entity closer
Name: The Entity Above

Description: Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.
Flavor: The maelstrom in the sky envelops the horizon. The island starts to break into pieces. The screeches of uncanny creatures fill the air, an unholy choir praying to a force beyond your comprehension. If you do not act soon, the path will be forever lost, and nobody will be able to prevent Hasturs agents from releasing his bonds.
Name: Swallowed Sky

Description: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at the Chapel of St. Aubert and there are no clues on that location, advance.
Flavor: Tidewater churns around the walls of the city. Layers of reality unfold. Reflected in the depths below, you can see the twisted spires of Carcosa. You have no choice but to dive in.
Name: Open The Path Below

Description: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at the Abbey Tower and there are no clues on that location, advance.
Flavor: Clouds churn over the abbey tower. Layers of reality unfold. Through the dark storm clouds, you can see the twisted spires of Carcosa. You have no choice but to make the leap.
Name: Open The Path Above

Description: [action] [action]: Move 1 doom from one agenda deck to the other. Then, place 2 clues on Porte de l'Avanc辿e (from the token bank).
Name: Porte de l'Avanc辿e

Description: Forced - After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or less while investigating Grand Rue: Place 1 doom on the agenda with the most doom (if they are tied for the most doom, choose one to place 1 doom on).
Name: Grand Rue

Description: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "a" agenda deck: Each investigator at the Outer Wall takes 1 damage.
Flavor: Waves slam against the stone walls, water spraying onto the pathways above. If you don't act quickly, even these stalwart walls won't be able to stop the rising tide.
Name: Outer Wall

Description: While the current "c" agenda has more doom on it than the current "a" agenda, double the number of skill icons on cards committed to skill tests at the Outer Wall.
Flavor: Waves slam against the stone walls, water spraying onto the pathways above. If you don't act quickly, even these stalwart walls won't be able to stop the rising tide.
Name: Outer Wall

Description: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "c" agenda deck: Each investigator at North Tower takes 1 horror.
Flavor: Wet, stone steps lead higher up the path, toward the abbey. Above, black storm clouds threaten to overtake the island.
Name: North Tower

Description: While the current "a" agenda has more doom on it than the current "c" agenda, reduce the difficulty of each skill test at North Tower by 1.
Flavor: Wet, stone steps lead higher up the path, toward the abbey. Above, black storm clouds threaten to overtake the island.
Name: North Tower

Description: Forced - After you enter Broken Steps: You must either lose 1 action or draw the topmost [[Omen]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.
Name: Broken Steps

Description: Forced - After you enter Broken Steps: You must either discard an asset you control or draw the topmost [[Cultist]] enemy in the encounter discard pile.
Name: Broken Steps

Description: If there are two agendas in play with different agenda numbers, Abbey Church gets +2 shroud. Forced - When Abbey Church is revealed: Put the set-aside Chur Gothique, Knight's Hall, Cloister, Chapel of St. Aubert, and Abbey Tower locations into play.
Name: Abbey Church

Description: [action] Place 1 doom on the current "a" agenda: Heal 2 damage. (Group limit once per game).
Flavor: Lightning flashes through the windows of the abbey, thunder quickly answering in a booming voice all around the island.
Name: Chur Gothique

Description: [action] Place 1 doom on the current "c" agenda: Heal 2 horror. (Group limit once per game).
Flavor: Lightning flashes through the windows of the abbey, thunder quickly answering in a booming voice all around the island.
Name: Chur Gothique

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Cloister: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a guide."
Flavor: A lone monk patrols the covered walk, surrounding himself in whispered prayer. He doesn't seem to notice the storm threatening to tear the abbey down.
Name: Cloister
