"If anybody asks, you slipped in while I was using the john, all right? Dont take any wooden nickels."
Name: At the Exhibit

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Eztli Exhibit can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: One of the museum security guards, a man named Drew Walker, recognizes you from your prior work with Alejandro and Dr. Horowitz. "Look, I aint supposed to be letting anybody into the exhibit... But the coppers dont know from nothing when it comes to this hokum." He steps aside and lets you pass. "If anybody asks, you slipped in while I was using the john, all right? Dont take any wooden nickels."
Name: At the Exhibit

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Harlan Earnstone: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: There is no sign of Harlan in his office, but one of the assistants in the administration building informs you that he took the day off and went to his home in Easttown.
Name: Harlan's Curse

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Harlan Earnstone: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: There is no sign of Harlan in his office, but one of the assistants in the administration building informs you that he took the day off and went to his home in Easttown.
Name: Harlan's Curse

Description: While Relic of Ages is attached to a location, that location gets +2 shroud. Objective - If Relic of Ages is attached to a location with no remaining clues, advance.
Flavor: You believe you have discovered the relics whereabouts. Now, you must scour this place from bottom to top in order to find it.
Name: Find the Relic

Description: While Relic of Ages is attached to an enemy, that enemy gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Objective - If the enemy the Relic of Ages is attached to leaves play, advance.
Flavor: Youve discovered who is carrying the relic. Now, you must secure it from them, whatever the cost!
Name: Recover the Relic

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Easttown can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Youve decided to search for Alejandro on your own, believing you will have a better shot at finding him without involving the police. His hotel is in Easttown, so you begin your search there.
Name: Search for Alejandro

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Easttown can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Suspecting foul play, youve decided to go to the police to enlist their help in searching for Alejandro.
Name: Missing Persons

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Arkham Police Station can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: The police station might be open to the public in theory, but getting your story heard by the proper authorities requires a bit more finesse than you imagined.
Name: At the Station

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Arkham Police Station can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: The police station might be open to the public in theory, but getting your story heard by the proper authorities requires a bit more finesse than you imagined.
Name: At the Station

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Henry Deveau: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: You cant get into Alejandros hotel room, so you decide to question several of the occupants in the neighboring rooms. One of them informs you that Alejandro has been meeting often with an acquaintance of his, a government official named Henry Deveau. They tend to meet nightly at Velmas Diner. Perhaps you should pay Henry a visit?
Name: Friends in High Places

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Henry Deveau: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: You cant get into Alejandros hotel room, so you decide to question several of the occupants in the neighboring rooms. One of them informs you that Alejandro has been meeting often with an acquaintance of his, a government official named Henry Deveau. They tend to meet nightly at Velmas Diner. Perhaps you should pay Henry a visit?
Name: Friends in High Places

Description: While Alejandro Vela is attached to a location, that location gets +2 shroud. Objective - If Alejandro Vela is attached to a location with no remaining clues, advance.
Flavor: You believe that Alejandro is held captive somewhere in this location. You must rescue him!
Name: Alejandro's Prison

Description: While Alejandro Vela is attached to an enemy, that enemy gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Objective - If the enemy Alejandro Vela is attached to leaves play, advance.
Flavor: You believe you have discovered the identity of Alejandros kidnapper. Now you must fight to rescue your companion!
Name: Alejandro's Plight

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Rivertown can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Ichtaca told you not to follow her, though you cant help but wonder what she is up to. You decide to pursue her as she heads down toward the riverside
Name: Trial of the Huntress

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Northside can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Ichtaca tells you that she saw several Eztli artifacts on sale in the strange shop near the northwestern edge of the city. She wants to head in that direction to investigate further.
Name: The Guardian's Inquiry

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Black Cave can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. There must be no clues remaining on the Black Cave in order to advance this act.
Flavor: You watched Ichtaca enter this abandoned cave on her own. What is she doing in such a strange place?
Name: The Cave of Darkness

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Black Cave can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. There must be no clues remaining on the Black Cave in order to advance this act.
Flavor: You watched Ichtaca enter this abandoned cave on her own. What is she doing in such a strange place?
Name: The Cave of Darkness

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Maria DeSilva: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: Inside the shop, an middle-aged woman wearing the height of fashion inspects the Eztli relics on display with admiration. How did those relics get here? And what does this woman know about all of this?
Name: Strange Relics

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Maria DeSilva: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: Inside the shop, an middle-aged woman wearing the height of fashion inspects the Eztli relics on display with admiration. How did those relics get here? And what does this woman know about all of this?
Name: Strange Relics

Description: While you are at any of "Ichtaca's destinations," the first treachery you draw from the encounter deck each round gains surge. Objective - If there are no clues remaining on each of "Ichtaca's destinations," advance.
Flavor: Ichtaca has found the target of her investigation. The trail of the mysterious cult leads here. A thorough search of the area may reveal more...
Name: Strange Occurrences

Description: "Ichtaca's prey" each get +1 fight, +1 [per_investigator] health, and +1 evade while at a location with no clues on it. Objective - If each of "Ichtaca's prey" is no longer in play, advance.
Flavor: Ichtaca has found target of her hunt. The mysterious cult has been revealed - but what is their ultimate purpose?
Name: The Brotherhood Is Revealed

Description:
Easttown is connected to Velma's Diner.
[action] [action] [action]: You kill some time at the diner and listen to the conversations of the patrons around you. Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: A bit of warmth in an otherwise dreary town.
Name: Velma's Diner

Description:
Northside is connected to Curiositie Shoppe.
While you are in the Curiositie Shoppe, reduce the cost of each [[relic]] asset you play by 2.
Flavor: A brass bell clangs as you push open the front door. Inside, the shop is dusty and disorganized. Inspecting the unusual wares on display causes the hair on your arms to stand on end.
Name: Curiositie Shoppe

Description: Downtown is connected to Town Hall. Forced - After you enter Town Hall, if you have 4 or more cards in your hand: Choose and discard cards from your hand until you have 3 cards in your hand.
Name: Town Hall

Description: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror. For each act deck the investigators have completed, this skill test gets +1 difficulty and deals +1 damage and +1 horror if it is failed.
Name: The Secret Must Be Kept

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. If there are no clues on your location, Nobody's Home gains surge. You must spend 1 additional action to investigate attached location. Forced - If there are no clues on attached location: Discard Nobody's Home.
Name: Nobody's Home

Description: Revelation - Attach Conspiracy of Blood to the current agenda. Attached agenda gets -1 doom threshold. Each [[cultist]] enemy gains: "[action] Parley. Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard 1 copy of Conspiracy of Blood from play. If you fail, place 1 doom on this enemy."
Name: Conspiracy of Blood

Description: You get +1 [combat] (+2 [combat] instead while attacking an enemy with Victory X). You get +1 [agility] (+2 [agility] instead while attempting to evade an enemy with Vengeance X). [reaction] After you add an enemy to the victory display, exhaust Ichtaca: You and Ichtaca each heal 1 horror.
Name: Ichtaca

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to explore.
Flavor:
Sunday, July 12th, 1925
What have we done?
Name: Expedition Journal

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and to each investigator at the chosen location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hyperawareness

Description: Attach to your location. Non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot move into or spawn at attached location. Each time a non-[[Elite]] enemy would spawn at attached location, spawn it at a connecting location instead, if able. Forced - When an investigator leaves attached location: Discard Barricade.
Name: Barricade

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hard Knocks

Description: Gain 10 resources.
Flavor: "I win again! Sorry sugar, its just not your night."
Name: Hot Streak

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Arcane Studies

Description:
Fast. Play after a phase begins.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy in your location. Until the end of the phase, reduce the chosen enemy's damage and horror values by 1, and treat its printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Name: Mind Wipe

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Dig Deep

Description: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Search the top X cards of your deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle the remaining cards into your deck. X is the amount you failed by.
Flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldnt say thats true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
Name: Rabbit's Foot

Description:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Gathering shown here.
- Remove Act 1a- "Trapped" from the game and replace it with the new Act 1a- "Mysterious Gateway."
(Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Gathering

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Guest Hall may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: As you leap to investigate, the door to your study vanishes before your eyes, leaving behind a strange gateway to another part of your house. There must be a reason why this is happening
Name: Mysterious Gateway

Description:
[action] [action]: Draw 3 cards. Only the lead investigator can activate this ability.
Forced - When an enemy attempts to spawn at a location that is not in play: Put that location into play and spawn that enemy there.
Flavor: The door to your study has vanished, leaving in its wake a gateway to another part of your house.
Name: Study

Description: Investigators in this location cannot take draw actions.
Flavor: How did you end up here ?
Name: Guest Hall

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Bedroom: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
Flavor: The bedsheets are tattered, and a strange symbol is drawn on the fabric. Blood pools at the foot of the closet door, and you can hear something chewing inside.
Name: Bedroom

Description: Forced - After you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [auto_fail] symbol while investigating the Bathroom: Lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
Flavor: The guest bathroom looks as though it hasn't been cleaned in years. A viscous green liquid fills the bathtub in the far corner of the room, and mold has grown across the walls.
Name: Bathroom

Description: Forced - After you reveal this location: Put the set-aside Attic, Cellar, and Parlor locations into play.
Flavor: The walls of your house are splattered with mud, and your hardwood floor is gone, replaced with a dirt path.
Name: Hallway

Description: Forced - After you reveal the Attic: Put the set-aside Far Above Your House location into play.
Flavor: The bloody carcass of some sort of beast swings from a meat hook chained to the ceiling. Blood drains slowly from the carcass, dripping into a small barrel. To your surprise, a wooden ladder at the far end of the attic ascends through your roof, to an even higher area
Name: Attic

Description: Forced - After you reveal Field of Graves: Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, discard 1 card at random from each player's hand.
Flavor: You climb the ladder and emerge from a pit in the ground amidst an endless field of graves. Each bears a branch from your family tree.
Name: Field of Graves

Description: Forced - After you reveal the Cellar: Put the set-aside Deep Below Your House location into play.
Flavor: Your cellar seems to have been replaced with an underground network of icy tunnels and caverns. The tunnels continue for miles, deeper and deeper beneath the surface.
Name: Cellar

Description: Forced - After you reveal Ghoul Pits: Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Swarm of Rats and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Flavor: These pits seem to be the creatures' lairs. They are ice-cold and filled with the decaying remains of humans and other animals.
Name: Ghoul Pits

Description:
Spawn - Bedroom.
Hunter.
Flavor: Behind the door to your closet, the creature finishes its meal. Its appetite insatiable, it quickly turns its attention to you.
Name: Corpse-Hungry Ghoul

Description:
Spawn - Bathroom.
Retaliate.
Flavor: Tearing its way out of the floor, a crazed beast emerges from the tunnels below. Its eyes are red with hunger and hate.
Name: Ghoul from the Depths

Description: Revelation - Each investigator with 3 or fewer cards in hand must take 1 damage and 1 horror. Each investigator with 4 or more cards in hand tests [willpower] (2). Each investigator who fails must discard 2 cards at random from his or her hand.
Flavor: The third seal will be the last.
Name: The Zealot's Seal

Description:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to the Midnight Masks shown here.
- Construct the act deck using one of the two copies of Agenda 1a- "Predator or Prey" at random, without looking at their other sides. Remove the other version of Agenda 1a from the game.
(Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Midnight Masks

Description: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.
Flavor: Lita seems convinced of a conspiracy within the city of Arkham. She believes that a secret cult serves the ghouls that live in the crypts beneath the city, and that several of the cults prominent members are scattered throughout Arkham. As you begin searching for them, you cant shake the feeling that you, too, are being hunted.
Name: Predator or Prey?

Description: [action]: Add 2 supply tokens or ammo tokens to an asset you control. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: You doubt that Sheriff Engle will believe your story, but you might be able to convince some of the other officers to assist in your investigation.
Name: Easttown

Description: [action]: Move to any [[Arkham]] location. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: The train has many stops throughout Arkham, and many more beyond. You are tempted to leave all of this behind.
Name: Northside

Description: [action] Take 2 horror: Gain 1 clue from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: The university's museum holds many peculiar exhibits and ominous relics from expeditions all over the world.
Name: Miskatonic University

Description: [action] Discard a card with X [willpower] icons: Remove X doom from a [[Cultist]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: The lone warehouse next to the river is quiet and secluded: an ideal venue for unsavory dealings.
Name: Rivertown

Description: Revelation - Each investigator with 2 or more clues takes 2 horror. If no horror is dealt by this effect, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.
Flavor: "Um担rdhothUm担rdhothUm担rdhoth"
Name: Masked Horrors

Description:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Devourer Below shown here.
- When choosing 4 Arkham Woods locations to put into play at random, include the 4 new Arkham Woods locations included in this encounter set, for a total of 10 possibilities.
- After setting the Um担rdhoth enemy aside, flip this card over and attach it to Um担rdhoth.
Name: Return to The Devourer Below

Description: Forced - After an investigator at this location succeeds at a skill test on a treachery: That treachery gains surge. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: It seems to groan and twist in the chill wind, as though alive.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - After you reveal a chaos token from the chaos bag while investigating this location: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token. (Limit once per test.)
Flavor: This used to be a popular spot for fishing, but it doesn't look like anybody has fished here in years.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Each enemy at this location cannot take more than 1 damage from each attack performed against it.
Flavor: The remains of half-eaten animal corpses litter this section of the woods, befouling the air with their stench.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - After you reveal a chaos token from the chaos bag during an evasion attempt at this location: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token. (Limit once per test.)
Flavor: Not even on a dare would you attempt to cross this rotted, rickety bridge.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Revelation - Each investigator must discard 1 card at random from his or her hand. Each investigator who has no cards in his or her hand is killed. Heal 1 damage from each enemy in play.
Flavor: It prefers to feast on the rot of the deceased, but when the hunger is overpowering, the living will suffice.
Name: Um担rdhoth's Hunger

Description: Forced - After Grave-Eater attacks you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
Flavor:
Its position was a kind of crouch, and as one looked one felt that at any moment it might drop its present prey and seek a juicier morsel.
-H. P. Lovecraft, Pickmans Model
Name: Grave-Eater

Description:
Prey - Fewest cards in hand.
While engaged with an investigator with no cards in his or her hand, Acolyte of Um担rdhoth cannot be evaded.
Flavor: Its dreadful mask conceals the true horror beneath.
Name: Acolyte of Um担rdhoth

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must discard 1 card at random from your hand. For each card you cannot discard, take 1 damage.
Flavor: The ground is covered in ice and frost, and a deep chill courses through the air.
Name: Chill from Below

Description:
Spawn - Farthest empty location.
Forced - After you spawn Disciple of the Devourer: You must either place 1 doom on it or place 1 of your clues on its location. If the current agenda is not agenda 1, do both instead.
Flavor: Placate the beast, and we are allowed to live. When we die, it will feast on our remains.
Name: Disciple of the Devourer

Description:
Spawn - Farthest empty location.
Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Corpse-Taker.
Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Corpse-Taker moves once toward Rivertown or Main Path. If Corpse-Taker is already at Rivertown or Main Path, move all doom from Corpse-Taker to the current agenda, instead.
Name: Corpse-Taker

Description:
Revelation - Attach to the farthest [[Cultist]] enemy and place 1 doom on that enemy. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy, draw it, and attach Mask of Um担rdhoth to it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Attached enemy gets +2 health. If attached enemy is unique, it gains retaliate. If it is non-unique, it gains aloof instead.
Name: Mask of Um担rdhoth

Description:
Spawn - Your House. Otherwise, Rivertown.
[action]: Parley. Add Jeremiah Pierce to the victory display. Then, test [willpower] (4). Place 1 doom on the current agenda for each point you fail by (this can cause the current agenda to advance).
Flavor: He seems a little too interested in what youve been up to these days.
Name: Jeremiah Pierce

Description:
Spawn - Easttown.
Forced - After a [[Monster]] enemy is defeated at Billy Cooper's location: Add Billy Cooper to the victory display.
Flavor: The cops have been writing off these disappearances as animal attacks. One cop, in particular
Name: Billy Cooper

Description:
Spawn - Southside.
[action]: Parley. Draw the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Then, add Alma Hill to the victory display.
Flavor: Miss Hill has been preventing other members of the Historical Society from researching similar disappearances. What is she afraid of?
Name: Alma Hill

Description:
Play only as your first action.
Heal 1 damage (2 instead if you drew a treachery this round). Then, draw 1 card.
Name: Second Wind

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
Take the Initiative loses [wild] for each action that has been completed by any investigator this phase.
Name: Take the Initiative

Description: [free] Exhaust Well Prepared: Choose an asset you control. You get +X skill value for this skill test, where X is the number of matching skill icons on the chosen asset.
Name: Well Prepared

Description:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Place 2 secrets on an asset you control.
Flavor:
How do you know Im mad? said Alice.
You must be, said the Cat, or you wouldnt have come here.
- Lewis Carroll, Alices Adventures in Wonderland
Name: Truth from Fiction

Description:
Commit only to a skill test from an ability printed on a scenario card.
If this skill test is successful, discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: True Understanding

Description: [free] Place 1 of your clues on your location and exhaust Quick Study: You get +3 skill value for this skill test.
Name: Quick Study

Description: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, the next time the evaded enemy takes damage this turn, deal it 1 additional damage.
Flavor: Only someone who is half seas over would lather up the OBannions.
Name: Hatchet Man

Description: [free] Spend 3 resources and exhaust High Roller: You get +2 skill value for this skill test. If you succeed, gain 3 resources.
Flavor: The higher the stakes, the better his luck.
Name: High Roller

Description: If this skill test is successful during an investigation, place 1 charge or secret on an asset you control.
Flavor: Voyaging far from our placid island of ignorance.
Name: Enraptured

Description: [reaction] When a skill test you are performing begins, if Recall the Future is ready, name a chaos token: If the named chaos token is revealed during this skill test, exhaust Recall the Future. Then, you get +2 skill value for this skill test.
Name: Recall the Future

Description:
Uses (3 tries). If Try and Try Again has no tries, discard it.
[reaction] After a skill test is failed, if a skill card you own is committed to that test, exhaust Try and Try Again and spend 1 try: Return that skill card to your hand.
Name: Try and Try Again

Description: [free] Discard 1 card from your hand: You get +2 skill value for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
Flavor: Bravery is born when there is no other choice.
Name: Cornered

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at an [[Ancient]] location). [cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy. [tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail and there is a [[Serpent]] enemy at your location, it attacks you. [elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, place 1 clue (from the token pool) on the nearest [[Ancient]] location.
Name: The Boundary Beyond

Flavor:
Ichtaca is already up and about when you awaken, donning her traditional armor, her bow on her back and a long blade at her side. "Something is wrong," she states cryptically. "I only meant to peer through the boundary"
Her eyes are bloodshot, her face pale as a ghost. You suspect she hasnt slept all night. "It matters not. It is time you witnessed the fate that will befall humanity if we fail."
Name: The Boundary, Broken

Flavor: Ichtacas strength continues to wane as you journey through the strange vision. Youve never seen her this troubled. She is often distracted, peering about as though any moment the answer will appear before her. From time to time, she mutters strange phrases to herself: "How could this have happened?The answer will be with the ancientsSomeone else is here, I know it"
Name: The Barrier Is Thin

Flavor: Alejandros former critic stands atop the steps of the main temple, her true self revealed to you. Silver streaks of lightning wind through her open arms. Coiled about her feet is an army of hissing cobras. "Only the chosen can find the Nexus! Only I am worthy!"
Name: Time Collapsing

Description: Objective - After the first [[Tenochtitl叩n]] location enters play by exploring successfully, advance.
Flavor:
As you depart the hotel, you realize that the landscape of the city has been altered. Silver lightning crackles in the sky overhead, and the earth rumbles deep below your feet. Monstrous, polypous entities float just below the clouds. "What is going on?" you yell to Ichtaca over the whistling wind. "What is this place?"
"One future," she replies enigmatically.
Name: Crossing the Threshold

Description: Objective - Find paths to the Nexus by discovering all of the clues from as many different [[Tenochtitl叩n]] locations as you can before time runs out. If there are 6 [[Tenochtitl叩n]] locations in play with no clues on them, advance.
Flavor: Is this real, or a vision? Either way, the secrets of the ancients may hold the key to finding the Nexus of Nkai
Name: Past and Present

Description: Objective - If Padma Amrita is defeated, advance. Objective - If investigators in Templo Mayor spend the requisite number of clues, advance.
Flavor: Ichtaca points to the temple in the distance, shouting over the raging storm. "It was her! She is the one trapping us here; shes known all along!" One way or another, if you want to get back home, youll have to slip through the rift Padma entered from.
Name: The Return Trip

Description: [action] [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Temple Ruins

Description: [action] Take 1 horror: Draw 2 cards. [action] If you have 6 or more cards in your hand: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Metropolitan Cathedral

Description: Forced - After you fail a [willpower] test while at Chapultepec Park: Take 1 horror. [action]: Explore. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Chapultepec Park

Description: [action] Discard cards with a total combined cost of at least 5 from your hand: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Z坦calo

Description: While you are at Xochimilco, you cannot gain resources. [action] Spend 3 resources: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Xochimilco

Description: [action] Take 1 damage or 1 horror: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Coyoac叩n

Description: Forced - After Templo Mayor enters play: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Serpent]] enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy here. [reaction] After you defeat or evade a [[Serpent]] enemy at this location: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Group limit once per phase.)
Name: Templo Mayor

Description: Forced - After Templo Mayor enters play: Shuffle your discard pile into your deck. Discard cards from the top of your deck until a weakness is discarded. Draw that weakness. [action] Shuffle a weakness from your discard pile into your deck: Discover 2 clues at this location. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Templo Mayor

Description: Forced - After Temples of Tenochtitl叩n enters play: Each investigator at this location takes 1 direct damage. While you are investigating Temples of Tenochtitl叩n, if you have 3 or fewer remaining health, Temples of Tenochtitl叩n gets -2 shroud.
Name: Temples of Tenochtitl叩n

Description: Forced - After Temples of Tenochtitl叩n enters play: Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. [action] Place 1 doom on an enemy: Discover 2 clues at this location. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Temples of Tenochtitl叩n

Description: Forced - After Chapultepec Hill enters play: Each investigator at this location discards 2 random cards from his or her hand. [action] Discard your hand of at least 3 cards: Discover 2 clues at this location. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Chapultepec Hill

Description:
Each investigator at Chapultepec Hill gets -2 [willpower].
[reaction] After you draw a [[Hex]] card: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Group limit once per phase.)
Name: Chapultepec Hill

Description:
Each enemy at Canals of Tenochtitl叩n gets +2 evade.
While there is an exhausted enemy at Canals of Tenochtitl叩n, it gets -3 shroud.
Name: Canals of Tenochtitl叩n

Description: Forced - After Canals of Tenochtitl叩n enters play: Place 4 resources on it. Canals of Tenochtitl叩n gets +1 shroud for each resource on it. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 resource from Canals of Tenochtitl叩n.
Name: Canals of Tenochtitl叩n

Description: Forced - After Lake Xochimilco enters play: Each investigator at this location loses all of his or her remaining actions. While you are investigating Lake Xochimilco, it gets +2 shroud for each action you have remaining.
Name: Lake Xochimilco

Description: Forced - After Lake Xochimilco enters play: Each investigator at this location takes 1 direct horror. While you are investigating Lake Xochimilco, if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity, Lake Xochimilco gets -2 shroud.
Name: Lake Xochimilco

Description: Forced - After Sacred Woods enters play: Each investigator at this location discards the top 10 cards of his or her deck. [action] If you have no cards remaining in your deck: Discover all of the clues at Sacred Woods.
Name: Sacred Woods

Description:
While you are at Sacred Woods, increase the cost of each card you play by 2.
While you are investigating Sacred Woods, it gets -1 shroud for each asset you control.
Name: Sacred Woods

Description: Alert. Retaliate. Hunter. While Padma Amrita is ready, clues cannot be discovered from each [[Ancient]] location. Forced - After Padma Amrita attacks you: If you have at least 1 clue, flip 1 of your clues to its doom side. Otherwise, take 3 horror.
Name: Padma Amrita

Description: While Serpent of Tenochtitl叩n is at an [[Ancient]] location with clues on it, it gains retaliate and alert. Otherwise, it gains hunter. Forced - After Serpent of Tenochtitl叩n deals you damage from its attack: If you are not poisoned, put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in your threat area.
Name: Serpent of Tenochtitl叩n

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from an [[Ancient]] location, if Hand of the Brotherhood is ready: Place 1 doom on Hand of the Brotherhood. While Hand of the Brotherhood is ready, [action] and [reaction] abilities on its location and connecting locations cannot be triggered.
Name: Hand of the Brotherhood

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Choose and shuffle an [[Ancient]] location back into the exploration deck (the [[Present-Day]] location underneath it takes its place). - Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect can cause the current agenda to advance).
Name: Window to Another Time

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Ancient]] location in play. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror, and shuffle Timeline Destabilization into the exploration deck.
Flavor: As the threads pull, the weave unravels
Name: Timeline Destabilization

Description: [free] Exhaust Relic of Ages: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, remove 1 doom from the current agenda. If you fail, add 1 doom to Relic of Ages. (Max one success per game.)
Flavor: The device throbs with power in your hands, and the air shimmers around its frame. Can such a device really alter the flow of time?
Name: Relic of Ages

Description: If this skill test is successful, add Intrepid to your play area as an asset with the text: "You get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility]. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Intrepid."
Name: Intrepid

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Place 2 ammo on that asset. Limit 1 per asset.
Attacks performed by attached asset deal +1 damage against [[Monster]] enemies.
Flavor: "You want me to bless - what?"
Name: Custom Ammunition

Description: [action] Exhaust Otherworldly Compass: Investigate. Your location gets -X shroud for this investigation. X is the number of revealed locations connected to your location.
Flavor: It always points where you don't want to go.
Name: Otherworldly Compass

Description:
Fast. Play during any [free] player window.
Choose an enemy at your location. Test [intellect] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you succeed, treat that enemy's fight value as if it were 0 for the next attack performed against it this phase. Draw 1 card.
Name: Expose Weakness

Description:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility].
[free] Exhaust Lola Santiago and spend X resources: Discover 1 clue at your location. X is the shroud value of your location.
Flavor:
"My line of work encounters a lot of so-called 'curses.'
It is a topic I would rather not discuss."
Name: Lola Santiago

Description: [reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, exhaust Olive McBride: Reveal 3 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 2 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.
Flavor: You must invest yourself in every spell. Sometimes literally.
Name: Olive McBride

Description: Ignore the effects of all [skull], [cultist], [tablet], and [elder_thing] symbols during this test (including their modifiers).
Flavor: "No."
Name: Defiance

Description: Fast. Play during any [free] player window. Put Premonition into play, reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag, and seal it on Premonition. Forced - When a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag: Resolve the token sealed here as if it were just revealed from the chaos bag, instead. Then, discard Premonition.
Name: Premonition

Description: Fast. Play after a skill test you failed ends (after resolving all effects from the failed test). Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.
Name: Live and Learn

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Take Heart to any type of test.
If this test fails, the performing investigator draws 2 cards and gains 2 resources.
Name: Take Heart

Description:
Fast. Play when you perform a skill test with a difficulty higher than your base skill value.
Reveal X additional chaos tokens for this skill test. Choose one to resolve and ignore the others. X is the difference between the test's difficulty and your base skill value.
Name: Against All Odds

Description: You get +1 [agility] during evasion attempts.
Flavor:
Roland loosened his tie, tilted his hat, and turned up his coat collar, and when he was sure he looked respectably disreputable, he approached the door.
- Graeme Davis, <u>The Dirge of Reason</u>
Name: Trench Coat

Description: Uses (1 ammo). Limit 1 ammo on Ornate Bow. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [agility] and deal +2 damage for this attack. [action]: You nock another arrow. Place 1 ammo on Ornate Bow.
Name: Ornate Bow

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are in a [[Cave]] location).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on your location.
[tablet]: -2. If you are poisoned, this test automatically fails instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, take 1 horror.
Name: Heart of the Elders

Description: [action]: Resign. "Let's make camp and solve this puzzle tomorrow." [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, look at the top 3 cards of the exploration deck. Place 1 on the bottom and the other 2 on top, in any order.
Name: Mouth of K'n-yan

Description: [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.
Flavor: You are deep in the jungle now, surrounded on all sides by the uncharted wilderness. All around you, the rainforest sings, its lyrics found in every chirping insect, every serpents hiss, every snapping tree branch.
Name: The Jungle's Heart

Description: [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.
Flavor: The day advances quickly. Through the thick canopy of trees, you can tell that the sun is starting to sink closer to the horizon. To the east, the sky grows dim. Soon the jungle will be covered in darkness, and you will have to stop and make camp for the night.
Name: Setting Sun

Flavor: Six stone pillars surround the entrance to the cavern, each carved with a series of uncanny grooves and hieroglyphs that form an intricate pattern. Touching them causes the grooves to glow brightly, and twisting them causes the patterns to shift and change. Perhaps these patterns match the glyphs found in other regions of the jungle?
Name: Search for the Pattern

Description: [action] Investigators at the Mouth of K'n-yan spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You solve one piece of the puzzle. Add 1 resource to the Mouth of K'n-yan, as a pillar token. Objective - Solve the puzzle of the six pillars in order to enter K'n-yan. If there are 6 pillar tokens on the Mouth of K'n-yan, advance to act 2b.
Flavor: You have discovered that the ruins within the jungle each bear a distinct pattern of glyphs, which match those found on the six pillars. As you turn the pillars to match these patterns, a serpentine creature descends from the clouds
Name: Opening the Maw

Description: [action] If there are no clues on your location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Forced - When this agenda advances: Do not remove doom from each location in play.
Flavor: Though much of this cavern system is natural and untouched by humans, you are stunned to find signs of an ancient civilization that once inhabited the area.
Name: The Lonely Caverns

Description: [action] If there are no clues on your location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. *This agenda gets +1 [per_investigator] doom threshold.
Flavor: Bright-yellow eyes peer at you from all sides as you continue delving deeper into the cavern. The glowing orbs vanish as light is cast on them, reappearing as soon as the darkness returns.
Name: Eyes in the Dark

Flavor: The vast underground caverns of Kn-yan are cold and all too quiet. Scattered, forsaken ruins lie undisturbed along your path to the Nexus of Nkai. What happened in this ancient and forgotten place? Were these ruins once occupied by humans? Or by a species far, far older?
Name: Cavern of the Forgotten Age

Description: Objective - If each surviving investigator is at the Descent to Yoth and there is no doom on it, you may advance.
Flavor: The deeper you descend into the cold darkness, the more you feel the crushing weight of the world above, and the dizzying reality of the world further below. You suddenly long for the surface and wonder if you will ever see the skyagain.
Name: Descent into Dark

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Test [agility] (3) to attempt to jump the gap. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. - Shuffle Pitfall into the exploration deck. You cannot choose this option if Pitfall was drawn from the exploration deck.
Name: Pitfall

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at the attached location who is poisoned takes 2 horror. Each investigator at the attached location who is not poisoned must put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in his or her threat area, instead. Discard Poisonous Spores.
Name: Poisonous Spores

Description: [action] [action]: Choose a non-[[Elite]] card worth vengeance points in the victory display. Place that card in the encounter discard pile. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: The flora along this path are wildly distorted. Some of the flowers are withered and some are vibrant, but all are alien to you.
Name: Time-Wracked Woods

Description: Forced - After you enter Stone Altar: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, lose 1 action. If you cannot, take 1 horror instead.
Flavor: Once a ceremonial site, now overgrown and forgotten.
Name: Stone Altar

Description: Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Apex Strangleweed makes an attack of opportunity against you: Check your supplies. If you do not have a pocket knife, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
Name: Apex Strangleweed

Description: Prey - Nearest to the Mouth of K'n-yan. Hunter. Forced - After a pillar token is placed on the Mouth of K'n-yan: Shuffle one copy of Basilisk into the encounter deck. (Max once per round.) Vengeance 2.
Name: Basilisk

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, discard a random card from your hand or choose and discard a card from your play area.
Flavor: One ant is a nuisance. A colony is another matter.
Name: Ants!

Description: As an additional cost for you to explore while at Vast Passages, check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has binoculars, you must spend 1 additional action.
Flavor:
The scale of these caverns is dizzying.
It is truly a world of its own.
Name: Vast Passages

Description: Forced - After you put Hall of Idolatry into play by successfully exploring: Check Campaign Log. If there are 5 or more tally marks under "Yig's Fury", draw the top card of the encounter deck (top 2 cards instead if there are 10 or more tally marks).
Name: Hall of Idolatry

Description: Forced - After Dark Hollow enters play, check your supplies. If no investigator has a map: Place 1 [per_investigator] additional clues on Dark Hollow.
Flavor: The throat of the cavern extends for miles, and you cannot help but feel as though you are descending into the belly of a great beast.
Name: Dark Hollow

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Perilous Gulch: Check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has rope, place 1 doom on Perilous Gulch.
Flavor: Along a dark chasm, the path winds and twists. Serpent statues with rearing heads are poised to strike as you pass.
Name: Perilous Gulch

Description: Forced - After you enter Crystal Pillars: Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vengeance point in the victory display. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: Enormous white crystals pierce through the tunnel, sending reflections of light across the walls and ceiling.
Name: Crystal Pillars

Description: Forced - After Descent to Yoth enters play: Each investigator must either place 1 doom on Descent to Yoth or draw the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. [reaction] After you successfully investigate Descent to Yoth: Instead of discovering clues, you may flip 1 doom on Descent to Yoth to its clue side. Vengeance 2.
Name: Descent to Yoth

Description: Revelation - Attach No Turning Back to your location or a connecting location. Limit 1 per location. Investigators cannot enter or leave attached location. [action]: Test [combat] (3) or check your supplies. If you succeed, or if you have a pickaxe, discard No Turning Back. Any investigator at a connecting location may activate this ability.
Name: No Turning Back

Description: Uses (8 ammo). [action] Spend 1-5 ammo: Fight. You get +X [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals X damage. X is the amount of ammo spent as part of this ability's cost.
Name: M1918 BAR

Description:
Researched. Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone."
[reaction] When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Deal that much damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Ancient Stone

Description:
Researched. Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone."
[reaction] When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Heal that much horror from a card at your location.
Name: Ancient Stone

Description: Evade. Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 2 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Slip Away

Description: Gain 1 resource for each action you performed this turn (including this one). If it is your turn, end your turn.
Name: Pay Day

Description: Discard a [mystic] asset you control. Then, draw 3 cards or gain 3 resources, or any combination thereof.
Flavor: The first step is the hardest.
Name: Sacrifice

Description:
Seal (+1 or [elder_sign]).
You get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
Flavor: Priceless in every sense of the word.
Name: Crystalline Elder Sign

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
Discard On Your Own if you control an asset that takes up an ally slot.
[reaction] When you play a [survivor] event, exhaust On Your Own: Reduce that event's cost by 2.
Name: On Your Own

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you have 5 or more cards in your hand).
[cultist] or [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, discard 1 random card from your hand.
Name: The City of Archives

Description: Investigators cannot put [[Item]] assets into play (including [[Item]] weaknesses).
Flavor: Somehow you have awoken in a futuristic city, inhabited by odd alien creatures beyond your imagining. You must explore this strange place if you are to find a way out, but your new body is difficult to get used to.
Name: City of the Great Race

Description: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
Flavor: Little by little, the memories of your former life are starting to fade. The most recent events are the first to disappear, but soon you begin to lose your grip on your human identity.
Name: Lost Memories

Description: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 4.
Flavor:
How long has it been? Days? Weeks?

Years?
Name: Humanity Fading

Description: Each copy of Yithian Observer gains aloof.
Flavor: Getting out of this strange city might be harder than you thought. Its halls are endless and filled with all manner of complex, futuristic machinery.
Name: Exploring Pnakotus

Description: Objective - If three of the following are true, you must advance: - An investigator "found the process." - An investigator "dissected an organ." - An investigator "interviewed a subject." - An investigator "realized what year it is." - An investigator "activated the device." - An investigator controls The Custodian.
Flavor: You have to find a way back home. Surely if the Yithians can bring you to this place, there must be a way to return
Name: Restricted Access

Description: Each Yithian Observer gains hunter. [action] Spend 1 clue: Draw. Draw 2 cards instead of 1. If your hand exceeds your maximum hand size, draw 1 additional card. Objective - If each surviving investigator has 10 or more cards in his or her hand, immediately advance. (Beware - remember to complete as many of the tasks listed on act 2b as you can.)
Flavor: You have gathered the knowledge necessary to repossess your body, but before you can initiate the process, you must expand your mind.
Name: Repossession

Description:
Each of your [[Ally]] assets gains the [[Yithian]] trait.
[reaction] After you commit a card to a skill test you are performing: Double the skill icons on that card. (Limit once per test.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Draw 1 card.
Name: Body of a Yithian

Description: [reaction] After you begin your turn in this location, if there is a [[Yithian]] enemy in this location: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: There were colossal round windows and high arched doors, and pedestals or tables each as tall as the height of an ordinary room. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Interview Room

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) or [combat] (4) to interrogate the captive mind restrained here. If you succeed, remember that you "interviewed a subject." If you fail, take 2 horror.
Name: Interview Room

Description: Forced - After you enter this location: Test [willpower] (3). Take 1 horror for each point you fail by.
Flavor: An unidentifiable ooze covers the large table near the center of the chamber. The remains of a failed experiment? Or something far worse?
Name: Interview Room

Description: [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Later I had visions of sweeping through Cyclopean corridors of stone, and up and down gigantic inclined planes of the same monstrous masonry. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Halls of Pnakotus

Description: [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Later I had visions of sweeping through Cyclopean corridors of stone, and up and down gigantic inclined planes of the same monstrous masonry. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Halls of Pnakotus

Description: [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: Later I had visions of sweeping through Cyclopean corridors of stone, and up and down gigantic inclined planes of the same monstrous masonry. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Halls of Pnakotus

Description: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Test [intellect] (3) to decipher the information you've found. If you succeed, remember that you have "found the process." Forced - At the end of the round, if there are fewer than 4 clues on Great Library: Add clues to Great Library until there are 4 clues on it.
Name: Great Library

Description:
[action] [action] If there are no clues on Yithian Orrery: Remember that you "realized what year it is."
While you are in the Yithian Orrery, increase your maximum hand size by 2.
Name: Yithian Orrery

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Laboratory of the Great Race: Test [agility] (3) to manipulate the controls on the technological device nearby. If you succeed, remember that you "activated the device." If you fail, place 1 clue on Laboratory of the Great Race (from the token pool).
Name: Laboratory of the Great Race

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (4) to attempt to retrieve a valuable organ from one of the alien cadavers. This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Deconstruction Room. If you succeed, remember that you "dissected an organ."
Name: Deconstruction Room

Description: [action]: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Shuffle your discard pile into your deck and draw cards equal to 1 more than the number of cards you discarded. (Limit once per turn.)
Flavor: The great sandy desert beyond is no escape for you. If you leave, you will never repossess your body.
Name: Towers of Pnakotus

Description: [reaction] When the investigation phase begins, if you control The Custodian: Each investigator at its location draws 1 card. [action] If The Custodian is not controlled by a player: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to converse with the library custodian. If you succeed, something about its mannerisms seems familiar to you; place 1 of your clues on it. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on it, take control of The Custodian.
Name: The Custodian

Description: Spawn - Great Library. Alert. Aloof. If an investigator has "found the process" or "realized what year it is," Keeper of the Great Library loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Keeper of the Great Library

Description: Spawn - Laboratory of the Great Race. Aloof. If an investigator has "activated the device" or "dissected an organ," Scientist of Yith loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Scientist of Yith

Description: Prey - Most cards in hand. Forced - When Scholar from Yith attacks you: Discard 2 random cards from your hand. [action] If Scholar from Yith is ready and engaged with you: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to attempt to pass as a member of the creature's race. If you succeed, draw 1 card and evade Scholar from Yith. If you fail, Scholar from Yith attacks you.
Name: Scholar from Yith

Description: Revelation - Put Yithian Presence into play in your threat area. If there is a [[Yithian]] enemy at your location, you cannot investigate that location or trigger [action] abilities on encounter cards (including this card). [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Discard Yithian Presence.
Name: Yithian Presence

Description: Revelation - Put Cruel Interrogations into play in your threat area. If any investigator has "interviewed a subject," take 1 horror and Cruel Interrogations gains surge. You cannot take draw actions. [action]: Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, discard Cruel Interrogations.
Name: Cruel Interrogations

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, remove the top card of your deck from the game. If there are less than 10 total cards in your hand, deck and discard pile, you are driven insane.
Flavor: All memories that could be eradicated were eradicated, so that in most cases only a dream-shadowed blank stretched back to the time of the first exchange. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow out of Time</u>
Name: Lost Humanity

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (0). Regardless of whether this skill test succeeds or fails, choose and discard all but X cards from your hand. X is your modified skill value for this test.
Flavor: It was not a kidnapping, but an exchange.
Name: Captive Mind

Description: Revelation - Shuffle each card from your hand into your deck and draw an equal number of cards. Shuffle Out of Body Experience into your deck.
Flavor: My head was aching, and I had a singular feeling - altogether new to me - that someone else was trying to get possession of my thoughts. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow Out of Time</u>
Name: Out of Body Experience

Description: [action] If Handcuffs is not attached to an enemy: Evade. Use only on a [[Humanoid]] enemy. This evasion attempt uses [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, attach Handcuffs to the just-evaded enemy. If the attached enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot ready and doom cannot be placed on it.
Name: Handcuffs

Description: As an additional cost to play Blood Eclipse, take up to 3 damage. Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack for each damage taken as part of this card's cost.
Name: Blood Eclipse

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Feed the Mind and spend 1 secret: Test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, draw 1 card. Then, take 1 horror for each card in your hand in excess of your maximum hand size.
Name: Feed the Mind

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Colt Vest Pocket.
Name: Colt Vest Pocket

Description: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. If this effect defeats that enemy, draw 1 card. If it is your turn, end your turn. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor:
Two bullets cracked open the creatures skull.
Then another. Then another. Then another.
Name: Coup de Gr但ce

Description:
Exceptional. Fast.
[action]: If the Skeleton Key is in your play area, attach it to your location. If it is already attached to your location, detach it and return it to your play area instead.
Set the attached location's shroud value to 1.
Name: The Skeleton Key

Description: Uses (5 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +3 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, after evading the chosen enemy, you may move to a connecting location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, choose and discard a card from your hand.
Name: Mists of R'lyeh

Description: You may play Winging It from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle it into your deck after resolving its effects. Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. (If you played Winging It from your discard pile, discover 1 additional clue if you succeed.)
Name: Winging It

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, the rifle jams. (This attack automatically fails. Before you can activate this ability again, you must perform the following ability: "[action]: You clear the jam.")
Name: Old Hunting Rifle

Description:
Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Thermos: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location (2 damage instead if he or she has 2 or more physical trauma).
[action] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Thermos: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location (2 horror instead if he or she has 2 or more mental trauma).
Name: Thermos

Description:
While your current location is connected to at least 2 other locations, you get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
While your current location is connected to at least 4 other locations, you get an additional +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
Name: Hemispheric Map

Description: [action] If Timeworn Brand is ready: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [action] Exhaust Timeworn Brand: Fight. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +3 damage. If this attack defeats an [[Elite]] enemy, draw 3 cards. (Max once per game.)
Name: Timeworn Brand

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: -X. X is the current depth level. [cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, each [[Serpent]] enemy at your location or a connecting location heals 2 damage. [tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 clue on your location (from the token pool). [elder_thing]: -2. If there are 3 or more vengeance points in the victory display, you automatically fail this test, instead.
Name: The Depths of Yoth

Flavor: Slowly and cautiously, you begin your descent into the red-litten caverns of Yoth. It is quiet, and only the crumbling of stone and your echoing footfalls can be heard in the tunnels surrounding you.
Name: The Descent Begins

Flavor: Hisses begin to emanate from the tunnels all around you. Snake eyes glare at you from the dark as you attempt to avoid encountering the creatures that remain in this realm. You weave in and out of narrow tunnels and hide behind brokendown walls and crumblingpillars.
Name: Horrific Descent

Flavor: You are convinced of it now: these caverns are without end. They must span the entirety of the subterranean layer of the Earth. Will you ever reach the Nexus? Will you ever make it home?
Name: Endless Caverns

Flavor: The caverns are no longer quiet. The angry cries and rattling of serpent creatures is all around you now, urging you onward. The caverns unnatural red glow becomes more intense. In this red light, the cities of Yoth take on another guise - no longer a source of hidden knowledge, but a place of animosity that resents your mere presence.
Name: City of Blood

Description: Forced - After the third doom is placed on this agenda: Find the enemy that is in pursuit with the highest evade value, and spawn it at the location where the investigators began at this depth level.
Flavor: The serpents have stirred up something much larger and more deadly than anything you have faced on this journey. Pale, sweaty, and terrified, you scurry for an exit - any exit.
Name: Fury That Shakes the Earth

Description: Forced - After any amount of doom is placed on this agenda: Find the enemy that is in pursuit with the highest evade value, and spawn it at the location where the investigators began at this depth level.
Flavor: The deeper your descent, the brighter and more pervasive the red glow of the caverns becomes. If you didnt know any better, you would think you were descending into the very depths of hell itself.
Name: The Red Depths

Description: Forced - At the end of the 'check doom threshold' step of the mythos phase: The investigators must draw 1 additional encounter card for each doom in play, in player order. Objective - If each investigator is defeated, advance this agenda.
Flavor: You never should have come here.
Name: VENGEANCE

Description: [action] If there are no clues on your location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Objective - At the end of the round, if investigators at Steps of Yoth possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Beware - any investigator who is not at Steps of Yoth will be defeated.)
Flavor: Doubt and horror grew upon me as I wound still farther down the seemingly endless staircase. Would the thing never stop?- H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Journey to the Nexus

Description: [reaction] When adding to the current depth level, if investigators at Steps of Yoth possess 5 [per_investigator] clues as a group, an investigator at Steps of Yoth crosses rope off from his or her supplies: Add 1 additional resource to the current depth level. (Max once per game.)
Flavor: A twisting passage over the chasm leads to a set of narrow, steep steps bathed in the red glow of the depths farther below.
Name: Steps of Yoth

Description: While City of the Serpents has no clues on it, it is considered to be in the victory display (for the purposes of counting vengeance).
Flavor: This much was known from the very few manuscripts and carvings found in the vaults of Zin, beneath the largest ruined city of Yoth.- H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: City of the Serpents

Description: While an investigator is in Hall of Heresy, it is considered to be in the victory display (for the purposes of counting vengeance).
Flavor: It had been built in imitation of certain temples depicted in the vaults of Zin, to house a very terrible black toad-idol - H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Hall of Heresy

Description: Forced - When you attempt to explore while at Crumbling Precipice: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, test [agility] (3). If you fail, test [combat] (2). If you fail, you fall to your death and are killed. (If you succeed at any of these tests, you explore as usual.)
Flavor: One false step
Name: Crumbling Precipice

Description: Forced - After Caverns of Yoth enters play: Place clues on it equal to the current depth level.
Flavor: They - or their principal ancestral element - had first been found in a wild state amidst the Cyclopean ruins of the deserted red-litten world of Yoth which lay below the blue-litten world of Kn-yan. - H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Caverns of Yoth

Description: Forced - When you explore while at Forked Path, check your supplies. If you have a map: Continue drawing cards from the exploration deck until you have drawn 2 connecting locations, if able. Put both of those locations into play and choose 1 to move to.
Name: Forked Path

Description: Bridge over N'kai gets +1 shroud for each vengeance point in the victory display.
Flavor: One other thing which endangered Zamaconas status in Tsath was his persistent curiosity regarding the ultimate abyss of Nkai, beneath red-litten Yoth - H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Bridge over N'kai

Description: Forced - When you explore while at Broken Passage, check your supplies. If you do not have a pickaxe: Place 1 doom on Broken Passage.
Flavor: The subterraneous approaches to Kn-yan, or such as could be remembered, were either blocked up or carefully guarded; and all encroachers were treated as dangerous spies and enemies. - H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Broken Passage

Description: X is the current depth level.
Flavor: Formerly several races of them had inhabited the entire underground world, which stretched down to unfathomable abysses and which included besides the blue-litten region a red-litten region called Yoth, where relics of a still older and non-human race were found by archaeologists. - H. P. Lovecraft and Zealia Bishop, <u>The Mound</u>
Name: Abandoned Site

Description: Forced - After you enter Bright Canyon, if you are poisoned: Take 1 damage. [action]: Check your supplies. If you have binoculars, discover 2 clues on Bright Canyon. (Group limit once each depth level.)
Name: Bright Canyon

Description:
Hunter. Massive.
Yig gets +6 [per_investigator] health.
Yig cannot be damaged while there is another ready [[Serpent]] enemy at its location.
Each other [[Serpent]] enemy at Yig's location gains alert and retaliate.
Name: Yig

Description: Spawn - If Yig is in play, spawn Pit Warden at Yig's location. Otherwise, place Pit Warden in the pursuit area. Hunter.
Name: Pit Warden

Description: Spawn - Put a random set-aside location into play and spawn Eater of the Depths there. Hunter. Massive. X is the current depth level.
Name: Eater of the Depths

Description: Revelation - Put Children of Valusia into play next to the agenda deck. Each [[Serpent]] enemy gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Children of Valusia from play. (Max once per round.)
Name: Children of Valusia

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (1). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current depth level. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Flavor: There is something in the black realm below. Something sealed away. Something worse than everything you have seen thus far, something that fills even the serpent creatures with unbridled terror.
Name: Lightless Shadow

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current depth level. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Flavor: There is still much of the Earth we do not understand. For that, we can be thankful.
Name: Bathophobia

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Serpent]] enemies in pursuit, Serpent's Ire gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Serpent]] enemy in pursuit with the highest fight value and spawn it engaged with you. If an enemy is spawned by this effect, test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you fail, that enemy immediately attacks you.
Name: Serpent's Ire

Description: [free] Exhaust Relic of Ages: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, remove 1 doom from any card in play. (Max one success per game.)
Flavor: After spending so much time with the relic and learning about its creators, you understand now why it was made. The doom of the Great Race of Yith was set in time but it could becircumvented.
Name: Relic of Ages

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If Kerosene has no supplies, discard it.
[action] If an enemy was defeated at this location this round, exhaust Kerosene and spend 1 supply: Heal up to 2 horror from among investigators and [[Ally]] assets at your location.
Name: Kerosene

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. The enemy chosen for this attack must be the enemy engaged with you with the highest fight. You get +4 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, instead of its standard damage, you may assign up to 4 damage among enemies engaged with you (any additional damage adds to this total).
Name: Flamethrower

Description:
Fast. Play after a location enters play or is revealed during an investigator's turn.
Until the end of the active investigator's turn, that location gets -1 shroud. You may move 1 clue to that location from any other location.
Name: Vantage Point

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would perform a skill test during a revelation effect, spend 1 secret: Do not reveal chaos tokens for that test.
[action] Spend 1 secret: Choose an investigator at your location. Do not reveal chaos tokens for the next skill test that investigator performs this round.
Name: Pnakotic Manuscripts

Description: Exceptional. [action]: Place 1 resource on Borrowed Time, as a click (to a maximum of 3 clicks on Borrowed Time). Does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - When your turn begins: Remove all clicks from Borrowed Time. You may take that many additional actions this turn.
Name: Borrowed Time

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card for each point you succeeded by, to a maximum of 5. Shuffle each weakness drawn by this effect back into your deck without resolving it.
Name: All In

Description: Seal (0). Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge or release a chaos token sealed here: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack for each "0" token sealed on Shards of the Void. For each "0" token revealed during this attack, seal that token on Shards of the Void and this attack deals 1 additional damage.
Name: Shards of the Void

Description: Seal ([auto_fail]). Uses (7 charges). If Seal of the Seventh Sign has no charges, or if it leaves play, remove it from the game. Forced - After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token is revealed during any skill test: Remove 1 charge from Seal of the Seventh Sign.
Name: Seal of the Seventh Sign

Description: You may play Impromptu Barrier from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle it into your deck after resolving its effects. Evade. The chosen enemy gets -1 evade for this evasion attempt. (If you played Impromptu Barrier from your discard pile, you may evade an additional enemy at the same location with evade X or lower. X is the amount you succeed by.)
Name: Impromptu Barrier

Description:
Fast. Play during any [free] player window.
Choose and discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy.
Flavor: We make our own fate.
Name: Alter Fate

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if the Relic of Ages is at your location).
[cultist]: -2. If you do not succeed by at least 1, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
[tablet]: -2. If you are poisoned, this test automatically fails instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, shuffle the topmost [[Hex]] treachery in the encounter discard pile into the exploration deck.
Name: Shattered Aeons

Description: Forced - If an investigator with the Relic of Ages in his or her hand, deck, discard pile, or play area is eliminated: Immediately advance to agenda 3b.
Flavor: As you enter the grand chamber beyond the doorway, the Nexus stirs. The Earth quakes below you, and the wall chips and crumbles. Shards of stone float in midair above the Nexus. You are running out of time: Reality is starting to shatter all around you.
Name: Threads of Time

Description: Forced - If an investigator with the Relic of Ages in his or her hand, deck, discard pile, or play area is eliminated: Immediately advance to agenda 3b.
Flavor:
Inside the Nexus, the interwoven
threads of ethereal light
begin to unravel, and reality
unravels with it.
Name: Pendulous Threads

Description: Forced - If an investigator with the Relic of Ages in his or her hand, deck, discard pile, or play area is eliminated: Immediately advance to agenda 3b.
Flavor: .time shattered of purgatory endless awful this in forever lost is know you Everything .Terrifying .False .different are they but ,repeat on out play future and ,present ,past your from Moments .changed has continuity the ,blink you time Each .between in everything and ,reverse in ,order in out play actions Your .here got you how recall cannot you but ,occurred yet not have that things remember You .alter to continues time of flow The
Name: Snapped Threads

Description: Forced - When an enemy would spawn at an empty location and there are no empty locations in play: Reveal cards from the exploration deck until a location is revealed. Put that location into play and spawn that enemy there. Shuffle the exploration deck.
Flavor: The energies of the Nexus swirl in the ground below you, beckoning you to enter. Whether it is a thing of science or magic, you do not know. It is a gateway of sorts, that much you can tell... but a gateway to where?
Name: Worlds Beyond

Description: Objective - If an investigator enters A Pocket in Time, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere deep within this nexus of worlds lies your objective: a place where timelines converge. You can see it in flashes of insight from beyond this reality. Windows into other timelines. A place carved out of time and space, where the Brotherhood no doubt resides.
Name: Search for the Brotherhood

Description: [action]: Search your deck or discard pile for the Relic of Ages and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. [action] If the Relic of Ages is attached to your location and there are no clues on that location: Take control of the Relic of Ages. Objective - If an investigator controls the Relic of Ages, advance.
Flavor: If you intend to mend the shattered timelines, you will need to find the Relic of Ages and learn to harness its power.
Name: The Yithian Relic

Description: [action] If you are at a [[Shattered]] location with no clues: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, attach your location facedown to the Relic of Ages. Each investigator and enemy at that location is moved to A Pocket in Time. Objective - If the number of locations attached to the Relic of Ages is equal to 1 plus the number of investigators who started the game, advance.
Flavor: Each window you step through seems to empower the relic. Once the artifact is fully powered, you can use it to mend the shattered timelines and prevent catastrophe.
Name: Mend the Shatter

Description: [action] If you are at a [[Shattered]] location with no clues: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, attach your location facedown to the Relic of Ages. Each investigator and enemy at that location is moved to A Pocket in Time. Objective - If Valusia is attached to the Relic of Ages, advance.
Flavor: Each window you step through seems to empower the relic. Once the artifact is fully powered, will you use it to restore the serpent civilization of Valusia to its former glory?
Name: Paradise Lost

Description: [action] If you are at a [[Shattered]] location with no clues: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, attach your location facedown to the Relic of Ages. Each investigator and enemy at that location is moved to A Pocket in Time. Objective - If Pnakotus is attached to the Relic of Ages, advance.
Flavor: Each window you step through seems to empower the relic. Once the artifact is fully powered, will you use it to prevent the destruction of Pnakotus and the Yithians?
Name: Timelock

Description: Forced - After you move from Nexus of N'kai to an [[Otherworld]] location, or vice versa: Take 1 horror for each clue on that [[Otherworld]] location. [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Do not take horror from the above Forced ability when moving via this effect.
Name: Nexus of N'kai

Description:
Check Campaign Log. If there are 16 or more tally marks under "Yig's Fury": Ichtaca refuses your plea. Flip this card back over. If there are 15 or fewer tally marks:
Ichtaca ceases her assault and listens to your words. "Valusia must be returned to glory. There is no other way," she decrees with bitter certainty.
