Description: Prey - Least remaining sanity. Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Piper of Azathoth attacks each investigator it is not engaged with at its location (regardless of whether it is ready or exhausted).
Name: Piper of Azathoth

Description: Surge. Revelation - If Piper of Azathoth is in play, deal 1 horror to each investigator at its location and at each connecting location. Otherwise, put Daemonic Piping into play next to the agenda deck. If there are 3 copies of Daemonic Piping in play, discard them and spawn the Piper of Azathoth engaged with its prey (from any out of play area).
Name: Daemonic Piping

Description: Revelation - Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. If this effect causes the encounter deck to run out of cards, draw the topmost [[Hex]] card in the encounter discard pile.
Flavor: The hidden cults to which these witches belonged often guarded and handed down surprising secrets from elder, forgotten aeons - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Coven Initiate

Description: Retaliate. Priestess of the Coven gets +1 fight and +1 evade for each [[Witch]] enemy in the encounter discard pile (to a maximum of +3 fight and +3 evade). Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Priestess of the Coven readies and attacks each investigator at its location.
Name: Priestess of the Coven

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, discard 1 random card from your hand. For each card you cannot discard, take 1 horror or 1 damage. This test gets +1 difficulty for each copy of Diabolic Voices in the encounter discard pile.
Flavor: The infernal wailing and cackling rattle endlessly through your mind.
Name: Diabolic Voices

Description: Revelation - Put Wracked into play in your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills during the first skill test you perform each round. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Wracked. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Wracked

Description: Revelation - Put Bedeviled into play in your threat area. You cannot trigger [action] abilities on cards you control. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Bedeviled. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Bedeviled

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Aloof. Forced - After Lodge Neophyte enters play: Place 1 doom on it. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, remove all doom from Lodge Neophyte.
Name: Lodge Neophyte

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Aloof. Retaliate. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 doom on Keeper of Secrets. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remove all doom from Keeper of Secrets.
Name: Keeper of Secrets

Description: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy. Then, until the end of the round, increase the difficulty to fight, evade, or parley with that enemy by 2. If no doom is placed by this effect, Mysteries of the Lodge gains surge.
Name: Mysteries of the Lodge

Description: Revelation - Put Evil Past into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area (if there is, discard Evil Past and it gains surge instead). Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Take 2 horror and test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Evil Past.
Name: Evil Past

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If a [[Curse]] treachery is discarded by this effect, deal 1 direct damage to your investigator and to each of your [[Ally]] assets.
Flavor: Perhaps these mysteries are better left unknown.
Name: Centuries of Secrets

Description: Prey - Investigator at the location with the most clues. Aloof. Hunter. Nether Mist's location gains: "Haunted - Nether Mist attacks you."
Flavor: We beseech the dead, but do we really wish to see them?
Name: Nether Mist

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Shadow Hound attacks you: Resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Flavor: The spectral mist coalesces into an incorporeal canine form. Hungry eyes shine from the darkness.
Name: Shadow Hound

Description: Revelation - Put Whispers in the Dark into play next to the agenda deck. Each location gains: "Haunted - Take 1 horror." Forced - When the round ends: Discard Whispers in the Dark.
Flavor: Hush, child. It will all be over soon.
Name: Whispers in the Dark

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Wraith is defeated by damage (except from a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]]): Instead of discarding it, attach it to its location. Attached location gains: "Haunted - Spawn Wraith at this location."
Name: Wraith

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. If your location is haunted, as an additional cost for an investigator to commit 1 or more cards to this skill test, he or she must resolve each haunted ability on this location.
Name: Trapped Spirits

Description: Revelation - Put Realm of Torment into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Resolve each haunted ability on your location. Forced - When your turn ends: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Realm of Torment.
Name: Realm of Torment

Description: Surge. Revelation - Resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Flavor: Is that no, it can't be. Just my imagination. Surely.
Name: Shapes in the Mist

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, put Terror in the Night into play next to the agenda deck. If you fail by 3 or more, Terror in the Night gains surge. If there are 3 copies of Terror in the Night next to the agenda deck, discard them and each investigator takes 3 horror.
Name: Terror in the Night

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - If there is no other copy of Fate of All Fools in play, put Fate of All Fools into play in your threat area. - An investigator with another copy of Fate of All Fools in his or her threat area takes 2 direct damage. - Place 1 doom on another copy of Fate of All Fools.
Name: Fate of All Fools

Description: Something Worth Fighting For may be assigned horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
Flavor: I can't die here. Not now. Not yet.
Name: Something Worth Fighting For

Description:
Fast. Play after an investigator discovers the last remaining clue at your location.
Investigators at that location gain a total of X resources, distributed as you wish. X is that location's shroud value.
Flavor: "when you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." <cite>Arthur Conan Doyle, "The Adventure of the Blanched Soldier"</cite>
Name: Crack the Case

Description:
Discover 1 clue at your location.
[reaction] When you play Intel Report, increase its cost by 2: Change "Discover 1 clue" to "Discover 2 clues."
[reaction] When you play Intel Report, increase its cost by 2: Change "at your location" to "at a location up to 2 connections away."
Name: Intel Report

Description:
Fast.
You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset.
Flavor: The body is but an extension of the mind.
Name: Sign Magick

Description: Evade. Use only on a non-[[Elite]] enemy. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, move the enemy just evaded to any location in play. If you succeed and a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol was revealed during this evasion attempt, that enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Banish

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack (+2 [combat] instead if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity). If this attack defeats an enemy, you may heal 1 horror. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may take 1 horror to have this attack deal +1 damage.
Name: Meat Cleaver

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Flavor: Used by both gangsters and police officers, the fully automatic Thompson submachine gun was favored due to its accuracy and high volume of fire.
Name: .45 Thompson

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Scroll of Secrets and spend 1 secret: Look at the bottom card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. Then, either discard that card, add it to its owner's hand, place it on the bottom of its deck, or place it on the top of its deck.
Name: Scroll of Secrets

Description: Uses (2 supplies). [fast] Exhaust Tennessee Sour Mash and spend 1 supply: You get +2 [willpower] for a skill test on a treachery card. [action] Discard Tennessee Sour Mash: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack.
Name: Tennessee Sour Mash

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may spend 1 charge to empower the blade. If you do, you get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Enchanted Blade

Description: [reaction] After you commit a card to a skill test, exhaust Grisly Totem: That card gains another instance of one of its skill icons of your choice.
Flavor:
We should have thrown it back immediately.
But how could we have known?
Name: Grisly Totem

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are at an [[Extradimensional]] location).
[cultist]: Reveal another chaos token. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail and Nahab is at your location, she attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play.
Name: The Secret Name

Description:
Each non-weakness enemy gets +1 health.
[reaction] After you defeat Brown Jenkin or Nahab: Gain 1 clue from the token bank (2 clues instead if there are 3 or more investigators in the game).
Flavor:
LOOK FOR ANSWERS WITHIN AND NOT WITHOUT.
MANY PATHS LEAD TO THE SAME ANSWER.
CONTEMPLATE THE GREATER TRUTH.
Name: THE HERMIT  IX

Description:
Each non-weakness enemy gets +2 health.
[reaction] After you defeat Brown Jenkin or Nahab: Gain 1 clue from the token bank (2 clues instead if there are 3 or more investigators in the game).
Flavor: the descriptions of the darting little furry object which served as her familiar were so painfully realistic despite their incredible details. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: The Familiar

Description:
Each non-weakness enemy gets +3 health.
[reaction] After you defeat Brown Jenkin or Nahab: Gain 1 clue from the token bank (2 clues instead if there are 3 or more investigators in the game).
Flavor: In the dazzling violet light of dream the old woman and the fanged, furry thing came again and with a greater distinctness than on any former occasion. This time they actually reached him, and he felt the crones withered claws clutching at him. -H.P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: The Witch Light

Description:
Each non-weakness enemy gets +4 health.
[reaction] After you defeat Brown Jenkin or Nahab: Gain 1 clue (2 clues instead if there are 3 or more investigators in the game).
Flavor: Either this house is truly haunted, or its strange angles and eerie light are playing tricks on your curse-addled mind. Are these ghostly visions real? Or echoes of the houses gruesome past?
Name: Marked for Sacrifice

Description: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is in Walter Gilman's Room, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: When you arrive at the old Witch House, you find it in a sorrier state than you imagined. Surrounded by a crooked picket fence, the house looks as though it may fall apart at any minute. The front door is locked, but you are able to easily enter through one of the windows after pulling apart the rotting wooden boards covering the shattered glass.
Name: Investigating the Witch House

Description: Objective - Only investigators in the Witch House Ruins may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Among the books in this strange room is a black, nameless tome inscribed with dried red blood. It matches a description from Walter Gilmans journal of a tome he names "The Black Book." This room must be the haunt of Keziah Mason, from over 200 years ago. It is rumored that Keziah had discovered deep mathematical truths that allowed her to traverse space and time. Perhaps you can find a way out using this knowledge.
Name: Beyond the Witch House

Description: Nahab cannot leave the Site of the Sacrifice. Forced - When Nahab is defeated: Instead of discarding her, heal all damage from her, disengage her from all investigators, and exhaust her. She does not ready during the upkeep phase this round. Objective - If there is no doom on Nahab, advance.
Flavor: You part the seams of space-time and arrive at your destination. It is the same cramped attic, but in a different time. The room is dark save for a violet glow emanating from the far edge, where the floor falls into oblivion. From out of the abyss, the ancient crone and her familiar emerge...
Name: Stopping the Ritual

Description: Haunted - Lose 3 resources.
Flavor: Within the aged, decrepit walls of the Witch House, the only signs of life are the rats which scurry in and out of holes in the walls.
Name: Moldy Halls

Description: Forced - After you reveal Landlord's Quarters: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Swarm of Rats and spawn it in Moldy Halls. Shuffle the encounter deck. Haunted - Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Swarm of Rats and spawn it in Moldy Halls. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Landlord's Quarters

Description: [action]: Search your deck for a [[Blessed]] or [[Item]] asset and add it to your hand. (Group limit once per game.) Haunted - You must either take 1 horror, or choose and discard an asset you control.
Flavor: This room is rather plain. Several crucifixes hang on the wall, and a broken loom sits on a table in the corner
Name: Joe Mazurewicz's Room

Description: Haunted - You must either place 1 of your clues on Frank Elwood's Room, or place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Flavor: A desk covered in university papers and books occupies one wall of the cramped room. Perhaps a student once lived here?
Name: Frank Elwood's room

Description: [action]: Draw 3 cards and take 1 horror. (Limit once per game.) Haunted - Discard the top 2 cards of the encounter deck.
Flavor: Gilman's room was of good size but queerly irregular shape; the north wall slanting perceptibly inward from the outer to the inner end, while the low ceiling slanted gently downward in the same direction. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Walter Gilman's Room

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Keziah's Room: Instead of discovering clues, put the top card of the Unknown Places deck into play, unrevealed. Then, you may move to that location. Haunted - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Hex]] card is discarded. Draw that card.
Name: Keziah's Room

Description: [action]: You request aid from your past self. Each investigator at this location may return 1 card from his or her discard pile to his or her hand. Each investigator who does so remembers that he or she "meddled with the past." (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Moldy Halls

Description: Forced - After you enter Twilight Abyss, test [combat] or [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Flavor:
These organic entities whose motions seemed least flagrantly irrelevant and unmotivated were probably projections of life-forms from our own planet, including human beings.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Twilight Abyss

Description: [reaction] After you reveal City of Elder Things, take 2 horror: Put the top card of the Unknown Places deck into play, unrevealed. For the remainder of the scenario, City of Elder Things is considered to be connected to that location, and vice versa.
Name: City of Elder Things

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.) Haunted - Lose 1 action.
Flavor: These appear to be the ruins of the Witch House, perhaps a vision of the building's future. It is a whirlwind of crumbling bricks, blackened, moss-grown shingles, and rotting planks and timbers.
Name: Witch House Ruins

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, move to any revealed location. (Limit once per game.) Haunted- Move to Keziah's Room.
Flavor:
not even Cotton Mather could explain the curves and angles smeared on the grey stone walls with some red, sticky fluid.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Salem Gaol, 1692

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Physics Classroom by 2 or more: Discover a clue at another revealed location. (Limit once per round.)
Flavor:
A place of higher learning?
Or a place where higher learning is shackled?
Name: Physics Classroom

Description: Forced - After you enter Court of the Great Old Ones, test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. Haunted - The next action you perform this round must be an investigate action.
Name: Court of the Great Old Ones

Description: [action] Investigators at this location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove 1 doom from Nahab. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity from Nahab. Forced - At the end of the round: Add clues to this location until it has 3 [per_investigator] clues on it. Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on Nahab, or Nahab attacks you.
Name: Site of the Sacrifice

Description: Revelation - Put Strange Geometry into play and move to it. Forced - After the investigation phase ends: Discard Strange Geometry and move each investigator and enemy here to the location with the most clues. Each investigator who moved by this effect takes 1 damage and 1 horror. [free] If Strange Geometry has no clues on it: Move to any revealed location.
Name: Strange Geometry

Description: Revelation - If Brown Jenkin is not in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for him, spawn him at your location, and take 1 damage. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Swarm of Rats, spawn it engaged with you, then take 1 damage.
Name: Meddlesome Familiar

Description: Revelation - If Nahab is in play, ready her, resolve her hunter keyword, and she attacks each investigator at her location. If Nahab is at the Site of the Sacrifice, place 1 doom on her, as well. Otherwise, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Nahab and spawn her at your location.
Name: Ghostly Presence

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for every 10 cards in the encounter discard pile. If you fail, discard an asset you control.
Flavor: On the morning of the 29th Gilman awaked into a maelstrom of horror. - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Extradimensional Visions

Description: Revelation - Put Pulled by the Stars into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move at least once during your turn: Take 2 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Pulled by the Stars from play. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Pulled by the Stars

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). If you fail, put Disquieting Dreams into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Discard Disquieting Dreams and reveal the top 10 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness revealed and discard each other revealed card.
Name: Disquieting Dreams

Description: Aloof. Hunter. Each ready [[Creature]] enemy gets +2 fight. Forced - When the enemy phase ends, if Brown Jenkin is ready: Each investigator at his location discards his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
Name: Brown Jenkin

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Do not remove doom from Nahab when the agenda advances. Nahab gets +X fight, where X is the number of the current agenda. Forced - After the enemy phase begins, if Nahab is ready: Place 1 doom on her.
Name: Nahab

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Black Book and take X horror: Reduce that card's cost by X.
Flavor:
He must sign in his own blood the book of Azathoth and take a new secret name... 
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: The Black Book

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you discover a clue, exhaust Alice Luxley: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Flavor: "Please leave this to the professionals. If I find you poking around again, I will bring you in."
Name: Alice Luxley

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to an [[Item]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] After attached asset is discarded: Return it to its owner's hand, along with each other [[Upgrade]] attachment that was attached to it.
Name: Well-Maintained

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[free] Exhaust Mr. "Rook" and spend 1 secret: Search the top 3, 6, or 9 cards of your deck for any card and draw it. If at least 1 weakness is among the searched cards, draw 1 of them, as well. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "Are you sure you want to know? There is no going back."
Name: Mr. "Rook"

Description: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered from your location: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on this card, as evidence. (Limit once per game at each location.) While Hawk-Eye Folding Camera has ... - ... 1 or more evidence, you get +1 [willpower]. - ... 2 or more evidence, you get +1 [intellect]. - ... 3 or more evidence, you get +1 sanity.
Name: Hawk-Eye Folding Camera

Description:
[action] Exhaust Henry Wan: One at a time, reveal random tokens from the chaos bag until you choose to stop, or until you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol.
- If you chose to stop, for each token revealed via this effect, you may either draw 1 card or gain 1 resource.
- If you revealed a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, do nothing.
Name: Henry Wan

Description:
Fast. Play during any investigator's turn, except during an action.
Immediately take an action as if it were your turn. This action does not count toward the number of actions you can take each turn.
Name: Swift Reflexes

Description: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during this attack, the attacked enemy gets -1 fight and -1 evade for the remainder of the turn (to a minimum of 1).
Name: Wither

Description: [action]: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during this test, you may choose a revealed location connected to your location; you are now investigating as if you were at the chosen location instead of your location (you may use either shroud value).
Name: Sixth Sense

Description: [reaction] When you initiate a skill test, exhaust Drawing Thin: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Gain 2 resources or draw 1 card.
Name: Drawing Thin

Description:
Fast. Play after you successfully evade an enemy by 2 or more.
Discover 1 clue at that enemy's location.
Name: Belly of the Beast

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 higher than the number of copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. Until the end of the round, each Heretic enemy in play gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, trigger the forced ability on a copy of Unfinished Business in yout threat area as if it were the end of the round.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail and this is an attack or evasion attempt, resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Name: The Wages of Sin

Flavor:
SURRENDER YOURSELF TO THE PATH OF SACRIFICE.
CONSIDER THE GOOD OF ALL BEFORE YOU ACT.
LET GO.
Name: THE HANGED MAN 揃 XII

Description: Locations cannot be flipped to their non-[[Spectral]] side.
Flavor: Hangmans Hill is plunged into darkness as the spectral mist invades every inch of the woods and the chapel. Somewhere in the mist, the watcher spies its prey with eyes as empty as graves.
Name: Death's Approach

Description: Locations cannot be flipped to their [[Spectral]] side.
Flavor: You have come to Hangmans Hill to investigate reports of ghost sightings and strange activity in the woods the last few nights, and to learn more about the witches who once hid in Arkhams past - witches who have since emerged from the shadows in pursuit of some unholy purpose.
Name: In Pursuit of the Dead

Description: [free]: Flip your location over. (Group limit once per round at each location.) Clues cannot be discovered at non-[[Spectral]] locations. Objective - Banish as many Heretics as you can. If there are 4 copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display, advance.
Flavor: With the mist comes the revenants of the past: witches who were executed hundreds of years ago, and whose hateful spirits have returned to wreak vengeance upon the living. If you can banish them, you might learn more of the covens secrets.
Name: In Pursuit of the Living

Description: [action]: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?"
Flavor: Originating from a natural spring near the peak of Hangmans Hill, the narrow, shallow brook fills the surrounding woods with a quiet, peaceful babbling. The brook winds down the hill southward, forming the western border of Arkham's Uptown district.
Name: Hangman's Brook

Description: Each [[Spectral]] enemy at Haunted Fields gets +1 horror value.
Flavor: Few creatures call the wooded fields surrounding Hangman's Hill home. Patches of dark, pointed witchweed blossoms have choked out all other flora, and wisps of thin grey fog seep through the air, like long fingers reaching out for somethingtograsp.
Name: Haunted Fields

Description: During the mythos phase, each investigator in Abandoned Chapel gets -1 to each skill.
Flavor: This old, broken-down chapel has been abandoned for several decades now. Perhaps once it was a place of sanctity. These days it is only a source of sober melancholy.
Name: Abandoned Chapel

Description: The Gallows gets +1 shroud for each [[Witch]] enemy in play.
Flavor: The gallows were decommissioned in 1901 after the execution of serial murderer Piper Thomassan. Even so, the wooden platform still stands atop Hangmans Hill, a memorial to the brutality of humankind.
Name: The Gallows

Description: X is the number of [[Geist]] enemies in play.
Flavor: The gallows were decommissioned in 1901 after the execution of serial murderer Piper Thomassan. Even so, the wooden platform still stands atop Hangmans Hill, a memorial to the brutality of humankind.
Name: The Gallows

Description: While investigating Heretics' Graves, add your [willpower] value to your skill value for the investigation.
Flavor: Only witches and criminals occupy these graves. Their tombstones have been left unmarked so as to forever erase the memory of their foul deeds.
Name: Heretics' Graves

Description: Forced - After a [[Witch]] enemy at Heretics' Graves is defeated: Discard the top 2 cards of the standard encounter deck.
Flavor: Only witches and criminals occupy these graves. Their tombstones have been left unmarked so as to forever erase the memory of their foul deeds.
Name: Heretics' Graves

Description: While there are no ready enemies at Chapel Crypt, it gets -3 shroud.
Flavor: A narrow stone staircase guides you deep below the chapel, where those of good repute were given "proper" burials. In a far corner of the room, a strange, dusty contraption is connected to one of the coffins, as dead as everything else in this room.
Name: Chapel Crypt

Description: While there are no [[Hex]] treacheries among investigators' threat areas at Chapel Crypt, it gets -3 shroud.
Flavor: A narrow stone staircase guides you deep below the chapel, where those of good repute were given "proper" burials. In a far corner of the room, a strange, dusty contraption is connected to one of the coffins, as dead as everything else in this room.
Name: Chapel Crypt

Description: Forced - After you draw a non-weakness card from your deck while at Chapel Attic: Place that card facedown beneath Chapel Attic, out of play. [reaction] After you successfully investigate Chapel Attic: Add each card beneath it to its owner's hand.
Name: Chapel Attic

Description: While investigating Chapel Attic, add the number of cards in your hand to your skill value for the investigation.
Name: Chapel Attic

Description: [action] Investigators at your location spend 1-3 clues, as a group: Fight. Use this ability only to attack a [[Geist]] enemy. You may choose to use your [willpower] instead of your [combat] for this attack. You get +X skill value and deal +X damage for this attack, where X is the amount of clues spent to trigger this ability.
Name: Spectral Web

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Spawn - The Gallows or Heretics' Graves. Alert. Hunter. Forced - When Vengeful Witch is defeated: Deal its damage and horror to each investigator at its location, as direct damage/horror.
Name: Vengeful Witch

Description: Spawn - Chapel Attic or Chapel Crypt. While Malevolent Spirit is at a [[Spectral]] location, it gains hunter and gets +1 damage value and +1 horror value. Forced - When Malevolent Spirit is defeated by damage (except from a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]]): Instead of discarding it, heal all damage from it, exhaust it, and move it to any [[Spectral]] location, if able.
Name: Malevolent Spirit

Description: Revelation - Put Punishment into play in your threat area. Forced - After an enemy at any location is defeated: Take 1 damage. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Punishment. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Punishment

Description: Revelation - If there are no copies of Unfinished Business in your threat area, Burdens of the Past gains surge. Otherwise, trigger the forced ability of each copy of Unfinished Business in your threat area as if it were the end of the round.
Name: Burdens of the Past

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Draw the top card of the spectral encounter deck. That card gains peril, and its effects cannot be canceled. - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail take 2 horror.
Name: Ominous Portents

Description: Revelation - If Grave-Light is drawn ... - ...from the standard encounter deck, shuffle it into the spectral encounter deck, and it gains surge. - ...from the spectral encounter deck, take 2 damage and place it in the standard encounter discard pile.
Name: Grave-Light

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Choose an Unfinished Business card in play, flip it to its Heretic side, and place damage on it equal to half its health. - Discard cards from the top of the spectral encounter deck until a [[Geist]] enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy engaged with you.
Name: Bane of the Living

Description: Uses (5 ammo). Ammo spent from .45 Thompson is placed in your resource pool, as resources. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: .45 Thompson

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by at least X, you may spend 1 ammo to deal this attack's damage to another enemy at your location, where X is that enemy's fight value.
Name: .45 Thompson

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Scroll of Secrets and spend 1 secret: Look at the bottom 3 cards of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard 1 of those cards. You may add 1 of those cards to its owner's hand. Place the rest of those cards on either the top or bottom of their deck, in any order.
Name: Scroll of Secrets

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Scroll of Secrets and spend 1 secret: Look at the top or bottom card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. Then, either discard that card, add it to its owner's hand, place it on the bottom of its deck, or place it on top of its deck.
Name: Scroll of Secrets

Description: Fast. Uses (2 supplies). [fast] Exhaust Tennessee Sour Mash and spend 1 supply: You get +3 [willpower] for a skill test on a treachery card. [action] Discard Tennessee Sour Mash: Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Tennessee Sour Mash

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [fast] Exhaust Tennessee Sour Mash and spend 1 supply: You get +2 [willpower] for a skill test on a treachery card. [action] Discard Tennessee Sour Mash: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. If this attack succeeds against a non-[[Elite]] enemy, automatically evade it.
Name: Tennessee Sour Mash

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, you may spend 1 charge to empower the blade, dealing +1 damage for this attack. If the blade is empowered and this attack defeats an enemy, draw 1 card and heal 1 horror.
Name: Enchanted Blade

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. As an additional cost to use this ability, you may spend up to 2 charges to empower the blade (for each charge spent in this way, you get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack).
Name: Enchanted Blade

Description: [reaction] After you commit a card to a skill test, exhaust Grisly Totem: That card gains another instance of one of its skill icons of your choice. If that skill test is successful, the performing investigator draws 1 card.
Flavor:
We should have thrown it back immediately.
But how could we have known?
Name: Grisly Totem

Description: [reaction] After you commit a card to a skill test, exhaust Grisly Totem: That card gains another instance of one of its skill icons of your choice. If that skill test fails, return that card to your hand.
Flavor:
We should have thrown it back immediately.
But how could we have known?
Name: Grisly Totem

Description: Uses (1 [per_investigator] locks). If there are no locks on The Council's Coffer, each investigator searches his or her deck or discard pile for any card and immediately plays it at no cost. Exile The Council's Coffer. (Max once per campaign.) [action] [action]: Test any skill (5). If you succeed, remove 1 lock. Any investigator at your location may activate this ability. Card design by The Council at Arkham Nights 2017.
Name: The Council's Coffer

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. Reveal another token.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, move 1 doom from the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to the current agenda.
Name: For the Greater Good

Description: Forced - When you defeat a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy: You leave behind some evidence of the scuffle. Move 1 doom from each enemy at that location to the current agenda.
Flavor:
ADAPT YOUR BELIEFS AND BE OPEN TO NEW TRUTHS.
YOU ARE EXPECTED TO CONFORM.
DO NOT STRAY FROM THE PATH.
Name: THE HIEROPHANT 揃 V

Description: Each [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in a [[Sanctum]] location loses aloof. Forced - When you defeat a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy: You leave behind some evidence of the scuffle. Move 1 doom from each enemy at that location to the current agenda.
Flavor: The Lodge will resort to drastic measures in order to achieve their goals. If you dont act quickly, blood will surely be shed.
Name: Ends and Means

Flavor: You have arrived at the Lodges manor in French Hill to see if they can help you piece together the evidence youve collected. Perhaps you can even speak with the president of the Lodge again. But as you approach the manor, you begin to wonder if this was a test of your loyalty all along.
Name: Warm Welcome

Description: [reaction] After you evade an enemy: Remove all doom from it.
Flavor: The Lodge is up to something - youre sure of it. Youre not sure exactly what their plans entail, but your suspicions have proven correct so far. You have decided to sneak into the Lodges manor in French Hill to learn what they are plotting.
Name: Infiltrating the Lodge

Description: Objective - If Nathan Wick is added to the victory display by any means, choose an investigator to take control of the attached Puzzle Box, and advance.
Flavor: Whatever the Lodge is planning, it involves a "device" they will do anything to open. It seems a Lodge member by the name of Nathan Wick holds the device at the moment. One way or another, you have to get your hands on it.
Name: Obtaining the Device

Description: Objective - If investigators at the same location control the Puzzle Box, the [skull] key, the [cultist] key, the [tablet] key, and the [elder_thing] key, advance.
Flavor: The "device" is nothing more than a locked puzzle box, just about large enough to hold a pair of shoes. The diagram on its surface depicts a broken pattern which can be manipulated to no apparent end, and there does not appear to be a keyhole of any kind.
Name: The Four Keys

Description: Enemies cannot spawn at the Lodge Gates. [action]: Resign. On second thought, maybe coming here was a bad idea.
Flavor: The headquarters of the Silver Twilight Lodge is a gorgeous Victorian mansion in French Hill, overlooking most of the city. Light flickers beyond its prominent stained-glass door.
Name: Lodge Gates

Description: Enemies cannot spawn at the Lodge Gates. [action]: Resign. On second thought, maybe coming here was a bad idea.
Flavor: The headquarters of the Silver Twilight Lodge is a gorgeous Victorian mansion in French Hill, overlooking most of the city. Light flickers beyond its prominent stained-glass door.
Name: Lodge Gates

Flavor: The guards step aside and allow you to enter the lobby. "Mr. Sanford has been expecting you," one of them says cryptically. The interior of the mansion is clean and well-kept, as you would expect from Arkham's most prestigious social club. Plaques, pictures, and other trinkets adorn the wooden walls, hinting at the Lodge's long and storied history.
Name: Lobby

Description: Forced - After the Lobby is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Flavor: The interior of the mansion is clean and well-kept, as you would expect from Arkham's most prestigious social club. Plaques, pictures, and other trinkets adorn the wooden walls, hinting at the Lodge's long and storied history.
Name: Lobby

Description: Forced - After the Lodge Cellar is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Flavor: The cellar of the Lodge contains only a large wine rack and several unmarked barrels. A heavy steel door bars your passage deeper into the basement. You almost don't want to know what lies beyond it. Almost.
Name: Lodge Cellar

Flavor: You slip through an unlocked window into the building's cellar. It contains only a large wine rack and several unmarked barrels. A heavy steel door bars your passage deeper into the basement. You almost don't want to know what lies beyond it. Almost.
Name: Lodge Cellar

Description: Forced - After the Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Vault and Library locations into play. Put the set-aside August Lindquist asset into play in the Lounge. Place 1 random set-aside key on him.
Flavor: As you enter the warm lounge, you spot an elegantly dressed man reading by the fire. To your surprise, he pays you almost no heed whatsoever.
Name: Lounge

Description: Forced - After the Vault is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Flavor: This simple unadorned room contains many shelves and filing cabinets, where important documents and records pertaining to the Lodge are kept. A small combination safe hides in a corner of the room. You wonder what secrets you could uncover here if you had more time.
Name: Vault

Description: While you are investigating the Library, if you control the [tablet] key, the Library gets -3 shroud.
Flavor: Even the Lodge's library is arranged to showcase the organization's wealth and power. There are hundreds of books among the room's tall, cramped shelves.
Name: Library

Description: Forced - When Lodge Catacombs is revealed: Put the set-aside Inner Sanctum and each of the set-aside Sanctum Doorway locations into play.
Flavor: Beyond the steel door, torchlit stone halls lead deeper underground. Compared to the polished wood upstairs, this area feels grimy and unclean. What the hell is this place?
Name: Lodge Catacombs

Description: Forced - When the round ends: Each investigator and each [[Ally]] asset in the Ceremony Room takes 1 direct horror. Cancel this effect if an investigator in the Ceremony Room controls the [skull] key.
Flavor: At the center of this room lies an ornately carved stone altar. Blood drains from the altar through a series of channels in the mosaic stone floor.
Name: Ceremony Room

Description: Forced - After Holding Cells is revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and spawn it in the Holding Cells. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Holding Cells

Description: Forced - After the Inner Sanctum is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Flavor: At the far end of this room, a podium stands atop a wooden platform. Several rows of plush seats face the stage. You've never heard of a meeting room like this within the Lodge; this must be a place for only the most dedicated and trusted members.
Name: Inner Sanctum

Description: Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to persuade Nathan to let you find another option. If you succeed, place 1 resource on Nathan Wick. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. If you fail, Nathan Wick attacks you.
Name: Nathan Wick

Description: Spawn - Any [[Sanctum]] location. Aloof. Forced - After Lodge Jailor enters play: Place 2 doom and 1 random set-aside key on it. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, either remove 1 doom from Lodge Jailor, or take control of its key.
Name: Lodge Jailor

Description: Spawn - Any [[Sanctum]] location. Alert. Forced - After Cell Keeper enters play: Place 2 doom and 1 random set-aside key on it. Forced - When you evade Cell Keeper by 2 or more: Take control of its key.
Name: Cell Keeper

Description: Retaliate. Hunter. Summoned Beast gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror for every 2 doom in play. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Summoned Beast defeats each [[Humanoid]] enemy at its location. Move all doom from each of those enemies to Summoned Beast. Objective - If the Summoned Beast is defeated, (R3).
Name: Summoned Beast

Description: Spawn - Any location connected to yours. Prey - Most ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) keys controlled. Alert. Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you enter Knight of the Inner Circle's location (or vice-versa): Test [agility] (4). If you fail, Knight of the Inner Circle engages you.
Name: Knight of the Inner Circle

Description: Spawn - Any location connected to yours. Aloof. Peril. Retaliate. Revelation - After Knight of the Outer Void spawns, place either 1 or 2 doom on it. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, take control of 1 doom on Knight of the Outer Void, and flip it to its clue side. If you fail, Knight of the Outer Void attacks you.
Name: Knight of the Outer Void

Description: Revelation - Find the 2 topmost [[Cultist]] enemies in the encounter discard pile and spawn them in the empty location with the most remaining clues. If no [[Cultist]] enemies are spawned by this effect, Call to Order gains surge.
Name: Call to Order

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, Expulsion gains surge. Otherwise, the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, engages you, and makes an immediate attack. Then, place each ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key you control on that enemy.
Name: Expulsion

Description: If you control at least 1 ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key, Beneath the Lodge gains peril and its skill test gets +1 difficulty. Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either lose 1 clue or take 1 horror.
Name: Beneath the Lodge

Description: Surge. Revelation - Check which investigator controls each key. The investigator with... - ...the [skull] key takes 1 damage. - ...the [cultist] key takes 1 horror. - ...the [tablet] key discards 2 random cards from hand. - ...the [elder_thing] key loses 3 resources.
Name: Mark of the Order

Description: [action] Investigators at August Lindquist's location spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Parley. Each investigator who spent at least 1 clue must either take 1 damage or 1 horror. Remove August Lindquist from the game and take control of his key.
Flavor: "I dont really care what youre doing here. But perhaps we can make an arrangement"
Name: August Lindquist

Description: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of the Puzzle Box to another investigator. [action]: Unlight a brazier at your location, exhaust The Spectral Watcher, or deal 5 damage to The Spectral Watcher if it is exhausted. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity from The Spectral Watcher. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Puzzle Box

Description:
As an additional cost to play Warning Shot, spend 1 ammo from a [[Firearm]] asset you control.
Move all non-[[Elite]] enemies at your location to a connecting location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: "Stay back!"
Name: Warning Shot

Description: Fast. Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset you control that takes up two hand slots. Attached asset cannot be used to attack enemies engaged with you. [reaction] When you perform a Fight action using attached asset, if you are engaged with no enemies, exhaust Telecopic Sight: This attack can target a non-[[Elite]] enemy at a connecting location. Ignore the aloof and retaliate keywords for this attack.
Name: Telescopic Sight

Description: Fast. Play only during your turn. Choose a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] asset you control, or reveal a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] asset from your hand. Resolve an [action] or [free] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost, if any). Then, if that asset was in your hand, you may discard it to draw 1 card.
Flavor: ... and power corrupts.
Name: Knowledge is Power

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Esoteric Atlas: Choose a revealed location that is exactly 2 connections away from your location. Move to that location.
Name: Esoteric Atlas

Description:
Uses (0 supplies). Limit 10 supplies on Investments.
[free] Exhaust Investments: Place 1 supply on it.
[action] Exhaust and discard Investments: Move all supplies from it to your resource pool, as resources.
Name: Investments

Description: Evade. Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. [reaction] When you play Decoy, increase its cost by 2: Change "a non-[[Elite]] enemy" to "up to 2 non-[[Elite]] enemies." [reaction] When you play Decoy, increase its cost by 2: Change "at your location" to "at a location up to 2 connections away."
Name: Decoy

Description: [action] Exhaust De Vermis Mysteriis and place 1 doom on it: Play a [[Spell]] or [[Insight]] event from your discard pile, reducing its resource cost by 1. After that event resolves, remove it from the game.
Flavor: Ludwig Prinn was its author; he who had perished in the inquisitorial stake in Brussels when the witchcraft trials were at their height. - Robert Bloch, "The Shambler from the Stars"
Name: De Vermis Mysteriis

Description: You get +1 [intellect]. Non-direct horror must be assigned to Guiding Spirit before it can be assigned to your investigator card. Forced - When Guiding Spirit is defeated by horror: Exile it.
Name: Guiding Spirit

Description:
Fast. Play when doom would be placed on any scenario card.
Max 1 per game.
Cancel 1 doom just placed on that card. Exile Fortune or Fate.
Name: Fortune or Fate

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: -2. If this is a skill test during a circle action, reveal another token. [cultist]: -3. If you have no damage on you, take 1 damage. If you have no horror on you, take 1 horror. [tablet]: -3. If you fail, a [[Spectral]] enemy at your location attacks you (even if it is exhausted). [elder_thing]: -3. If this is a skill test during a circle action and you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Name: Union and Disillusion

Flavor:
YOU ARE AT A CROSSROADS.
REFLECT ON THE CHOICES YOU HAVE MADE.
YOU SHALL BE CONFRONTED WITH A TERRIBLE DILEMMA.
Name: THE LOVERS 揃 VI

Flavor: As you continue through the woods, you notice the dark mist which has permeated the island is starting to drift away from the shoreline, toward the center of the island where the beacon of spectral energy still rises into the sky.
Name: Crossroads of Fate

Flavor: The foggy shores of the Unvisited Isle are barren and unwelcoming. Not a soul greets you as you draw closer to the island, save for the judging gaze of ghostly birds that observe you from the trees. In the distance, the pillar of spectral energy is rising into the clouds, a vortex of otherworldly mist spiraling about it.
Name: The Unvisited Isle

Description: Each investigator cannot leave the location in front of him or her.
Flavor: The trap set by the Silver Twilight Lodge has drawn the attention of the spectral realm and its inhabitants. One way or another, those who were trapped in the mist will end up here.
Name: Fated Souls

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is lit, advance.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. You must light the braziers to find the way. Then, all that is left to do is bait the watcher to the trap and bind it there.
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. I)

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is unlit, advance.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. The braziers have already been lit, enabling the trap. You will have to unlight each of them in order to break the circle.
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. II)

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is unlit, advance.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. The braziers have already been lit, enabling the trap. You will have to unlight each of them in order to break the circle.
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. III)

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is unlit, advance.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. The braziers have already been lit, enabling the trap. You will have to unlight each of them in order to break the circle.
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. IV)

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If The Spectral Watcher is defeated at The Geist-Trap while the brazier there is lit, advance.
Flavor: At the center of the clearing lies the spectral trap: a pillar of ghostly energy which swirls about a stone obelisk. Hundreds of phantasmal faces and a conglomeration of rotted limbs and flesh intertwine within, a revolting display of death and despair. An unlit silver brazier stands in front of the pillar, ready for you to act.
Name: The Binding Rite

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If The Spectral Watcher is defeated at The Geist-Trap while the brazier there is unlit, advance.
Flavor: At the center of the clearing lies the spectral trap: a pillar of ghostly energy which swirls about a stone obelisk. Hundreds of phantasmal faces and a conglomeration of rotted limbs and flesh intertwine within, a revolting display of death and despair. A silver brazier stands in front of the pillar, its blue flame flickering in the wind.
Name: The Broken Rite

Description: [action]: Resign. You take your rowboat back to the shore of the Miskatonic River, leaving the mysterious island behind.
Flavor: Despite the urgency of your task, you find yourself rowing quietly, as though trying to avoid disturbing the river.
Name: Miskatonic River

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to find the brazier by the wooded trail. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - You must either lose 1 action or lose 2 resources.
Name: Forbidding Shore

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [willpower]+[intellect] (10) to examine the brazier in front of the standing stone. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - Until the end of the round, increase the difficulty of each skill test during a circle action by 2.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [willpower]+[agility] (11) to traverse the mist surrounding the brazier. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on this location, or take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [willpower]+[combat] (11) to clear a path through the woods. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - You must either search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Whippoorwill and spawn it at this location, or the nearest Whippoorwill attacks you.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [combat]+[agility] (10) to explore the mossy steps. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier at the top. Haunted - Your next move action this round costs 1 additional action.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [intellect]+[agility] (9) to reach the brazier in the center of the spring. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - You must either discard an asset you control, or take 1 damage.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: [action]: Circle. Test [intellect]+[combat] (9) to find the brazier inside the decaying tree. If you succeed, you may light or unlight the brazier. Haunted - Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Name: Unvisited Isle

Description: While The Spectral Watcher is at The Geist-Trap, it gains retaliate. [action]: Circle. Test [willpower]+[intellect]+[combat]+[agility] (20) to complete the ritual, or to disrupt it. If you succeed, you may either light or unlight the brazier here. Haunted - Take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: The Geist-Trap

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After an enemy attacks you, even if that attack was canceled, exhaust Gavriella Mizrah: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Gavriella Mizrah

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location draws a treachery from the encounter deck, exhaust Jerome Davids and discard cards from your hand with a total of at least 2 [intellect] icons: Cancel that card's revelation effect.
Name: Jerome Davids

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test during a revelation effect, exhaust Penny White: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Penny White

Description:
You get +1 [agility].
[free] During a skill test you are performing, spend 2 resources and exhaust Valentino Rivas: Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1.
Name: Valentino Rivas

Description:
Check the "Missing Persons" section of the Campaign Log. If Gavriella disappeared into the mist and you are on Gavriella's trail:
Gavriella stumbles out of the mist, her eyes bloodshot and her voice strained. "Where am I? Who are you?"
Take control of the set-aside Gavriella Mizrah story asset. For the remainder of this scenario, she does not take up an ally slot. Next to Gavriella Mizrah's profile, record Gavriella is alive.
If Gavriella was claimed by specters: Flip this card to its enemy side and spawn it at your location. If you are on Gavriella's trail, it spawns exhausted and unengaged. Otherwise, it spawns engaged with you.
Otherwise:
You find Gavriella's weapon lying in the grass, decayed and broken. No other sign of her can be seen.
Name: Gavriella's Fate

Description:
Check the "Missing Persons" section of the Campaign Log. If Jerome disappeared into the mist and you are on Jerome's trail:
Jerome crawls out of the mist, and you help him to his feet. "Oh god the mist" he whispers. "It's all connected It's all connected"
Take control of the set-aside Jerome Davids story asset. For the remainder of this scenario, he does not take up an ally slot. Next to Jerome Davids's profile, record Jerome is alive.
If Jerome was claimed by specters: Flip this card to its enemy side and spawn it at your location. If you are on Jerome's trail, it spawns exhausted and unengaged. Otherwise, it spawns engaged with you.
Otherwise:
You find a scrap of paper from Jerome's pocket notebook on the ground. It simply reads: "HELP"
Name: Jerome's Fate

Description:
Check the "Missing Persons" section of the Campaign Log. If Penny disappeared into the mist and you are on Penny's trail:
Penny nearly runs directly into you. Her whole body shakes with panic as you hold her safe. "A-are you alive?" she cries. "Is this nightmare finally over?"
Take control of the set-aside Penny White story asset. For the remainder of this scenario, she does not take up an ally slot. Next to Penny White's profile, record Penny is alive.
If Penny was claimed by specters: Flip this card to its enemy side and spawn it at your location. If you are on Penny's trail, it spawns exhausted and unengaged. Otherwise, it spawns engaged with you.
Otherwise:
You find Penny's apron lying on the ground, covered in blood. There is no other sign of her.
Name: Penny's Fate

Description:
Check the "Missing Persons" section of the Campaign Log. If Valentino disappeared into the mist and you are on Valentino's trail:
Valentino limps out of the mist, leaning on a nearby tree. He chuckles morbidly as he spots you. "Cavalry's finally here, eh?"
Take control of the set-aside Valentino Rivas story asset. For the remainder of this scenario, he does not take up an ally slot. Next to Valentino Rivas's profile, record Valentino is alive.
If Valentino was claimed by specters: Flip this card to its enemy side and spawn it at your location. If you are on Valentino's trail, it spawns exhausted and unengaged. Otherwise, it spawns engaged with you.
Otherwise:
Valentino's cane lies in the mud, cracked nearly in half. Its handle is stained with old blood.
Name: Valentino's Fate

Description:
Aloof. Hunter.
Each investigator at Whippoorwill's location gets -1 [willpower], -1 [intellect], -1 [combat], and -1 [agility].
Flavor:
"It is vowed that the birds are psychopomps lying in wait for the souls of the dying"
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
Name: Whippoorwill

Description: Prey - Lowest [intellect]. Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Spectral Raven engages you: You must either resolve each haunted ability on your location, or Spectral Raven gets +2 fight and +2 evade until the end of the investigation phase.
Name: Spectral Raven

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase this skill test's difficulty by 1 for each damage on you. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Flavor:
If they can catch the fleeing soul when it leaves the body, they instantly flutter away chittering in daemonic laughter
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
Name: Eager for Death

Description: Surge. Peril. Revelation - Add Psychopomp's Song to any investigator's threat area. Forced - When you would take 1 or more damage: Take 2 additional damage and discard Psychopomp's Song.
Name: Psychopomp's Song

Description: Surge. Peril. Revelation - Add Death Approaches to any investigator's threat area. Forced - When you would take 1 or more horror: Take 2 additional horror and discard Death Approaches.
Name: Death Approaches

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). Increase this skill test's difficulty by 1 for each horror on you. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Name: Marked for Death

Description: Revelation - Each investigator tests [willpower] (5). Each investigator who fails must resolve either the haunted ability on his or her location, or the haunted ability on The Spectral Watcher's location.
Name: Watcher's Gaze

Description: Uses (3 supplies). If Mk 1 Grenades has no supplies, discard it. [action] Spend 1 supply: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 2 damage to each enemy and each other investigator at the attacked enemy's location (any additional damage is dealt to the attacked enemy).
Name: Mk 1 Grenades

Description:
Agency Backup may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[free] Exhaust Agency Backup and deal 1 damage to it: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
[free] Exhaust Agency Backup and deal 1 horror to it: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Agency Backup

Description: Discover 3 clues at your location. Give any number of your clues to another investigator, or place any number of your clues on any location. You are defeated and suffer 1 mental trauma. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Ghastly Revelation

Description:
Permanent.
You begin each game with 1 additional card in your opening hand.
Flavor:
Possibly Gilman ought not to have studied so hard.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Studious

Description:
Deal 1 damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.
[reaction] When you play Small Favor, increase its cost by 2: Change "Deal 1 damage" to "Deal 2 damage."
[reaction] When you play Small Favor, increase its cost by 2: Change "at your location" to "at a location up to 2 connections away."
Name: Small Favor

Description:
Permanent.
You begin each game with 2 additional resources.
Flavor: Never lose sight of whats really important.
Name: Another Day, Another Dollar

Description: Uses (3 secrets). [free]: Attach a non-weakness [[Spell]] event from your hand to Dayana Esperence. Limit 1 event attached to her. The attached event may be played as if it were in your hand. It is not placed in your discard pile after it is played (it remains attached). As an additional cost to play the attached event, exhaust Dayana Esperence and spend 1 secret.
Name: Dayana Esperence

Description:
Fast. Play when an encounter card or enemy attack would cause you to do one of the following (choose one): Discard cards from hand, lose resources, lose actions, take damage, or take horror.
You ignore that aspect of the effect. Then, perform the opposite of that aspect (draw cards, gain resources, gain additional actions, heal damage, or heal horror, respectively).
Name: Deny Existence

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose one of your skills. Until the end of your turn, set the base value of that skill to 5.
Flavor: You never really know what you are capable of until something is trying to eat you.
Name: Trial by Fire

Description: Either (choose one): - Evade. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], evade the enemy and move it to a connecting location. - Evade. Use only on a non-[[Elite]] enemy at a connecting location. If you succeed, evade that enemy and switch locations with it.
Name: Bait and Switch

Description:
You have 2 additional tarot slots.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Anna Kaslow is in your opening hand: Put her into play.
[reaction] After Anna Kaslow enters play: Search your deck for a [[Tarot]] asset and put it into play.
Name: Anna Kaslow

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the total amount of doom and breaches on your location.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If there are fewer than 3 breaches on your location, place 1 breach on your location.
[tablet]: -2. For each point you fail by, remove 1 breach from the current act.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, place 1 breach on a random location.
Name: In the Clutches of Chaos

Description: Forced - When doom would be placed on this agenda: Instead, place 1 breach on a number of different random locations equal to 1 more than the number of investigators. Forced - When a breach would be placed on a location with 3 breaches: Instead, resolve an incursion at that location.
Flavor:
THE CONQUEST HAS BEGUN.
ALL SHALL TREMBLE BEFORE THE HOST OF CHAOS.
SUBMIT OR PERISH.
Name: THE CHARIOT 揃 VII

Description: [free] Remove 3 breaches from this act: Place 1 clue on a random location. Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance. When this act advances, move all of the breaches on it to the next act.
Flavor: The state of the city continues to decay. Breaches in reality begin to rip through the fabric of the Earth, and a faint melody of discordant pipes can be heard throughout the streets.
Name: Dark Knowledge (v. I)

Description: [free] Remove 3 breaches from this act: Place 1 clue on a random location. Objective - If Anette Mason is defeated, advance.
Flavor: This nightmare will not end until you stop the one behind it: Anette Mason and the spirit which possesses her. The world is falling apart all around you, and the coven is only bringing the end closer.
Name: Beyond the Grave

Description: [free] Remove 3 breaches from this act: Place 1 clue on a random location. Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance. When this act advances, move all of the breaches on it to the next act.
Flavor: The state of the city continues to decay. Breaches in reality begin to rip through the fabric of the Earth, and a faint melody of discordant pipes can be heard throughout the streets.
Name: Dark Knowledge (v. II)

Description: [free] Remove 3 breaches from this act: Place 1 clue on a random location. Objective - If Carl Sanford is defeated, advance.
Flavor: This nightmare will not end until you overthrow the one behind it: Carl Sanford and the Order of the Silver Twilight. Even with the world falling apart all around you, the cult seems intent on continuing their plot to the bitter end.
Name: New World Order

Description: [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Move 1 breach from French Hill to the current act, +1 additional breach for each [willpower] icon on that card.
Name: French Hill

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (2). For each point you succeed by, move 1 breach from French Hill to the current act.
Name: French Hill

Description: [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Move 1 breach from Rivertown to the current act, +1 additional breach for each [intellect] icon on that card.
Name: Rivertown

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (2). For each point you succeed by, move 1 breach from Rivertown to the current act.
Name: Rivertown

Description: [free]: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck and move 1 breach from Southside to the current act. Choose a [[Power]] treachery discarded by this effect and resolve its revelation ability, if able.
Name: Southside

Description: [free] Choose and discard any number of cards from your hand: For each card discarded in this way, move 1 breach from Southside to the current act.
Name: Southside

Description: [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Move 1 breach from Uptown to the current act, +1 additional breach for each [agility] icon on that card.
Name: Uptown

Description: [action]: Test [agility] (2). For each point you succeed by, move 1 breach from Uptown to the current act.
Name: Uptown

Description: [action]: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, move all breaches from South Church to the current act. [action]: Resign. You hide through the night.
Flavor: Many fearful citizens are seated at the church's wooden pews, praying and whispering amongst themselves.
Name: South Church

Description: [action] Discard an asset you control from play: Move all breaches from South Church to the current act. [action]: Resign. You hide through the night.
Flavor: Many fearful citizens are seated at the church's wooden pews, praying and whispering amongst themselves.
Name: South Church

Description: [action] Discard the top 5, 10, or 15 cards of your deck: For every 5 cards discarded in this way, move 1 breach from Merchant District to the current act. Draw each weakness discarded in this way.
Name: Merchant District

Description: [free] Spend 2 resources: Move 1 breach from Merchant District to the current act.
Name: Merchant District

Description: [action]: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Witch]] enemy and draw it. Then, move all breaches from Hangman's Hill to the current act. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Hangman's Hill

Description: [free] Take 1 horror: Move 1 breach from Silver Twilight Lodge to the current act.
Name: Silver Twilight Lodge

Description: [free] Take 1 damage: Move 1 breach from Hangman's Hill to the current act.
Name: Hangman's Hill

Description: [action]: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy and draw it. Then, move all breaches from Silver Twilight Lodge to the current act. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Silver Twilight Lodge

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). Place 1 breach on X different random locations, where X is the amount by which you failed.
Flavor: You look upon the face of true chaos. Everything you have ever known, everything you have ever loved - it is all meaningless by comparison.
Name: Chaos Manifest

Description: Revelation - Attach to a random location. Place breaches on attached location until there are exactly 3 breaches on it. Treat the attached location as if its printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]). [action]: Test [intellect] or [willpower] (4) to close the gateway. If you succeed, discard Primordial Gateway.
Name: Primordial Gateway

Description: Revelation - If there are no breaches on your location, place 1 breach on your location. You must take X damage or horror, divided as you wish. X is the total amount of doom and breaches on your location.
Name: Terror Unleashed

Description: Spawn - Most breaches (or Silver Twilight Lodge if there are no locations in play with breaches on them). Retaliate. Treat Lodge Enforcer's location as if its printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Name: Lodge Enforcer

Description: Revelation - Find the [[Cultist]] enemy in play with the most doom on it. For each doom on that enemy, place 1 breach on that enemy's location. If no breaches are placed by this effect, Secrets of the Beyond gains surge.
Name: Secrets of the Beyond

Description: Spawn - Fewest breaches. Hunter. Forced - After Witness of Chaos enters a location: Place 1 breach on that location.
Name: Witness of Chaos

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Resolve the revelation ability on the topmost [[Power]] treachery in the encounter discard pile. - Resolve an incursion at your location.
Name: Toil and Trouble

Description: Limit 1 per deck. Forced - After Hallowed Mirror enter play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck. When Hallowed Mirror leaves play, find each of those copies of Soothing Melody (even if they are out of play) and set them aside, out of play.
Name: Hallowed Mirror

Description:
Bonded (Hallowed Mirror).
Heal 2 damage or 2 horror (or any combination thereof) from among investigators and/or [[Ally]] assets at your location. Draw 1 card.
Flavor:
...Et leur chanson se m棚le au clair de lune,
Au calme clair de lune triste et beau...
- Paul Verlaine, "Clair de Lune"
Name: Soothing Melody

Description:
Fast. Play when you are dealt damage and/or horror.
Cancel up to 2 damage and/or horror just dealt to you. Then, gain that many resources.
Name: "I've had worse"

Description: Limit 1 per deck. Forced - After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck. When Occult Lexicon leaves play, find each of those copies of Blood-Rite (even if they are out of play) and set them aside, out of play.
Name: Occult Lexicon

Description:
Bonded (Occult Lexicon).
Draw 2 cards. Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. For each card thusly discarded, you may either gain 1 resource, or spend 1 resource to deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Blood-Rite

Description: Shuffle any number of non-weakness cards from your hand into your deck. Draw cards until you reach your maximum hand-size. Remove Glimpse the Unthinkable from the game.
Name: Glimpse the Unthinkable

Description: Look at another investigator's hand. You may play a non-weakness card in that investigator's hand, under your control. If you do, you and that investigator each draw 1 card.
Flavor: "Yeah, yeah, sure. That's what you said the last 3 times."
Name: "You owe me one!"

Description:
Exceptional.
[reaction] After you play an event, exhaust Double, Double: Play that event again as if it were in your hand.
Flavor:
Harpier cries, "'Tis time, 'tis time."
- William Shakespeare, Macbeth
Name: Double, Double

Description: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during this attack, the attacked enemy gets -1 fight, -1 health, and -1 evade for the remainder of the turn (to a minimum of 1).
Name: Wither

Description: [action]: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +2 [willpower] for this investigation. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during this test, you may choose a revealed location up to 2 connections away from your current location; you are now investigating as if you were at the chosen location in addition to your location (you may use either shroud value).
Name: Sixth Sense

Description: Attach to your location or to a connecting location. During the enemy phase, each enemy that moves does so along the shortest path toward the attached location, instead of to where it would normally move. Forced - While attached, at the end of the round: Discard Lure.
Name: Lure

Description:
Fast. Play when you reveal a chaos token that would reduce your skill value to 0 during a skill test (including the [auto_fail] token).
Cancel that token and treat it as an [elder_sign] token, instead.
Name: Eucatastrophe

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half of the doom on Azathoth (rounded up), to a minimum of 2.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, Azathoth attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -4. If your modified skill value for this test is 0, place 1 doom on Azathoth.
Name: Before the Black Throne

Description:
Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it.
Do not remove doom from enemies when this agenda advances.
Flavor:
ONE END IS ANOTHER BEGINNING.
CHANGE IS THE ONLY CONSTANT.
YOUR ULTIMATE FATE IS AT HAND.
Name: WHEEL OF FORTUNE 揃 X

Description:
Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it.
Do not remove doom from enemies when this agenda advances.
Flavor:
...the boundless daemon-sultan Azathoth, whose name no lips dare speak aloud, and who gnaws hungrily in inconceivable, unlighted chambers beyond time amidst the muffled, maddening beating of vile drums and the thin, monotonous whine of accursed flutes...
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: It Awaits

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it. Do not remove doom from enemies when this agenda advances. (Beware - the scenario will not end when this agenda advances, but the doom of the world will be close at hand.)
Flavor:
...that leering, tittering shantak coursed on impetuous and relentless, flapping its great slippery wings in malignant joy, and headed for those unhallowed pits whither no dreams reach... 
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: The Final Countdown

Description: [action] Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos -" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective - Only investigators at Hideous Palace may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. (Beware - any investigator who is not there will be killed.)
