Flavor: From the horizonless breach in the gaping maw of the sky, you have traveled an impossible distance, and yet you are still many leagues from the nighted throne where Azathoth stirs.
Name: The Cosmos Beckons

Description: [action] Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos -" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective - Only investigators at Court of the Great Old Ones may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. (Beware - any investigator who is not there will be killed.)
Flavor: Your bones shiver violently with the silent, still cold of this empty place. No light penetrates these black halls. No warmth reaches you, no breeze touches your skin. This must be what death feels like, you think morbidly.
Name: In Azathoth's Domain

Description: [action] Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos -" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective - If the lead investigator is at The Black Throne and there are no clues on it, advance.
Flavor: You are close now. You can feel the churning and twisting of aeons in the emptiness around you. Here, in the nucleus of all things - the very center of chaos itself - your objective, and your ultimate fate, lie at hand.
Name: What Must Be Done

Description: Forced - At the end of the round: Add clues to Cosmic Ingress until it has 3 clues on it. Each [[Void]] location gains: "[action]: Shuffle this location into the Cosmos, moving each investigator and enemy that was at this location to Cosmic Ingress."
Name: Cosmic Ingress

Description: Forced - At the end of the round: Add clues to Hideous Palace until it has 4 clues on it. Each [[Void]] location gains: "[action]: Shuffle this location into the Cosmos, moving each investigator and enemy that was at this location to Hideous Palace."
Name: Hideous Palace

Description: Forced - At the end of the round: Add clues to Court of the Great Old Ones until it has 6 clues on it. Each [[Void]] location gains: "[action]: Shuffle this location into the Cosmos, moving each investigator and enemy that was at this location to Court of the Great Old Ones."
Name: Court of the Great Old Ones

Description: The Black Throne gets +X shroud, where X is half of the doom on Azathoth (rounded up). Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on Azathoth, or Azathoth attacks you.
Flavor:
...the ultimate nighted throne of the daemon Azathoth in the formless central void.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: The Black Throne

Description: Cosmos - You must either connect to the right, or lose 2 resources and connect to an adjacent location in a direction of your choice. [reaction] After you move to Dancer's Mist, remove 1 resource from the scenario reference card: Move to a connecting location.
Name: Dancer's Mist

Description: Cosmos - You must either connect above, or take 2 horror and connect to the topmost revealed location in a direction of your choice. [action] Remove 1 resource from the scenario reference card: Move the placement of Flight into Oblivion once upward, placing an empty space in the spot it previously occupied. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Flight into Oblivion

Description: Cosmos - You must either connect below, or take 2 damage and connect to the bottommost revealed location in a direction of your choice. [action] Remove 1 resource from the scenario reference card: Move the placement of Infinity of Darkness once downward, placing an empty space in the spot it previously occupied. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Infinity of Darkness

Description: Cosmos - Connect to any revealed location, in a direction of your choice. Forced - After you enter Cosmic Gate: You must either spend 1 clue or take 1 horror. [action] Remove 1 resource from the scenario reference card: Move any number of investigators at Cosmic Gate to any other [[Void]] location.
Name: Cosmic Gate

Description: Cosmos - Connect in a direction of your choice. Forced - After you enter Pathway into Void: You must either discard 1 card from your hand or take 1 damage. [action] Remove 1 resource from the scenario reference card: Move Pathway into Void to any adjacent spot, placing an empty space in the spot it previously occupied. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Pathway into Void

Description: Spawn - Farthest empty space. Hunter. Mindless Dancer can enter empty space as if it were a location. Forced - After Mindless Dancer moves to an empty space via its hunter keyword: Resolve its hunter keyword again. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Mindless Dancer

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, attach Ultimate Chaos to Azathoth. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror. If you fail by 3 or more, Ultimate Chaos gains surge. Cannot be canceled. If there are 3 copies of Ultimate Chaos attached to Azathoth, discard them and either place 1 doom on Azathoth, or Azathoth attacks each investigator in player order. Cannot be canceled.
Name: Ultimate Chaos

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): Place 1 doom on Azathoth, or Azathoth attacks you.
Flavor:
There was the immemorial figure of the deputy or messenger of hidden and terrible powers...
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
Name: Whispered Bargain

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +X difficulty, where X is the current agenda number. If there is no agenda in play, X is 4. If you fail, move each doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy in play to Azathoth (or place 1 doom on Azathoth if there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play).
Name: The End is Nigh!

Description: Revelation - If there is no doom on Azathoth, A World in Darkness gains surge. Otherwise, for each doom on Azathoth, you must choose one: - Lose 1 resource. - Choose and discard 1 card from your hand. - Take 1 horror. - Take 1 damage.
Name: A World in Darkness

Description: Azathoth is oblivious and omnipotent. It is immune to all player card effects and investigator actions, and cannot be defeated by any means. Forced - If there is 10 or more doom on Azathoth: The Blind Idiot God rises from its throne in the ultimate void of chaos and devours the universe. (R1)
Name: Azathoth

Description: Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack. [free] Spend 1 resource: Return .32 Colt to your hand.
Name: .32 Colt

Description: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset. Spend 1 additional ammo token from that asset. When you reveal chaos tokens for this attack, reveal 1 additional chaos token. Choose one to resolve and ignore the other.
Name: "Eat lead!"

Description: For each clue you have (to a maximum of 3), either heal 2 horror from an investigator at your location or discard a [[Terror]] card at your location.
Flavor:
"I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing."
- Plato, <u>The Republic</u>
Name: Logical Reasoning

Description: Researched. Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. If you succeed, you may put an asset with printed cost of X or lower into play from your hand. X is the amount you succeeded by.
Name: Archaic Glyphs

Description: [free] During your turn, exhaust Stealth: Evade. The chosen enemy gets -2 evade for this evasion attempt. If you successfully evade the enemy, disengage with it but do not exhaust it. Until the end of your turn, that enemy cannot engage you.
Name: Stealth

Description: Uses (3 charges). If Suggestion has no charges, discard it. [action] Exhaust Suggestion: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 charge from Suggestion.
Name: Suggestion

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[action] Exhaust Alchemical Transmutation, spend 1 charge: Test [willpower] (0). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 4). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, take 1 damage.
Name: Alchemical Transmutation

Description: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack. If you succeed, instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 3 damage to each enemy at the attacked enemy's location (any additional damage is dealt to the attacked enemy). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed during this attack, deal 2 damage to each investigator at the attacked enemy's location.
Name: Storm of Spirits

Description: [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. [action] Discard Lantern: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location (or remove Lantern from the game to deal 2 damage, instead). This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Lantern

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Gravedigger's Shovel: Discover 1 clue at your location (or remove Gravedigger's Shovel from the game to discover 2 clues, instead).
Flavor: I knew I should have, but I couldn't stop digging.
Name: Gravedigger's Shovel

Description: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy in excess of its remaining health: Discard this card from your hand.
Name: Unspeakable Oath

Description: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] After you successfully investigate a location with no clues on it: Discard this card from your hand.
Name: Unspeakable Oath

Description: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [action]: Evade. Use only on an exhausted unengaged enemy at your location. If you succeed, discard this card from your hand.
Name: Unspeakable Oath

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Curtain Call shown here. - Construct the act deck using all six copies of Act 2a - "The Stranger." (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Curtain Call

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from The King in Yellow might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from The King in Yellow might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.
Flavor: The mysterious Stranger from The King in Yellow might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.
Name: The Stranger

Description: Forced - After you reveal the Theatre Lounge: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Search the encounter deck for the 2 topmost hidden cards and secretly add both of those cards to your hand. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Theatre Lounge

Description: While you are investigating Prop Shop, it gets -1 shroud for each horror on you. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Prop Shop: Take 1 horror.
Name: Prop Shop

Description: Spawn - Balcony. Hunter. Forced - After you defeat La Comtesse: Place her in your hand, as a hidden card. While La Comtesse is in your hand, she gains: "La Comtesse counts as 4 cards instead of 1 while checking your hand size. Forced - After you discard 1 or more cards from your hand during the upkeep phase: Take 1 horror."
Name: La Comtesse

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Last King shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Last King

Flavor: As you pull up to the manor, you notice that something is wrong. A trail of blood leads up the porch steps, and the front door is smashed. Muted music comes from within the house, its warped and discordant notes painful to your ears. Has the madness of <u>The King in Yellow</u> already made its way here?
Name: Better Never Than Late

Description: Hunter. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, you manage to get through to them for just a moment; automatically evade Crazed Guest. If you fail, your words fall on deaf ears.
Name: Crazed Guest

Description: Prey - Most clues. Hunter. Dianne Devine gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After any investigator performs a parley action: Move Dianne Devine once toward that investigator.
Name: Dianne Devine

Description: Each investigator at Dianne Devine's location cannot discover or take control of clues. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: Find the [[Bystander]] asset with the fewest clues on it (among [[Bystander]] assets with at least one clue). Move Dianne Devine to that asset's location, if able.
Name: Dianne Devine

Description: Revelation - Find the [[Bystander]] asset with the most clues on it, and put Party Guest into play at that asset's location. Investigators cannot parley with [[Bystander]] assets at Party Guest's location. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Move Party Guest to a connecting location.
Name: Party Guest

Description: Revelation - Randomly resolve one of the Sickening Reality cards underneath the scenario reference card. Cannot be canceled.
Name: Shocking Display

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Echoes of the Past shown here. - Randomly choose one [[Basement]] Historical Society location and remove it from the game, without looking at its revealed side. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Echoes of the Past

Description: Entry Hall is connected to Quiet Halls. Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Basement]] location. [action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls (from the token bank).
Name: Quiet Halls

Description: While you have at least 1 hidden card in your hand, you cannot investigate this location.
Name: Historical Society

Description: Forced - When you investigate this location, if there is at least 1 [[Cultist]] enemy in play: This location gets -3 shroud for this investigation. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, move 1 clue from this location to the [[Cultist]] enemy farthest from you (before resolving the effects of the test).
Name: Historical Society

Description: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues at this location: One at a time, draw that many cards from the top of the encounter deck.
Flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the basement rooms used by the Historical Society.
Name: Historical Society

Description: While the number of the current act is greater than the number of the current agenda, Keeper of the Oath gains hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Find each investigator whose location shares a [[Trait]] with Keeper of the Oath's location. Move 1 clue from each of those investigators to Keeper of the Oath.
Name: Keeper of the Oath

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Unspeakable Oath shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Unspeakable Oath

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)
Flavor: Daniel is somewhere in the secured basement where the most dangerous patients are kept. Now that you have the key, you can explore this area of theasylum.
Name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. III)

Description: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)
Flavor: Daniel is somewhere in the secured basement where the most dangerous patients are kept. Now that you have the key, you can explore this area of theasylum.
Name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. IV)

Description: Massive. Hunter. Host of Insanity gets +2 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you control Clasp of Black Onyx: Parley. You reveal the clasp to the creature. It freezes in place, whispering a garbled prayer. Automatically evade Host of Insanity.
Name: Host of Insanity

Description: Forced - At the end of the round: Daniel Chesterfield's controller takes 2 horror. [action] If you are at Infirmary: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, detach Radical Treatment and add it to the victory display. If you control Clasp of Black Onyx, reduce the difficulty of this test by 3.
Name: Radical Treatment

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Forget something an investigator has "remembered" from an ability on a location. (It is no longer true.) - Take 1 horror and Clouded Memory gains surge.
Name: Clouded Memory

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to A Phantom of Truth shown here. - Randomly choose 1 of the 2 Montparnasse locations, 1 of the 2 Grand Guignol locations, 1 of the 2 P竪re Lachaise Cemetery locations... (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to A Phantom of Truth

Description: Forced - After you discover any number of clues from Montparnasse: Discard cards from your hand with that many [willpower] icons among them. If you cannot, take 1 horror.
Name: Montparnasse

Description: [action] Spend 5 resources: Either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or remove 1 doom from the current agenda. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: It seems the theatre is performing a show about insanity. You wonder if they have ever performed <u>The King in Yellow</u>.
Name: Grand Guignol

Description: Forced - After an enemy moves into P竪re Lachaise Cemetery: It gets +1 horror value for the remainder of the round.
Flavor: Paths of stone wind through rows of graves and countless mausoleums. The dense, twisting cemetery has you trapped in a state of melanchoy, surrounded by death on all sides.
Name: P竪re Lachaise Cemetery

Description: While you are at Canal Saint-Martin, you must use your [combat] in place of your [agility], and vice versa.
Name: Canal Saint-Martin

Description:
Each enemy at Notre-Dame gets +1 fight and -1 evade.
[reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Notre-Dame by 3 or more during your turn: You may take an additional action this turn. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Notre-Dame

Description: Forced - After you enter Gardens of Luxembourg, if there is at least 1 [[Byakhee]] enemy in play: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, each [[Byakhee]] enemy in play readies and moves to Gardens of Luxembourg.
Name: Gardens of Luxembourg

Description: Revelation - Check Campaign Log. - If you have more (or equal) Doubt than Conviction, move The Organist 1 location away from the nearest investigator (to a location with no investigators, if possible). - If you have more Conviction than Doubt, resolve The Organist's hunter keyword.
Name: Figure in the Shadows

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter set for Return to The Pallid Mask shown here. - When building the Catacombs deck, first set aside the Tomb of Shadows and the Blocked Passage, as normal. - Next, add the 4 new Catacombs locations included in this encounter set with the remaining Catacombs locations, and determine your starting location, as normal. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Pallid Mask

Description: [action] If you control Clasp of Black Onyx: You place the clasp within the skull's eye socket, and the passage opens. Reveal the Catacombs location to the right of Secret Passage. Forced - When Secret Passage is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play to the right of Secret Passage.
Name: Secret Passage

Description: Forced - When Mound of Bones is revealed: Put the top 4 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, to the left, and to the right of Mound of Bones. At the end of the current round, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Malformed Skeleton and spawn it at Mound of Bones.
Name: Mound of Bones

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Research Site: Reveal any Catacombs location. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - When Research Site is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, or to the right of any other location.
Name: Research Site

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at Sea of Skulls: You must either take 1 direct horror or choose and discard 3 cards from your hand. Forced - When Sea of Skulls is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, or to the right of the location farthest from Sea of Skulls and mark it with a horror token. For the remainder of the game, Sea of Skulls is connected to the marked location.
Name: Sea of Skulls

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Malformed Skeleton would resolve its hunter keyword: If there are no investigators within 2 locations of Malformed Skeleton, instead of resolving its hunter keyword, move it to the Catacombs location nearest to an investigator. Forced - When Malformed Skeleton attacks you: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.
Name: Malformed Skeleton

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Black Stars Rise shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Black Stars Rise

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Cloister: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, remember that you have "found the tower key."
Flavor: A lone monk patrols the covered walk, surrounding himself in whispered prayer. A large ringe of brass keys hangs from the sash around his waist.
Name: Cloister

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Knight's Hall: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a guide."
Flavor: You hear pounding on a nearby door, as one of the abbey's monks tries to escape the destruction outside. "Let me in!" he cries, panicked. "Please, I beg you!"
Name: Knight's Hall

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Hastur's Gaze to your hand. Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "c" agenda: Take 2 horror and discard Hastur's Gaze from your hand.
Name: Hastur's Gaze

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Hastur's Grasp to your hand. Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "a" agenda: Take 2 damage and discard Hastur's Grasp from your hand.
Name: Hastur's Grasp

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Path to Carcosa Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Dim Carcosa shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Dim Carcosa

Description: Palace of the King cannot be flipped over while Hastur has more than 2 [per_investigator] remaining health.
Flavor:
I pray God will curse the writer, as the writer has cursed the world with this beautiful, stupendous creation, terrible in its simplicity, irresistible in its truth
- Robert W. Chambers, The Repairer of Reputations, <u>The King in Yellow</u>
Name: Palace of the King

Description:
While you are in the Recesses of Your Own Mind, set the base value of your [willpower] to 0.
Each investigator at Recesses of Your Own Mind is considered to be at a different copy of Recesses of Your Own Mind for the purposes of player card effects and committing cards to each other's skill tests.
Name: Recesses of Your Own Mind

Description:
Hastur cannot leave The Throne Room.
Hastur cannot be exhausted.
Hastur cannot make attacks of opportunity.
Name: The Throne Room

Description:
While Hastur is moving, if there is an investigator at Stage of the Ward Theatre, Hastur's location is considered to be connected to Stage of the Ward Theatre.
While you are at Stage of the Ward Theatre, you cannot attack Hastur.
Name: Stage of the Ward Theatre

Description: Spawn - Palace of the King. Prey - Most cards in hand. Hunter. Forced - When High Priest of Hastur attacks you, if you have a copy of Possession in your hand: Reveal it. The high priest welcomes you into the grand company of the King. You are eliminated and driven insane.
Name: High Priest of Hastur

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - You must either secretly add Delusory Evils to your hand, or place 1 doom on the current agenda and discard Delusory Evils (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance). Forced - When you would succeed at a skill test by 3 or more: You automatically fail, instead. Discard Delusory Evils from your hand.
Name: Delusory Evils

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, lose 1 action and take 1 horror.
Name: Bleeding Walls

Description: Revelation - Discard events from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of your location. If no cards are discarded by this effect, Fragile Thoughts gains surge.
Name: Fragile Thoughts

Description:
Maggot Swarm's location gets +2 shroud.
While Maggot Swarm is at a location with no clues, it gains hunter.
Name: Maggot Swarm

Description: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity only. Hunter. While engaged with an investigator with remaining sanity 4 or fewer, swap Preying Byakhee's fight and evade values.
Name: Preying Byakhee

Description: Peril. Revelation - Attach The Sign of Hastur to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. Forced - Each time an investigator takes 1 or more horror: He or she takes 1 additional horror.
Name: The Sign of Hastur

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 play action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.
Name: Visions in Your Mind

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 resource action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.
Name: Visions in Your Mind

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 move action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.
Name: Visions in Your Mind

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 draw action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.
Name: Visions in Your Mind

Description: Surge. Revelation - If you have 1 or more hidden cards in your hand, take 1 horror.
Name: Maddening Delusions

Description: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must choose a different option: - Lose 2 resources. - Take 1 horror. - Get -2 to the next skill test you perform this round.
Name: Voice of Tru'nembra

Description: Revelation - Put Melancholy into play in your threat area. Increase the resource cost of each card in your hand by 1. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Melancholy.
Name: Melancholy

Description: Revelation - Put Painful Reflection into play in your threat area. Forced - When you play an event: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token, cancel that event, take 1 horror, and discard Painful Reflection.
Name: Painful Reflection

Description:
[reaction] When an asset you control is defeated: Gain X resources, where X is the total amount of damage and horror on that asset. Shuffle that asset into your deck.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may move up to 2 damage and/or horror from Tommy Muldoon to an asset you control, or vice versa.
Flavor: "Eyes up, Tommy."
Name: Tommy Muldoon

Description:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would search their deck or the encounter deck: They may either search 3 additional cards or resolve 1 additional target of the search. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a card and either draw it or commit it to this test, if able. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Mandy Thompson

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to engage or fight an enemy with 1 or more bounties on it.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Place 1 bounty on Bounty Contracts.
Flavor: "When I find that beast, I'll put it down for good."
Name: Tony Morgan

Description:
You begin the game with Gate Box in play.
You may play one event each turn as if you were at a connecting location and engaged with each enemy at that location.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Place 1 charge on Gate Box.
Flavor: "The key to the Dreamlands lies within us all."
Name: Luke Robinson

Description:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 3.
During each upkeep phase, instead of drawing 1 card, discard all non-weakness cards in your hand and draw until you have 5 cards in hand.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, you may shuffle all but 1 card from your discard pile into your deck.
Name: Patrice Hathaway

Description: Tommy Muldoon deck only. Uses (2 ammo). Each resource gained from Tommy Muldoon's [reaction] ability may instead be placed on Becky, as ammo. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Becky

Description: Revelation - Discard each asset you control with damage or horror on it. If no assets are discarded by this effect, shuffle Rookie Mistake back into your deck.
Name: Rookie Mistake

Description:
Mandy Thompson deck only.
Shuffle Occult Evidence into your deck.
[reaction] When you search your deck and Occult Evidence is among the searched cards, reveal it: Draw it and discover 1 clue at your location. (Max one [[Research]] ability per search.)
Name: Occult Evidence

Description: Revelation - Shuffle Shocking Discovery back into your deck. (If you cannot, discard it and draw the top card of the encounter deck, instead.) Forced - When you search your deck and this card is among the searched cards: Discard it. Cancel the search and all of its effects. Shuffle the searched deck. Draw the top card of the encounter deck.
Name: Shocking Discovery

Description: Permanent. Tony Morgan deck only. Uses (6 bounties). [reaction]: After an enemy enters play: Move 1-3 bounties from Bounty Contracts to that enemy, to a maximum of that enemy's health. Forced - After you defeat an enemy with 1 or more bounties on it: Move its bounties to your resource pool, as resources.
Name: Bounty Contracts

Description: Tony Morgan deck only. Uses (3 ammo). [reaction]: After you play Tony's .38 Long Colt: Play another Tony's .38 Long Colt from your hand, at no cost. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for each bounty on the attacked enemy. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy with 1 or more bounties on it, place 1 bounty on Bounty Contracts.
Name: Tony's .38 Long Colt

Description: Spawn - Location farthest from Tony Morgan. Aloof. Forced - After Tony's Quarry enters play: Place 1 doom on it. Then, place 1 resource on it (from the token pool), as a bounty.
Name: Tony's Quarry

Description: Luke Robinson deck only. Uses (3 charges). [fast] Exhaust Gate Box and spend 1 charge: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you, search your bonded cards for Dream-Gate (Wondrous Journey), put it into play, and move to it.
Name: Gate Box

Description: Revelation - If Dream-Gate (Wondrous Journey) is already in play, flip it over. Otherwise, search your bonded cards for Dream-Gate (Pointless Reality) and put it into play. In either case, disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to Dream-Gate.
Name: Detached from Reality

Description: Bonded (Gate Box). Dream-Gate is connected to each other revealed location, and vice versa. Enemies and investigators other than Luke Robinson cannot enter Dream-Gate. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Set Dream-Gate aside, out of play. (If Luke Robinson is here, move him to any revealed location.)
Name: Dream-Gate

Description:
Patrice Hathaway deck only.
[fast] Choose and discard 1 card from your hand and exhaust Patrice's Violin: Choose an investigator at your location to either gain 1 resource or draw 1 card.
Name: Patrice's Violin

Description: Peril. Hidden. Hunter. Revelation - Secretly add this enemy to your hand. You may fight or evade this enemy while it is in your hand (as if it were at your location). If you succeed, discard it from your hand. If you fail, spawn it engaged with you. Forced - When your deck runs out of cards, if this enemy is in your hand: It attacks you (from your hand).
Name: Watcher from Another Dimension

Description: Limit 1 per deck. As an additional cost to play this card, you must search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Bloodlust and shuffle them into your deck. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack for each attached copy of Bloodlust. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, place 1 resource on this card (from the token bank), as an offering.
Name: The Hungering Blade

Description: Bonded (The Hungering Blade). Revelation - Remove 2 offerings from The Hungering Blade to attach Bloodlust to it. If you cannot, take 1 horror and shuffle Bloodlust back into your deck. [free] While attacking with The Hungering Blade, shuffle Bloodlust into your deck: You deal +1 damage for this attack. (Max once per attack.)
Name: Bloodlust

Description:
Myriad. Fast.
Play Solemn Vow under the control of another investigator at your location.
[fast] If the owner of Solemn Vow is at your location, exhaust Solemn Vow: Move 1 damage or horror from a card you control to a card that investigator controls.
Name: Solemn Vow

Description:
Myriad. Fast.
[free] If you have 3 copies of Segment of Onyx in play: Set them aside, out of play. Search your bonded cards for Pendant of the Queen and put it into play.
Name: Segment of Onyx

Description:
Bonded (Segment of Onyx). Uses (3 charges). If this card has no charges, set it aside, out of play, and shuffle 3 set-aside copies of Segment of Onyx into your deck.
[free] Exhaust Pendant of the Queen and spend 1 charge: Choose a revealed location and select one - move to that location, discover 1 clue at that location, or automatically evade an enemy at that location.
Name: Pendant of the Queen

Description:
Myriad.
Astounding Revelation cannot be played.
[reaction] When you search your deck and Astounding Revelation is among the searched cards, discard it: Either gain 2 resources or place 1 secret on an asset you control. (Max one [[Research]] ability per search.)
Name: Astounding Revelation

Description:
As an additional cost to play this card, you must search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Guardian of the Crystallizer and shuffle it into your deck.
[reaction] After you play an event: Attach it facedown to Crystallizer of Dreams instead of discarding it (to a maximum of 5 attached events). Attached events may be committed to skill tests as if they were in your hand.
Name: Crystallizer of Dreams

Description: Bonded (Crystallizer of Dreams). Hunter. Prey - Investigator with a Crystallizer of Dreams only. Guardian of the Crystallizer enters play exhausted. Forced - If there is no Crystallizer of Dreams in play: Set Guardian of the Crystallizer aside, out of play.
Name: Guardian of the Crystallizer

Description:
Myriad.
Gain 2 resources and draw 1 card.
[reaction] After you play Easy Mark: Play another Easy Mark from your hand, at no cost.
Name: Easy Mark

Description:
Max twice per game.
Play only if there are 10 or more cards in the encounter deck.
Search your bonded cards for 1 copy of The Stars Are Right and shuffle it into the top 10 cards of the encounter deck.
Name: Stargazing

Description: Bonded (Stargazing). Revelation - Remove The Stars Are Right from the game. Choose an investigator. That investigator draws 1 card, gains 1 resource, and may take an immediate action as if it were their turn (this action does not count toward the number of actions that investigator can take each turn).
Name: The Stars Are Right

Description:
Myriad. Fast.
Play only during your turn.
Attach to your location. Group limit 3 in play.
Investigators may move between any two locations with an attached Open Gate as if the locations were connected.
Name: Open Gate

Description: Limit 1 per deck. Forced - After Miss Doyle enters play: Search your bonded cards for Hope, Zeal, and Augur. Randomly choose 1 to put into play and shuffle the other 2 into your deck. When Miss Doyle leaves play, find each of those assets (even if they are out of play) and set them aside, out of play.
Name: Miss Doyle

Description: Bonded (Miss Doyle). Fast. Forced - After Hope enters play: Discard Zeal and Augur. [action] If Hope is ready, exhaust or discard him: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] value of 5. (If you discarded Hope, this test is automatically successful. Then, you may shuffle Hope into your deck to put Zeal or Augur into play from your discard pile.)
Name: Hope

Description: Bonded (Miss Doyle). Fast. Forced - After Zeal enters play: Discard Hope and Augur. [action] If Zeal is ready, exhaust or discard her: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] value of 5. (If you discarded Zeal, this test is automatically successful. Then, you may shuffle Zeal into your deck to put Hope or Augur into play from your discard pile.)
Name: Zeal

Description: Bonded (Miss Doyle). Fast. Forced - After Augur enters play: Discard Hope and Zeal. [action] If Augur is ready, exhaust or discard her: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] value of 5. (If you discarded Augur, this test is automatically successful. Then, you may shuffle Augur into your deck to put Hope or Zeal into play from your discard pile.)
Name: Augur

Description: Myriad. X is the number of other copies of Fortuitous Discovery in your discard pile. Investigate. You get +X [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover X additional clues at your location.
Name: Fortuitous Discovery

Description: Multiplayer only. Revelation - Put Self-Centered into play in your threat area. You cannot commit cards to other investigators' skill tests or affect other investigators with player card effects (except aspects that cause damage or horror). [action] [action]: Discard Self-Centered.
Name: Self-Centered

Description: Multiplayer only. Revelation - Put Kleptomania into play in your play area. [action]: Take control of an [[Item]] asset or 2 resources from another investigator at your location. Then, shuffle Kleptomania into your deck. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror.
Name: Kleptomania

Description: Multiplayer only. Revelation - Put Narcolepsy into play in your threat area. You cannot take actions, trigger abilities, or play cards. [action]: "Wake up!" Discard Narcolepsy. Forced - After you take damage or horror: Discard Narcolepsy.
Name: Narcolepsy

Description: Multiplayer only. Hunter. Prey - Bearer only. The bearer of Your Worst Nightmare cannot attack, damage, or defeat it.
Name: Your Worst Nightmare

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull] : -X. X is half the number of cards in your hand (rounded up).
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of revealed Enchanted Woods locations.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail and this is an attack or evasion attempt against a swarming enemy, add 1 swarm card to it.
Name: Beyond the Gates of Sleep

Description: Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda during the mythos phase, if any investigator is at a [[Steps]] location: Place 1 additional doom on this agenda.
Flavor: From your initial dream, you have been drawn into a familiar dreamscape: the same one that Virgil Gray traversed in his story in <u>Tales from Nevermore</u>. Is this real? Or is your mind simply conjuring what it expects to see?
Name: Journey through the Gates

Description: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective - If an investigator enters The Cavern of Flame, immediately advance.
Flavor: The door leading out of your initial dream takes you to a stone staircase. Thousands of different stairways join together here, forming an incomprehensible nexus of steps where worlds and stories join together. Where the stairs meet, they form a single spiraling pathway descending deeper into the land ofdreams.
Name: Entering the Dreamlands

Description: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective - If neither Nasht nor Kaman-Thah are in play, immediately advance.
Flavor: The barred golden gates beyond will not open for you. Only the priests can judge whether you are worthy to pass through to the steps below. They cross their weapons - a steel halberd and a silver scythe - in front of the gates.
Name: The Trial of Nasht and Kaman-Thah

Description: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective - If each investigator is at The Enchanted Path, immediately advance.
Flavor: Spiraling stairs descend below for what seems like an infinity.
Name: The Final Descent

Description: Forced - After the first time any investigator enters an Enchanted Woods location: Record in your Campaign Log the dreamers strayed from the path. Objective - Only investigators at The Enchanted Path may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: All you have to do is stay on the path.
Name: The Path

Description: Forced - When you leave the Seventy Steps: Take 1 horror for each card in your hand in excess of 5. [free]: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Name: Seventy Steps

Description: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Each investigator in The Cavern of Flame takes 1 damage.
Flavor: "In light slumber he descended the seventy steps to the cavern of flame and talked of this design to the bearded priests Nasht and Kaman-Thah. And the priests shook their pshent-bearing heads and vowed it would be the death of his soul." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: The Cavern of Flame

Description: Forced - When you leave the Seven Hundred Steps: Take 1 horror for each card in your hand in excess of 3. [free]: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Name: Seven Hundred Steps

Description: Forced - After you enter the Base of the Steps, if you have at least 1 card in your hand: Test [willpower] (X). X is the number of cards in your hand (after committing cards to this test). If you fail, for each card in your hand, you must either take 1 horror or discard that card.
Name: Base of the Steps

Description: The Enchanted Path is connected to each Enchanted Woods location. The Enchanted Path gets +1 shroud for each unrevealed Enchanted Woods location in play. [action] [action] [action]: You do as you were told... but you feel as though you are missing something. Place 1 clue on The Enchanted Path (from the token pool).
Name: The Enchanted Path

Description: As an additional cost for you to leave this location, you must choose and discard 1 card from your hand for each clue on this location.
Flavor: "Threading now the low phosphorescent aisles between those gigantic trunks, Carter made fluttering sounds in the manner of the Zoogs, and listened now and then for responses." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Forced - After a [[Zoog]] enemy with the swarming X keyword spawns at this location: Add 1 additional swarm card to it.
Flavor: "He remembered one particular village of the creatures near the centre of the wood." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Forced - After this location is revealed: Spawn the set-aside Laboring Gug at this location.
Flavor: "Finally the greater light of those thicker fungi revealed a sinister green and grey vastness pushing up through the roof of the forest and out of sight." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: While you are investigating this location, it gets +1 shroud for each card in your hand.
Flavor: "...at that spot a mighty slab of stone rests on the forest floor; and those who have dared approach it say that it bears an iron ring three feet wide." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Forced - After you enter this location: You must either take 2 horror or lose all of your remaining actions.
Flavor: "The Council of Sages, recognising the visitor, offered a gourd of fermented sap from a haunted tree unlike the others..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at this location: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token, take 1 damage and lose 1 action.
Flavor: "He traced his way by the grotesque fungi, which always seem better nourished as one approaches the dread circle..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Forced - After you reveal this location: If you do not leave this location before the end of the round, place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Flavor: "In the tunnels of that twisted wood, whose low prodigious oaks twine groping boughs..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Enchanted Woods

Description: Aloof. Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (2) to prove that you are worthy to enter the Dreamlands. This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, flip Kaman-Thah over and resolve the text on his other side. If you fail, Kaman-Thah attacks each investigator at his location. Forced - After you defeat Kaman-Thah: Flip him over and resolve the text on his other side.
Name: Kaman-Thah

Description: Aloof. Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [agility] (2) to prove that you are worthy to enter the Dreamlands. This test gets +1 [per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, flip Nasht over and resolve the text on his other side. If you fail, Nasht attacks each investigator at his location. Forced - After you defeat Nasht: Flip him over and resolve the text on his other side.
Name: Nasht

Description:
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After a [tablet] symbol is revealed during a skill test at your location, exhaust Randolph Carter: Draw 2 cards.
Name: Randolph Carter

Description:
Hunter.
Laboring Gug cannot enter The Enchanted Path.
Name: Laboring Gug

Description: Spawn - Any Enchanted Woods location (unrevealed, if able). Aloof. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Ancient Zoog is ready: Add 1 swarm card to each swarming [[Zoog]] enemy in play.
Name: Ancient Zoog

Description: Surge. Revelation - Each investigator at an Enchanted Woods location tests [willpower] (3). Each investigator who fails loses 1 action and takes 1 horror.
Name: Lost in the Woods

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if you are engaged with a [[Staff]] enemy).
[cultist]: Reveal another chaos token. If you fail and it is agenda 2 or 3, make an infestation test.
[elder_thing]: -X. X is the number of infested locations.
Name: Waking Nightmare

Flavor: A heavy, ominous feeling haunts you as you explore St. Marys Hospital. Its halls are eerily dark and empty of everything but the occasional orderly making the late-night rounds. Lights flicker, and shadows seem to dart from corner to corner. The hospitals maze of corridors has begun to take on an almost dreamlike haziness. You notice yet another spider crawling up your leg and brush it away, wondering what is causing them to appear so often.
Name: Halls of St. Mary's

Description: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Make an infestation test.
Flavor: A monstrous presence has infested St. Marys. It lies inside the walls and watches you from all sides. In mere minutes, it has spun thick, sticky webbing throughout each of the rooms you visit. The lights are either flickering or out across the hospital, and some of the more advanced medical machinery is broken and covered in cobwebs.
Name: The Infestation Spreads

Description: Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Make an infestation test. Each [[Spider]] enemy at an infested location gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Flavor: The entire building has become infested with a sinister evil - something that does not follow the laws of nature. You need to find some way to either stop it or to escape before it consumes you, too.
Name: Hospital of Horrors

Flavor: Something is wrong with your companions, and while medical science has come far, it cant account for what is happening to them. Youve decided to take it upon yourself to figure out what is wrong and set things right.
Name: Looking for Answers

Description: Objective - If an investigator controls Randolph Carter, advance.
Flavor: You need to learn where this mysterious patient is being kept. If you can find them and speak with them, perhaps they can provide some answers about what is happening to your friends.
Name: Search for the Patient

Description: Each infested location gains: "[action]: Test [willpower] (X) to attempt to seal the rift. X is this location's shroud. Investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to automatically succeed. If you succeed, replace the damage token on this location with a horror token. For the remainder of the game, this location cannot become infested." Objective - If there are no infested locations in play, advance.
Flavor: With the aid of Randolph Carter, you must attempt to close the rifts that have opened between the Dreamlands and the waking world.
Name: Containing the Outbreak

Description: While Waiting Room is not infested, it gains: "[action]: Resign. You flee the hospital, leaving your companions behind."
Flavor: In the corner of the windows, silken webbing creeps along the glass, spun almost of its own accord. Was that there when you first arrived...?
Name: Waiting Room

Description: While you are in the Emergency Room, each of your skill tests gets +1 difficulty for each card committed to it.
Flavor: This room contains the aftermath of what must have been a gruesome admission. Splatters of dried blood cover the mattress in the center of the room, and medical supplies - bandages, gauze, and syringes - litter the floor.
Name: Emergency Room

Description: [reaction] When you investigate Experimental Therapies Ward, take 1 horror: Experimental Therapies Ward gets -2 shroud for this investigation.
Flavor: This room is filled with beds, each one surrounded by a partition curtain. High-tech machines sit next to each bed, ready to administer all sorts of radical treatments.
Name: Experimental Therapies Ward

Description: [action] [action] [action] If you are not engaged with any enemies: One at a time, take 4 basic investigate actions.
Flavor: Shelves of folders line the walls of this room, and for some strange reason, they are completely waterlogged. You notice that the ceiling has partially collapsed due to mold and rot, and water drips from the ceiling onto the floor. Webs stick to your shoes with every step you take.
Name: Records Office

Description: [reaction] After you enter Stairwell from a non-[[Basement]] location: Move to a [[Basement]] location. Then, test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 2 damage. Forced - After Stairwell becomes infested: Make an infestation test.
Name: Stairwell

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discover 1 clue at this location. If you fail, take 1 horror. Forced - After the last remaining clue is discovered from Morgue: Make an infestation test.
Flavor: That doesn't look human.
Name: Morgue

Description: [action] [action]: Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, heal 3 damage from that investigator. If you fail, deal 1 damage to that investigator.
Flavor: This room seems to have been abandoned midsurgery. On the operating table lies a deceased patient completely covered in a thin sheet... save for the spindly, spiderlike legs emerging from the patient's body.
Name: Operating Room

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you succeed, test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group to give control of the set-aside Randolph Carter asset to an investigator at this location.
Flavor: The patient you've been looking for sits on a bed in the middle of this dark room. You ask him about his condition, but he merely replies, "Why should I help you? You'd never believe me, anyway."
Name: Private Room

Description:
Place 1 damage token on the location with the most clues (the 2 locations with the most clues if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game). For the remainder of the scenario, damage tokens on locations represent the spreading infestation. Each location with a damage token on it is an "infested" location.
Create a separate bag consisting of the following tokens: [skull], [tablet], [tablet], [tablet], [tablet], [cultist], [cultist]. (If you do not have a second bag, use a cup, bowl, or other opaque container.) This is the infestation bag, and these are infestation tokens. They are not chaos tokens.
Some abilities will instruct the players to make an infestation test. An infestation test may cause the infestation to spread to other locations or endanger investigators at infested locations. To resolve an infestation test, an investigator must reveal a random infestation token from the infestation bag, and resolve the effects for that token as indicated on the other side of this card.
Flip this card over and place it next to the scenario reference card.
Name: The Infestation Begins...

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After an [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a skill test at your location, exhaust Randolph Carter: Draw 2 cards.
Name: Randolph Carter

Description:
[free] Exhaust Dr. Shivani Maheswaran: Automatically evade an engaged Suspicious Orderly.
[reaction] When an investigator reveals a [skull] or [cultist] symbol on an infestation token, remove Dr. Shivani Maheswaran from the game: Cancel that token and return it to the infestation bag.
Name: Dr. Shivani Maheswaran

Description:
Hunter.
Suspicious Orderly cannot attack, be attacked, or be dealt damage.
While Suspicious Orderly is engaged with you, you cannot investigate.
Name: Suspicious Orderly

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Corrupted Orderly is dealt 1 or more damage while at an infested location: Cancel 1 of that damage.
Name: Corrupted Orderly

Description: Revelation - Perform an infestation test. If you are at an infested location, treat each [tablet] token you reveal as a [skull] token instead.
Name: Outbreak

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. While Grey Weaver is ready, each investigator at its location cannot take move actions.
Name: Grey Weaver

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If there is a [[Spider]] enemy at your location, you cannot commit cards to this skill test. If you fail, you cannot attack or investigate until the end of the round.
Name: Will of the Spider-Mother

Description: Prey - Most cards in hand. Hunter. Massive. Increase the difficulty for you to attack or attempt to evade The Crawling Mist by 1 for each card in your hand with an encounter card back.
Name: The Crawling Mist

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. You cannot play cards or trigger abilities on player cards with an odd printed resource cost. [action] Discard a player card with an even printed resource cost from your hand: Discard this card from your hand.
Name: Law of 'Ygiroth

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. You cannot commit cards to skill tests with an odd number of total skill icons on them. [action] Discard a player card with an even number of total skill icons from your hand: Discard this card from your hand.
Name: Law of 'Ygiroth

Description: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. You cannot play cards or commit cards to skill tests with an odd number of words in their title. (A word is any text separated by spaces.) [action] Discard a player card with an even number of words in its title from your hand: Discard this card from your hand.
Name: Law of 'Ygiroth

Description: Peril. Revelation - Choose a skill ([willpower], [intellect], [combat], or [agility]). For the remainder of the round, each investigator gets -2 to the chosen skill. You cannot choose a skill that has already been chosen by a copy of this effect this round.
Flavor: "...no god or daemon could have aspired to discoveries and conquests like those which we planned in whispers." - H. P. Lovecraft, "Hypnos"
Name: Whispers of Hypnos

Description: Hunter. Prey - Most damage. Forced - After Hunting Ghast enters a location with a [[Gug]] enemy: Ready each [[Gug]] enemy at its location and deal 1 damage to Hunting Ghast.
Name: Hunting Ghast

Description: Forced - After Lumbering Gug exhausts: It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Lumbering Gug

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage, to a maximum of 3 damage. For the purposes of counting icons committed to this skill test, [intellect], [combat], and [agility] icons count as matching icons, and [willpower] and [wild] icons count as 2 matching icons.
Name: Dreamer's Curse

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror, to a maximum of 3 horror. For the purposes of counting icons committed to this skill test, [intellect], [combat], and [agility] icons count as matching icons, and [willpower] and [wild] icons count as 2 matching icons.
Name: Somniphobia

Description: Revelation - Put Deeper Slumber into play in your threat area. Your maximum hand size is reduced by 3 and is checked after each time you draw 1 or more cards. [action] [action]: Discard Deeper Slumber.
Name: Deeper Slumber

Description: Revelation - Put Dreamlands Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you initiate an investigation: You must either take 1 horror, or your location gets +2 shroud for this investigation. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Dreamlands Eclipse.
Name: Dreamlands Eclipse

Description: Revelation - Put Prismatic Phenomenon into play in your threat area. The first time you perform one of the following actions (draw, resource, or play) each round, it costs 1 additional action. Forced - After you successfully investigate a location: Instead of discovering clues, discard Prismatic Phenomenon.
Name: Prismatic Phenomenon

Description: Revelation - Put Night Terrors into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness revealed this way and remove the other cards from the game. [action] If Night Terrors is in your threat area: Test [willpower] (4). After this test ends, discard Night Terrors (even if you fail).
Name: Night Terrors

Description: Revelation - Put Glimpse of the Underworld into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would take damage and/or horror: Take 1 additional damage or horror. [free]: Discard Glimpse of the Underworld. Then, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: Glimpse of the Underworld

Description: Revelation - Attach to the non-permanent, non-weakness asset you control with the highest printed cost. Otherwise, Threads of Reality gains surge. Treat attached asset as if its printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]] and forced abilities). [action] Discard an asset you control: Discard Threads of Reality.
Name: Threads of Reality

Description: Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Add 1 swarm card to each Swarm of Spiders enemy in play. If there are no Swarm of Spiders enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Swarm of Spiders enemy and spawn it at Spider of Leng's location with no swarm cards.
Name: Spider of Leng

Description: Swarming 2. X equals the number of Swarm of Spiders enemies at this location (including swarm cards).
Name: Swarm of Spiders

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Each [[Spider]] enemy at attached location gains retaliate and alert. Investigators cannot move out of attached location. [action]: Test [combat] (3) or [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Sickening Webs.
Name: Sickening Webs

Description: Revelation - Attach Hunted by Corsairs to the current act. Forced - When the act advances: Each investigator takes 2 damage. Attached act gains: "[action]: Test [intellect] (4) to outwit the Corsairs or [agility] (4) to sneak past them. If you succeed, discard Hunted by Corsairs."
Name: Hunted by Corsairs

Description: Spawn - Nearest [[City]] or [[Surface]] location. Alert. Forced - After Corsair of Leng attacks via its alert keyword: It gets -3 evade for the remainder of the phase.
Name: Corsair of Leng

Description: Spawn - Engaged with the investigator at your location with the lowest [combat]. Prey - Lowest [combat]. Retaliate. Swarming 1.
Flavor: "...although they live mostly on fungi it is muttered that they have also a slight taste for meat..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Furtive Zoog

Description: Spawn - Engaged with the investigator at your location with the lowest [agility]. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Alert. Swarming 1.
Flavor: "...one sees their weird eyes long before one can discern their small, slippery brown outlines." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Stealthy Zoog

Description: Spawn - Any connecting location. Hunter. Swarming 2. Forced - When Inconspicuous Zoog is defeated: Cancel all excess damage and move any of its remaining swarm/host cards to a connecting location, exhausted.
Flavor: "Most of them live in burrows, but some inhabit the trunks of the great trees..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
Name: Inconspicuous Zoog

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, add 1 swarm card to the nearest swarming [[Zoog]] enemy. If you fail and there are no such enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Zoog]] enemy, draw it, and shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Zoog Burrow

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Guest]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -1. If there is an [[Innocent]] enemy in the victory display, reveal another chaos token.
[tablet]: -3. You may place one of your clues on your location to treat this as a -1 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail and there is an [[Innocent]] enemy in the victory display, take 1 horror.
Name: Murder at the Excelsior Hotel

Description: If there is only 1 investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold.
Flavor: When you come to, you are standing over the man's body. You recoil immediately at the grisly sight. Multiple stab wounds perforate his chest. Blood spills onto the floor. What in the hell happened here? And why can't you remember a thing?
Name: The Murder

Description: Forced - After an investigator at the same location as a ready [[Police]] enemy discovers 1 or more clues at that location or deals damage to a [[Humanoid]] enemy: Each ready [[Police]] enemy at that location engages that investigator and makes an immediate attack.
Flavor: You're not the only ones interested in the strange events at the Excelsior tonight, and the police are on to you. You're still not sure what happened - or if it could happen again.
Name: Special Investigation

Description: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the top card of the Leads deck. Objective - If the investigators control two [[Lead]] assets, advance.
Flavor: Your head is spinning as you try to make sense of the situation. Empty bottles are scattered around the room. Your hands tingle. The shadows seem to coil and writhe around you. Were you drugged? Or is this something else entirely?
Name: What Happened...?

Description: Objective - Learn more about your leads by placing clues on them (using abilities on some locations). The more clues, the better. At the end of the round, you may choose to advance if each [[Lead]] asset has at least 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. (Hint: If you wish to present this evidence to the police, you may wish to have at least 2 [per_investigator] clues on each [[Lead]] asset, instead.)
Flavor: Thanks to the leads you discovered in the suite, you're fairly sure whoever framed you is still in the hotel. The only real question is where to find this person. Looking at the leads you've found, you feel like the answers are right in front of you...
Name: Following Leads

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Exhaust Bloodstained Dagger and take 1 horror: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If this attack defeats an enemy, draw 1 card.
Flavor: You feel your sins crawling on your back.
Name: Bloodstained Dagger

Description: Revelation - Put What Have You Done? into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to parley, you must discard a card at random from your hand. [action]: Shuffle What Have You Done? into your deck.
Name: What Have You Done?

Description:
Sergeant Monroe may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to any investigator at his location, even if he is uncontrolled.
[reaction] When Sergeant Monroe is dealt any amount of damage or horror, exhaust him: Deal that much damage to a non-[[Innocent]] enemy at his location. Any investigator at Sergeant Monroe's location may trigger this ability.
Name: Sergeant Monroe

Description: Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with clues). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move 1 clue to Arkham Officer from its location, flipping it to its doom side. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, either automatically evade Arkham Officer, or flip one of its doom to its clue side and take control of it.
Name: Arkham Officer

Description:
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "cleaned up the blood."
[action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "hid the body."
[action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "tidied up the room."
Name: Room 225

Description: [action]: Choose a [[Humanoid]] enemy at Suite Balcony and test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, take 1 direct horror and defeat the chosen enemy (if that enemy is [[Elite]], deal 2 damage to it instead). This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Suite Balcony

Description: [reaction] After you enter this location: You may immediately move to a connecting location. If you do, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, draw the top card of the encounter deck.
Name: Second Floor Hall

Description: [action]: Resign. You flee the scene of the crime. Forced - When you attempt to move out of the Foyer while there is at least 1 [[Guest]] enemy here: Test [agility] (X), where X is the number of [[Guest]] enemies here. If you fail, you must spend 1 additional action to move out of the Foyer.
Name: Foyer

Description: [action] Spend 2 resources: You place an order while enduring the withering glares of the entire waitstaff. At the end of your turn, if you are still at the Restaurant, you may take 1 horror to heal 3 damage. (Limit once per game.) [free] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Restaurant (from the token bank.)
Name: Restaurant

Description:
[action]: Test [agility] (4) or [combat] (4). If you succeed, move to either Room 212, Room 225, or Room 245.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators at this location to Alien Device (if it is in play).
Name: Hotel Roof

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators at this location to Sinister Solution (if it is in play).
Flavor: A mass of inhuman matter sits in a glass tub on the desk, connected to all manner of strange and futuristic lab equipment. The bed nearly looks like it was never slept in. Sitting on the mattress is a case of vials, each filled with green, viscous liquid.
Name: Room 212

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (3). Only the top card of your discard pile may be committed to this skill test (place it on the bottom of your deck after this test resolves). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators in Room 245 to Time-Worn Locket (if it is in play).
Flavor: The room beyond is immaculate, seemingly untouched in quite some time.
Name: Room 245

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, you may move 1 clue controlled by an investigator in the Office to Manager's key (if it is in play).
Flavor: The manager of the Excelsior is obviously a busy person - newspaper clippings, strange documents, and keys of all sorts are scattered about.
Name: Office

Description:
[action]: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, move a [[Humanoid]] enemy at any location once toward the Basement.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy in the Basement: Move any number of clues controlled by investigators at the Basement to Tome of Rituals (if it is in play).
Name: Basement

Description: Spawn - Foyer. Hunter. Forced - After Mr. Trombly enters play: Immediately resolve the hunter and patrol keywords on each other [[Staff]] enemy in play.
Flavor: The concierge regards you with a feverish, maddened expression. "Did you request a wake-up call?"
Name: Mr. Trombly

Description: Spawn - Nearest [[Crime Scene]] location. Prey - Most clues. Hunter.
Flavor:
"You lost? I don't think you should be here."
Their eyes gleam with malice, and their knuckles turn white as they brandish the closest object they can find.
Name: Conspicuous Staff

Description: Spawn - Nearest [[Hall]] location. Aloof. Patrol (nearest [[Crime Scene]] location). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Hotel Guest is at a [[Crime Scene]] location: Add 1 doom to Hotel Guest. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Hotel Guest.
Name: Hotel Guest

Description: Revelation - In player order, each investigator at your location must choose: - Test [agility] (3) to attempt to flee before the gas fills the room. If you succeed, move to a connecting location. If you fail, take 2 damage. - Test [combat] (3) to attempt to hold your breath. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Name: Noxious Fumes

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Humanoid]] enemies in play, Driven to Madness gains surge. Otherwise, attach Driven to Madness to the nearest [[Humanoid]] enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade. Attached enemy loses aloof. Investigators cannot parley with attached enemy. Forced - After attached enemy is evaded: Discard Driven to Madness.
Name: Driven to Madness

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each [[Innocent]] enemy in the victory display. If you fail, take 2 horror (if you are at a [[Crime Scene]] location, you must also choose and discard a card from your hand).
Flavor: Blood will have blood.
Name: Blood on your Hands

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest non-[[Crime Scene]] location. Attached location gains the [[Crime Scene]] trait and gets +2 shroud. [reaction] When you successfully investigate attached location: Instead of discovering clues, discard Incriminating Evidence.
Name: Incriminating Evidence

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Humanoid]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Humanoid]] enemy, draw it, and shuffle the encounter deck. Otherwise, the nearest [[Humanoid]] enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, engages you, and makes an immediate attack.
Name: Violent Outburst

Description: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Alien Device to another investigator.
Flavor: A device constructed of strange parts, and emitting a signal you don't hear so much as feel. The contraption smells of the stars and feels like the inescapable emptiness of the night sky.
Name: Alien Device

Description: Retaliate. Forced - When Otherworldly Meddler would take damage from an attack: Remove 1 doom from Otherworldly Meddler. Then, reduce the damage dealt by 1. Forced - After an investigator is defeated: Add 3 doom to Otherworldly Meddler.
Name: Otherworldly Meddler

Description: Peril. Revelation - Place 1 doom on Otherworldly Meddler (if it is in play) and test [willpower] (4). If you fail, you must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Deal 2 damage to an investigator or [[Humanoid]] enemy at your location.
Name: Encephalon Signal

Description: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Manager's Key to another investigator.
Flavor: A seemingly inconspicuous key, the word "Office" etched on one side. Was the victim a member of the hotel's staff? What diabolical scheme was in motion at the Excelsior?
Name: Manager's Key

Description: Massive. Retaliate. Each [[Guest]] enemy loses patrol and gains surge. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Add 1 [[Guest]] enemy at Hotel Manager's location to the victory display, then place 2 doom on Hotel Manager. Move each other [[Guest]] enemy one location toward Hotel Manager.
Name: Hotel Manager

Description: Spawn - Nearest empty location. Hunter. Retaliate. If there is at least 1 [[Guest]] enemy in play, Hotel Security loses hunter and gains "Patrol (nearest location with a [[Guest]] enemy)."
Flavor: Whatever it is, it's clearly no longer human.
Name: Hotel Security

Description: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Tome of Rituals to another investigator.
Flavor: A massive book, its pages ancient and weathered. As you page through, a leaflet falls out. Picking it up, you see it contains a simple message: "The Enclave awaits below."
Name: Tome of Rituals

Description: Hunter. Forced - After Dimensional Shambler deals you damage from its attack: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If an [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, it snatches you from this dimension; remove Dimensional Shambler from the game and you are defeated.
Name: Dimensional Shambler

Description: Spawn - Basement. Hunter. Forced - After Cultist of the Enclave attacks: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Name: Cultist of the Enclave

Description: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Sinister Solution to another investigator.
Flavor: The flask is ice-cold, and the sickly green liquid within has the consistency of syrup. It smells vaguely of fish and ozone. Hanging from the top of the flask is a tag stamped: "Test 1."
Name: Sinister Solution

Description: Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Each investigator at attached location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Each other investigator must either take 1 damage or 1 horror (their choice).
Name: Harvested Brain

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each location away from Room 212 you are. If you fail, you must either place 1 of your clues on your location, or take 2 horror.
Name: Morbid Awareness

Description: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Time-Worn Locket to another investigator.
Flavor: The faded photograph within depicts a beautiful young woman from another time. A previous guest of the hotel, perhaps?
Name: Time-Worn Locket

Description: Patrol (Room 245). Retaliate. Forced - When damage would be placed on Vengeful Specter: Reduce that damage to 1 unless it was dealt by a [[Spell]], [[Relic]], [[Charm]], or encounter card.
Name: Vengeful Specter

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. For each point you succeed by, you may deal 1 damage to a [[Geist]] enemy at your location. If an [elder_sign] symbol is revealed during this test, you may deal 2 damage to a [[Geist]] enemy at any location.
Name: Chilling Presence

Description: Alien Device gains: "[action] If Vengeful Specter is exhausted and at your location, remove 2 clues from Alien Device: Deal 2 damage to Vengeful Specter." Objective - If Vengeful Specter is defeated, advance.
Name: The True Culprit (v. I)

Description: Sinister Solution gains: "[action] If you are in Room 212: Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, you may remove 2 clues from Sinister Solution to either exhaust Otherworldly Meddler or deal it 2 damage." Objective - If Otherworldly Meddler is defeated, advance.
Name: The True Culprit (v. II)

Description: Alien Device gains: "[action] Exhaust Alien Device and remove 2 clues from it: Add a [[Staff]] enemy at your location to the victory display (or deal it 2 damage if it is [[Elite]]). Does not provoke attacks of opportunity." Objective - If Hotel Manager is defeated, advance.
Name: The True Culprit (v. III)

Description: Tome of Rituals gains: "[action] Remove 2 clues from Tome of Rituals: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat].
