Name: The Great Web

Description: Massive. Forced - When Atlach-Nacha leaves a location: If there are no investigators at that location, place 1 doom there. Otherwise, it attacks each investigator at that location. Forced - After you evade Atlach-Nacha: Instead of exhausting it, choose an investigator at your location. It cannot attack the chosen investigator this round.
Name: Atlach-Nacha

Description: Massive. This enemy cannot make attacks of opportunity. X is the shroud value of this enemy's location. Forced - When you would evade this enemy: Instead of exhausting it, choose an investigator at your location. This enemy cannot attack the chosen investigator this round.
Name: Legs of Atlach-Nacha

Description: Massive. This enemy cannot make attacks of opportunity. X is the shroud value of this enemy's location. Forced - When you would evade this enemy: Instead of exhausting it, choose an investigator at your location. This enemy cannot attack the chosen investigator this round.
Name: Legs of Atlach-Nacha

Description: Massive. This enemy cannot make attacks of opportunity. X is the shroud value of this enemy's location. Forced - When you would evade this enemy: Instead of exhausting it, choose an investigator at your location. This enemy cannot attack the chosen investigator this round.
Name: Legs of Atlach-Nacha

Description: Massive. This enemy cannot make attacks of opportunity. X is the shroud value of this enemy's location. Forced - When you would evade this enemy: Instead of exhausting it, choose an investigator at your location. This enemy cannot attack the chosen investigator this round.
Name: Legs of Atlach-Nacha

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Aloof. Forced - At the end of the round, if Web-Spinner is ready: Place 1 doom on Web-Spinner's location.
Name: Web-Spinner

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest [[Ancient One]] enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 damage and +1 horror. [action]: Test any skill (5). If you succeed, discard The Spinner in Darkness.
Name: The Spinner in Darkness

Description: Revelation - Put Caught in a Web into play in your threat area. You get -1 [agility] and cannot take more than one move action each round. [action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, discard Caught in a Web.
Name: Caught in a Web

Description: Revelation - Choose a [[Spider]] enemy in play. If it is engaged with an investigator, it makes an immediate attack, along with each of its swarm/host cards. Otherwise, place 1 doom on its location. If there are no [[Spider]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Spider]] enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Endless Weaving

Description:
Dexter Drake deck only. Replacement.
[free] Exhaust Molly Maxwell and deal her 1 horror: Name any trait. One at a time, reveal cards from the top of your deck until an asset with the named trait is revealed. Draw that asset. Shuffle each other revealed card back into your deck.
Name: Molly Maxwell

Description: Dexter Drake deck only. Replacement. Revelation - Put Yaztaroth into play in your threat area. You cannot play assets or put assets into play. [action] [action]: Discard Yaztaroth.
Name: Yaztaroth

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for every 5 cards Subject 8L-08 has devoured.
[cultist]: -2. If this token is revealed during an attack against an enemy, that enemy gains retaliate for this attack.
[tablet]: -3. After this skill test ends, Subject 8L-08 devours each card that was committed to the test.
[elder_thing]: -5. Choose up to 5 cards from your hand. Subject 8L-08 devours each of those cards. You get +1 skill value for this test for each card devoured in this way.
Name: The Blob That Ate Everything

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).
Flavor: You were in the town of Blackwater when the impact event occurred. For several days you investigated the matter, until the anomaly emerged and all hell broke loose. Fleeing is no longer an option, as the quarantine still holds and is strictly enforced. The only way you're getting out of here alive is if you can find a way to kill the anomaly... if such a thing is even possible.
Name: The Anomaly Spreads

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).
Flavor: The creature from inside the meteorite continues to digest Blackwater whole. By day two, nearly all of the town is covered in vibrant green slime. Acid slowly eats away at the buildings, the streets, even the dirt. Will it ever cease?
Name: The Anomaly Swells

Description: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).
Flavor: By the third day, the anomaly threatens to overtake the quarantine zone. The acid within its body can devour not just creatures, objects, and buildings; it is also capable of consuming thoughts, concepts, emotions, or other aspects of reality. You realize now that the creature threatens not just the lives of all humanity, but the fabric of existence itself.
Name: The Anomaly Consumes

Description: *This act has a global clue threshold (see page 6 of the rules for details). Only clues on copies of this act among all groups contribute to the global clue threshold. [free] Place up to 3 of your clues on this act. (Limit once per round.) Objective - At the start of the round, if the global clue threshold has been reached, you must advance. The event organizer will announce when this threshold has been reached. (Beware - advancing will expose the anomaly's weak spot. Be ready for a fight.)
Name: Expose the Anomaly

Description: Objective - At the start of the round, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. (Beware - advancing will expose the anomaly's weak spot. Be ready for a fight.)
Name: Expose the Anomaly

Description: Forced - After any amount of damage is placed on Vulnerable Heart: Place twice that much damage on Subject 8L-08 as well. [free] While an investigator at your location is attacking Vulnerable Heart, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 [combat] for this attack. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance.
Flavor: The creature's heart is exposed. Now is your chance!
Name: Extraterrestrial Physiology

Description: Each [[Ooze]] enemy gains retaliate and loses the Blob X keyword. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance. (The scenario will not end when this act advances.)
Flavor: You may have managed to finally harm the creature directly, but in doing so, you've caused it to split even further.
Name: Blackwater's Bane

Description: Each [[Ooze]] enemy gains retaliate and loses the Blob X keyword. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance. (The scenario will not end when this act advances.)
Flavor: You may have managed to finally harm the creature directly, but in doing so, you've caused it to split even further.
Name: Blackwater's Bane

Description: [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Deal 3 damage to Subject 8L-08 or a [[Manifold]] enemy at any location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at The Crater takes 1 damage.
Flavor: Bullet casings litter the blackened dirt, though there are no bodies to be found anywhere. A gentle humming fills the air.
Name: The Crater

Description: [action] Spend 2 clues: Gain 1 countermeasure. [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Place 2 clues on Research Site (from the token pool).
Name: Research Site

Description:
[action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Choose one -
- Heal 3 damage.
- Heal 3 horror.
- Gain 5 resources.
- Draw 3 cards.
Name: Temporary HQ

Description: [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Choose a [[Mi-Go]] enemy at any location and test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, deal 1 damage to the chosen enemy (to a maximum of 5).
Flavor: The mound is covered by a thick purple fungus, its fleshy tendrils digging into the ground and surrounding trees. What in the hell is this stuff, anyway?
Name: Fungus Mound

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, move to a location up to X connections away from Sewer, where X is the amount you succeeded by.
Flavor: These sewers intersect throughout Blackwater. Though you would not relish the journey, you could use these passages to move unhindered from one section of the town to the next.
Name: Sewer

Description: [free]: Choose an exhausted [[Manifold]] enemy at Bridge and test [intellect] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you succeed, defeat the chosen enemy. (Max one success per game.)
Name: Bridge

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Water Tower: Test [intellect] (3) to find the structure's weakness. If you succeed, deal 3 damage to each [[Ooze]] enemy at Water Tower and at each connecting location. (Max one success per game.)
Flavor: This rusty old water tower has seen better days.
Name: Water Tower

Description: [action] If there are no clues on Church: Choose an [[Ooze]] enemy at Church, or a connecting location. Move the chosen enemy one location away from Church and automatically evade it. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Church

Description: Forced - After a [[Manifold]] enemy spawns at Oozy Lakebed: Place 1 clue on Oozy Lakebed. That enemy cannot take damage this round.
Name: Oozy Lakebed

Description: Forced - After you discover any number of clues from Slimy Streets: Reveal that many random tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull] or [auto_fail] token revealed by this effect, take 1 damage or 1 horror.
Name: Slimy Streets

Description: While you are at Desiccated Farmland, you cannot gain resources. Forced - After you end your turn at Desiccated Farmland: Lose 1 resource.
Name: Desiccated Farmland

Description: Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Mi-Go Abductor at the Fungus Mound. Put the set-aside University Chemist asset into play at the location farthest from all investigators. Put this card into play, next to the act deck. Forced - After an investigator who controls University Chemist enters the Temporary HQ: Remember that "the chemist was saved." Flip this card over. Forced - If University Chemist is defeated or devoured: Remember that "the formula was not completed." Flip this card over.
Flavor: When the anomaly emerged, the first thing the researchers did was try to find a way to dissolve the ooze composing its body. One of the chemists was on the verge of a breakthrough, but she recently disappeared. She was last seen attempting to collect samples in a dangerous section of the quarantine zone. If you can reach her, perhaps you can assist her.
Name: Rescue the Chemist

Description: Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Mi-Go Harvester at the Fungus Mound. Put the set-aside Meteorite Sample asset into play at The Crater. Put this card into play, next to the act deck. Forced - After an investigator who controls a Meteorite Sample enters the Research Site: Remember that "the sample was recovered." Flip this card over. Forced - If Meteorite Sample is attached to the Mi-Go Harvester and it is at the Fungus Mound: Remember that "the sample was lost." Flip this card over.
Flavor: With the emergence of the creature from within the meteorite, it has become clear that our understanding of the universe on a cosmic scale is flawed, at the very least. The anomaly defies all laws of biology, which makes it impossible to understand, let alone destroy. Perhaps if you can recover a sample of the meteorite, the researchers can study it in order to learn more.
Name: Recover the Sample

Description: Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Mi-Go General at the Fungus Mound. Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on the Fungus Mound. Put this card into play, next to the act deck. Forced - If Mi-Go General is defeated, or if there are no clues on the Fungus Mound: Remember that "the Mi-Go were driven off." Flip this card over. Forced - If there are 4 [per_investigator] or more clues on Fungus Mound: Remember that "the secret of the ooze was stolen." Flip this card over.
Flavor: Reports from survivors throughout the town tell of another force of creatures descending from above and collecting globs of ooze from all over Blackwater. What are these other alien creatures, and what is their goal?
Name: Drive Off the Mi-Go

Description: Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Mi-Go Meddler at the Fungus Mound. Put this card and the set-aside The Military's Plan asset into play next to the act deck, with 5 damage tokens on it. Place 1 horror token on 1 [per_investigator] different [[Oozified]] locations farthest from the Crater. Horror tokens on locations represent explosives. Forced - If there are no explosives among locations in play: Remember that "the explosives were defused." Flip this card over. Forced - If The Military's Plan has no damage on it: Remember that "the explosives were detonated." Flip this card over.
Flavor: You are approached by a military officer who informs you of the military's plan to destroy the anomaly using explosives. "I tried to tell them why it won't work, but the General was too stubborn to listen," he explains. "The explosives are on a timed fuse. If they detonate, it will only split the creature further and make it even harder to destroy. Orders be damned; we have to stop them!"
Name: Defuse the Explosives

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) on University Chemist. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on it, take control of it.
Name: University Chemist

Description: If uncontrolled and unattached, attach Meteorite Sample to its location. If attached to a location with no clues on it, Meteorite Sample gains: "[action] Test [willpower] or [agility] (6). If you succeed, detach Meteorite Sample and take control of it."
Name: Meteorite Sample

Description: Hunter. Forced - After Mi-Go General attacks you: Move 1 of your clues to Fungus Mound.
Name: Mi-Go General

Description: Horror tokens on locations represent explosives. Each location with explosives gains: "[action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remove the horror token on this location." Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 damage from this card.
Name: The Military's Plan

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, discard an [[Obstacle]] treachery at your location.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is 1 more than that enemy's remaining health. If you succeed, that enemy is defeated. Does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Universal Solvent

Description: [fast] Defeat a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location with 2 or less remaining health. Then, heal all damage from Pet Oozeling, place 1 resource on it, and reveal X chaos tokens, where X is the number of resources on it. If an [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, you are defeated and suffer 1 physical trauma.
Flavor: WARNING: DO NOT FEED OOZELING UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES
Name: Pet Oozeling

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. The device fires a blast of entropic energy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed and the enemy is not defeated, move it one location away from you. (If you succeed by 3 or more, deal +1 damage and move the enemy an additional location away.)
Name: Mi-Go Weapon

Description:
[fast] Exhaust Lt. Wilson Stewart: Discard a card from your hand or from the top of your deck. Then, for each...
...[willpower] icon on that card, get +1 for your next test this round.
...[intellect] icon on that card, draw 1 card.
...[combat] icon on that card, heal 1 damage or horror from him.
...[agility] icon on that card, gain 1 resource.
Name: Lt. Wilson Stewart

Description: Spawn - Location with the most clues (other than Fungus Mound). Surge. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Mi-Go Drone is ready: Move 1 clue from Mi-Go Drone's location to Fungus Mound.
Name: Mi-Go Drone

Description: While Mi-Go Harvester is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Meteorite Sample is attached to Mi-Go Harvester, move it once toward the Fungus Mound. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Harvester once toward Meteorite Sample's location. Then, if it is at the same location as Meteorite Sample, attach Meteorite Sample to it."
Name: Mi-Go Harvester

Description: While Mi-Go Meddler is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Mi-Go Meddler is at a location with explosives, remove 1 damage from The Military's Plan. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Meddler once toward a location with explosives."
Name: Mi-Go Meddler

Description: While Mi-Go Abductor is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Mi-Go Abductor is at University Chemist's location, deal 1 direct damage to University Chemist. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Abductor once toward University Chemist's location."
Name: Mi-Go Abductor

Description: *Subject 8L-08 has a global health pool (see page 6 of the rules for details). If Subject 8L-08 is defeated, proceed to (R2).
Name: Subject 8L-08

Description: Subject 8L-08 gets +15 health. If Subject 8L-08 is defeated, proceed to (R2).
Name: Subject 8L-08

Description: Spawn - Any empty [[Oozified]] location. Blob 1.
Flavor:
Subject Report: 8L-08-b
1846 hours - Recovered subject sample (8L-08-b) for further study. Subject appears to share same physiological qualities as 8L08, but acts with its own sentience. The pH levels observed in subject are similar to those found in 8L-08... (report continues on next page)
Name: Oozeling

Description: Spawn - Nearest [[Oozified]] location. Hunter. Forced - After you perform an attack against Grasping Ooze using a [[Melee]] card: Subject 8L-08 devours that card. Blob 3.
Name: Grasping Ooze

Description: Revelation - Immediately attempt to evade Cubic Ooze (without spending an action). If you fail, spawn Cubic Ooze engaged with you, and it attacks you. If you succeed, spawn Cubic Ooze at your location, exhausted and unengaged. Blob 2.
Name: Cubic Ooze

Description: Spawn - Farthest [[Oozified]] location. Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Blob 5.
Name: Oozewraith

Description:
Massive. Retaliate.
X is the amount of damage on Vulnerable Heart.
Vulnerable Heart cannot be evaded and cannot make attacks of opportunity.
Vulnerable Heart cannot have more than 15 damage on it. All excess damage is canceled.
Name: Vulnerable Heart

Description: Revelation - Subject 8L-08 devours a random aspect of reality. Reveal two random chaos tokens from the chaos bag and consult pages 16-19 of the rules to determine what it devoured. (If the combination of chaos tokens revealed is not listed, or if the listed aspect cannot be devoured, reveal two new chaos tokens and consult the chart again.)
Name: Reality Acid

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, choose an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset you control. Subject 8L-08 devours that asset. (If you cannot, take 2 damage instead.)
Flavor: You are forced to look away as the ooze engulfs his body almost instantly.
Name: Devouring Ooze

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, Subject 8L-08 devours either one of your resources or a random card from your hand.
Flavor:
"It ate all the lab equipment? But wait, how did it get through the isolation chamber? What about Dr. Roberts - "
"It ate EVERYTHING!"
Name: Corrosive Slime

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). Take 1 damage for each point you fail by. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect.
Flavor: Jaws of slime close around you, enveloping you in alienacid.
Name: Consuming Maw

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). Take 1 horror for each point you fail by. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect.
Flavor: Green slime suddenly floods through the street, devouring everything it touches.
Name: Wave of Ooze

Description: Revelation - Put Caustic Dissemination into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at an [[Oozified]] location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect. Discard Caustic Dissemination. (Max once per round.)
Name: Caustic Dissemination

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest [[Oozified]] location. As an additional cost to enter or leave attached location, an investigator must spend an action. [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Discard Sticky Feet.
Flavor: "I just bought those shoes!"
Name: Sticky Feet

Description: Revelation - Find the [[Manifold]] enemy with the most damage on it. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until another [[Manifold]] enemy with equal or lower printed health is discarded. Spawn that enemy at the same location, then distribute the damage that is on both enemies so that the remaining health on both enemies is as equal as possible. If no enemy is spawned by this effect, Replication gains surge.
Name: Replication

Description: Revelation - Put "It's got me!" into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 resource on "It's got me!" Then, if there are 6 or more resources on it, Subject 8L-08 devours you. [action] If you are at the Research Site, spend 1 countermeasure: Discard "It's got me!"
Name: "It's got me!"

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Manifold]] enemies in play, Alien Food Chain gains surge. Otherwise, attach to the [[Manifold]] enemy with the least remaining health and fully heal that enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, and gains hunter.
Name: Alien Food Chain

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 resource on the nearest [[Mutated]] enemy, as a mutation.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, draw the top [[Hex]] card in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, place one card committed to this test facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy, as a swarm card.
Name: War of the Outer Gods

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next blue agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next blue agenda.
Flavor: Deep in the cosmos of another dimension, something begins to seep through the veil between worlds...
Name: The Summoning of Silenus

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next blue agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next blue agenda.
Flavor: The Cult of the Empty Sky predicted these events many years ago. Now they will live out the ending that they have long foreknown.
Name: The Summoning Progresses

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside Silenus Descends agenda. If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside Silenus Descends agenda.
Flavor: The end is nigh.
Name: The Summoning Nears Completion

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next green agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next green agenda.
Flavor: In a profane place hidden from society, an entity siphons otherworldly heat from another dimension...
Name: The Incubation of the Egg

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next green agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next green agenda.
Flavor: From each drop of embryonic liquid that rolls off of the egg's surface, horrible creatures gestate: agents of paradise, or so the Cult of Ark'at believes.
Name: The Incubation Progresses

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside The Egg Hatches agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside The Egg Hatches agenda.
Flavor: The end is nigh.
Name: The Incubation Nears Completion

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next red agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next red agenda.
Flavor: From a pit deep within the crust of the Earth, something horrid begins to emerge...
Name: The Proliferation of the Swarm

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next red agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next red agenda.
Flavor: For the Cult of Assimilation, the appearance of the swarm is the heralding of a new era. A rebirth, of sorts, into a higher form. An ascendance.
Name: The Proliferation Progresses

Description: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges agenda. If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges agenda.
Flavor: The end is nigh.
Name: The Proliferation Nears Completion

Description: Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - Investigators may only spend the requisite number of clues if no [[Cultist]] enemies are in play.
Flavor: Three zealous cults have emerged from the shadows and their schemes are engulfing Earth in all-out war. You must find out why the cults are fighting and put a stop to their battle.
Name: War of the Outer Gods

Description: [action] If you are at a [[Ritual Site]]: You try to seal off the portal. Place 1 of your clues around Hub Dimension. Then you may test [willpower] (2) or [intellect] (2). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues around Hub Dimension. Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - If your group has "sealed off the Hub Dimension," advance.
Flavor: Seal off the hub dimension before it is too late!
Name: Close the Portal

Description: [action] If you are at a [[Ritual Site]]: You try to seal off another portal. Test [willpower] (3) or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues around another group's Hub Dimension. Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - If each group has "sealed off the Hub Dimension," advance.
Flavor: Help your companions seal off all the hub dimensions before a cult completes their ritual.
Name: Close All Portals

Description:
Arkham cannot have attachments.
[free] Spend 1 [per_investigator] resources: Move to a connecting location.
Name: Arkham

Description: [action] [action]: Deal 3 damage to a non-[[Ancient One]] enemy at a [[Providence]] location in any group. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Streets of Providence

Description: [free] Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Place 1 ward on the blue agenda. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Athenaeum of the Empty Sky

Description: [action]: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 clue (from the token pool).
Name: The Arcade

Description: [action] [action]: Deal 3 damage to a non-[[Ancient One]] enemy at a [[Montr辿al]] location in any group. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Streets of Montr辿al

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 clue <i>(from the token pool)<i>.
Name: Chateau Ramezay

Description: [free] Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Place 1 ward on the green agenda. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Shrine of Magh'an Ark'at

Description: [action] [action]: Deal 3 damage to a non-[[Ancient One]] enemy at a [[New York City]] location in any group. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Streets of New York City

Description: [free] Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Place 1 ward on the red agenda. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: The Burning Pit

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 clue (from the token pool).
Name: The Penthouse

Description:
Hub Dimension cannot have attachments.
Hub Dimension is connected to each [[Ritual Site]], and vice versa.
[action]: Test [willpower] (2) or [intellect] (2). If you succeed, spend 3 clues or remove 2 clues from around Hub Dimension to deal 2 damage to an [[Ancient One]] enemy (if you succeed by 3 or more, instead deal 3 damage).
Name: Hub Dimension

Description: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - Athenaeum of the Empty Sky. Forced - At the end of the round, if no green or red enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the blue agenda.
Flavor: "A swift and painless end is a mercy."
Name: Nihilistic Stargazer

Description: Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - You and each asset you control take 1 direct damage. - Choose an [[Item]] asset you control and remove it from the game.
Name: Death and Decay

Description: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - Shrine of Magh'an Ark'at. Forced - At the end of the round, if no blue or red enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the green agenda.
Flavor: "We shall usher in a new paradise!"
Name: Zealot of Paradise

Description: Revelation - Attach Predator's Call to the nearest green enemy. If that enemy is [[Mutated]], place 1 resource on it, as a mutation. If no green enemies are in play, Predator's Call gains surge. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror.
Name: Predator's Call

Description: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - The Burning Pit. Forced - At the end of the round, if no blue or green enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the red agenda.
Flavor: "Assimilation is the only way."
Name: Disciple of the Swarm

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each swarm card in play. If you fail, take 2 horror (if you fail by 4 or more, instead take 3 horror).
Name: Feast of Locusts

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, either take 2 damage or place 2 of your clues on your location (if you fail and have 4 or more clues, do both instead).
Name: Hellfire

Description: Revelation - Each non-[[Elite]] enemy moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase. Enemies do not exhaust after attacking in this way. If no attacks were made as a result of this effect, Ravages of War gains surge.
Name: Ravages of War

Description: Revelation - For each faction that has the most enemies in play, place 1 doom on that faction's agenda. If no enemies are in play, place no doom and While They Sleep gains surge.
Name: While They Sleep

Description: Each blue enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Silenus is defeated, (R3).
Name: Silenus Descends

Description: *Silenus has a global health pool of 8[per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Each investigator at Silenus's location must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Remove each card in your hand from the game. - Take 3 horror.
Name: Silenus

Description:
Hunter.
Anytime an investigator is forced to "decide" by an ability on a blue encounter card, they must choose two options instead of one.
Name: The Inescapable Maw

Description: Warring. Forced - After Hune-Stitched Herald engages you: You must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Remove 2 clues from around Hub Dimension. - Hune-Stitched Herald attacks you.
Name: Hune-Stitched Herald

Description: Warring. Spawn - Athenaeum of the Empty Sky. Forced - After Ethereal Entity engages you: You must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Place 1 of your clues on your location. - Take 2 horror.
Name: Ethereal Entity

Description: Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Choose 3 cards in your hand and remove them from the game. - Remove the top 6 cards of your deck from the game. Shuffle each weakness removed this way into your deck.
Name: Inevitable End

Description: Each green enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Magh'an Ark'at is defeated, (R4).
Name: The Egg Hatches

Description: *Magh'an Ark'at has a global health pool of 8[per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 resource on each [[Mutated]] enemy at Magh'an Ark'at's location, as a mutation. Deal 1 damage to each investigator at this location for each mutation on Magh'an Ark'at.
Name: Magh'an Ark'at

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Vile Broodmaster gets +1 health for each mutation on it. Forced - When 1 or more mutations would be placed on an enemy: Place 1 additional mutation on that enemy.
Name: Vile Broodmaster

Description: Retaliate. Warring. Horrific Shoggoth gets +1 damage for each mutation on it. Forced - When Horrific Shoggoth attacks: Place 1 resource on it, as a mutation.
Name: Horrific Shoggoth

Description: Aloof. Retaliate. Warring. Spawn - Shrine of Magh'an Ark'at. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 resource on Bringer of Paradise, as a mutation. Then, if there are 3 or more mutations on it, remove 2 of them and place 2 doom on the green agenda.
Name: Bringer of Paradise

Description: Revelation - Place 1 resource on the [[Mutated]] enemy with the highest fight, as a mutation. That enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, and engages you. Then, it attacks you. If no [[Mutated]] enemies are in play, Hunt Down gains surge.
Name: Hunt Down

Description: Each red enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Ezel-zen-rezl is defeated, (R2).
Name: Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges

Description: *Ezel-zen-rezl has a global health pool of 7 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Each investigator at Ezel-zen-rezl's location chooses both a card from their hand and an asset they control and places them facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as swarm cards.
Name: Ezel-zen-rezl

Description: Hunter. Swarming 6. Forced - After Droning Horde enters play: Each investigator chooses a card from their hand and places it facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as a swarm card. Forced - When Droning Horde attacks: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.
Name: Droning Horde

Description: Swarming 2. Warring. Spawn - Burning Pit. Forced - When Trylogog attacks: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.
Flavor: The irritating, incessant buzzing of the swarm can be heard from miles away.
Name: Trylogog

Description: Revelation - Place an asset you control facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as a swarm card. If no [[Insect]] is in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Trylogog and spawn it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Transmogrify

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would engage you, spend 1 charge: Exhaust that enemy instead.
Name: Cloak of the Outer Realm

Description: Fast. Forced - After Pocket Portal enters play: Place your investigator mini-card onto Pocket Portal and immediately end your turn. While your mini-card is on Pocket Portal, you are not at any location and enemies cannot spawn engaged with you. At the start of your turn, discard Pocket Portal and move to any revealed location.
Name: Pocket Portal

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Choose one -
- Place a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location on top of the encounter deck.
- Look at the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Discard 2 of them and return the rest to the top, in any order.
Name: Dreaded End

Description: [free] Exhaust Blade of Ark'at and spend 1 resource: Place 1 resource on Blade of Ark'at (from the token pool). [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for each resource on Blade of Ark'at. If you succeed, remove up to 3 resources from Blade of Ark'at to deal that much additional damage to the attacked enemy.
Name: Blade of Ark'at

Description:
[free] Exhaust Enchanted Skull: Place the top card of your deck facedown underneath Enchanted Skull.
[free]: You get +1 to this skill test for each card underneath Enchanted Skull. Then discard 1 card from underneath Enchanted Skull, at random. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Enchanted Skull

Description: As an additional cost to play Blood Eclipse, take 2 damage. Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +2 damage for this attack.
Name: Blood Eclipse

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [reaction] When an enemy attacks you during the enemy phase (before resolving that attack), exhaust Survival Knife: Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Survival Knife

Description: Place 2 secrets among assets controlled by investigators at your location (3 secrets instead if there is a clue at your location).
Flavor:
"How do you know I'm mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, "or you wouldn't have come here."
 - Lewis Carroll, <u>Alice's Adventures in Wonderland</u>
Name: Truth from Fiction

Description:
Researched. Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone."
[reaction] When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Move that many times.
Name: Ancient Stone

Description: Uses (0 charges). [reaction] After an investigator, [[Ally]] asset, or enemy at your location is defeated: Place 1 resource (from the token bank) on Decorated Skull, as a charge. [action] Spend up to 3 charges: Draw that many cards and gain that many resources.
Name: Decorated Skull

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round, if you triggered Colt Vest Pocket's "[action]" ability: Discard it.
Name: Colt Vest Pocket

Description: Uses (5 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +1 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, after evading the chosen enemy, you may move to a connecting location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, choose and discard a card from your hand.
Name: Mists of R'lyeh

Description: Seal ([skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing]). Uses (3 charges). If The Chthonian Stone has no charges, return it to your hand. Forced - After you reveal an [auto_fail] symbol during a skill test: Remove 1 charge from The Chthonian Stone.
Name: The Chthonian Stone

Description: Choose and discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy.
Flavor: We make our own fate.
Name: Alter Fate

Description: Exceptional. Permanent. Your investigator gains: "Deckbuilding Restrictions: No assets that take up an ally slot." [reaction] When you play a [survivor] event, exhaust On Your Own: Reduce that event's cost by 2.
Name: On Your Own

Description:
[reaction] After Backpack enters play: Search the top 12 cards of your deck for up to 3 non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Supply]] cards, and attach them facedown to Backpack. Shuffle your deck.
Cards attached to Backpack may be played as if they were in your hand. If there are no cards attached to Backpack, discard it.
Name: Backpack

Description: Revelation - Put Dendromorphosis into play in your threat area. It cannot leave play while it has no damage on it. [fast] Take 1 direct damage: Deal 1 damage to Dendromorphosis. Card design by the Botanists at Arkham Nights 2018.
Flavor: "Plants!"
Name: Dendromorphosis

Description: Campaign Mode only. When you become the bearer of this weakness, gain 2 experience. Revelation - Lose 5 resources. If you cannot, instead remove Offer You Cannot Refuse from your deck, search the collection for Fine Print, and place it in your discard pile.
Name: Offer You Cannot Refuse

Description: Revelation - Lose 7 resources. If you cannot, instead remove Fine Print from your deck, search the collection for Sell Your Soul, and place it in your discard pile.
Flavor: Your scarlet signature drips from its surface.
Name: Fine Print

Description: Revelation - Lose 10 resources. If you cannot, your dark patron tears your consciousness from your body. You are driven insane.
Flavor: One way or another, the debt shall be repaid.
Name: Sell Your Soul

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Untamed Wilds shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Untamed Wilds

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Doom of Eztli shown here. - Gather the 3 Pit Viper cards from the Serpents encounter set and set them aside, out of play. - Before setup, remove the original Burial Pit, Underground Ruins, and Secret Passage locations from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Doom of Eztli

Description: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. While this enemy has 5 [per_investigator] or more damage on it, it gets +2 fight and -2 evade. Forced - After a successful attack or evasion attempt against this enemy ends: Place 1 resource on it. Then, if there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on it, it vanishes with a sinister hiss. (Set it aside, out of play. It keeps all damage tokens.)
Name: Harbinger of Valusia

Description: [action]: Resign. You've escaped... for now. [action]: Check your supplies. If you have torches: Look at the top 2 cards of the exploration deck. Discard 1 treachery or enemy looked at by this effect. Shuffle the exploration deck. This ability can be used at any location.
Name: Entryway

Description: [action] Check your supplies. If you have the Key of Eztli: Search the exploration deck and all set-aside cards for Chamber of Time and put it into play. If it is act 1a, skip directly to act 2a. For the remainder of this act, Sealed Passage is connected to Chamber of Time and vice versa. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Sealed Passage

Description: [action] Check your supplies. If you have a canteen: The chamber accepts your gift of water. Remove 1 doom from any location in play. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Mosaic Chamber

Description: [action] Check your supplies. If an investigator at Tomb of the Ancients has rope: Move to a revealed location up to 3 connections away. Until the end of the round, Tomb of the Ancients is considered to be connected to that location, and vice versa. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Tomb of the Ancients

Description:
While Throne Room has doom on it, it is considered to be in the victory display (for the purposes of counting vengeance).
[action] If there are no clues or doom on Throne Room: Record "mysterious scepter" in your supplies. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Throne Room

Description: Forced - After you put Snake Pit into play by exploring successfully, but before moving to it: Spawn 1 [per_investigator] set-aside Pit Viper enemies in Snake Pit (to a maximum of 3). Check your supplies. If an investigator at your location has binoculars, you may choose not to move to Snake Pit. Otherwise, you must move to it.
Name: Snake Pit

Description:
Ancient Hall enters play with 1 [per_investigator] doom on it.
[action]: Flip 1 doom on Ancient Hall to its clue side.
[fast]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, flip 1 doom on Ancient Hall to its clue side. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Ancient Hall

Description: [action] Check your supplies. If you have a map and there are no clues on Grand Chamber: For the remainder of the scenario (and its resolution), Grand Chamber loses Vengeance 1 and gains Victory 1. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Grand Chamber

Description: Forced - After Chamber of Time enters play: Attach the set-aside Relic of Ages asset to the Chamber of Time. Place 1 doom on Chamber of Time.
Flavor: The floor of this central chamber is intricately carved and glows strangely...
Name: Chamber of Time

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Threads of Fate shown here. - Set the Veda Whitsley story asset aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Threads of Fate

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Rivertown can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: You decide to head to the estate of Marshall Hastings to learn more about the strange happenings mentioned in the Advertiser's article. Perhaps this new development can shed light on your other recent troubles.
Name: Search for the Meaning

Description: Objective - Only investigators in Northside can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: In order to get to the bottom of this new development, you decide to search for the anonymous source of the Advertiser's article. Perhaps if you head to its offices in Northside, you can inquire further - although you may have to grease a few palms to get the information you need.
Name: Search for the Source

Description: Objective - Only investigators at The Hastings Estate can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: When you arrive at the Hastings estate, you find it in a much sorrier state than was originally described. The rainforest has come to Arkham, claiming the manor and the surrounding area almost entirely.
Name: The Overgrown Estate

Description: Objective - Only investigators at The Hastings Estate can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: When you arrive at the Hastings estate, you find it in a much sorrier state than was originally described. The rainforest has come to Arkham, claiming the manor and the surrounding area almost entirely.
Name: The Overgrown Estate

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Merle Garvin: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: You've learned the identity of the Advertiser's source: a man named Merle Garvin, who recently returned from an expedition funded by none other than Marshall Hastings. He was last seen anxiously rummaging through the library at the university, though nobody is quite sure why.
Name: Seeking Trouble

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Merle Garvin: You must remove them and immediately advance.
Flavor: You've learned the identity of the Advertiser's source: a man named Merle Garvin, who recently returned from an expedition funded by none other than Marshall Hastings. He was last seen anxiously rummaging through the library at the university, though nobody is quite sure why.
Name: Seeking Trouble

Description: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Clinton Freeman: You must remove them and immediately advance. Objective - If Loading Docks is in play and there are no clues remaining on it: You must immediately advance.
Flavor: You're close to learning the truth behind this other expedition. What were they after, and why? Does this have anything to do with Ichtaca and the Eztli?
Name: Discover the Truth

Description: Objective - If the Harbinger of Valusia leaves play, advance.
Flavor: You never thought this creature would track you all the way to Arkham. Or perhaps it's just a figment of your imagination. A ghost in your mind. A shard of your subconscious, driving you away from this line of inquiry.
Name: Impossible Pursuit

Description: [fast] Exhaust Veda Whitsley: Look at the top card of the exploration deck or encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may deal 1 damage to Veda Whitsley to discard it. If it is a treachery, you may deal 1 horror to Veda Whitsley to discard it. Otherwise, return it to the top of its deck.
Name: Veda Whitsley

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Boundary Beyond shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Boundary Beyond

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Temple Ruins: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Temple Ruins

Description: [action] Take 1 horror: Gain 2 resources. [action] If you have 10 or more resources: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Metropolitan Cathedral

Description: Forced - After you fail an [agility] test while at Chapultepec Park: Take 1 damage. [action]: Explore. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Chapultepec Park

Description: [action] Discard cards with a combined total of at least 4 skill icons from your hand: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Z坦calo

Description: [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an enemy at Xochimilco: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Xochimilco

Description: While you are at Coyoac叩n, damage/horror cannot be healed from cards you control. [action] If you have 5 or more total damage and/or horror on your investigator: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.
Name: Coyoac叩n

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 1 shown here. - Remove Act 1a - "Search for the Pattern" from the game and replace it with the new Act 1a - "A Familiar Pattern." (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 1

Description: Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.
Flavor: Six stone pillars surround the entrance to the cavern, each carved with a series of uncanny grooves and hieroglyphs that form an intricate pattern. Touching them causes the grooves to glow brightly, and twisting them causes the patterns to shift and change. Perhaps these patterns match the glyphs found in other regions of the rainforest?
Name: A Familiar Pattern

Description: X is the number of pillar tokens on Mouth of K'n-yan. While X is 3 or higher, Feathered Serpent gains alert and hunter. [action]: Evade. Check your supplies. If you have a mysterious scepter, you automatically evade the serpent and command it to deal its damage to another enemy at its location.
Name: Feathered Serpent

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 2 shown here. - After setup, search the collection for the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns) and set it aside, out of play. If the Harbinger of Valusia would enter play during this scenario, use this version instead of the original one. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Heart of the Elders, Part 2

Description: [action] [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, discover 2 clues on Ruins of K'n-yan. (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Ruins of K'n-yan

Description: [fast] If there are no clues on Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you have a canteen, place 1 doom on this location and record "sticky goop" in your supplies. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you do not have a pocketknife, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
Name: Subterranean Swamp

Description: Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Chthonian Depths: Check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has torches, place 1 doom on it.
Name: Chthonian Depths

Description: [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a pickaxe, reduce the shroud value of Treacherous Descent by 2 for the remainder of the scenario. (Group limit 3 times per game.)
Name: Treacherous Descent

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The City of Archives shown here. - Put Halls of Pnakotus (Southern Corridors) into play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The City of Archives

Description: Objective - If three of the following are true, you must advance: - An investigator "found the process." - An investigator "dissected an organ." - An investigator "interviewed a subject." - An investigator "realized what year it is." - An investigator "activated the device." - An investigator controls The Custodian. - An investigator "read about Earth." - An investigator "saw a familiar specimen."
Name: Unrestricted Access

Description: This location is connected to Halls of Pnakotus (Eastern Corridors) and Halls of Pnakotus (Western Corridors), and vice versa. [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Halls of Pnakotus

Description:
[action]: Discard each non-weakness card in your hand.
[action] If you have no cards in your hand: Remember that you "read about Earth."
[action] [action] If you have fewer than 5 cards in your hand: Draw cards until you have exactly 5 cards in your hand.
Name: Cyclopean Vaults

Description:
While you are in the Alien Conservatory, decrease your maximum hand size by 2.
[action]: Test [willpower] (1). If you succeed, test [agility] (2). If you succeed, test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "saw a familiar specimen."
Name: Alien Conservatory

Description: Spawn - Alien Conservatory. Aloof. Retaliate. If an investigator "read about Earth" or "saw a familiar specimen," Captive Subjects loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Captive Subjects

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Depths of Yoth shown here. - After setup, search the collection for the new Harbinger of Valusia (The Sleeper Returns) and set it aside, out of play. If the Harbinger of Valusia would enter play during this scenario, use this version instead of the original one. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Depths of Yoth

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play. (This exploration fails.) - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play: take horror or damage equal to the current depth level; and continue exploring as if you had not drawn Perils of Yoth.
Name: Perils of Yoth

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Shattered Aeons shown here. - When building the exploration deck, use only the 4 single-sided [[Otherworld]] locations. Do not include any of the other encounter cards listed in the original setup instructions. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Shattered Aeons

Description: [reaction] After you move to Great Hall of Celeano, place 1 doom on it: Look at the top card of the encounter deck, the exploration deck, or any player deck. You may discard that card.
Name: Great Hall of Celeano

Description: Buenos Aires gets -2 shroud for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Buenos Aires.
Name: Buenos Aires

Description: Forced - After Ultima Thule enters play: Search the chaos bag for the [elder_sign] chaos token and seal it on Ultima Thule.
Name: Ultima Thule

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Reveal 4 chaos tokens. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - Choose and discard 1 card from your hand and shuffle Unknowable Past into the exploration deck. You cannot choose this option if Unknowable Past was drawn from the exploration deck.
Name: Unknowable Past

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Forgotten Age Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Turn Back Time shown here. - Gather the 3 Pit Viper cards from the Serpents encounter set and set them aside, out of play. - Before setup, remove the original Burial Pit, Underground Ruins, and Secret Passage locations from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Turn Back Time

Description: Forced - After any number of clues are discovered at Riverside Temple: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Riverside Temple has chalk, shuffle an equal number of cards from the top of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.
Name: Riverside Temple

Description: [reaction] When you investigate Waterfall: Check your supplies. If an investigator at Waterfall has rope, reduce Waterfall's shroud by 3 for this investigation. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Waterfall: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
Name: Waterfall

Description: Forced - After you investigate or explore while at Trail of the Dead: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Trail of the Dead has binoculars, take 1 horror.
Name: Trail of the Dead

Description: Forced - When an enemy at Cloud Forest would be dealt any amount of damage: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Cloud Forest has torches, cancel that damage.
Name: Cloud Forest

Description: Spawn - Location with the most [[Cultist]] enemies. Aloof. Forced - After Brotherhood Acolyte enters plaay: Place 1 doom on each other [[Cultist]] enemy at its location.
Name: Brotherhood Acolyte

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Stolen Mind gets +1 fight for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Stolen Mind.
Name: Stolen Mind

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). Place X doom on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, divided as evenly as possible. X is the amount you failed by. If you fail and there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, instead search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).
Name: From Another Time

Description: Revelation - Take 1 horror and attach Resentful Wilds to the nearest location without a copy of Resentful Wilds attached. Forced - After you successfully explore at attached location: Add Resentful Wilds to the victory display.
Name: Resentful Wilds

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Lose 2 actions. - Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.
Name: Best-Laid Plans

Description: Revelation - Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. For each card in your hand that matches one of the cards (by title), discard that card from your hand and lose 1 action. Shuffle each weakness discarded by this effect into your deck.
Name: Merging Timelines

Description: Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Tindalos Alpha attacks you: Shuffle a non-story asset you control into your deck, moving all damage and horror from that asset to your investigator. Discard Tindalos Alpha. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Discard Tindalos Alpha.
Name: Tindalos Alpha

Description: Hunter. Forced - After you draw Vengeful Serpent: Draw each Vengeful Serpent in the victory display as well.
Name: Vengeful Serpent

Description: Spawn - Nearest location with at least 1 clue. Aloof. While Serpent Guardian is unengaged, its location gets +2 shroud. While there are 3 or more vengeance points in the victory display, Serpent Guardian loses aloof and gains hunter.
Name: Serpent Guardian

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vengeance point in the victory display. If you fail, put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in your threat area (if you cannot, take 2 damage).
Name: Wrath of Yig

Description:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only. Advanced.
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you. At the end of the round, you may disengage from each engaged enemy and move up to 2 locations away.
Name: On the Lam

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [fast]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit three times per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 9 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.
Name: Hospital Debts

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -2 (-4 instead if you have 10 or more resources).
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, lose 3 resources.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, "Skids" O'Toole takes 1 horror.
Name: All or Nothing

Description: [action] If you are in the Clover Club Cardroom, spend any number of clues: You cash in your chips. Gain 5 resources for each clue just spent. Forced - If "Skids" O'Toole is defeated: (R2)
Flavor: The Clover Club is filled with mobsters and gamblers from all walks of life. Winning big without causing alarm may not be as easy as you thought.
Name: Eyes All Around You

Description: Investigators cannot resign. Clover Club Pit Boss gains aloof. Forced - After a [[Criminal]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. Objective - At the end of the round: If an investigator has 15 or more resources, advance.
Flavor: You don't want trouble, so it's best not to cause it. Try not to go all in too soon, or you'll likely take the bounce.
Name: Playing Cards

Description: Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains hunter and gets +1 health. Forced - When an investigator resigns: Place each of that investigator's resources on this act. Objective - Collect as many resources as you can and get out. When each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: Collect your winnings and escape!
Name: Hot on your Tail

Description: Forced - After Siobhan Riley engages you: For every 5 resources you have, lose 1 resource. Forced - After an investigator at Siobhan Riley's location gains 1 or more resources during the investigation phase: Siobhan Riley readies, engages that investigator, and makes an attack.
Name: Siobhan Riley

Description: When Clover Club Bouncer is engaged with you, it gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 5 resources you have. [action] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, disengage from Clover Club Bouncer and exhaust it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Clover Club Bouncer

Description:
[reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy by an event or a fight ability on an event: Deal 1 additional damage. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this skill test is successful during an attack, return an event from your discard pile to your hand.
Flavor: "I must fight on."
Name: Nathaniel Cho

Description: Nathaniel Cho deck only. [reaction] After Randall Cho enters play: Heal 3 damage or search your deck and discard pile for a [[Weapon]] asset, play it (paying its cost), and shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "You gotta give this up, Nathaniel. Sooner or later, you're gonna get yourself killed."
Name: Randall Cho

Description: Prey - Nathaniel Cho only. Hunter. Forced - When Tommy Malloy would take any amount of damage: Reduce that amount to 1.
Flavor:
They call him "The Big Palooka."
Nathaniel calls him scum.
Name: Tommy Malloy

Description: Revelation - Put Self-Destructive into play in your threat area. Forced - When you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy: Take 1 damage. [action] [action]: Discard Self-Destructive.
Name: Self-Destructive

Description:
You get +1 [combat] while fighting.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Boxing Gloves: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Spirit]] event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Boxing Gloves

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror from an enemy attack, exhaust Flesh Ward and spend 1 charge: Cancel 1 damage or horror just dealt from that attack.
Name: Flesh Ward

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Grete Wagner and deal 1 damage to her: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: "With Iron and Salt. With Water and Fire."
Name: Grete Wagner

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description:
[reaction] When you deal excess damage to an enemy, exhaust Relentless: Place that excess damage on Relentless.
[fast] Discard Relentless: Gain resources equal to the amount of damage on it.
Name: Relentless

Description: [reaction] After another investigator moves from your location to a connecting location, exhaust Safeguard: Move to that location.
Flavor: Keep an eye out for any trouble, she told me. I rolled my eyes. There was always trouble.
Name: Safeguard

Description: Fight. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: Time to tighten some screws.
Name: Clean Them Out

Description: Fast. Play after an enemy attacks you, even if that attack was canceled. Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy.
Name: Counterpunch

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack.
Name: Dodge

Description: Engage. Fight. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location. Move that enemy to your location, engage it, and attack it.
Name: "Get over here!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Draw 2 cards.
Flavor: Ding, ding, ding!
Name: Glory

Description: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Monster Slayer

Description: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, you may fight that enemy again. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for that attack.
Flavor: Nathaniel is renowned for his rapid left jab and right cross signature move.
Name: One-Two Punch

Description: Choose another investigator at your location. Both you and that investigator gain 2 resources.
Flavor: They won't take us down that easily!
Name: Stand Together

Description: If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: With a sickening smack, he struck the abomination over and over... until at last, it stopped moving.
Name: Vicious Blow

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Discover 1 clue at your location (2 clues instead if you defeated enemies with a combined total of at least 4 printed health this turn).
Flavor: Just as I suspected!
Name: Evidence!

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Ready a [guardian] asset you control. You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight.
Name: Galvanize

Description: Fast. Play when an enemy attacks you (before resolving that attack). Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Counterpunch

Description: Fast. Play during any [free] window. Engage. Fight. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy up to 2 locations away. Move that enemy to your location, engage it, and attack it.
Name: "Get over here!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you take damage from an enemy attack.
Discover 2 clues at your location.
Name: Lesson Learned

Description:
Play only as your first action.
Deal 2 damage to an enemy engaged with you. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Mano a Mano

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Die, you beast!
Name: Overpower

Description:
You get +2 [combat] while fighting.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Boxing Gloves: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Spirit]] event and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Boxing Gloves

Description:
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Grete Wagner and deal 1 damage to her: Discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location.
Flavor: "With Iron and Salt. With Water and Fire."
Name: Grete Wagner

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Engage any number of enemies at your location. For each enemy engaged this way, deal it 1 damage and draw 1 card.
Flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
Name: Taunt

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
[free] Spend 1 resource from your resource pool or from Physical Training: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description: Fight. You automatically succeed and deal +1 damage for this attack. You may fight again. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for that attack.
Flavor: Nathaniel is renowned for his rapid left jab and right cross signature move.
Name: One-Two Punch

Description:
[reaction] After an investigator at your location draws 1 or more cards from their deck during the investigation phase: That investigator draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Draw 1 card.
Flavor: "I have experience dealing with these sorts of horrors."
Name: Harvey Walters

Description:
Harvey Walters deck only.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate, exhaust Vault of Knowledge and choose an investigator at your location: That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Vault of Knowledge

Description: Revelation - For every 3 cards in your hand: Take 1 damage.
Flavor:
"... I can only hope that my account will not arouse a curiosity greater than sane caution on the part of those who believe me at all."
- H. P. Lovecraft, "At the Mountains of Madness"
Name: Thrice-Damned Curiosity

Description: Revelation - Put Obsessive into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Discard 1 non-weakness card at random from your hand. [action] [action]: Discard Obsessive.
Name: Obsessive

Description:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Tome]] asset.
Flavor: An augmented mind can memorize entire volumes of books.
Name: Arcane Enlightenment

Description:
While you have...
- ...5 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [intellect].
- ...10 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [willpower].
- ...15 or more cards in hand, you get +1 [intellect].
Name: Celaeno Fragments

Description: [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy spawns at your location, discard Disc of Itzamna: Automatically evade that enemy or deal it 2 damage.
Flavor: Do they fear it because of what it will do to them? Or, do they fear it because of what it will do to you?
Name: Disc of Itzamna

Description:
Uses (5 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Encyclopedia and spend 1 secret: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator gets +2 to a skill of your choice until the end of the phase.
Name: Encyclopedia

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Feed the Mind and spend 1 secret: Test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by (to a maximum of 3), draw 1 card.
Name: Feed the Mind

Description:
Uses (5 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome and spend 1 secret: Draw 1 card. Then, if you have 10 or more cards in your hand and there are no secrets on Forbidden Tome, you may discard it to record in your Campaign Log that "you have translated the tome."
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description:
While you have 5 or more cards in your hand, Higher Education gains:
"[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test."
Name: Higher Education

Description:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After Laboratory Assistant enters play: Draw 2 cards.
Name: Laboratory Assistant

Description:
While you control a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset, you get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you reveal a location or put a new location into play, exhaust Whitton Greene: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Whitton Greene

Description: Investigate. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: You'll sleep when you're dead.
Name: Burning the Midnight Oil

Description:
Gain 2 resources.
[reaction] After you draw Cryptic Writings during your turn: Play it.
Flavor: "...these are few as compared with those in languages I cannot understand." - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Statement of Randolph Carter"
Name: Cryptic Writings

Description:
Reduce the cost to play Extensive Research by 1 for each other card in your hand.
Discover 2 clues at your location.
Flavor:
"Nothing in here, either. How many do we have left?"
"...See the wall behind you?"
Name: Extensive Research

Description: As an additional cost to play Occult Invocation, discard up to 2 cards from your hand. Fight. - This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [intellect] and deal +1 damage for this attack for each card discarded as part of this card's cost.
Name: Occult Invocation

Description:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Draw 3 cards.
Name: Preposterous Sketches

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location.
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description: [reaction] After Library Docent enters play, return a [[Tome]] asset you control to its owner's hand: Play a different [[Tome]] asset (by title) from your hand, reducing its cost by 2.
Name: Library Docent

Description: Draw 1 card. Shuffle any number of non-weakness cards from your hand into your deck. Then, draw that many cards.
Flavor: Ignorance is a bliss you cannot afford.
Name: Glimpse the Unthinkable

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret: Choose a revealed location up to 3 connections away from your location. Move to that location.
Name: Esoteric Atlas

Description:
While you control a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset, you get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you reveal a location or put a new location into play, exhaust Whitton Greene: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Relic]] asset and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Whitton Greene

Description:
Gain 3 resources (4 resources instead if you have 10 or more other cards in hand).
[reaction] After you draw Cryptic Writings during your turn: Play it.
Flavor: "...these are few as compared with those in the languages I cannot understand." - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Statement of Randolph Carter"
Name: Cryptic Writings

Description: Fight. This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [intellect] for this test. You deal +1 damage for this attack for each clue you have (max +3 damage).
Flavor: "That's the worst plan I've ever heard. Well, what are we waiting for?"
Name: "I've got a plan!"

Description:
Fast. Play during your turn.
Until the end of the round, add your [intellect] to your [combat] and [agility]. Draw 1 card.
Name: Mind over Matter

Description: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Flavor: Some people need to know the truth at any cost. Some truths can cut like knives.
Name: Seeking Answers

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: At last, I've found it!
Name: Perception

Description:
Researched.
[action] [action] [action] [action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome: Move 1 damage from a player card at your location to an enemy at your location. Reduce this ability's cost by 1 action for every 4 cards in your hand (to a minimum of [action]).
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description:
Researched.
[action] [action] [action] [action] Exhaust Forbidden Tome: You may move to a connecting location. Discover 1 clue at your location. Reduce this ability's cost by 1 action for every 4 cards in your hand (to a minimum of [action]).
Name: Forbidden Tome

Description: [fast] During your turn, if you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust Farsight: Play an event from your hand (paying its cost).
Flavor: Beyond all points in time. Beyond all angles of space. Beyond the curves of reality.
Name: Farsight

Description: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You have 2 additional ally slots, which can only be used to hold [[Miskatonic]] assets. Forced - When you take damage or horror: No more than 1 of that damage/horror can be assigned to a [[Miskatonic]] asset.
Name: Miskatonic Archaeology Funding

Description:
Uses (6 secrets). Limit 1 per deck.
[free] Spend 1 secret: You get +2 skill value for this skill test.
[free] Spend 2 secrets: Draw 2 cards.
[free] Spend 3 secrets: Discover 1 clue at any location.
[free] Spend 4 secrets: Deal 3 damage to an enemy engaged with you.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description:
[free] If 2 different non-weakness cards you control are committed to this skill test: Draw 1 card. (Limit once per test.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. After this test ends, for every 2 points you succeeded by, return a card you committed to this test to your hand.
Flavor: "I can top that."
Name: Winifred Habbamock

Description:
Winifred Habbamock deck only.
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
Flavor: "Told you."
Name: Anything You Can Do, Better

Description:
You must commit Arrogance to each eligible skill test you perform.
