This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it.
If this test succeeds, return this skill to your hand.
Name: Arrogance

Description: Commit only to a skill test you are performing (of any type) that has no other cards committed to it. Other cards cannot be committed to this skill test. If this test fails, return this skill to your hand. Forced - If Reckless is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and lose 2 resources.
Name: Reckless

Description: [action] Exhaust Lockpicks: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you do not succeed by at least 2, discard Lockpicks.
Name: Lockpicks

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Exhaust Mauser C96 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Mauser C96 or gain 1 resource.
Name: Mauser C96

Description: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Switchblade

Description: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Lucky Cigarette Case: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: "Its not really all that lucky. Just in the mood for a smoke."
Name: Lucky Cigarette Case

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[fast] Exhaust Lonnie Ritter and spend 1 resource: Choose an [[Item]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Heal 1 damage from that asset and 1 horror from Lonnie Ritter.
Name: Lonnie Ritter

Description: Fast.
Flavor:
"You think wearing that makes you look like the cat's meow?"
"Nah, I already know I'm the cat's meow. This just lets everyone else know."
Name: Leather Jacket

Description:
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +2 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +2 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Streetwise

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, automatically evade the attacked enemy.
Flavor: "Aim for the eyes," they told me.
Name: Cheap Shot

Description:
Fast. Play when you would succeed at a skill test.
You get +2 skill value for this test.
Flavor:
"McGlen, are you tryin' to get us both killed?"
"Not this time, pal. Not this time."
Name: Daring Maneuver

Description: Evade. Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 2 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Slip Away

Description: Investigate. This investigation uses [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at your location.
Name: Pilfer

Description: Evade. When this action begins, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: Being told not to do something was generally Winifred's cue to proceed as planned.
Name: Sneak By

Description: For each point this skill test succeeds by, after it resolves, you may immediately move to a connecting location (to a maximum of 3 times).
Name: Nimble

Description: After you commit Daredevil to a skill test, discard cards from the top of your deck until you discard a [rogue] skill you can commit to this test. Commit it. Shuffle each weakness that was discarded by this effect back into your deck.
Flavor:
"You're a maniac, Wini!"
"I know! Isn't it wonderful?"
Name: Daredevil

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
If you succeed by 3 or more, return Opportunist to your hand after this test instead of discarding it.
Name: Opportunist

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location to heal 1 horror. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (2). If the test succeeds, they draw 1 card. If the test fails, they heal 1 additional horror and discard 1 card at random from their hand.
Name: Liquid Courage

Description: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Exhaust Mauser C96 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Mauser C96 or gain 1 resource (if you succeed by 4 or more, do both).
Name: Mauser C96

Description:
Fast. Play when you would succeed at a skill test.
You get +3 skill value for this test. Draw 1 card.
Flavor:
"McGlen, are you tryin' to get us both killed?"
"Not this time, pal. Not this time."
Name: Daring Maneuver

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, automatically evade the attacked enemy. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Cheap Shot to your hand at the end of your turn.
Flavor: "Aim for the eyes," they told me.
Name: Cheap Shot

Description: Evade. Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 1 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Slip Away to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Slip Away

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Too easy.
Name: Manual Dexterity

Description: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or more, exhaust Lucky Cigarette Case: Search the top X cards of your deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle the remaining cards into your deck. X is the amount you succeeded by.
Name: Lucky Cigarette Case

Description:
[reaction] When you use a fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset, exhaust Sharpshooter: Choose one, or both - 
- This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. All modifiers to your [combat] for this attack modify your [agility] instead.
- Use the attacked enemy's evade value for this attack, instead of their fight value.
Name: Sharpshooter

Description: Investigate. This investigation uses [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, return Pilfer to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Pilfer

Description: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. This attack deals +2 damage. If you succeed by 2 or more, return Backstab to your hand at the end of your turn.
Name: Backstab

Description: After you commit Copycat to a skill test, search the discard pile of another investigator for a skill you can commit to this test, and commit it. After this test ends, place that card on the bottom of its owner's deck.
Name: Copycat

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Exhaust Beretta M1918 and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +4 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, either ready Beretta M1918, or this attack deals an additional +1 damage (if you succeed by 4 or more, do both).
Name: Beretta M1918

Description:
[reaction] When you play a [[Tactic]] or [[Trick]] event, exhaust Chuck Fergus: Choose two -
- That event gains fast.
- That event costs 2 fewer resources to play.
- You get +2 skill value while performing a skill test during the resolution of that event.
Name: Chuck Fergus

Description:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would reveal any number of chaos tokens: Reveal 2 additional tokens. Of the revealed tokens, choose and cancel 2 non-[auto_fail] tokens, or 1 [auto_fail] token. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this effect is canceled or ignored, draw 1 card.
Flavor: "The future can be rewritten."
Name: Jacqueline Fine

Description:
Jacqueline Fine deck only.
[reaction] When you use Jacqueline Fine's [reaction] ability, exhaust Arbiter of Fates: This use of her ability does not count towards its limit.
Flavor: I can see the threads. I know when they will snap.
Name: Arbiter of Fates

Description: Revelation - Put Dark Future into play in your threat area. You cannot cancel or ignore [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], and [auto_fail] tokens. Forced - At the end of your turn: Reveal 5 random tokens from the chaos bag. If an [elder_sign] symbol is revealed, discard Dark Future.
Name: Dark Future

Description: Revelation - Put Nihilism into play in your threat area. Forced - After you reveal, cancel, or ignore an [auto_fail] token: Take 1 damage and 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Nihilism.
Name: Nihilism

Description: [reaction] After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a test you are performing: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Flavor: The wax tapers give off an eerie glow, and the flames move as if they are alive.
Name: Ritual Candles

Description: Uses (4 secrets). [reaction] After a skill test at your location begins, exhaust Scrying Mirror and spend 1 secret: Perform the "reveal chaos token" step of the test now (before committing cards), instead of after committing cards.
Name: Scrying Mirror

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 1 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 1 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 resource.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description: You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] asset.
Flavor: "Thou art wholly unworthy. But I shall serve thee for now."
Name: Familiar Spirit

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After a skill test at your location begins, exhaust Crystal Pendulum: Name a number. If this test succeeds by that number or fails by that number, draw 1 card.
Name: Crystal Pendulum

Description: [reaction] When you play a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Robes of Endless Night: Reduce the cost of that card by 1.
Flavor: Dark is the abyss without. Bright is the abyss within.
Name: Robes of Endless Night

Description: Move. Move to any revealed location and reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, you must discard an [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you control (if you cannot, take 1 damage).
Flavor: Extradimensional travel had its risks, he knew. But who could resist the frontiers beyond time and space?
Name: Astral Travel

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, deal the attacking enemy's damage to itself.
Name: Hypnotic Gaze

Description: Look at the top 4 cards of the encounter deck. Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, shuffle those cards into the encounter deck. Otherwise, return them to the top of the encounter deck in any order.
Flavor: "If I said that I could tell you when you were going to die, would you want to know?"
Name: Parallel Fates

Description: Gain 1 resource. Reveal 3 random tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol revealed, gain an additional 2 resources.
Name: Voice of Ra

Description:
Fast. Play when you would reveal a chaos token.
Reveal 5 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose one of those tokens with a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol to resolve, and ignore the rest. (If no such token is revealed, choose any one of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the rest.)
Flavor: The secrets were written in the stars.
Name: Dark Prophecy

Description: Before revealing chaos tokens for this test, choose one of the following symbols: ([skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing]). Ignore the effects of the chosen symbol during this test (including its modifier).
Flavor: No.
Name: Defiance

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
After you commit Prescient to a skill test, name "even," "odd," or "symbol." After this test ends, if a chaos token of the named type was revealed during this test, you may return a [[Spell]] card from your discard pile to your hand.
Name: Prescient

Description:
Fast. Play when you would resolve an effect on a [mystic] card that triggers "when," "if," or "after" a chaos token is revealed.
Either cancel that effect, or resolve it an additional time.
Name: Eldritch Inspiration

Description:
Uses (3 charges). If Grotesque Statue has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, spend 1 charge: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose one of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.
Name: Grotesque Statue

Description: [reaction] When you play a [[Spell]] card, exhaust Robes of Endless Night: Reduce the cost of that card by 1. Playing that card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: Dark is the abyss without. Bright is the abyss within.
Name: Robes of Endless Night

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to its damage or horror.
Name: Hypnotic Gaze

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card (2 cards instead if it succeeds by 2 or more).
Flavor: Stay back! I'll handle this.
Name: Guts

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 1 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +2 [willpower] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 1 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +2 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 resource.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
[fast] Spend 1 resource from your resource pool or from Arcane Studies: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Arcane Studies

Description: Choose a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location and reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, add 1 charge to the chosen asset. Otherwise, add 4 charges to the chosen asset.
Name: Recharge

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +3 [willpower] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this attack, take 2 damage.
Name: Azure Flame

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +3 [willpower] for this investigation. If you succeed, discover 2 additional clues at this location. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this investigation, take 2 horror.
Name: Clairvoyance

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +3 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to the evaded enemy. If an [elder_sign], "+1," or "0" token is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 2 resources.
Name: Ineffable Truth

Description:
[reaction] After you fail a skill test: You may take an additional action during your turn this round. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may instead choose to automatically fail this skill test to heal 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: "I can hear it. Can it hear me?"
Name: Stella Clark

Description:
Stella Clark deck only.
If this skill test fails, cancel all effects of the failed test.
Flavor: ...nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.
Name: Neither Rain nor Snow

Description: Revelation - Put Called by the Mists into play in your threat area. Forced - After you initiate a skill test with a difficulty of 4 or higher: Take 1 damage. [action] [action]: Discard Called by the Mists.
Name: Called by the Mists

Description: Revelation - Put Atychiphobia into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Take 1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Atychiphobia.
Name: Atychiphobia

Description: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer.
Name: .18 Derringer

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Grimm's Fairy Tales and spend 1 secret: Heal 1 horror from that investigator.
Name: Grimm's Fairy Tales

Description: Uses (2 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring.
Name: Old Keyring

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator fails by either 1 less or 1 more.
Name: Granny Orne

Description: [fast] Discard Mysterious Raven and take 1 horror: Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor:
"And his eyes have all the seeming
of a demon's that is dreaming..."
- Edgar Allan Poe, "The Raven"
Name: Mysterious Raven

Description: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldn't say that's true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
Name: Rabbit's Foot

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Scrapper

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Do not reveal chaos tokens for the next skill test you perform this turn.
Name: Will to Survive

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, cancel that card's revelation effect.
Flavor: With or without hope, all you can do is resist.
Name: A Test of Will

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on top of the encounter deck.
Flavor: Fortune favors the oblivious.
Name: Dumb Luck

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test.
You get +1 to each of your skills for the remainder of the round.
Name: Grit Your Teeth

Description: Fast. Play after a skill test you failed ends (after resolving all effects from the failed test). Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.
Name: Live and Learn

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while attacking an enemy engaged with you.
Deal this attack's damage to a different enemy at your location.
Name: Oops!

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Take Heart to any type of test.
If this test fails, the performing investigator draws 2 cards and gains 2 resources.
Name: Take Heart

Description: Forced - When Cherished Keepsake is defeated by horror: Exile it.
Flavor: Mr. Pawterson always told Wendy things would turn out okay. But then again, Mr. Pawterson was a teddy bear, and he didn't know any better.
Name: Cherished Keepsake

Description: Forced - When Leather Coat is defeated by damage: Exile it.
Flavor: The coat was not the most fashionable choice, but it did feel warm and reassuring in its bulk.
Name: Leather Coat

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer and the next time you trigger this ability this round, you get an additional +1 [combat] for that attack.
Name: .18 Derringer

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, exile A Test of Will.
Flavor: With or without hope, all you can do is resist.
Name: A Test of Will

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck.
Flavor: Fortune favors the oblivious.
Name: Dumb Luck

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test fails, return Unexpected Courage to your hand.
Name: Unexpected Courage

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator either gets +1 skill value or -1 skill value for that test.
Name: Granny Orne

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location would fail a skill test.
They get +3 to their skill value for that test. That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Lucky!

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If this attack fails, either place 1 supply on Chainsaw or deal 1 damage to the attacked enemy.
Name: Chainsaw

Description:
Permanent.
During or before your first action of each of your turns, each skill test you perform gets +1 difficulty.
During or after your third action of each of your turns, each skill test you performed gets -1 difficulty.
Name: Quick Learner

Description:
Permanent.
In between two scenarios of a campaign, reduce the experience cost to repurchase up to 3 cards that you exiled during the last scenario by 1 each.
Flavor: Haven't you seen this before?
Name: D辿j Vu

Description:
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Discover 1 clue at your location. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each clue on your location.
Flavor: Everything by the book: every "i" dotted, every "t" crossed. It has worked, until now.
Name: Roland Banks

Description:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on [[Tome]] [action] abilities.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, draw 1 card for each [[Tome]] you control.
Flavor: "I know of books so powerful, they can rewrite reality."
Name: Daisy Walker

Description:
[free] During your turn, spend 2 resources: You may take an additional action this turn. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, gain 2 resources.
Flavor: "I didn't get out of the joint just to watch the world end."
Name: "Skids" O'Toole

Description:
[reaction] After 1 or more horror is placed on Agnes Baker: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. (Limit once per phase.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each horror on Agnes Baker.
Flavor: "I remember another life, one of sorcery and conquest."
Name: Agnes Baker

Description:
[reaction] When you reveal a chaos token, choose and discard 1 card from your hand: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token. (Limit once per test/ability.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If Wendy's Amulet is in play, you automatically succeed instead.
Name: Wendy Adams

Description: Roland Banks deck only. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +3 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Roland's .38 Special

Description: Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 3 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Cover Up

Description:
Daisy Walker deck only.
You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets.
Name: Daisy's Tote Bag

Description: Revelation - Put The Necronomicon into play in your threat area, with 3 horror on it. It cannot leave play while it has 1 or more horror on it. Treat each [elder_sign] you reveal on a chaos token as a [auto_fail]. [action]: Move 1 horror from The Necronomicon to Daisy Walker. Then, if The Necronomicon has no horror on it, discard it.
Name: The Necronomicon

Description:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only.
Fast. Play after your turn begins.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you.
Flavor: I ain't going to the pen a second time.
Name: On the Lam

Description: Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [free]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit twice per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 6 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.
Name: Hospital Debts

Description:
Agnes Baker deck only.
[reaction] After you play a [[Spell]] card: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: The etchings on its surface change from day to day, shifting and moving whenever I'm not looking.
Name: Heirloom of Hyperborea

Description: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. Forced - If Dark Memory is in your hand at the end of your turn, reveal it and take 2 horror.
Flavor: No... not again!
Name: Dark Memory

Description: Wendy Adams deck only. You may play the topmost event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.
Name: Wendy's Amulet

Description: Revelation - Take 2 direct horror and remove all cards in your discard pile from the game.
Flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
Name: Abandoned and Alone

Description: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: .45 Automatic

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Physical Training

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Discard Beat Cop: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator at your location.
Name: First Aid

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If the attacked enemy is the only enemy engaged with you, this attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: Cuts through vines, underbrush, and tentacles equally well.
Name: Machete

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.
Flavor: Fiercely loyal, these trained canines make for perfect companions.
Name: Guard Dog

Description:
Fast. Play after you defeat an enemy.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor: Just as I suspected!
Name: Evidence!

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack.
Name: Dodge

Description: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and to each investigator at the chosen location.
Name: Dynamite Blast

Description: If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: With a sickening smack, he struck the abomination over and over... until at last, it stopped moving.
Name: Vicious Blow

Description: Place 3 ammo tokens on a [[Firearm]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
Flavor: I've never met a beast that could outsmart a bullet.
Name: Extra Ammunition

Description:
You get +1 [willpower].
[free] While an investigator at your location is taking his or her turn, discard Police Badge: That investigator may take 2 additional actions this turn.
Name: Police Badge

Description:
You get +1 [combat].
[free] Exhaust Beat Cop and deal 1 damage to it: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
Name: Beat Cop

Description: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you succeed by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5). If you fail and would damage another investigator, this attack deals 1 damage for each point you fail by (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 5).
Name: Shotgun

Description:
Fast.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
Flavor: A lens into a world unseen can reveal things you wish it hadn't.
Name: Magnifying Glass

Description: [action] Exhaust Old Book of Lore: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches the top 3 cards of his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles the remaining cards into his or her deck.
Name: Old Book of Lore

Description: [reaction] After Research Librarian enters play: Search your deck for a [[Tome]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor: "There have been problems at the Orne Library, as we both know, given poor Armitage's condition, and the other, unrelated... incident of a few years ago..."
Name: Research Librarian

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you successfully investigate: Gain 1 resource.
Flavor: "While I truly believe that this nightmare is just a singular abomination, I must admit that I am exhilarated by the possibility that this is but one specimen of a new genus!"
Name: Dr. Milan Christopher

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hyperawareness

Description: [action] Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, heal 1 damage from that investigator. If you fail, deal 1 damage to that investigator.
Name: Medical Texts

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of the round, you may use your [intellect] in place of your [combat] and [agility].
Name: Mind over Matter

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Discover 1 clue at your location.
Name: Working a Hunch

Description: Attach to your location. Non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot move into attached location. Forced - When an investigator leaves attached location: Discard Barricade.
Name: Barricade

Description: If this skill test is successful while investigating a location, discover 1 additional clue at that location.
Flavor: I knew I had seen this symbol before. I must warn the others before it is too late!
Name: Deduction

Description:
Fast.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating.
[free] If there are no clues on your location: Return Magnifying Glass to your hand.
Flavor: A lens into a world unseen can reveal things you wish it hadn't.
Name: Magnifying Glass

Description: [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy spawns at your location, discard Disc of Itzamna: Discard that enemy.
Flavor: Do they fear it because of what it will do to them? Or, do they fear it because of what it will do to you?
Name: Disc of Itzamna

Description: [action] Exhaust Encyclopedia: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator gets +2 to a skill of your choice until the end of the phase.
Flavor: It's supposed to be comprehensive, but the more I search through its pages, the more I realize we know nothing about the real truths of the cosmos.
Name: Encyclopedia

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator draws 3 cards.
Name: Cryptic Research

Description: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Switchblade

Description: [action] Exhaust Burglary: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, gain 3 resources.
Name: Burglary

Description: [reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Pickpocketing: Draw 1 card.
Name: Pickpocketing

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: .41 Derringer

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn.
Flavor: "I was born in Mississippi. Louisiana just sounded better."
Name: Leo De Luca

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Hard Knocks

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to a revealed location with no enemies.
Name: Elusive

Description: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. This attack deals +2 damage.
Name: Backstab

Description: Deal 2 damage to an exhausted enemy at your location.
Name: Sneak Attack

Description:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
If you succeed by 3 or more, return Opportunist to your hand after this test instead of discarding it.
Name: Opportunist

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn.
Flavor: "I was born in Mississippi. Louisiana just sounded better."
Name: Leo De Luca

Description:
You get +1 [agility].
[action] Exhaust Cat Burglar: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to a connecting location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Cat Burglar

Description:
Fast. Play after you reveal a chaos token with a negative modifier.
Switch that token's "-" to a "+".
Name: Sure Gamble

Description: Gain 10 resources.
Flavor: "I win again! Sorry sugar, it's just not your night."
Name: Hot Streak

Description:
Uses (4 secrets). If Forbidden Knowledge has no secrets, discard it.
[free] Exhaust Forbidden Knowledge and take 1 horror: Move 1 secret from Forbidden Knowledge to your resource pool, as a resource.
Name: Forbidden Knowledge

Description: You get +1 [willpower].
Flavor: Whether focused through a mundane trinket or a mystical artifact, there is real power in faith all the same.
Name: Holy Rosary

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this check, take 1 horror.
Name: Shrivelling

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Exhaust Scrying and spend 1 charge: Look at the top 3 cards of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. Return them to the top of that deck in any order.
Name: Scrying

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Arcane Studies

Description: Forced - After Arcane Initiate enters play: Place 1 doom on it. [free] Exhaust Arcane Initiate: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.
Name: Arcane Initiate

Description: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, discover 2 clues at your location.
Flavor: "We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Call of Cthulhu"</cite>
Name: Drawn to the Flame

Description:
Fast. Play when you draw a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, take 1 horror.
Name: Ward of Protection

Description: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn.
Name: Blinding Light

Description: If this skill test is successful, heal 1 horror.
Flavor: Only by standing firm against the darkness can we live to see the light of another day.
Name: Fearless

Description:
Fast. Play after a phase begins.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the end of the phase.
Name: Mind Wipe

Description: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn and take 1 horror.
Name: Blinding Light

Description:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
[action] Exhaust Book of Shadows: Add 1 charge to a [[Spell]] asset you control.
Name: Book of Shadows

Description:
Uses (4 charges). If Grotesque Statue has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, spend 1 charge: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 1 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.
Name: Grotesque Statue

Flavor: The coat was not the most fashionable choice, but it did feel warm and reassuring in its bulk.
Name: Leather Coat

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate by 2 or more, exhaust Scavenging: Choose an [[Item]] card in your discard pile and add it to your hand.
Name: Scavenging

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, discard Baseball Bat after the attack resolves.
Name: Baseball Bat

Description: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.
Flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldn't say that's true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
Name: Rabbit's Foot

Description: [free] Discard Stray Cat: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.
Flavor: He never came if you called for him. It always seemed like he had his own agenda.
Name: Stray Cat

Description:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Dig Deep

Description: Evade. Automatically evade all enemies at your location.
Flavor: That should buy us some time.
Name: Cunning Distraction

Description:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.
Name: "Look what I found!"

Description:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test.
Name: Lucky!

Description: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, the evading investigator may immediately disengage from each other enemy engaged with him or her, and may move to a connecting location.
Name: Survival Instinct

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, exhaust Aquinnah and deal 1 horror to her: Deal that enemy's damage to another enemy at your location, instead. (You still take horror dealt by the attack.)
Flavor: "Do not be frightened by what you see. Be frightened by what you cannot see."
Name: Aquinnah

Description:
Fast. Play after a non-weakness, non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location is evaded.
Shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck.
Name: Close Call

Description:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test. Draw 1 card.
Name: Lucky!

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, do not reveal chaos tokens for any skill tests you perform.
Name: Will to Survive

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Knife: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Knife

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation.
Name: Flashlight

Description: Gain 3 resources.
Flavor: You can never be too prepared.
Name: Emergency Cache

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Stay back! I'll handle this.
Name: Guts

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: At last, I've found it!
Name: Perception

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Die, you beast!
Name: Overpower

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.
Flavor: Too easy.
Name: Manual Dexterity

Description: Max 1 committed per skill test.
Flavor: Sometimes, the most selfless acts can come from the strangest places
Name: Unexpected Courage

Flavor: Bullets are one thing... twelve-inch fangs quite another.
Name: Bulletproof Vest

Flavor: This has been in my family for generations. Take care of it, and it will take care of you.
Name: Elder Sign Amulet

Description: Revelation - Choose and discard all but 1 card from your hand.
Flavor: Wait... where am I? What was I doing?
Name: Amnesia

Description: Revelation - Discard all your resources.
Flavor: What was that noise?
Name: Paranoia

Description: Revelation - Add Haunted to your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills. [action] [action]: Discard Haunted.
Name: Haunted

Description: Revelation - Add Psychosis to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more horror: Take 1 direct damage. [action] [action]: Discard Psychosis.
Name: Psychosis

Description: Revelation - Add Hypochondria to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more damage: Take 1 direct horror. [action] [action]: Discard Hypochondria.
Name: Hypochondria

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. [action] Spend 4 resources: Parley. Discard Mob Enforcer.
Flavor: You knew you shouldn't have borrowed money from the O'Bannion gang. It seems like they're always looking to collect at the worst times.
Name: Mob Enforcer

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. Forced - After Silver Twilight Acolyte attacks: Place 1 doom on the current agenda.
Flavor: You'll never forget the day you learned the true secret of the Silver Twilight Lodge's inner circle. The truth is too terrible for the Lodge to let you live.
Name: Silver Twilight Acolyte

Description: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. While Stubborn Detective is at your location, treat your investigator as if his or her printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Flavor: Despite everything, he still won't believe you had nothing to do with those murders.
Name: Stubborn Detective

Description:
Uses (4 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset in your location.
Name: First Aid

Description:
Fast. Play when you are dealt damage and/or horror.
Cancel up to 5 damage and/or horror just dealt to you. Then, gain that many resources.
Name: "I've had worse"

Description: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.
Flavor: Some people need to know the truth at any cost. Some truths can cut like knives.
Name: Seeking Answers

Description:
Uses (2 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Old Book of Lore: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches the top 3 cards of their deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles their deck. Then, you may spend 1 secret to have that investigator immediately play that card, reducing its cost by 2.
Name: Old Book of Lore

Description: Uses (3 supplies). If Lockpicks has no supplies, discard it. [action] Exhaust Lockpicks: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 supply from Lockpicks.
Name: Lockpicks

Description: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. Once per turn, if you succeed by 3 or more, you may take an additional action this turn.
Name: .41 Derringer

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +2 [willpower] for this test. If you succeed you discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, after this test resolves lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.
Name: Rite of Seeking

Description:
Uses (3 charges).
[free] Exhaust Scrying and spend 1 charge: Look at the top 3 cards of any investigator's deck, or the encounter deck. Return them to the top of that deck, in any order. If a [[Terror]] or [[Omen]] card is among the looked-at cards, take 1 horror.
Name: Scrying

Description: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, exhaust Aquinnah and deal 1 horror to her: Deal that enemy's damage to any enemy at your location, instead. (You still take horror dealt by the attack.)
Flavor:
"Do not be frightened by what you see.
Be frightened by what you cannot see."
Name: Aquinnah

Description:
Fast. Play when you reveal a chaos token that would reduce your skill value to 0 during a skill test (including the [auto_fail] token).
Cancel that token and treat it as an [elder_sign] token, instead.
Name: Eucatastrophe

Description: Gain 3 resources and draw 1 card.
Flavor: You can never be too prepared.
Name: Emergency Cache

Description:
Permanent.
You have 1 additional ally slot.
Flavor: When you turn on the charm, it could light the entire town.
Name: Charisma

Description:
Permanent.
You have 1 additional accessory slot.
Flavor: No stone unturned, no ancient treasure left behind.
Name: Relic Hunter

Description:
During setup, add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
[reaction] When the round ends: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you succeed, add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.
Flavor: "The Lord watches over my path. I am armored in faith."
Name: Sister Mary

Description: Forced - At the start of the investigation phase: Draw 1 card. Discard the card beneath Amanda Sharpe. Choose a card from your hand and place it beneath her. Forced - At the start of a skill test you are performing: Commit the card beneath Amanda Sharpe, if able. Do not discard it when the test ends. [elder_sign] effect: +0. For this test, you may double the number of skill icons on the card beneath Amanda Sharpe.
Name: Amanda Sharpe

Description:
[reaction] After you discover 1 or more clues at a location with an enemy: Either discover 1 additional clue at that location, or automatically evade that enemy. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If this is an investigation, you may choose any revealed location; you are now investigating as if you were at that location instead.
Name: Trish Scarborough

Description:
[free] During your turn, discard an asset you control: Play an asset with a different title from your hand, reducing its cost by 1. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may return an asset from your play area to your hand. Then, draw 1 card.
Flavor: "Do you want to see true magic?"
Name: Dexter Drake

Description:
[reaction] After you reveal a chaos token during a skill test you are performing: Return a skill you committed to this test to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may commit a skill from your discard pile to this test. After this test ends, return that skill to your hand instead of discarding it.
Flavor: "Leave your fears on the docks, lads."
Name: Silas Marsh

Description:
Sister Mary deck only.
Guardian Angel may be assigned damage dealt to other investigators at your location and connecting locations.
[reaction] When any amount of damage is assigned to Guardian Angel: Add that many [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Guardian Angel

Description: Revelation - For each [bless] token in the chaos bag, you must either replace it with a [curse] token or take 1 horror.
Name: Crisis of Faith

Description:
Amanda Sharpe deck only.
Fast. Play when you initiate a skill test.
Return the card beneath Amanda Sharpe to your hand and place Obscure Studies beneath her.
Name: Obscure Studies

Description: This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. Forced - When choosing a card to place beneath Amanda Sharpe, if Whispers from the Deep is in your hand: You must choose it.
Name: Whispers from the Deep

Description:
Trish Scarborough deck only.
Fast. Play after your turn begins.
Disengage from each enemy engaged with you. Until the end of the round, enemies cannot engage you and you cannot deal damage to enemies.
Name: In the Shadows

Description: Prey - Trish Scarborough only. Hunter. While Shadow Agents is engaged with you, you cannot discover clues except by investigating. Forced - After Shadow Agents is evaded: Discard it.
Name: Shadow Agents

Description:
Dexter Drake deck only.
[reaction] After an asset enters play under your control: Until the end of the round, you get +2 to each of your skills while resolving a triggered ability on that asset.
Name: Showmanship

Description:
Occult Scraps cannot be played using a play action.
While Occult Scraps is in your hand, you get -2 [willpower].
While Occult Scraps is in play, you get -1 [willpower].
Name: Occult Scraps

Description: Silas Marsh deck only. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you committed 1 or more skills to this skill test, this attack deals +1 damage. When this skill test ends, you may return Sea Change Harpoon to your hand to return all of your committed skill cards to your hand instead of discarding them.
Name: Sea Change Harpoon

Description: Silas Marsh deck only. [action]: Evade. You get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed and you committed 1 or more skills to this skill test, you may automatically evade another enemy engaged with you. When this skill test ends, you may return Silas's Net to your hand to return all of your committed skill cards to your hand instead of discarding them.
Name: Silas's Net

Description: Revelation - Put Siren Call into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to commmit 1 or more cards to a skill test, you must pay 1 resource for each matching skill icon those cards have. [action] [action]: Discard Siren Call.
Name: Siren Call

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location. Add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Book of Psalms

Description: [action] If Blessed Blade is ready: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If a [bless] or [elder_sign] token is revealed during this attack, this attack deals +1 damage. Before revealing chaos token(s) for this attack, you may exhaust Blessed Blade to add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.
Name: Blessed Blade

Description:
Seal (up to 5 [bless]). If Rite of Sanctification has no tokens sealed on it, discard it.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location plays a card, exhaust Rite of Sanctification and release a chaos token sealed on it: Reduce the cost of that card by 2.
Name: Rite of Sanctification

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, add [bless] tokens to the chaos bag equal to the attacking enemy's total combined damage and horror values.
Name: Hand of Fate

Description: Uses (3 secrets). [fast] Exhaust Cryptographic Cipher and spend 1 secret: Investigate. Your location gets +1 shroud for this investigation. [action] Exhaust Cryptographic Cipher and spend 1 secret: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation.
Name: Cryptographic Cipher

Description:
[action]: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[action] If there are 10 [curse] tokens in the chaos bag, discard Cryptic Grimoire: Record in your Campaign Log that "you have translated the grimoire." Replace 5 [curse] tokens in the chaos bag with 5 [bless] tokens.
Name: Cryptic Grimoire

Description: As an additional cost to play Deep Knowledge, add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. Investigators at your location draw a combined total of 3 cards (you decide how many cards each investigator draws).
Name: Deep Knowledge

Description:
If this skill test is during or before the first action of this turn, Plan of Action gains [willpower] [agility].
If this skill test is between the first and third actions of this turn, draw 1 card if it succeeds.
If this skill test is during or after the third action of this turn, Plan of Action gains [combat] [intellect].
Name: Plan of Action

Description: Fast. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. If the attacked enemy is exhausted, you get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: .25 Automatic

Description: Seal (up to 5 [curse]). Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: You must either spend 1 resource or discard Dark Ritual.
Name: Dark Ritual

Description:
Fast. Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against you, spend 1 charge: Cancel that attack.
Flavor: "Now you see me..."
Name: Obfuscation

Description:
As an additional cost to play Faustian Bargain, add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
Investigators at your location gain a total of 5 resources, distributed as you wish.
Name: Faustian Bargain

Description: Playing Sword Cane does not provoke attacks of opportunity. [reaction] After Sword Cane enters play: Immediately trigger its "[action]" ability without paying its cost. [action] Exhaust Sword Cane: Fight/Evade. You may use your [willpower] in place of your [combat] or [agility] for this attack or evasion attempt.
Name: Sword Cane

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window, or at the start of the round.
Replace all [curse] tokens in the chaos bag with an equal number of [bless] tokens. At the end of the round, replace all [bless] tokens in the chaos bag with an equal number of [curse] tokens.
Name: Tides of Fate

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Reveal 5 random chaos tokens from the chaos bag.
If a [bless] or [elder_sign] token is revealed, cancel that treachery card's revelation effect.
Name: Ward of Radiance

Description: After you commit Promise of Power to a skill test, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. If you cannot, take 2 horror instead.
Name: Promise of Power

Description: [reaction] After a skill test ends in which 1 or more [curse] or [auto_fail] tokens were revealed, exhaust Token of Faith: Add that many [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Token of Faith

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Add 4 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.
Name: Keep Faith

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Predestined to any type of test.
If this test fails, either add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag or remove 2 [curse] tokens from the chaos bag.
Name: Predestined

Description: If a [bless] token is revealed during this test, you may remove Beloved from the game to replace that token's effects with the following: "You automatically succeed. (Do not reveal another token. Return this token to the chaos bag after this test ends)."
Flavor: Love is perhaps the strongest spell of all.
Name: Beloved

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Add 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. Then, add 3 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag and draw 1 card.
Name: Tempt Fate

Description: Spawn - Location farthest from you. Aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
Name: Accursed Follower

Description: Revelation - Add 5 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
Flavor:
We all have wings, but they have not been of any avail to us and if we could tear them off, we would do so.
 - Franz Kafka, "The Blue Octavo Notebooks"
Name: Dread Curse

Description: Revelation - Attach Day of Reckoning to the current agenda. Then, search the chaos bag for an [elder_sign] token and seal it on Day of Reckoning. Card design inspired by the events of Arkham Nights 2018.
Name: Day of Reckoning

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-2 instead if your location is partially flooded; -3 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail and your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail and you control a key, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail and The Amalgam is in the depths, put it into play engaged with you.
Name: The Pit of Despair

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Flavor: A salmon lays dead on the ground nearby, its scaly flesh just starting to rot. You can tell from the kelp and the dripping-wet walls that this cavern was underwater not too long ago. How much time do you have before high tide?
Name: Awakening

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Flavor: Your every movement is coupled with the loud swashing of rippling water all around you. If the tide continues to rise, the cavern will be completely submerged in a matter of hours.
Name: The Water Rises

Description: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.
Flavor: Save for a few rocky perches, the entire cavern system is submerged in seawater. You have to find a way out of here, and soon...
Name: Sacrifice for the Deep

Flavor: You have awakened in a waterlogged cavern, your mind robbed of its memories... and you are not alone. Whatever else lives in this cavern, it can't possibly be friendly. You have to get out of this place and back to civilization.
Name: The Pit

Description: Forced - After a location is revealed: Put locations from the top of the Tidal Tunnel deck into play below, to the left, and to the right of that location. Objective - There must be a way out of here somewhere. If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: What in the hell is this place, and why have you been trapped here? You have to find a way out, but more of your memories might be tucked away in this pit...
Name: The Escape

Description: Forced - After Unfamiliar Chamber is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Unfamiliar Chamber without looking at it.
Name: Unfamiliar Chamber

Description: For each key controlled by an investigator at Bone-Ridden Pit, it gets -1 shroud. [free] If there are no clues on Bone-Ridden Pit and you control the yellow key: You notice an odd joint socket near the skeleton's midsection that matches the shape of the yellow key. Read Flashback II in the Campaign Guide.
Name: Bone-Ridden Pit

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at Fish Graveyard, if you do not control a key: Take 1 horror. [free] If there are no clues on Fish Graveyard and you control the red key: Inside a pile of half-rotten fish guts, you find a strange figurine the red key fits into perfectly. Read Flashback III in the Campaign Guide.
Name: Fish Graveyard

Description: [action] If investigators at Altar to Dagon control the blue key or three or more other keys, they may spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Take control of the set-aside green key.
Name: Altar to Dagon

Description: Forced - After Idol Chamber is revealed: Place the set-aside blue key on it. [free] If there are no clues on Idol Chamber and you control the purple key: The purple key opens the stone door at the far end of the chamber, revealing a shrine with two familiar statues, one of white marble, the other of onyx. Read Flashback IV in the Campaign Guide.
Name: Idol Chamber

Description: [action] If an investigator at Sealed Exit controls the green key: Resign. You unlock the grate and swim through the tunnel to freedom. Return all of your clues to the token pool and place all of your keys on this location when you resign. Forced - After Sealed Exit is revealed: It becomes fully flooded.
Name: Sealed Exit

Description: Hunter. [reaction] After you successfully evade The Amalgam by 2 or more: Take control of 1 key on it. Forced - After The Amalgam engages you, if you control a key: Either place 1 of your keys on it, or it attacks you. Forced - When The Amalgam is defeated: Place it in the depths.
Name: The Amalgam

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail and The Amalgam... - ...is in play, it readies, moves directly to your location, engages you, and makes an immediate attack. - ...is in the depths, put it into play engaged with you. It makes an immediate attack.
Name: Blindsense

Description: Revelation - If The Amalgam is in the depths, put it into play engaged with you. Otherwise, place The Amalgam in the depths and From the Depths gains surge.
Name: From the Depths

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current agenda number.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
Name: The Vanishing of Elina Harper

Description: Forced - If you defeat a [[Suspect]] enemy other than the kidnapper: Take control of each clue on that enemy. Record in your Campaign Log (name of enemy) is out for blood.
Flavor: "Furtiveness and secretiveness seemed universal in this hushed city of alienage and death, and I could not escape the sensation of being watched from ambush on every hand by sly, staring eyes that never shut." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Decrepit Decay

Description: Forced - If you defeat a [[Suspect]] enemy other than the kidnapper: Take control of each clue on that enemy. Record in your Campaign Log (name of enemy) is out for blood. (Hint: If you do not make an accusation by the time this agenda advances, you will run out of time!)
Flavor: "Just how fully the pursuit was organised - and indeed, just what its purpose might be - I could form no idea." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Growing Suspicion

Description: Forced - If you defeat a [[Suspect]] enemy other than the kidnapper: Take control of each clue on that enemy. Record in your Campaign Log (name of enemy) is out for blood.
Flavor: "My frantic running ceased before I had covered a block, for at my left I began to hear something like the hue and cry of organised pursuit. There were footsteps and guttural sounds, and a rattling motor wheezed south along Federal Street." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Frantic Pursuit

Description: [free] The investigators spend X [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Parley. Reveal the top X cards of the Leads deck (to a maximum of 3) and draw 1 of them. Shuffle the rest back into the Leads deck, along with the top card of the encounter deck. (Group limit once per round.) Objective - You may advance at the end of any round.(Hint: You will have to make an accusation when you advance. Advance when you believe you have narrowed down Agent Harper's kidnapper and whereabouts.)
Flavor: The next morning, you and Agent Dawson split up and search for his missing agent...
Name: The Search for Agent Harper

Description: The kidnapper loses aloof, gets +1 [per_investigator] health, and cannot be parleyed with. Objective - If either the kidnapper is in the victory display, or there are no clues on Elina Harper's location, advance (if there are 2 or more investigators in the game, both conditions must be fulfilled, instead).
Flavor: All of your evidence leads here. You must rescue Agent Harper at all costs!
Name: The Rescue

Description: Possible Suspects Brian Burnham Othera Gilman Joyce Little Barnabas Marsh Zadok Allen Robert Friendly Possible Hideouts Innsmouth Jail Shoreward Slums Sawbone Alley The House on Water Street Esoteric Order of Dagon New Church Green
Name: Finding Agent Harper

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [combat].
[reaction] After an enemy attacks an investigator at your location, even if the attack was canceled, exhaust Thomas Dawson: That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Thomas Dawson

Description: [action] [action]: Draw 4 cards. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: "That refinery, though, used to be a big thing, and Old Man Marsh, who owns it, must be richer'n Croesus." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Marsh Refinery

Description: [action]: Heal 2 damage or 2 horror (or any combination thereof). (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: "Some of the windows on the Gilman House side were faintly glowing, and I thought I heard confused sounds within." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Gilman House

Description: [action]: Resign. You decide to lay low for a while. [free] Spend 2 resources: Move. Move to a connecting [[Innsmouth]] location.
Flavor: "I did not need to be told that this was the civic centre of Innsmouth." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Innsmouth Square

Description: Forced - After you successfully investigate Innsmouth Harbour by 3 or more: Look at the top card of the Leads deck. Then, shuffle the Leads deck. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: "...just try to fish there yourself and see how the folks chase you off!" - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Innsmouth Harbour

Description: [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)
Name: First National Grocery

Description: [action] [action]: Gain 4 resources. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: "The Fish Street bridge, according to the sketch, was in ruins." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Fish Street Bridge

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating The Little Bookshop: Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
Name: The Little Bookshop

Description: Revelation - Put Esoteric Order of Dagon into play. Forced - After the last remaining clue is discovered from Esoteric Order of Dagon: Remove the top card of the Leads deck from the game (without looking at it).
Flavor: "This, then, was the former Masonic Hall now given over to a degraded cult." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Esoteric Order of Dagon

Description: Revelation - Put Sawbone Alley into play. Each [[Humanoid]] enemy at Sawbone Alley gets +2 fight and -2 evade.
Flavor: "It would be well not to make oneself too conspicuous in such neighbourhoods..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: Sawbone Alley

Description: Revelation - Put Shoreward Slums into play. Shoreward Slums gets -2 shroud for each doom on it. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Shoreward Slums: Place 1 doom on it.
Name: Shoreward Slums

Description: Revelation- Put The House on Water Street into play. Forced - After you successfully investigate The House on Water Street by 3 or more: Either draw the top card of the encounter deck, or shuffle that card into the Leads deck.
Flavor: "Not a living thing did I see, except for the scattered fishermen..." - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: The House on Water Street

Description: Revelation - Put Innsmouth Jail into play. Forced - When you defeat an enemy at Innsmouth Jail: Instead of discarding that enemy, shuffle it into the Leads deck.
Name: Innsmouth Jail

Description: Revelation - Put New Church Green into play. [action] [action] If there are no clues on New Church Green: Look at the top card of the Leads deck. If it does not have Victory X, discard it. (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: "Their creeds were heterodox and mysterious..."- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Shadow over Innsmouth</u>
Name: New Church Green

Description: Revelation - Put Robert Friendly into play at the Innsmouth Harbour, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Robert Friendly. Then, if there are no clues on him, add him to the victory display.
Name: Robert Friendly

Description: Revelation - Put Zadok Allen into play at the Fish Street Bridge, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Zadok Allen. Then, if there are no clues on him, add him to the victory display.
Name: Zadok Allen

Description: Revelation - Put Brian Burnham into play at the First National Grocery, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. Aloof. [action] Discard cards from your hand with at least 3 total skill icons among them: Parley. Take control of 1 of the clues on Brian Burnham. Then, if there are no clues on him, add him to the victory display.
Name: Brian Burnham

Description: Revelation - Put Barnabas Marsh into play at the Marsh Refinery, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 1 horror. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Barnabas Marsh. Then, if there are no clues on him, add him to the victory display.
Name: Barnabas Marsh

Description: Revelation - Put Joyce Little into play at The Little Bookshop, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on her. Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Joyce Little. Then, if there are no clues on her, add her to the victory display.
Name: Joyce Little

Description: Revelation - Put Othera Gilman into play at the Gilman House, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on her. Aloof. [action] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Take control of 1 of the clues on Othera Gilman. Then, if there are no clues on her, add her to the victory display.
Name: Othera Gilman

Description:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [combat].
[reaction] After an enemy attacks an investigator at your location, even if the attack was canceled, exhaust Thomas Dawson: That investigator draws 1 card.
Name: Thomas Dawson

Description:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility].
The first action you perform each turn does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Elina Harper

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - When Priest of Dagon would be defeated or evaded, if there is no doom on it: Instead, heal all damage from it, ready it, and place 1 doom on it. Forced - At the end of the round, if Priest of Dagon is ready and there is no doom on it: Place 1 doom on it.
Name: Priest of Dagon

Description: Spawn - Any empty location. While Initiate of Dagon has no doom on it, it gets +2 fight and +2 evade. Forced - At the end of the round, if Initiate of Dagon is ready and there is no doom on it: Place 1 doom on it.
Name: Initiate of Dagon

Description: Prey - Fewest cards in hand. Aloof. Hunter. While an investigator at Lloigor's location has no cards in hand, Lloigor loses aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Lloigor's location or a connecting location discards 1 random card from their hand.
Name: Lloigor

Description: Revelation - If you have no cards in your hand, Psychic Pull gains surge. Otherwise, discard 1 random card from your hand. Then, test [willpower] (X), where X is the printed cost of the discarded card. If you fail, lose 1 action.
Name: Psychic Pull

Description: Forced - After Deep One Bull engages you: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand. Forced - After an investigator defeats another [[Deep One]] enemy at any location: Ready Deep One Bull and move it once toward that investigator's location.
Name: Deep One Bull

Description: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - After Lurking Deep One engages you: Take 1 damage.
Name: Lurking Deep One

Description: Revelation - Disengage from each [[Deep One]] enemy at your location. Each [[Deep One]] enemy at your location and each connecting location engages you. If no enemies engage you from this effect, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Deep One]] enemy, spawn it engaged with you, and shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Deep One Assault

Description: Revelation - If your location is unflooded, Undertow gains surge. Otherwise, put Undertow into play in your threat area. Forced - After you move: Take 2 damage and 2 horror. Discard Undertow. [free] Discard 1 card from your hand: Test [combat] (3) or [agility] (3) to fight the pull of the tides. If you succeed, discard Undertow.
Name: Undertow

Description: Revelation - Increase the flood level of the nearest location that can have its flood level increased. If no location's flood level is increased by this effect, Rising Tides gains surge.
Name: Rising Tides

Description: Revelation - If your location is unflooded, Riptide gains surge. Otherwise, test [agility] (3) (4 instead if your location is fully flooded). If you fail, choose and discard 1 asset you control. If you cannot, lose 1 resource for each point you fail by instead.
Name: Riptide

Description:
Hunter.
X is the shroud value of Winged One's location.
Winged One takes 1 fewer damage from attacks except by [[Ranged]], [[Firearm]], or [[Spell]] cards (to a minimum of 1 damage).
Name: Winged One

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, either take 1 horror or put Fog over Innsmouth into play next to the agenda deck. If you fail, do both. Each location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Fog over Innsmouth from play. (Max once per round.)
Name: Fog over Innsmouth

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you reveal a [cultist] token during this test, you automatically fail. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Name: Macabre Memento

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you reveal a [tablet] token during this test, you automatically fail. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Name: Fractured Consciousness

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4) or [intellect] (4). If you reveal a [elder_thing] token during this test, you automatically fail. For each point you fail by, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Name: Memory of Oblivion

Description: Revelation - Attach to the nearest [[Vehicle]] story asset. "[action]" abilities on attached asset cannot be triggered. [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Malfunction.
Flavor: "Get this damned thing working again, or we ain't going anywhere!"
Name: Malfunction

Description: Peril. Revelation - Choose a location where there is at least 1 investigator. Increase that location's flood level. Each investigator at the chosen location takes 1 damage. If the chosen location's flood level is not increased by this effect, Tidal Alignment gains surge.
Name: Tidal Alignment

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Each investigator loses 3 resources. - Each investigator takes 2 horror. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect can cause the current agenda to advance).
Name: Syzygy

Description: [action]: Move. Move from Underwater Cavern to any flooded [[Cave]] location. Forced - After Underwater Cavern is revealed: It becomes fully flooded.
Name: Underwater Cavern

Description: Tidal Pool gets +1 shroud while it is partially flooded and +2 shroud while it is fully flooded. Forced - After Tidal Pool is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Tidal Pool without looking at it.
Name: Tidal Pool

Description: Underground River cannot be fully flooded. Forced - After Underground River is revealed: Increase its flood level.
Name: Underground River

Description: Spawn - Location with the most clues. Hunter. [action] Place 1 of your clues on your location: Parley. Exhaust Innsmouth Troublemaker. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase. This ability may be triggered by an investigator at a connecting location.
Name: Innsmouth Troublemaker

Description: Revelation - Put Innsmouth Look into play in your threat area. You get -1 [intellect] and -1 sanity, and you gain the [[Deep One]] trait. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Innsmouth Look.
Name: Innsmouth Look

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, either take 1 damage or put Furtive Locals into play next to the agenda deck. If you fail, do both. Investigators cannot parley. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Furtive Locals from play. (Max once per round.)
Name: Furtive Locals

Description: You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to engage.
Flavor: "If you blow that thing one more time, I'm gonna make you eat it."
Name: Riot Whistle

Description: Engage. Choose an enemy up to 2 locations away. Move (one location at a time) to that enemy's location, engage it, and add [bless] tokens to the chaos bag equal to that enemy's horror value.
Flavor: Lita narrowed her eyes and tightened her grip. They wouldn't get away. Not this time. Not ever again.
Name: Righteous Hunt

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] After an investigator at any location performs the "reveal chaos token" step of a skill test, exhaust Sacred Covenant: Return any number of [bless] tokens revealed during this test to the chaos bag, ignoring their modifiers for this test.
Name: Sacred Covenant

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[fast]: Exhaust Eldritch Sophist: Move 1 secret or charge from an asset you control to another asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
Flavor: Once you let go of your assumptions, anything is possible
Name: Eldritch Sophist

Description:
As an additional cost to play Stirring Up Trouble, add [curse] tokens to the chaos bag equal to your location's shroud value.
Discover 2 clues at your location.
Flavor: When you start following a thread, it's hard to say what you'll find at the other end.
Name: Stirring Up Trouble

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [curse] token during a skill test, exhaust Blasphemous Covenant: Treat that token's modifier as +1 instead of its normal modifier. After this test ends, return that token to the chaos bag.
Name: Blasphemous Covenant

Description: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may automatically evade an enemy at this location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: If you're careful, it's just "entering."
Name: Breaking and Entering

Description: During this skill test, treat the modifier of each [bless] and each [curse] token as +1 instead of its normal modifier.
Flavor: "Oh, hooey. What's the worst that could happen?"
Name: Skeptic

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [curse] token during a skill test, exhaust False Covenant: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the token pool, and reveal another token.
Name: False Covenant
