Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot play more than 2 cards each round. [reaction] When you play an [[Insight]] or [[Tactic]] event, exhaust this Directive: That event gains fast.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot voluntarily assign damage or horror to [[Ally]] assets. You have 1 additional ally slot.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - When your location has 1 or more clues, you cannot commit cards to skill tests unless you have discovered a clue this round. [reaction] After you discover a clue, if an enemy is at your location, exhaust this Directive: Draw 1 card.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot move more than twice each round. You get +3 sanity.
Name: Directive

Description: Roland Banks deck only. Advanced. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +4 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy and there are no clues on your location, place 1 ammo on Roland's .38 Special
Name: Roland's .38 Special

Description: Advanced. Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 4 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.
Name: Cover Up

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display, to a maximum of 5.
[cultist]: -2. If a [[Cultist]] enemy is engaged with you, reveal an additional chaos token.
[tablet]: -3. Ready each [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, Roland Banks takes 1 damage.
Name: By the Book

Description: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.
Flavor: Mr. Grey is a powerful man with a lot of friends. Getting him behind bars is going to be tricky.
Name: A Covert Conspiracy

Description: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.
Flavor: Your superiors are pressuring you to drop your investigation. Mr. Grey's influence, no doubt. Meanwhile, he and his lackies are doing everything in their power to quietly remove you from the equation, once and for all.
Name: Your Deadline Nears

Description: [fast] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigators] clues, as a group: Flip over a facedown conspirator at your location and put it into play engaged with you. [fast] Spend 1 resource: Exhaust a [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you (it remains engaged). Only Roland Banks may trigger this ability.] Objective - Parley with as many conspirators as you can. If 10 [[Cultist]] enemies are in the victory display, advance.
Flavor: Taking down the culprits behind the sacrifices can only be done with proof, in a court of law. You'll have to do this fair and square.
Name: Capture the Conspirators

Description: Arkham Police Station is connected to Rivertown, Downtown, and Easttown, and vice versa. [fast]: Move to a connecting location. [fast] Choose a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy at this location and spend clues equal to its remaining health: Parley. Add that enemy to the victory display.
Name: Arkham Police Station

Description:
Each asset you control with health gets +1 health.
Each asset you control with sanity gets +1 sanity.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Star  XVII is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Star  XVII

Description: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Soothing Melody: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Hallowed Mirror enter play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.
Name: Hallowed Mirror

Description:
[fast] If you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust The World  XXI: Draw 1 card.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The World  XXI is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The World  XXI

Description: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Blood-Rite: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.
Name: Occult Lexicon

Description:
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test: You get +1 skill value for this test. You may discard Knight of Swords to get +3 instead.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Knight of Swords is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Knight of Swords

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] Exhaust Well Connected: You get +1 skill value for this skill test for every 4 resources you have.
[fast] Spend 2 resources: Ready Well Connected. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Well Connected

Description:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up accessory slots, and vice versa.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Hierophant  V is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Hierophant  V

Description: Fast. You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset. [reaction] After you activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset, exhaust Sign Magick: Activate an [action] ability on a different [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control (without paying its [action] cost).
Name: Sign Magick

Description:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness encounter card, exhaust Nine of Rods: Cancel all of that card's effects and shuffle it into the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Nine of Rods is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Nine of Rods

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, set the base value of each of your skills to 5, or the base value of one of your skills to 7.
Flavor: You never really know what you are capable of until something is trying to eat you.
Name: Trial by Fire

Description:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Fool  0: Reduce that card's cost by 1.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Fool  0 is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: The Fool  0

Description:
You have 1 additional tarot slot.
Each non-weakness [[Tarot]] asset in your hand or committed to a skill test gains [wild] [wild].
[reaction] When the game begins, if Moon Pendant is in your opening hand: Put it into play.
Name: Moon Pendant

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator.
Before setting up each game, draw 3 random cards from the tarot deck and choose 1. Place the chosen card in front of you, in the upright position. Each other investigator ignores its effects. Shuffle the rest back into the tarot deck.
Name: Observed

Description:
Permanent.
Before setting up each game, draw a random card from the tarot deck and place the chosen card in front of you, in the reverse position. Each other investigator ignores its effects.
Name: Damned

Description: You cannot play assets other than The Devil XV while it is in your hand. If The Devil XV is drawn in your opening hand during setup (before or after taking a mulligan), you cannot replace it. It must stay in your opening hand.
Name: The Devil  XV

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Witching Hour shown here. - Remove Arkham Woods (Quiet Glade) from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Witching Hour

Description: Objective - "Perhaps we can learn more from them..." If there are more than 1 [per_investigator] exhausted [[Witch]] enemies at the Witches' Circle, investigators at the Witches' Circle may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: For what purpose have these people gathered? Are they the cause of the disturbances in these woods? And if so, what is their true goal?
Name: A Circle Unbroken

Description: [free] Take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror: Choose an investigator at a different Witch-Haunted Woods. That investigator heals 1 damage and 1 horror. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Witch-Haunted Woods

Description: Forced - When you discover the last clue from this location: Draw the topmost [[Hex]] treachery in the encounter discard pile. (If you cannot, instead discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Hex]] treachery is discarded, and draw it.)
Name: Witch-Haunted Woods

Description: During the "enemy attacks" step of the enemy phase, instead of their standard attack, each ready [[Witch]] enemy at this location attacks each investigator in play. Attacks made in this way do not cause the enemy to exhaust.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: While you are at this location, you cannot cancel or ignore card or game effects, and each encounter card you draw gains peril.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Forced - After you successfully investigate this location: Discard 1 card from the top of the encounter deck for each point you succeeded by. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Each investigator at this location takes 2 damage.
Name: Arkham Woods

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to At Death's Doorstep shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to At Death's Doorstep

Description: Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to speak with the Senator. If you succeed, either take control of 1 of his clues, or flip 1 doom on him to its clue side. If you fail, flip one of his clues to its doom side.
Flavor: "Change is what the people demand, and change is what I aim to give them!"
Name: Senator Nathaniel Rhodes

Description: Spawn - The location with no other [[Silver Twilight]] enemies farthest from you. Forced - After Dmitri Konstantinov enters play: Place 2 doom on him. [reaction] After you evade Dmitri Konstantinov: For every 2 points you succeeded by, remove 1 doom from him.
Flavor: "Do you understand who you are meddling with?"
Name: Dmitri Konstantinov

Description: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [action]: You disturb the tranquility of this quiet place in search of evidence. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Monster]] enemy is discarded. Set that enemy aside, out of play. Then gain 2 clues (from the token pool). (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Wine Cellar

Description: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [reaction] After you successfully investigate the Wine Cellar: Either discover 1 additional clue, or remove 1 doom from a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play. Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play, or take 1 direct horror.
Name: Wine Cellar

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Secret Name shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Secret Name

Description: Forced - After you reveal Temple of R'lyeh: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. If you fail by 3 or more, that card gains surge.
Name: Temple of R'lyeh

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (5) to topple the strange, eldritch statue. If you succeed, remove 1 doom from Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.) Haunted - Place 1 doom on Nahab (even if she is out of play).
Name: The Price Manor

Description: [action]: Investigate. Investigate using [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, after discovering clues, you may move to any [[Extradimensional]] location. Haunted - You cannot leave The 9th Ward this round. During your turn, reduce the shroud value of The 9th Ward by 1.
Name: The 9th Ward

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (5) to search the library for arcane lore. If you succeed, deal 3 damage to Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.)
Name: Library of Ebla

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Wages of Sin shown here. - Set the Erynn MacAoidh story asset aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to The Wages of Sin

Description: Locations cannot be flipped to their [[Spectral]] side.
Flavor: You have come to Hangman's Hill to investigate reports over the last few nights of ghost sightings and strange activities in the woods. The witch named Erynn told you to meet her here...but for what purpose?
Name: In Pursuit of Answers

Description: [reaction] When you would "banish" a ghost: You may instead place it beneath Erynn MacAoidh, Heretic side faceup. [action] If you are at Erynn MacAoidh's location, spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Parley. Choose a Heretic beneath her and place it beneath this act. Objective - Help Erynn find answers by placing Heretics beneath this act. If there are 3 beneath this act, advance.
Flavor: "The spirits of my kin are restless," Erynn explains. "But the knowledge they possess is too great to ignore. Please, help me learn from them."
Name: In Pursuit of the Beyond

Description: [action]: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?"
Flavor: Originating from a natural spring near the peak of Hangmans Hill, the narrow, shallow brook fills the surrounding woods with a quiet, peaceful babbling. The brook winds down the hill southward, forming the western border of Arkham's Uptown district.
Name: Hangman's Brook

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.
Name: Heretic

Description: Peril. Revelation - If Witchweed is drawn... - ...from the standard encounter deck, shuffle it into the spectral encounter deck. - ...from the spectral encounter deck, trigger each haunted ability on your location twice. You may give Witchweed surge to place it in the standard encounter discard pile. Otherwise, place it in the spectral encounter discard pile.
Name: Witchweed

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness [[Curse]] or [[Power]] treachery, spend 1 secret and exhaust Erynn MacAoidh: Cancel that card's revelation effect.
Name: Erynn MacAoidh

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to For the Greater Good shown here. - Set the new Hidden Passageway and Sanctum Doorway locations aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to For the Greater Good

Description: Forced - After the Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Vault and Library locations into play. [action] Investigators at the Lounge spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Hidden Passageway location into play.
Flavor: The lounge is warm, cozy, and surprisingly empty. There's got to be something else here...right?
Name: Lounge

Description: While an investigator controls the [skull] key, Relic Storage is connected to Lodge Catacombs, and vice versa. Forced - After Relic Storage is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.
Name: Relic Storage

Description: [action]: Choose a ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key on a card and test [willpower] or [intellect] (8). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play. If you succeed, swap the chosen key with another key in play or with a set-aside ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key.
Name: Shrouded Archive

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Union and Disillusion shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Union and Disillusion

Description: [free] During a circle action, spend 1 clue: Reduce the difficulty of this skill test by 2. Objective - If each Unvisited Isle location in play is revealed and the brazier on each of them is lit, advance.
Flavor: You are close to the site of the binding ritual. You must light all the braziers to find the way. Then, all that is left to do is bait the watcher to the trap and bind it there.
Name: Beyond the Mist (v. V)

Description: Revelation - Put Brazier Enchantment into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the difficulty of each skill test during circle actions on locations by 2. [action]: Circle. Test your lowest skill + your next lowest skill (6). If you succeed, discard Brazier Enchantment. If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location.
Name: Brazier Enchantment

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to In the Clutches of Chaos shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from French Hill to the current act. Then, test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.
Name: French Hill

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from Rivertown to the current act. Then, test [intellect] (X), where X is 1 more than the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, either take 1 horror or 1 damage.
Name: Rivertown

Description: [action]: Evade. Use this ability on any enemy in play or in the encounter discard pile. If you fail, that enemy attacks you (even if it is not in play). If you succeed, instead of evading the chosen enemy, move all breaches from Southside to the current act.
Name: Southside

Description: [action]: Move any number of breaches from Uptown to the current act. Then, test [agility] (X), where X is the number of breaches moved. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.
Name: Uptown

Description: [action] [action]: Move all breaches from South Church to the current act. [action]: Resign. You hide through the night.
Flavor: Many fearful citizens are seated at the church's wooden pews, praying and whispering amongst themselves.
Name: South Church

Description: [action]: Move 1 breach from Merchant District to the current act. You may spend any number of charges, secrets, supplies, or ammo from any assets you control to move that many additional breaches.
Name: Merchant District

Description: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Before the Black Throne shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)
Name: Return to Before the Black Throne

Description: [action] Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos -" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective - If the lead investigator is a The Black Throne and there are no clues on it, advance.
Flavor: You are close now. You can feel the churning and twisting of aeons in the emptiness around you. Here, in the nucleus of all things - the very center of chaos itself - your objective, and your ultimate fate, lie at hand.
Name: What Must Be Done (v. II)

Description: Cosmos - Connect in a direction of your choice, but only onto a spot where an empty space exists. Remove that empty space from the game instead of shuffling it back into its owner's deck. Then, discard each other copy of that card from play and from each investigator's hand.
Name: Nightmare Breach

Description: Cosmos - Connect in the direction nearest to The Black Throne (or any direction if The Black Throne is not in play). While you are at Interstellar Abyss, you cannot spend clues.
Name: Interstellar Abyss

Description: Cosmos - Connect to the leftmost revealed location in a direction of your choice. You may choose not to move to Winding Gulf and instead place 1 doom on Azathoth. Haunted - Take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Name: Winding Gulf

Description: While you control Nightgaunt Steed, you may enter empty space as if it were a location. Forced - After you enter empty space, Nightgaunt Steed takes 1 direct damage. Forced - If Nightgaunt Steed leaves play, remove it from the game and move to the nearest revealed location.
Name: Nightgaunt Steed

Description: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each non-weakness treachery in your threat area. If you fail, take 2 damage or 2 horror.
Name: Trespasser!

Description: Revelation - Put Despoiled into play in your threat area. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test during your turn: Increase the difficulty of each subsequent test you perform this turn by 1. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Despoiled. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Despoiled

Description: Revelation - Put Maligned into play in your threat area. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Maligned. If there is an exhausted [[Witch]] enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.
Name: Maligned

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or put Impending Evils into play next to the agenda deck and it gains surge. If there are 3 copies of Impending Evils next to the agenda deck, discard them and advance the current agenda.
Name: Impending Evils

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). If you fail, take 2 damage. If you succeed, put Unavoidable Demise into play next to the agenda deck. While Unavoidable Demise is next to the agenda deck, each other copy of Unavoidable Demise gets +1 difficulty and deals +1 damage if its test is failed.
Name: Unavoidable Demise

Description: Revelation - If there is no other copy of Fate of All Fools in play, put Fate of All Fools into play in your threat area. Otherwise, an investigator with another copy of Fate of All Fools in their threat area draws the top card of the encounter deck. That card gains peril, its effects cannot be canceled, and cards cannot be committed to skill tests while resolving its revelation effect.
Name: Fate of All Fools

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you leave attached location: Resolve each haunted ability on it. Forced - At the end of the round: If there are no investigators at attached location, discard Unstable Energies.
Name: Unstable Energies

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location (if you fail by 3 or more, resolve each of them twice, instead).
Name: From the Other Side

Description: Revelation - Attach Vice and Villainy to a non-permanent asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Discard attached asset. Forced - When attached asset leaves play: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, attach Vice and Villainy to a different non-permanent asset you control.
Name: Vice and Villainy

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If a [[Curse]] treachery is discarded by this effect, deal 1 direct horror to your investigator and to each of your [[Ally]] assets.
Name: Unhallowed Land

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (5). If you fail, choose and discard cards from your play area and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the amount you failed by.
Name: Supernatural Tempest

Description: Revelation - Attach to your location. Attached location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no clues on attached location: Move Mists from Beyond once towards the nearest location with 1 or more clues.
Name: Mists from Beyond

Description: Hunter. Forced - When you deal 1 or more damage to Screeching Banshee (except from a [[Spell]] or [[Relic]]): Resolve each haunted ability at its location.
Name: Screeching Banshee

Description: Revelation - Put Bloodthirsty Spirits into play in your threat area. While your location is haunted, as an additional cost for you to commit 1 or more cards to a skill test, you must resolve each haunted ability on your location. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Bloodthirsty Spirits.
Name: Bloodthirsty Spirits

Description:
[reaction] After an enemy attacks you (except an attack of opportunity you provoked), even if that attack was canceled: Either deal 1 damage to that enemy, or automatically evade it.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you were attacked by an enemy this round, you automatically succeed, instead.
Flavor: "Relax, tough guy. I'll handle this. You stand over there and look pretty."
Name: Daniela Reyes

Description: Daniela Reyes deck only. [fast] Exhaust Mechanic's Wrench: Choose an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. [action]: Fight. Use this ability only against an enemy that has attacked you since the end of your last turn. You get +2 [combat] for this attack and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Mechanic's Wrench

Description: Hunter. Prey - Daniela Reyes only. This enemy's attacks cannot be canceled. Damage/horror dealt by this enemy's attacks is treated as direct.
Flavor: Debt is a family affair.
Name: Mob Goons

Description: Play with the top card of your deck revealed. Once per round, you may play the top card of your deck as if it were in your hand, at -1 resource cost. Forced - After a weakness is revealed while on top of your deck: Draw it. [elder_sign] effect: +X. You may swap the top card of your deck with a card in your hand. X is the resource cost of the top card of your deck.
Name: Norman Withers

Description:
Norman Withers deck only.
[fast] Exhaust Livre d'Eibon: Swap the top card of your deck with a card in your hand.
[fast] Exhaust Livre d'Eibon: Commit the top card of your deck to an eligible skill test performed by an investigator at your location.
Name: Livre d'Eibon

Description: Revelation - Place this card on top of your deck. While The Harbinger is revealed and on top of your deck, cards in your deck cannot be searched, drawn, or manipulated in any way except by the below ability. [action] [action]: Discard The Harbinger. This ability may be activated while The Harbinger is on top of your deck, as if it were in your threat area.
Name: The Harbinger

Description:
[reaction] At the end of your turn, if you started this round 1 location away from your current location: Either gain 1 resource or draw 1 card (if you started this round 2 or more locations away, do both instead).
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you started this round 1 or more locations away from your current location, gain 1 resource or draw 1 card.
Name: Monterey Jack

Description: Fast. Monterey Jack deck only. [action]: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. If this attack succeeds, you may exhaust Trusty Bullwhip to either automatically evade the attacked enemy or deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Trusty Bullwhip

Description: Revelation - Put Buried Secrets into play in your threat area. If your location can be investigated, you cannot move except by scenario card effects. [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Buried Secrets. If you fail, you may take 2 horror to shuffle it into your deck.
Name: Buried Secrets

Description:
You begin the game with each Discipline in your deck in play, [[Unbroken]] side faceup.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. After this test ends, flip a [[Broken]] Discipline you control to its [[Unbroken]] side.
Flavor: "I have been preparing to confront this evil my entire life. My focus must be absolute."
Name: Lily Chen

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [willpower].
[action]: Take 1 direct damage to heal 3 horror, or take 1 direct horror to heal 3 damage. Flip this asset over.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [intellect].
[action]: If you have fewer than 5 cards in your hand: Draw cards until there are 5 cards in your hand. Flip this asset over.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [combat].
[action]: You get +5 skill value for the next skill test you perform this turn. After that skill test ends, flip this asset over. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Discipline

Description:
Lily Chen deck only. Permanent.
You get +1 [agility].
[action]: One at a time, take up to 3 different fight or evade actions. Flip this asset over. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Discipline

Description: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Flip a Discipline you control to its [[Broken]] side. It cannot be flipped back this round. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror.
Flavor: "How can I save them if I can't even save myself?"
Name: Burden of Destiny

Description:
At any time, an investigator at your location may reveal to you the [[Item]] assets in their hand.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play an [[Item]] asset from the hand of an investigator at your location, under their control. (Both investigators may spend resources to pay its cost).
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each [[Item]] asset you control.
Name: Bob Jenkins

Description:
Bob Jenkins deck only.
Reduce the cost of each [[Item]] asset you play by 1.
[reaction]: When you play an [[Item]] asset: Play it under the control of any investigator at your location.
Flavor: "You say the 'end of the world.' I hear 'business opportunity.'"
Name: Shrewd Dealings

Description: Revelation - Take 1 horror. If you have... - ...10 or fewer resources, take 1 additional horror. - ...5 or fewer resources, take 1 additional horror. - ...0 resources, take 1 additional horror.
Flavor: Worshipped by its own cult, one might say.
Name: Greed

Description: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation. Forced - When your first turn of the game begins: One at a time, play any number of [[Item]] assets from your hand, reducing the cost of each by 1. During this turn, you have 3 fewer actions to take.
Name: Geared Up

Description: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage and is automatically successful. As an additional cost to perform this attack, the chosen enemy makes an attack against you.
Flavor: Sometimes, the only way out is through.
Name: Toe to Toe

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the phase, whenever an enemy would attack another investigator at your location, it attacks you instead, then engages you. Cancel 1 horror dealt by each attack made in this way.
Name: "Get behind me!"

Description: Fight. For each different class among cards you control, you get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.
Flavor: "You mess wit' one of us, you mess wit' all of us!"
Name: Gang Up

Description: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed, automatically evade the attacked enemy.
Flavor: "Very good, Li. Now, again."
Name: Sweeping Kick

Description: While Defensive Stance is in your hand or committed to a skill test, it gains [combat] icons equal to your [agility], and [agility] icons equal to your [combat].
Flavor: You slide your feet into position, take a deep breath, and center yourself. They are many, but you are one.
Name: Defensive Stance

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. After this attack, you may exhaust Butterfly Swords to fight again, adding your [agility] to your skill value for that attack. That attack deals +1 damage.
Flavor: In a practiced grip, they are an extension of the empty hand.
Name: Butterfly Swords

Description:
Fast. Play when an enemy attacks an investigator at your location.
Cancel that attack. Then, test [agility] (1). If you succeed, deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Name: Dodge

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility].
Non-direct damage/horror must be assigned to Combat Training before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[fast] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] or +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Combat Training

Description: Fast. Play when you would draw an encounter card during the mythos phase. Instead, search the encounter deck for an enemy, spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location), attach On the Hunt to it, and shuffle the encounter deck. [reaction] When you defeat attached enemy: Gain 3 resources.
Name: On the Hunt

Description: Fight. Choose an enemy at any revealed location as the target for this attack. Before resolving this attack, you may move to that enemy's location. Add your [agility] to your [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +3 damage.
Flavor: The fangs of Tindalos reach any prey.
Name: Fang of Tyr'thrha

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. After this attack, you may fight again, adding your [agility] to your skill value for that attack. If both attacks are successful, you may exhaust Butterfly Swords to have the second attack deal +1 damage.
Name: Butterfly Swords

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
Increase your deck size by 15.
During each upkeep phase, instead of drawing 1 card, draw 2 cards and discard 1 of them.
Name: Forced Learning

Description:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After Jeremiah Kirby enters play, choose "even" or "odd:" Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Draw each card with a cost that matches the chosen option. Shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.
Name: Jeremiah Kirby

Description:
Limit 1 per deck. As an additional cost to play this asset, place 1 resource on 4 different locations, as leylines.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate a location with a leyline, exhaust this asset: Move that leyline onto this asset. Then, if there are 4 leylines on it, discard it, take its leylines as resources, and record in your Campaign Log that "you have identified the gateway."
Name: Archive of Conduits

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a weakness, shuffle it back into your deck. Otherwise, for the remainder of your turn, while that card is in your discard pile, commit it to each eligible skill test you perform.
Name: Written in the Stars

Description:
Limit 1 [[Footwear]] per investigator.
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from your location, exhaust Hiking Boots: Move to a connecting location with at least 1 clue, or to a connecting unrevealed location.
Name: Hiking Boots

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn. Reduce the cost of this card by 1 for each different class among cards you control.
Move to any revealed location.
Flavor: The true journey is the one we take in our minds.
Name: Join the Caravan

Description: While Survey the Area is in your hand or committed to a skill test, it gains [intellect] icons equal to your [agility], and [agility] icons equal to your [intellect].
Flavor: They won't believe you if you don't capture it on film. Hell, they probably still won't believe you.
Name: Survey the Area

Description: [action]: Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, heal 1 damage from that investigator (2 damage instead if you succeed by 2 or more). If you fail, you must either exhaust Medical Texts or deal 1 damage to that investigator.
Name: Medical Texts

Description: Investigate. Choose up to 2 [seeker] assets in your hand. The difficulty of this skill test is equal to the combined cost of the chosen assets. If you succeed, put the chosen assets into play, one at a time. For each [[Relic]] asset put into play by this ability, draw 1 card.
Name: Unearth the Ancients

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [combat].
Non-direct damage/horror must be assigned to Scientific Theory before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[fast] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] or +1 [combat] for this skill test.
Name: Scientific Theory

Description:
Researched. Uses (4 leylines). Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Move 1 leyline from this asset to a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
[action]: Choose an investigator, and an enemy with a leyline at a revealed location. That investigator moves to that location. You may remove the leyline to deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Name: Archive of Conduits

Description:
Researched. Uses (4 leylines). Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Move 1 leyline from this asset to a revealed location.
[action]: Choose an investigator and a revealed location with a leyline. That investigator moves to that location. You may remove the leyline to have them take an investigate action.
Name: Archive of Conduits

Description:
Researched. Uses (4 leylines). Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Move 1 leyline from this asset to a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
[action]: Choose an investigator engaged with an enemy with a leyline. That investigator disengages from that enemy and moves to a connecting location. You may remove the leyline to automatically evade that enemy. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Archive of Conduits

Description:
Researched. Uses (4 leylines). Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Move 1 leyline from this asset to an investigator.
[action]: Choose an investigator with a leyline. That investigator draws 1 card and heals 1 damage or 1 horror. You may remove the leyline to have them instead draw 2 cards and heal 2 damage or 2 horror.
Name: Archive of Conduits

Description:
While you are not at the locus, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [agility], and you may ignore attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After Prophesiae Profana enters play: Choose a revealed location. That location is "the locus" until Prophesiae Profana leaves play.
[action]: Move any investigator to the locus.
Name: Prophesiae Profana

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
Your deck cannot include more than 1 copy of each non-weakness, non-signature card (by title).
Reduce your deck size by 5.
Name: Underworld Support

Description: Move. Move up to 3 times. Enemies do not engage you during this movement.
Flavor: "... a viewless aura repelled me and bade me retreat from antique and sinister secrets that no man should see, and no man else had ever dared to see." - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Nameless City"
Name: Scout Ahead

Description:
One at a time, reveal random tokens from the chaos bag until you choose to stop. Treat each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] as a 5; the [auto_fail] as a 10; and the [elder_sign] as either a 1 or an 11. If the combined value of those tokens (ignoring +/-) is...
- ...18 or less, gain 4 resources.
- ...19, gain 5 resources.
- ...20, gain 6 resources.
- ...21, gain 9 resources.
Name: 21 or Bust

Description:
Fast. Play when you draw a non-weakness treachery.
Cancel that card's revelation effect and draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[reaction] When you play Counterespionage, increase its cost by 2. Change "the encounter deck" to "your deck".
[reaction] When you play Counterespionage, increase its cost by 2: Change "you" to "any investigator".
Name: Counterespionage

Description:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Gain 1 resource for each different class among cards you control.
Flavor: If you weren't supposed to do it, it wouldn't be legal.
Name: Cheat the System

Description: Reveal an [[Item]] asset in your hand. Another investigator at your location may play that asset as if it were in their hand. If they do, draw 1 card and gain resources equal to that asset's printed cost.
Flavor: "Really? You're going to haggle with me now?"
Name: Untimely Transaction

Description: Savant gains [wild] icons equal to your lowest skill other than the skill being tested.
Flavor: Fifty percent luck, a hundred percent skill.
Name: Savant

Description: Exceptional. Uses (0 charges). Forced - After your turn begins: Either place 1 charge here, or take all charges here, as resources. Then, if it has exactly... - 1 charge, you get +3 skill value for your next skill test. - 2 charges, you may move up to 2 times. - 3 charges, you may take an additional action this turn.
Name: The Red Clock

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at any location initiates a skill test.
Instead of the skill type indicated for this test ([willpower], [intellect], [combat], or [agility]), this is a resource skill test. The performing investigator's base skill value for this test is equal to half the number of resources in your resource pool (rounded down). Draw 1 card.
Name: Money Talks

Description:
Fast. Play at the start of the investigation phase.
One at a time, reveal cards from the top of any investigator deck(s) until exactly 5 cards have been revealed. Set those cards aside, out of play. While set aside, any investigator may play any of those cards as if they were in their hand. At the start of the next investigation phase, shuffle each of those cards still set aside into its owner's deck.
Name: Black Market

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [agility].
Non-direct damage/horror must be assigned to Moxie before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[fast] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [agility] for this skill test.
Name: Moxie

Description:
Exceptional.
While you have...
- ...10+ resources, you get +1 health and +1 sanity.
- ...15+ resources, you may take one additional action during your turn.
- ...20+ resources, you get +1 to each of your skills.
Name: The Black Fan

Description: Exceptional. Uses (0 charges). Forced - After your turn begins: You may take all charges here, as resources. Place 1 charge here. If it has exactly... - 1 charge, you get +4 skill value for your next skill test. - 2 charges, you may move up to 3 times. - 3 charges, you may take 2 additional actions this turn.
Name: The Red Clock

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
After each scenario of a campaign, reduce the experience cost of the first 2 cards you upgrade before the next scenario by 1.
Increase the experience cost for you to purchase new cards by 1.
Name: Down the Rabbit Hole

Description: You have 1 additional arcane slot. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack for each of your arcane slots that is filled. If at least 2 of your arcane slots are filled, this attack deals +1 damage.
Name: Dragon Pole

Description: For each of your arcane slots that is filled, either heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
Flavor: You let your mind drift into cold, meaningless oblivion. The emptiness feels like home.
Name: Meditative Trance

Description:
Uses (1 charge for each class among cards you control, including this one).
[fast] Spend 1 charge and exhaust Close the Circle: Take a basic action. For each skill test performed during that action, you may use your [willpower] instead of the skill indicated for that action.
Name: Close the Circle

Description:
Place 2 charges on an asset you control.
[reaction] After you draw Winds of Power during your turn: Play it.
Flavor: May Oya's breath guide us all.
Name: Winds of Power

Description:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location would draw a card from their deck or from the encounter deck.
Name a card. If the drawn card is the named card, that investigator may either (choose one):
- Cancel that card's effects and discard it.
- Immediately play that card at -2 cost.
Name: Foresight

Description: While Occult Theory is in your hand or committed to a skill test, it gains [willpower] icons equal to your [intellect], and [intellect] icons equal to your [willpower].
Flavor: When knowledge is lacking, belief must suffice.
Name: Occult Theory

Description: Look at the top 6 cards of an investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may either return them to the top of that deck in any order, or shuffle them into that deck. If you looked at an investigator's deck, that investigator may draw 1 card.
Flavor: "If I said that I could tell you when you were going to die, would you want to know?"
Name: Parallel Fates

Description:
[fast] Exhaust Astronomical Atlas: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, attach it facedown to Astronomical Atlas (max 5 cards attached).
[fast]: Commit a card attached to Astronomical Atlas to an eligible skill test. If that test succeeds, add that card to your hand instead of discarding it. (Limit once per test.)
Name: Astronomical Atlas

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 2 damage from among investigators at your location.
Flavor: You don't necessarily trust the occult words, but you have no other choice.
Name: Healing Words

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
You get +1 skill value during skill tests on [[Spell]] cards.
Non-direct damage/horror must be assigned to Grounded before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Spell]] card, spend 1 resource: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Grounded

Description: Uses (1 charge). Replenish this charge at the start of each round. You may resolve abilities on [[Spell]] assets in your hand by revealing them from your hand. Treat True Magick as if it were the revealed asset (to pay its costs, spend charges, perfom its effect, etc).
Name: True Magick

Description: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation. Forced - When your first turn of the game begins: Discard the top 10 cards of your deck.
Flavor: You can only pray that it's enough.
Name: Short Supply

Description:
Uses (5 secrets). If Schoffner's Catalogue has no secrets, discard it.
You may spend secrets on Schoffner's Catalogue as resources to pay for [[Item]] assets played by any investigator at your location.
Name: Schoffner's Catalogue

Description:
Uses (3 supplies). If Bandages has no supplies, discard it.
[reaction] After an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location takes 1 or more damage, spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage from that card.
Name: Bandages

Description:
Uses (3 durability).
Attach to an [[Item]] asset controlled by an investigator at your location.
[fast] During a skill test on attached asset, spend 1 durability: You get +2 skill value for this test.
Flavor: If it ain't broke, make it better.
Name: Jury-Rig

Description:
Uses (1 charge).
[fast] Spend 1 charge: You get +2 skill value for this test. (Limit once per test.)
[reaction] After an enemy attacks you: Place 1 charge on Bangle of Jinxes.
Name: Bangle of Jinxes

Description: Exile a level 0-5 card in your hand. Discover 2 clues at your location. If the exiled card was level 2 or higher, remove 1 doom from the current agenda. Exile Burn After Reading. Card designed by the Council-in-Exile at Gen Con 2020
Name: Burn After Reading

Description: Strength in Numbers gains a [wild] icon for each different class among cards you control.
Flavor: "Watch my back, will ya? In fact, watch my front, too."
Name: Strength in Numbers

Description: While Dauntless Spirit is in your hand or committed to a skill test, it gains [willpower] icons equal to your [combat], and [combat] icons equal to your [willpower].
Flavor: This day just keeps getting better and better.
Name: Dauntless Spirit

Description:
Fast. Play after an enemy attacks you. Max 1 per attack.
Damage/horror from this attack cannot be assigned to [[Ally]] assets. For each point of damage and/or horror you took from this attack, draw 1 card.
Name: Blood Will Have Blood

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [action] Discard Fire Extinguisher: Evade. Automatically evade all enemies engaged with you. You may exile Fire Extinguisher instead of discarding it to discard each non-[[Elite]] enemy evaded by this effect.
Name: Fire Extinguisher

Description:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
Non-direct damage/horror must be assigned to Plucky before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[fast] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] or +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
Name: Plucky

Description:
Fast. Play when a non-[[Elite]] enemy spawns at your location.
That enemy attacks you. Then, automatically evade that enemy and attach Fend Off to it.
Attached enemy cannot ready.
Name: Fend Off

Description: [reaction] After Medical Student enters play: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Flavor: "Can I get course credit for this?"
Name: Medical Student

Description: Choose an enemy at any location other than yours. Either move twice toward that enemy, or discover 1 clue at any empty location between you and the chosen enemy, along the shortest path to reach that enemy.
Flavor: "The game is afoot!"
Name: On the Trail

Description: Choose an enemy at any location other than yours. Move twice toward that enemy. Discover 1 clue at each location you entered by this effect.
Flavor: "The game is afoot!"
Name: On the Trail

Description: You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [combat]. [reaction] After you successfully investigate: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Michael Leigh, as evidence (to a maximum of 3 evidence). [reaction] When you initiate an attack, exhaust Michael Leigh and spend 1 evidence: You deal +1 damage for this attack.
Name: Michael Leigh

Description: During the next fight action you perform this turn using a [[Ranged]] or [[Firearm]] asset, treat each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token you reveal as a "0" token. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Snipe

Description: Uses (0 ammo). While playing an event, treat Old Shotgun's uses value as 2. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack's damage is equal to the amount you succeed by, or fail by if you fail and would damage another investigator (to a minimum of 1, to a maximum of 3).
Name: Old Shotgun

Description:
[fast]: Choose a [[Firearm]] asset taking up only 1 hand slot in your play area. Attach it to Quickdraw Holster, or switch it with the attached asset. The attached asset takes up no hand slots. (Limit 1 attached asset.)
[fast] Exhaust Quickdraw Holster: Perform a fight action on the attached asset without paying its [action] cost.
Name: Quickdraw Holster

Description: Uses (6 charges). [action]: Fight. For this attack, you may use [willpower] instead of [combat], and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1 or 2 charges. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 1 damage for each charge spent. If you succeed by 0, lose 1 action.
Name: Brand of Cthugha

Description: [reaction] After Nkosi Mabati enters play: Name a non-[elder_sign] chaos token with a symbol. Until this card leaves play, the named symbol is your "sigil." [reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol, exhaust Nkosi Mabati: Search the chaos bag for your sigil and reveal it, instead (returning the other token to the chaos bag).
Name: Nkosi Mabati

Description: Uses (9 charges). [action]: Fight. For this attack, you may use [willpower] instead of [combat], and you get +2 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1, 2, or 3 charges. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 1 damage for each charge spent. If you succeed by 0, lose 2 actions.
Name: Brand of Cthugha

Description: [action]: Fight. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this attack. You deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may move it one location away from you. (If you succeed by 3 or more, you instead deal +2 damage and may move the enemy up to two locations away from you.)
Name: Cyclopean Hammer

Description: [action]: Fight. You get -1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [action] [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack.
Flavor: Twenty pounds of steel vengeance.
Name: Sledgehammer

Description: [reaction] When you draw a [[Hazard]] treachery, deal 1 damage and 1 horror to Protective Gear: Cancel that card's revelation effect.
Flavor: After what you've seen, you intend to sleep in it.
Name: Protective Gear

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [action] [action] [action]: Fight. You get +5 [combat] and deal +5 damage for this attack.
Flavor: Twenty-five pounds of steel vengeance.
Name: Sledgehammer

Description: [fast] Exhaust Pocket Telescope: Look at the revealed side of a connecting unrevealed location. [action]: Investigate. Investigate a revealed connecting location as if you were there.
Name: Pocket Telescope

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[fast] During your turn, exhaust Eon Chart and spend 1 secret: Choose and take one of the following actions (move, evade, or investigate).
Name: Eon Chart

Description:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility].
[reaction] During your turn, after you move to a location, exhaust Gen辿 Beauregard: Move a clue or a non-[[Elite]] enemy from a connecting location to your location, or vice versa.
Name: Gen辿 Beauregard

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[fast] During your turn, exhaust Eon Chart and spend 1 secret: Choose and take two different actions of the following, in any order (move, evade, or investigate).
Name: Eon Chart

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action]: Investigate. For this investigation, you may use [willpower] instead of [intellect], and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1 or 2 charges. Instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover 1 clue at your location for each charge spent. If you succeed by 0, choose and discard a card from your hand.
Name: Divination

Description:
Fast. Play after an [[Ally]] asset at your location is discarded by a card effect or is defeated.
Either return that asset to its owner's hand, or its owner draws 3 cards.
Flavor:
All living things have breath.
Be careful they do not curse you with theirs.
Name: Protecting the Anirniq

Description: Uses (6 charges). [action]: Investigate. For this investigation, you may use [willpower] instead of [intellect], and you get +2 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1, 2, or 3 charges. Instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover 1 clue at your location for each charge spent. If you succeed by 0, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand.
Name: Divination

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[reaction] When you successfully investigate, exhaust Professor William Webb and spend 1 secret: Instead of discovering a clue at your location, either choose an [[Item]] card in your discard pile and add it to your hand, or discover a clue at a connecting location.
Name: Professor William Webb

Description:
Fast.
[fast] During a skill test while fighting or investigating, exhaust Ice Pick: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Ice Pick

Description:
Uses (3 secrets).
[reaction] When you successfully investigate, exhaust Professor William Webb and spend 1 secret: Choose an [[Item]] card in your discard pile and add it to your hand. Instead of discovering a clue at your location, you may discover a clue at a connecting location.
Name: Professor William Webb

Description: Fast. [fast] During a skill test while fighting or investigating, exhaust Ice Pick: You get +1 skill value for this test. If you succeed, you may discard Ice Pick to have this attack deal +1 damage (if you are fighting), or to discover 1 additional clue at your location (if you are investigating).
Name: Ice Pick

Description: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at a revealed location up to 2 connections away. Swap places with that enemy.
Flavor: "Now, for my next trick..."
Name: Ethereal Slip

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] If Blur has charges remaining: Evade. For this evasion attempt, you may use [willpower] instead of [agility], and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1 charge and you may take an additional action this turn. If you succeed by 0, take 1 damage.
Name: Blur

Description: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any revealed location. Swap places with that enemy.
Flavor: "Now, for my next trick..."
Name: Ethereal Slip

Description: Uses (4 charges). [action] If Blur has charges remaining: Evade. For this evasion attempt, you may use [willpower] instead of [agility] and get +2 skill value. If you succeed, spend 1 or 2 charges and you may take that many additional actions this turn. If you succeed by 0, take 2 damage.
Name: Blur

Description:
Fast. Play after you reveal a chaos token during a skill test.
Reveal an additional chaos token, switching its "-" to a "+". If that chaos token is a [skull] token, you automatically fail.
Name: "Hit me!"

Description: Limit 1 per investigator. Cannot leave play. [reaction] After you play Unscrupulous Loan: Gain 10 resources. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if you have fewer than 10 resources in your resource pool: Exile Unscrupulous Loan.
Name: Unscrupulous Loan

Description: Limit 1 Precious Memento (From a Former Life) per deck. [reaction] After you fail a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Precious Memento: Heal 1 damage from it. [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Precious Memento: Heal 1 horror from it.
Name: Precious Memento

Description: Limit 1 Precious Memento (From a Future Life) per deck. [reaction] After you fail a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Precious Memento: Heal 1 horror from it. [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Precious Memento: Heal 1 damage from it.
Name: Precious Memento

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Play Talisman of Protection under the control of any investigator at your location.
[reaction] When you assign damage and/or horror that would defeat you, discard Talisman of Protection: Cancel up to 2 of that damage and/or horror.
Name: Talisman of Protection

Description:
Uses (4 charges).
[action]: Test [willpower] (1). For each point you succeed by, you may spend 1 charge to heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator at your location. If you succeed by 0, lose 1 resource.
Name: Earthly Serenity

Description: Uses (3 charges). [action] Exhaust Enchanted Bow: Fight. You must use either [willpower] or [agility] instead of [combat] and get +1 skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may spend 1 charge to have this attack target a non-[[Elite]] enemy at a connecting location; if you do, ignore the aloof and retaliate keywords for this attack.
Name: Enchanted Bow

Description:
Uses (6 charges).
[action]: Test [willpower] (0). For each point you succeed by, you may spend 1 charge to heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator at your location. If you succeed by 0, lose 2 resources.
Name: Earthly Serenity

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Prophetic may be spent to pay for [[Fortune]], [[Spell]], or [[Spirit]] cards.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Fortune]], [[Spell]], or [[Spirit]] card, spend 1 resource from Prophetic: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Prophetic

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Sleuth may be spent to pay for [[Charm]], [[Tactic]], or [[Tome]] cards.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Charm]], [[Tactic]], or [[Tome]] card, spend 1 resource from Sleuth: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Sleuth

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Bruiser may be spent to pay for [[Armor]], [[Firearm]], or [[Melee]] cards.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Armor]], [[Firearm]], or [[Melee]] card, spend 1 resource from Bruiser: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Bruiser

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Crafty may be spent to pay for [[Insight]], [[Tool]], or [[Trick]] cards.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Insight]], [[Tool]], or [[Trick]] card, spend 1 resource from Crafty: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Crafty

Description:
Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round.
Resources on Antiquary may be spent to pay for [[Favor]], [[Relic]] or [[Ritual]] cards.
[fast] During a skill test on a [[Favor]], [[Relic]] or [[Ritual]] card, spend 1 resource from Antiquary: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Name: Antiquary

Description:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
When you purchase In the Thick of It, suffer 2 total physical and/or mental trauma. Then, earn 3 experience.
Name: In the Thick of It

Description: [reaction] After you reveal a non-[auto_fail] symbol on a chaos token during a skill test you are perfoming, deal 1 damage to Heavy Furs: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token.
Name: Heavy Furs

Description: You may include up to 4 copies of Sled Dog in your deck. Up to 2 Sled Dog cards take up a single ally slot. [action] Exhaust X Sled Dogs: Move. Move X times. [action] Exhaust X Sled Dogs: Fight. You get +X [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals X damage.
Name: Sled Dog

Description:
You have 2 additional ally slots, which can only be used to hold [[Creature]] assets.
[reaction] When you play a [[Creature]] asset during your turn: Reduce that asset's cost by 1.
Name: Rod of Animalism

Description:
One at a time, in any order, if you control a...
- [rogue] card, you may move to a connecting location.
- [guardian] card, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.
- [seeker] card, discover 1 clue at your location.
- [mystic] card, heal 1 horror from any card.
- [survivor] card, heal 1 damage from any card.
Name: Call for Backup

Description: Revelation - Put Arm Injury into play in your threat area. Arm Injury can be healed as if it were a single point of damage on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - After you take a fight or activate action: You cannot take any of those types of actions for the remainder of the turn.
Name: Arm Injury

Description: Revelation - Put Leg Injury into play in your threat area. Leg Injury can be healed as if it were a single point of damage on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - After you take a move, resign, or evade action: You cannot take any of those types of actions for the remainder of the turn.
Name: Leg Injury

Description: Revelation - Put Panic into play in your threat area. Panic can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - After you take a play, engage, or resource action: You cannot take any of those types of actions for the remainder of the turn.
Name: Panic

Description: Revelation - Put Stupor into play in your threat area. Stupor can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - After you take a parley, draw, or investigate action: You cannot take any of those types of actions for the remainder of the turn.
Name: Stupor

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: X. X is half the shelter value of your location (rounded up).
[cultist]: 2. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, take 1 horror).
[tablet]: 3. For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded by this effect.
Name: Ice and Death

Description: [action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3) to scavenge from the wreckage. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Spare Parts. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 0.
Name: Crash Site

Description: Frozen Shores gets +2 shroud if an encounter card is attached to it. Shelter 2.
Flavor: The sun never quite sets over the horizon past the icy shoreline, painting the sky a myriad tapestry of beautiful colors.
Name: Frozen Shores

Description: Forced After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at Treacherous Path: Take 1 damage or horror for each [frost] token revealed. Shelter 1.
Name: Treacherous Path

Description: [reaction] When you draw a [[Hazard]] treachery while at Precarious Ice Sheet, add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Cancel that cards effects and discard it. (Group limit once per round.) Shelter 2.
Name: Precarious Ice Sheet

Description: [reaction] When you successfully investigate Broad Snowdrifts, add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Discover 3 additional clues at Broad Snowdrifts. (Group limit once per game.) Shelter 4.
Name: Broad Snowdrifts

Description: Treat the modifier of the first [frost] token revealed during each skill test at Icy Wastes as 3, instead of 1. Shelter 4.
Name: Icy Wastes

Description: Forced When a treachery is attached to Rocky Crags: That treachery gains surge. (Max once per phase.) Shelter 3.
Name: Rocky Crags

Description: [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Snow Graves, shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them: In the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Green Soapstone. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 5.
Name: Snow Graves

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to search the trapped ship for supplies. If you succeed, either remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag or record Small Radio in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 5.
Name: Icebreaker Landing

Description: [action] Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: In the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Mineral Specimen. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 6.
Name: Frigid Cave

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (4) to convince some of the other explorers here to give you something useful. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Dynamite. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.
Name: Barrier Camp

Description: [action]: Test [combat] (4) to dig through the snow in search of supplies. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Wooden Sledge. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.
Name: Remnants of Lakes Camp

Description: [action]: Test [agility] (5) to climb up one of the crystalline walls in search of evidence. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Miasmic Crystal. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 8.
Name: Crystalline Cavern

Description: Hunter. Forced When you defeat Skittering Nonsense: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, Skittering Nonsense attacks you).
Name: Skittering Nonsense

Description: Revelation Test [willpower] (X), where X is your locations shelter value. If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Take 1 horror for each point you failed by. - Place 2 of your clues on your location. - Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.
Name: Apeirophobia

Description: Revelation Put Zero Visibility into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to leave a location with a treachery attached to it, you must spend 1 action. Forced At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, discard Zero Visibility.
Name: Zero Visibility

Description: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)
Flavor: This isnt exactly how you imagined your first foray into the Antarctic wilds. The stinging cold and lashing, frozen winds will only get worse over time.
Name: Cold Welcome

Description: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)
Flavor: Something dwells beneath the ice. Something youve never seen or heard of before, not even in William Dyers horrifying report. Something...unreal.
Name: Into the White

Description: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)
Flavor: The sun hangs low in the sky, but never sets. Your party is exhausted from the long , arduous day. Though the sky is never plunged into the dark of night, you know its only a matter of time before you are forced to make camp.
Name: Running Out of Time

Description: [action] If each investigator is at the same location and that location has no clues on it: Resign. You set up camp. Each investigator resigns. Objective Find somewhere safe to set up camp. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. The higher the shelter value of the location they resigned at, the better.
Flavor: Youre going to have to find a way back to camp, and soon...or youll have to make due camping in the wilds.
Name: Search for a Camp Site

Description:
Hunter. Massive.
Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health.
While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators cannot resign at its location or discover clues at its location.
Name: Terror of the Stars

Flavor: Several of your party have mysteriously vanished in the night. Without a sign of any struggle, you can only assume they left of their own accord...but why?
Name: A Harsh Wind Blows

Flavor: The low-hanging sun dimly illuminates the Antarctic night. Gray clouds cover the sky, threatening an icy storm.
Name: The Chill of Night

Flavor: The storm grows closer, and with it looming in the sky, that damnable sound returns. It haunts you with its presence, worming its way into your mind. Is it the cause of this folly? This madness?
Name: Madness and Death

Description: [fast] Investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the encounter card beneath your location. [action] If you are at camp: Resign. You turn in for the night. Objective Find as many missing expedition members as you can by adding them to the victory display, then head back to camp before daybreak. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
Flavor: You set out to search for the missing team members, hoping to find them before daybreak...
Name: The Lost Expedition

Description:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: There is nothing here but ice and snow, and no sign of any missing team members. Frustrated, you turn back. You won't find anyone here.
Name: Dead End

Description:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor:
As you traverse the glacial wilds, something rumbles and churns beneath your feet. Is that where these depths of the ice?
A somber thought crosses your mind. If you are right, such entities could exert their vile influence no matter where you stand. Perhaps this has something to do with your missing companions after all, though there are no signs of them here.
Name: Cracks in the Ice

Description:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: You come across evidence of one of your lost companions, abandoned and half-buried in snow - torn scraps from a heavy fur coat and a pair of goggles. Examining the goggles closely yields a terrifying discovery - a dark, sticky substance that you cannot, for the life of you, identify.
Name: Somber Remains

Description:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor:
The tracks continue for some time before vanishing , bafflingly, into the snow. Theres no sign of any struggle, nor are there any other tracks that might indicate where they could have gone. Could the winds have covered the tracks? And if so, why were you able to follow the rest of the footprints so easily?
But when you turn back to examine the prints you first followed, they too are gone.
Name: Disappearing Footprints

Description:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: You follow a set of tracks into a small cavern carved into a glacial wall, and your stomach lurches at the sight before you. One of your missing team members lies in a crumpled heap at the end of the hollow, his clothing torn open. A clean vertical incision has bisected his torso open from his sternum to his belly, and his entrails have been carefully removed. You struggle not to retch. Who could have possibly done such a thing?
Name: Dissected Explorer

Description:
Discard an [[Eidolon]] enemy that does not have the [[Elite]] trait from play.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: You are fleeing from a creature made of kaleidoscopic ooze when you suddenly freeze in place, a web of cracks reaching out across the ice beneath your boots. Your breath catches in your throat. Another step could spell your doom or save your life. Behind you, the entity gains on you, reaching out with arms that are not quite solid or liquid. Feeling lucky, you decide to roll the dice, striking the ground behind you and fleeing to the side. Just as you hoped, the ice is thin enough to splinter open, and the creature tumbles down through the crack, into the icy depths. You breathe a sigh of relief, thankful you did not share a similar fate.
Name: Evil Within

Description:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: You follow a set of footprints through the snow, hoping they will lead you to a sign, any sign, of your lost companions. Sadly, the evidence you discover is not the kind you were hoping to find. Where the prints end, you find an ice pick covered in freshly frozen blood. To your horror, a human eye lies nearby, staining the snow red. A shudder creeps up your spine. What on Earth could compel somebody to do such a thing?
Name: Bloody Evidence

Description:
Choose a [[Possessed]] enemy in play that does not have the [[Elite]] trait. Take control of each doom on that enemy, flipping them to their clue sides. Discard the chosen enemy.
Add this story card to the victory display.
Flavor: To your relief, you come across one of your missing team members - but they are not themself. Their eyes glazed over, their expression dazed and lost. A murky, slimy substance drips from their face and trickles onto the ice below. When you finally manage to get through to them, they wipe the strange, inky miasma from their face, staining their cheeks black. "What...was I doing?" they ask.
Name: Madness Inside

Description: [action] Choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand: Parley. Place that many resources on Professor William Dyer (from the token bank). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced If Professor William Dyer is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Professor William Dyer

Description: [action]: Parley. You listen closely to Danforths rambling. Draw up to 2 cards from the top of the Tekeli-li deck. Then, place that many resources on Danforth (from the token pool). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced If Danforth is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Danforth

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2) to sneak by Anyu and speak with Eliyah. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced If Eliyah Ashevak is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Eliyah Ashevak

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to attempt to calm Dr. Sinha down. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced If Dr. Mala Sinha is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Dr. Mala Sinha

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to get Claypool to stop babbling nonsense. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced If Avery Claypool is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Avery Claypool

Description: Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (2) to wrestle the gun away from Cookie. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced If James "Cookie" Fredericks is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: James "Cookie" Fredericks

Description: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to convince Dr. Kensler to tell you what she has seen. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced If Dr. Amy Kensler is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.
Name: Dr. Amy Kensler
