Flavor: Unconventional ailments require unconventional treatments.
Name: Bizarre Diagnosis

Description: Search the top 6 cards of your deck. You may place up to 3 of your clues on your location. For each clue placed in this way, choose and add 2 of the searched cards to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Flavor:
"Don't you realize what this means?"
"Why don't you calm down and tell me very slowly?"
Name: Captivating Discovery

Description: Investigate. Add your [willpower] or [agility] to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues at this location, attach Map the Area to it. Limit 1 per location. Reduce the difficulty of all skill tests at attached location by 1.
Name: Map the Area

Description: After revealing a chaos token for this skill test, you may place 1 of your clues on your location to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)
Name: Analysis

Description: [reaction] When you would fail a skill test on a [seeker] card by 1 or less, exhaust Lab Coat: You succeed by 0, instead.
Flavor: It makes you feel like you know what you're doing, even when you're in way over your head.
Name: Lab Coat

Description:
Uses (4 secrets).
[fast] Spend 1 secret: Choose any non-weakness treachery not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy. Until the end of the round, treat that card's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Name: Orphic Theory

Description: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [willpower] or [intellect] (8). This test gets -1 difficulty for each other card in your hand. If you succeed, automatically evade the chosen enemy and attach Existential Riddle to it. Attached enemy gains aloof.
Name: Existential Riddle

Description: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take their turn this round. During their turn this round, the chosen investigator gets +1 to each of their skills, and may take an additional action. Playing Guidance does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Guidance

Description: [reaction] When any investigator draws an encounter card from the encounter deck, exhaust Dr. William T. Maleson and place 1 of your clues on your location: That investigator draws another card from the top of the encounter deck, chooses one of those 2 cards to resolve, and cancels and discards the other.
Name: Dr. William T. Maleson

Description: [reaction] After you spend 1 or more clues or place 1 or more clues on your location, exhaust Press Pass: You may take an additional action during this turn (or your next turn if it is not currently your turn).
Flavor: It's amazing how differently everyone treats you while you're wearing one.
Name: Press Pass

Description:
Uses (4 supplies).
[reaction] When one of your card effects heals damage from an investigator, spend 1 supply: Either that effect heals 1 additional damage, or you draw 1 card and heal 1 horror.
[action] [action]: Heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
Name: Surgical Kit

Description: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Exhaust Fingerprint Kit and spend 1 supply: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 2 additional clues at your location.
Name: Fingerprint Kit

Description:
[action]: Choose a card at your location and test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by, choose one -
- The next time that card would be healed this round, heal +1 damage/horror (to a maximum of +3).
- The next time that card would be dealt damage this round, deal +1 damage (to a maximum of +3).
Name: Gray's Anatomy

Description: Customizable. Uses (3 evidence). [action] Exhaust Damning Testimony and choose an enemy at any location: Investigate (your location). If you succeed, you may spend 1 evidence to discover 1 additional clue at the chosen enemy's location.
Name: Damning Testimony

Description:
Customizable. When you purchase Friends in Low Places, choose and record a [[Trait]] on its upgrade sheet.
Look at the top 6 cards of your deck. For each looked-at card with the chosen [[Trait]](s), you may spend 1 resource to add that card to your hand. Shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.
Flavor: "Pleasure doing business with you, Ms. O'Bannion."
Name: Friends in Low Places

Description:
Customizable. Fast. Play this card only after one of the following conditions is met:
- The agenda or act advances.
- You succeed at a skill test by 3 or more.
Immediately take an action as if it were your turn (Max once per round).
Name: Honed Instinct

Description: Uses (4 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Evade. You get +2 [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.
Name: Disguise

Description: [fast] Exhaust Embezzled Treasure: Move up to 2 resources from your resource pool to Embezzled Treasure (to a maximum of 10 resources on it). Forced - When you resign or the game ends: For every 2 resources on Embezzled Treasure, an investigator of your choice begins the next scenario of the campaign with 1 additional resource in their resource pool.
Name: Embezzled Treasure

Description: Uses (6 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. You may use [agility] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, gain 1 resource.
Flavor: "Why do I keep these on me? Why, to be better informed regarding the unsavory methods of art thieves, of course."
Name: Thieves' Kit

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach to a [[Clothing]] or [[Armor]] asset you control.
Attached asset gains: "You have 1 additional hand or accessory slot (your choice), which can only be used to hold an [[Illicit]] asset."
Flavor: "Thanks! It has pockets!"
Name: Hidden Pocket

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Put an [[Ally]] asset from your hand into play. At the end of your turn, if that asset is still in play, return it to your hand.
Flavor: "Impeccable timing, Mr. Fergus."
Name: Hit and Run

Description:
Fast. Play when you successfully evade a [[Humanoid]] enemy or successfully investigate.
Play an [[Item]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by X, where X is the amount you succeeded by. Attach "I'll take that!" to that asset. Attached asset gains [[Illicit]].
Name: "I'll take that!"

Description: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location). Then, discover 1 clue at your location and gain X resources, where X is that enemy's health value. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Name: Kicking the Hornet's Nest

Description: Fast. Play when an enemy attacks you. Evade. Attempt to evade the attacking enemy. If you succeed, cancel that enemy's attack.
Flavor: It's out of sight, but never out of mind.
Name: Quick Getaway

Description: Max 1 committed per skill test. Commit only to a test you are performing of any type, and only if it is your turn. Calculated Risk gains [wild] for each action you performed this turn (including this one). After this test ends, end your turn.
Name: Calculated Risk

Description: [reaction] When you gain 1 or more resources during your turn via another player card effect, exhaust Stylish Coat: Gain 1 additional resource.
Flavor: "Dress for the job you want, you say. What if the job I want is yours?"
Name: Stylish Coat

Description:
[reaction] When you play a [[Tactic]] or [[Trick]] event, exhaust Chuck Fergus: Choose one -
- That event gains fast.
- That event costs 2 fewer resources to play.
- You get +2 skill value while performing a skill test during the resolution of that event.
Name: Chuck Fergus

Description:
Limit 1 per investigator.
While attacking, parleying, or attempting to evade an exhausted enemy, you get +2 skill value.
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Dirty Fighting: Take a fight action against that enemy. Ignore the aloof keyword for this attack.
Name: Dirty Fighting

Description: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed by 1 or more, you may automatically evade an enemy at this location. If you succeed by 3 or more, return Breaking and Entering to your hand at the end of your turn. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Flavor: If you're careful, it's just "entering."
Name: Breaking and Entering

Description: Uses (6 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. For this investigation, you may use [agility] instead of [intellect], and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed, gain 1 resource (2 resources instead if you succeed by 2 or more).
Flavor: "...okay, fine, they're mine."
Name: Thieves' Kit

Description: [reaction] After Trigger Man enters play: Attach an [[Illicit]] asset from your hand to Trigger Man (it is considered to be in play and under your control). [fast] Exhaust Trigger Man and spend 1 resource: Resolve an [action] ability on attached asset, without paying its [action] cost. Resolve that ability with a base skill value of 4.
Name: Trigger Man

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional. You get +10 deck size.
[reaction] Before drawing your opening hand, choose 10 [[Illicit]] cards from your deck: Shuffle them together and place them next to Underworld Market, as your market deck.
[reaction] At the start of your turn: Reveal the top 2 cards of your market deck. You may spend 1 resource to draw 1 of them. Place the rest on the bottom, in any order.
Name: Underworld Market

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
For each exhausted non-swarm enemy at your location, choose a different option:
- Gain 2 resources.
- Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
- Discover 1 clue at your location.
- Draw 1 card.
Name: Clean Sneak

Description:
Customizable. When you purchase Living Ink, choose a skill and circle it on its upgrade sheet.
Uses (3 charges).
Remove 1 charge from Living Ink at the start of each of your turns. If Living Ink has no charges, discard it.
You get +1 to the chosen skill(s).
Name: Living Ink

Description:
Customizable. As an additional cost to play Summoned Servitor, you must discard another asset you control.
Summoned Servitor enters play at your location. It can take 1 action during each of your turns, which can only be used to take the following action:
- Move Summoned Servitor to a connecting revealed location.
Name: Summoned Servitor

Description: Customizable. Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. [action] If attached enemy is at your location: Parley. Give it a command (limit once per round per command) - - "Go." This enemy moves once in a direction of your choice. - "Cower." This enemy exhausts.
Name: Power Word

Description: [action]: Fight. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [combat] for this attack. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Ceremonial Sickle and place 1 doom on it to get +1 skill value and deal +1 damage for this attack. - If this attack defeats an enemy, remove 1 doom from Ceremonial Sickle.
Name: Ceremonial Sickle

Description: [action]: Investigate. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Dowsing Rod and place 1 doom on it to move to a connecting location. - If this investigation discovers the last clue at a location, remove 1 doom from Dowsing Rod.
Name: Dowsing Rod

Description:
[action]: Choose an investigator at your location and either (choose one) -
- Exhaust Hallowed Chalice and place 1 doom on it to heal 2 damage or 2 horror from that investigator.
- Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from that investigator. If you heal the last damage or horror from that investigator, remove 1 doom from Hallowed Chalice.
Name: Hallowed Chalice

Description: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +1 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, remove 1 doom from Onyx Pentacle.
Name: Onyx Pentacle

Description: For each arcane slot you have, draw 1 card (max 5). For each filled arcane slot you have, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Flavor:
By both light and shadow /
may dusk beget dawn;
May the turning of the world /
lead to power everlasting.
Name: Eldritch Initiation

Description:
Before you play Explosive Ward, you may discard any number of cards from your arcane slots.
Deal X damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy engaged with you. X cannot be greater than the number of empty arcane slots you have. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
Name: Explosive Ward

Description: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and either (choose one): - Automatically evade that enemy and place 1 doom on it. It cannot take damage for the remainder of the round. Discover 1 clue at your location. - If that enemy has 1 or more doom on it, defeat it. Gain 1 resource for each doom that was on it.
Name: String of Curses

Description:
You get +1 arcane slot for each enemy beneath Binder's Jar.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy is defeated at your location: Place that enemy facedown beneath Binder's Jar (limit 2 enemies beneath it).
[reaction] When an enemy attacks you, discard an enemy beneath Binder's Jar that shares a [[Trait]] with the attacking enemy: Cancel that attack.
Name: Binder's Jar

Description:
After you commit Ghastly Possession to a skill test on an asset, choose one:
- Place 1 doom on that asset. Ghastly Possession gains [wild][wild].
- If this test is successful, either remove 1 doom from this asset, or replenish half of its uses (rounded down).
Name: Ghastly Possession

Description:
For each of your arcane slots that are empty, you have one additional hand slot.
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play an asset into one of your hand slots.
Name: Astral Mirror

Description:
You get +1 skill value while resolving a skill test on an attached asset.
1 doom on each attached asset does not count towards the agenda's doom threshold.
[fast] Exhaust Elle Rubash: Choose an asset in your play area with 1 or more doom on it. Attach it to Elle Rubash, or switch it with an attached asset. (Limit 2 attached assets).
Name: Elle Rubash

Description:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Remove all doom from a non-[[Elite]] card at your location.
Flavor: "In the name of the moon..."
Name: Moonlight Ritual

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[fast] Exhaust Sin-Eater: Move 1 doom from an asset you control to Sin-Eater. Then, either ready that asset or place 1 charge on it.
[action]: Remove all doom from Sin-Eater.
Name: Sin-Eater

Description: You may discard a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control. Play a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] card from your hand or discard pile, reducing its resource cost by 3.
Flavor:
The power seized her, made her shudder and spasm.
Its energy united with hers, and then,
she opened her eyes
Name: Uncage the Soul

Description: [action]: Fight. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [combat] for this attack. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Ceremonial Sickle and place 1 doom on it to get +3 skill value and deal +1 damage for this attack. - If this attack defeats an enemy, ready Ceremonial Sickle and remove all doom from it.
Name: Ceremonial Sickle

Description: [action]: Investigate. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Dowsing Rod and place 1 doom on it to move to a connecting location and get +2 skill value for this investigation. - If this investigation discovers the last clue at a location, ready Dowsing Rod and remove all doom from it.
Name: Dowsing Rod

Description: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +3 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, ready Onyx Pentacle and remove all doom from it.
Name: Onyx Pentacle

Description:
Customizable. Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] During a skill test you are performing, exhaust Pocket Multi Tool: You get +1 skill value for this test.
Flavor: But wait - there's more!
Name: Pocket Multi Tool

Description: Customizable. Uses (2 time). If Makeshift Trap has no time, discard it. Attach to your location. Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at attached location get -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 time from Makeshift Trap.
Name: Makeshift Trap

Description: Customizable. When you purchase Grizzled, choose and record two [[Traits]] on its upgrade sheet. If this is a skill test on or against an encounter card (including fighting, evading, or parleying), Grizzled gains [wild][wild] for each of the chosen traits that encounter card possesses.
Name: Grizzled

Description: [reaction] When you are dealt damage and/or horror, exhaust Idol of Xanatos and discard up to 3 cards from your hand: Cancel that much damage/horror.
Flavor: The weight of it was reassuring, the metal warm against her skin.
Name: Idol of Xanatos

Description: Improvised Shield can only be played from your discard pile. Forced - When Improvised Shield is defeated: Shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it.
Name: Improvised Shield

Description:
Fast. Play during your turn only if the final agenda is in play.
Draw 1 card, gain 1 resource, and gain 1 additional action. Remove End of the Road from the game.
Flavor: "So... should we turn around?"
Name: End of the Road

Description:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. Instead of this test's normal effects, discard the attacked or evaded enemy (if it is [[Elite]], automatically evade it and deal it 3 damage instead).
Name: Exploit Weakness

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Choose two skills ([willpower], [intellect], [combat], or [agility]). Until the end of the investigation phase, each investigator gets +1 to each of the chosen skills, and -1 to each other skill.
Flavor: There is a certain clarity in the grim mathematics of survival.
Name: Making Preparations

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, draw 1 card. Otherwise, you must decide (choose one): - Each unengaged enemy moves once toward the nearest investigator. - Each investigator disengages from each enemy engaged with them and moves once away from the nearest enemy.
Name: Predator or Prey

Description:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an investigation you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. You discover 1 additional clue at this location and 1 additional clue at any location.
Name: Shed a Light

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Choose an investigator and decide (choose one): - The chosen investigator must immediately take an action as if it were their turn, then discards 1 card at random from their hand. - The chosen investigator loses 1 action during their next turn, then draws 3 cards.
Name: At a Crossroads

Description:
Max 1 per turn.
Fast. Play when an investigator's turn would end.
That investigator may take X additional actions during their turn. X is the number of skill tests they failed during their turn. Exile Lifeline.
Name: Lifeline

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Reveal the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose an investigator to draw 1 of the revealed cards and discard the rest. Then, choose an investigator to discover 1 clue at any revealed location.
Name: Nature of the Beast

Description:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Gumption to any type of skill test.
While Gumption is committed to a skill test, that test gets -2 difficulty.
Flavor: "Now you listen here, mister!"
Name: Gumption

Description: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, either (choose one): - Return Baseball Bat to your hand after this attack. - This attack deals an additional +1 damage. Discard Baseball Bat after this attack.
Name: Baseball Bat

Description:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness card from the top of your deck, before resolving any of its effects, exhaust Katja Eastbank: Place that card facedown beneath her (limit 5 cards beneath her). Draw a new card to replace it.
[action]: Draw any card beneath Katja Eastbank.
Flavor: "Let's bookmark that for later."
Name: Katja Eastbank

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - Reveal the top card from each investigator's deck and place them in a pile. Repeat this two more times. Choose one of the three piles. Each investigator draws each of their cards from that pile. Shuffle each weakness in each other pile into its owner's deck. Remove each other revealed card from the game.
Name: Heed the Dream

Description: Choose an [[Item]] asset in your discard pile. Either (choose one): - Remove that asset from the game and gain resources equal to its cost. - Play that asset (paying its cost).
Flavor: You feel a bit discarded, too.
Name: Salvage

Description: Uses (3 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring, and if this test's difficulty is 0, you discover 1 additional clue.
Name: Old Keyring

Description: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator heals 3 damage and 3 horror. - Remove 1 doom from the current agenda. Each investigator takes 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror. Remove Fickle Fortune from the game.
Name: Fickle Fortune

Description: Customizable. Uses (4 aether). If Hyperphysical Shotcaster has no aether, discard it. [action] Spend 1 aether: Resolve the Manifest ability of the Hyperphysical Shotcaster's current form. [fast] Exhaust Hyperphysical Shotcaster: Change its form (to one you have unlocked on its upgrade sheet).
Name: Hyperphysical Shotcaster

Description:
Each attached asset takes up no slots and its text box is treated as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
[fast] Exhaust Tool Belt: Choose one - attach a [[Tool]] asset in your play area to Tool Belt, switch a [[Tool]] asset in your play area with an attached asset, or detach an attached asset.
Name: Tool Belt

Description:
As an additional cost to play Refine, spend an action.
Immediately mark a checkbox on an upgrade sheet for a customizable card you own, even if it is not in play.
Max once per game for each investigator.
Name: Refine

Description: Uses (4 supplies). [reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets -2 difficulty. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.
Name: Flashlight

Description:
Permanent. Exceptional.
For every point of damage and/or horror you heal in excess of an investigator's current damage/horror, place 1 resource on Soul Sanctification, as an offering. This still counts as healing.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 skill value for this test. (Limit twice per test.)
Name: Soul Sanctification

Description: [guardian] investigator only. Hunter. Spawn - Any connecting location. Lurker in the Dark can only be attacked or damaged using [[Weapon]] assets or [[Tactic]] events, and takes 1 fewer damage from each source.
Name: Lurker in the Dark

Description: [seeker] investigator only. As an additional cost to play Quantum Paradox, you must choose and discard 4 other cards from your hand. Forced - If Quantum Paradox is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 1 horror.
Name: Quantum Paradox

Description: [rogue] investigator only. As an additional cost to play Pay Your Due, you may spend any number of additional actions. Reduce its cost by 5 for each additional action spent. Forced - If Pay Your Due is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 1 damage.
Name: Pay Your Due

Description:
[mystic] investigator only.
Hunter.
The first time you reveal a chaos token while attacking or attempting to evade Ectoplasmic Horror, reveal an additional token for each empty arcane slot you have.
Name: Ectoplasmic Horror

Description:
[survivor] investigator only.
Play only if Underprepared is the only card in your hand and you have exactly 1 resource in your resource pool.
While Underprepared is in your hand, each card you commit to skill tests is considered to have 1 fewer matching skill icon.
Name: Underprepared

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: 1 (-3 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: 1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.
Name: Riddles and Rain

Description: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.
Flavor: Arriving in London, you patiently await your contact... but none arrives. Inspector Flint - or one of his proxies - was supposed to meet you at a quiet teahouse tucked away in a narrow storefront just outside Trafalgar Square. Wondering what could have gone wrong, and suspecting the worst, you set off to investigate.
Name: When It Rains...

Description: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.
Flavor: Your mind must be playing tricks on you. Misshapen figures dance through the dense London fog whenever the rain lets up. Are these distortions, like the one in the photograph Inspector Flint showed you? Or is it your quarry hiding in the mist and gloom?
Name: Figures in the Fog

Flavor: It is clear now that Inspector Flint's hunches were correct. The man in the red gloves is not operating alone, and whatever he is up to, it has something to do with the recent vanishings. You could wait to report what you have seen, but by then the man and his cohorts may have already put into motion whatever scheme the planning. No - you have only one choice. You must find the man with the red gloves, at all costs.
Name: The Connection

Flavor: Deep fog blots out the moonlight, bathing the city in utter darkness. From the rooftops, ravens watch your progress with inhuman intelligence. Every moving shadow sets your mind racing. If you don't find the man with the red gloves and stop his plans, who knows what he will do next?
Name: Plots and Panic

Description: Objective As a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance before the agenda advances.
Flavor: You draw your umbrella closer, using it to obscure your identity. Each person you pass on the street could be your contact... or be out to get you.
Name: Clues and Capers

Description: Objective Chase down the mysterious figure before the agenda advances. If an investigator engages The Red-Gloved Man, advance.
Flavor: You chase a shadow shrouded by night. It might as well be a needle in a haystack. But still you search, hoping for any clue that may lead you to the truth...
Name: The Game is Afoot!

Description: Objective Only investigators at the Tower of London may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Your gaze turns eastward, in the direction you last saw the man heading. Over the Tower Bridge lies the famed Tower of London, where even more eyes watch your approach, these belonging to a conspiracy of dark and brooding ravens. For what reason could he be heading there...?
Name: Eyes in the Tower

Description: The Red-Gloved Man gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to interrogate The Red-Gloved Man. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him." Objective - Stop The Red-Gloved Man from stealing The Eye of Ravens. If he is defeated, or if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere in these forgotten crypts, the man with the red gloves is searching for something... but for what purpose?
Name: Caught Red-Handed

Description: Rainy London Streets gets +X shroud. X is the current act number. Forced - If there are no clues on Rainy London Streets: Add clues to it until it has 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. [action]: Resign. "We should wait for Inspector Flint..."
Name: Rainy London Streets

Description: [fast]: Choose a concealed mini-card at Big Ben or a connecting location and test [agility] (2). If you succeed, look at the revealed side of that concealed mini-card (without exposing it). If you fail, take 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Big Ben

Description: [action]: Parley. Choose a location and test [willpower] (1) to ask around the abbey. For each point you succeed by, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at the chosen location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)
Name: Westminster Abbey

Description: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at Kensington Gardens: Heal 1 horror. Forced - After you expose an enemy at Kensington Gardens: Take 1 horror.
Name: Kensington Gardens

Description: [action]: "Maybe there is another way in..." Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5). If you succeed, put the set-aside Traitors' Gate location into play.
Flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
Name: The Tower Bridge

Description: [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (5). If you succeed, reveal the Tower of London. If you fail, take 1 damage.
Flavor: Finding a way in through here will be tricky, but if your hunch is right, you might be able to slip in without anyone suspecting your approach. You prepare yourself for an underwater excursion, hoping the gate wasn't fully blocked off...
Name: Traitors' Gate

Description: Forced - After you end your turn at the Tower of London: You must either lose 2 resources, or each enemy in the shadows attacks you.
Name: Tower of London

Description: [fast] While an investigator at Tower Prison is performing a skill test, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.
Name: Tower Prison

Description: Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Retaliate.
Flavor: "The only detail I could remember was his gloves; red, red as blood."
Name: The Red-Gloved Man

Description: Shift - During a skill test at your location, the performing investigator sets their base skill value for this test to 6. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #5-A19 / Subject Class: Yellow / Key appears as small red marble found lodged in eyesocket of deceased Coterie operative. Paradimensional capabilities unknown.
Name: The Eye of Ravens

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: 1 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: 1. You may take 1 damage. If you do not, a civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.
Name: Dead Heat

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains "Spawn - Random location."
Flavor: Everywhere you go, you have the distinct feeling of being followed, as though the shadows themselves move of their own accord. In nearby alleyways and backroads, you hear the gnashing of teeth and the tearing of meat. The palpable sense of unease only grows stronger as night falls.
Name: Gnashing Teeth

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains hunter and "Spawn - Random location."
Flavor: The city grows quieter as more and more civilians disappear each night. The soul-deadening heat of the day sees more hollow-eyed figures walk the streets. Once a thriving oasis of life and culture, Marrakesh now feels like an empty echo of its former self.
Name: Empty Streets

Description: Objective - At the end ot the round, investigators at a [[Ritual Site]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Strange happenings are afoot. A tomb robbery of an ancient philosopher. Rumors of the dead walking the streets. A string of disappearances. If you can gather information on Amaranth's whereabouts, you may be able to get to the bottom of things.
Name: Find Amaranth

Description: Forced - After a civilian is slain, if 4[per_investigator] or more civilians have been slain: Advance this act. Objective - If Amaranth would be defeated, advance.
Flavor: A network of necrous vines has grown through the city, spurred on by Amaranth. The woman with the red flower is conducting strange rites upon a stolen corpse in the Bahia Palace Gardens. You must stop her at any cost.
Name: Ritual of Life and Death

Description: Objective - If neither Amaranth nor Razin Farhi are in play, advance.
Flavor: Unnatural vines choke the city streets as Amaranth pursues you, drunk with power. The blossom in her hair stretches wide like a garnet maw as she laughs cruelly.
Name: Queen of Nothing at All

Description: [fast]: Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per turn.) [action]: Resign. You flee the city. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.) Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Name: Marrakesh Railway Station

Description: [action] If 1 or more civilians are on this location: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. You may play an asset from among those cards (paying its cost). Shuffle the rest into your deck. (Limit once per game.) Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square

Description: Saadian's Tombs gets +1 shroud for each civilian on it. Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters or spawns at Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Exhaust it. Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Name: Saadian's Tombs

Description: [fast] Choose a [[Risen]] enemy from the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you: Place clues on Tanneries (from the token pool) equal to that enemy's health. Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Name: Tanneries

Description: [reaction] After you rescue a civilian on Bahia Palace Gardens: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
Name: Bahia Palace Gardens

Description: As an additional cost for you to move out of Marrakesh Railway Station, you must spend 1 resource. [action]: Resign. You run for your life. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.)
Name: Marrakesh Railway Station

Description: While you are at Jemaa el-Fnaa Square, increase the cost of each asset you play by 2.
Flavor: Stalls and tables are tipped over and merchandize is ruined. The entire square is devoid of both patrons and merchants. You won't be buying anything here anytime soon.
Name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square

Description: Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Heal all damage from it.
Flavor: Do the risen throngs still fear the tombs? Or do they merely resent death?
Name: Saadian's Tombs

Description: Each [[Risen]] enemy at Tanneries gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
Flavor: You watch the risen intentionally submerge themselves into pools of chemicals and swallow great mouthfuls of the foul liquid. Amaranth's power can only stave off decomposition so long. Perhaps this strange ritual preserves their rotting tissue.
Name: Tanneries

Description: Forced - When you end your turn at Bahia Palace Gardens: Take 1 damage or 1 horror.
Flavor: "Man selects only for his own good: Nature only for that of the being which she tends." -- Charles Darwin, The Origin of Species
Name: Bahia Palace Gardens

Description: The civilians of Marrakesh are under attack! By getting them out of harm's way, you may be able to avert a massacre. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) [action] Spend 1 clue: Rescue a civilian from your location (place it on this card). Forced - When the game ends: flip this card (keep all tokens on it).
Flavor: A piercing howl resounds through the dusty streets, accompanied by the sound of feeding. Bystanders flee packs of the hungry dead as you traverse the city. All around you is the scent of rot and blood. Only you can save the people of this city from a terrible fate.
Name: Save the Civilians

Description: Hunter. Forced - When damage or horror from Amaranth's attack is assigned to an asset: Defeat that asset and Amaranth shifts each of her attached keys.
Flavor: "Many say they would do anything for love. But I actually mean it."
Name: Amaranth

Description: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After any key is shifted: If Razin Farhi is exhausted, read him. Otherwise, he makes an immediate attack against the engaged investigator.
Flavor: "I have not crossed vast oceans of time only to be defeated by the likes of you!"
Name: Razin Farhi

Description:
The first copy of Thrall drawn each round gains surge.
[fast] During your turn: Attempt to evade Thrall. It gains alert for this evasion attempt. (Limit once per turn).
Flavor: With dim light and thick clothing they can clumsily pass for living, but by daylight their unnatural pallor, glassy eyes, and gruesome wounds are impossible to hide.
Name: Thrall

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Ancient Raider attacks you: 1 civilian at your location is slain.
Flavor: The former vanguard of Razin Farhi, these soldiers now serve Amaranth with an unnatural fervor.
Name: Ancient Raider

Description: Hunter. Forced - After Khalid enters play: Move each other non-[[Elite]] enemy and civilian from its location to a connecting location (distributed as evenly as possible).
Flavor: "They say cats have nine lives, but my sweet Khalid is already on his tenth."
Name: Khalid

Description: Revelation - Put Famine into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Famine from play.
Flavor: Those that ate the blighted crop died even faster than those who chose to starve.
Name: Famine

Description: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, either (choose one): - 1 civilian at your location is slain. - Take 1 damage for each point you fail by.
Flavor: Although the risen move slowly, they hunt like wolves, surrounding their prey before they pounce.
Name: Cornered!

Description: Shift - Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from each investigator at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #11-B31 / Subject Class: Red / Key appears as flora of extraterrestrial origin, with long, black prehnsile vines that attach intravenously with host.
Name: The Last Blossom

Description: Easy / Standard [skull]: X. X is the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: 5. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: 1. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).
Name: Sanguine Shadows

Description: Forced - At the start of the game, or after the agenda deck resets: Set the amount of doom on this agenda to 1 [per_investigator]. Forced - After you expose a decoy: La Chica Roja attacks you. (Hint - when this agenda advances, La Chica Roja will collect one of the pieces she seeks!)
Flavor: La Chica Roja is stealing pieces divided up from an old art collection, which you believe are parts of an ancient Key.
Name: Where is She...?

Description: Objective Expose the thief's whereabouts. If an investigator engages La Chica Roja, advance.
Flavor: Thanks to Officer Bol鱈var, you believe you know which buildings might hold the pieces La Chica Roja is after. All that is left is to catch her in the act.
Name: The Scarlet Shadow

Description: La Chica Roja gains: "[action] Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (6) to outsmart the thief. You may spend 1 clue to reduce this test's difficulty by 2. If you fail, La Chica Roja attacks you." Objective If La Chica Roja would be defeated, instead advance. Objective - If an investigator successfully parleys with La Chica Roja, advance.
Flavor: You finally have her in your sights!
Name: In the Searchlight

Description: If your difficulty level is... - ...Easy, X is 2. - ...Standard, X is 3. - ...Hard, X is 4. - ...Expert, X is 5. [action]: Resign. Looks like La Chica Roja wins this game.
Name: Avenida de Mayo

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [intellect](4) to observe the staff. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Name: Casa Rosada

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [agility](4) to watch the rooftops of the cathedral. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Name: Catedral Metropolitana

Description: [action] Spend X clues and take X horror: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).
Name: Cementario de la Recoleta

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [combat](4) to break into the mansion. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Name: Palacio Err叩zuriz

Description: [fast]: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). Then, draw the top card of the encounter deck. You may spend 2 clues to cancel this card's effects and discard it.
Name: The Cabildo

Description: Spend X clues and thrice as many resources: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).
Name: Banco de la Provincia

Description: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [willpower](4) to stake out the rafters of the opera house. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.
Name: Teatro Col坦n

Description: Concealed 5. Forced - When an investigator engaged with La Chica Roja moves: Disengage her from that investigator.
Flavor: "Think out your plan like a woman of action. Then act out your plan like a woman of thought."
Name: La Chica Roja

Description:
Hunter.
While attacking Bound Nightgaunt, double the negative modifier of each revealed chaos token.
Flavor: "He had learned that they are bound by solemn treaties..."-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath"
Name: Bound Nightgaunt

Description: Peril. Surge. Revelation - If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you may expose it. If an enemy's mini-card would be exposed by this effect, instead flip it back over and shuffle it facedown with the concealed mini-cards at your location.
Name: Cat and Mouse

Description: Revelation - Attach to a location without a target, and without a copy of Calling Card attached. While Calling Card is in play, clues cannot be spent (at any location). [reaction] After you successfully investigate attached location by 2 or more: Discard Calling Card. Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at any location (without exposing it).
Name: Calling Card

Description: Revelation - Test [intellect](4). If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the agenda to advance. - The nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you.
Flavor: "Better luck next time!"
Name: Outsmarted

Description: Forced - After a decoy is exposed: Place 1 doom on this agenda. Forced When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. Objective - If the Sanguine Watcher is defeated, advance.
Flavor: Scarlet light drowns the city. Somewhere, La Chica Roja's rival lies in wait, hoping to claim the final pieces of the Key for himself.
Name: Seeing Red

Description: Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Sanguine Watcher is ready: Each investigator must either take 2 damage or 2 horror.
Flavor: "You dare get in my way, girl?"
Name: The Sanguine Watcher

Description: Concealed 4. Forced - After Apportioned Ka is exposed: Deal 5 damage to the Sanguine Watcher. Return Apportioned Ka to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword, distributing those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each non-[[Central]] location without a target.
Name: Apportioned Ka

Description: Shift - Discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #16-D25 / Subject Class: Green / Once assembled, Key appears as small statuette of unidentified woman, weeping trandimensional, red flue ("tears?") of unknown origin.
Name: The Weeping Lady

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: X. X is the highest number of clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play, to a maximum of 3. (If it is act 3, X is 3.)
[cultist]: 5. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -1.
[tablet]: 3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Name: Dealings in the Dark

Description: Each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy gains concealed 1. Forced - After you evade a [[Cultist]] enemy, return it to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword: Take control of 1 of its clues.
Flavor: The cult operating in Istanbul is secretive and deadly, with eyes everywhere and ears in every dark corner of the city.
Name: Agents of the Dark

Description: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at any location(s), possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)
Flavor: According to Ms. ahin, the talisman has been hidden somewhere in the city for many hundreds of years. You must not let it fall into the cult's hands!
Name: Search for the Manuscript

Description: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at the location designated as the east gate, possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)
Flavor: According to the manuscript, the talisman was discovered somewhat recently by a third party, and brought to the Grand Bazaar as a valuable item to be sold. You can't let that happen!
Name: Search for the Talisman

Description: Objective - "Get this thing out of here!" If an investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, you may proceed to (R1) (page 25). Objective - "Don't let them get away with the Key!" If an enemy with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, or if the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is defeated, proceed to (R6) (page 25).
Name: The Chase

Description: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy: Flip them to their clue side. If an enemy has more than 3 clues on it, move the clues in excess of 3 to Clues Unveiled, below. The number of clues possessed by the cult is equal to the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play plus the number of clues on Clues Unveiled, below.
Name: The Unveiling

Description: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.
Flavor: With the Foundation's travel documents, you should be able to charter a ship out of the city with ease.
Name: Galata Docks

Description: [fast] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Expose a concealed mini-card at any location. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Galata

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Obelisk of Theodosius: Move 1 of your clues to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Name: Obelisk of Theodosius

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Clues Unveiled. (Max one success per game.)
Name: Istanbul University

Description: Hagia Sophia gets +3 shroud for each study token on it. [action]: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Hagia Sophia (from the token pool). Place 1 resource on Hagia Sophia (also from the token pool), as a study token.
Name: Hagia Sophia

Description: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at this location by 2.
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: While you are at this location, treat the text box of each [[Weapon]] asset you control as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [fast]: Parley. Take control of 1 clue from a [[Cultist]] enemy at this location. Then, return that enemy to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: Forced - After you expose a decoy at this location: Move 1 clue from this location to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: Forced - When you would move out of this location: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either lose 1 action or cancel the effects of the move.
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [reaction] After you move to this location from a connecting location: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, move again. Forced - After an enemy moves to this location via hunter or patrol: Resolve that keyword again.
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, you may play a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 for each point you succeeded by (to a minimum of 0).
Name: Grand Bazaar

Description: [fast] Exhaust Ece ahin: Look at the top card of any investigator's deck. If it is not a weakness, you may place it facedown beneath Ece Sahin (limit 5 cards beneath her). Forced - After any key is shifted: The owner of each card beneath Ece ahin draws that card.
Flavor: "Why do you suppose the keys have not been erased?"
Name: Ece ahin

Description: Hunter. Forced - When Umbral Harbinger is dealt damage: Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to it.
Flavor:
"Trouble with memory. I see things I never knew before. Other worlds and other galaxies.. Dark. The lightning seems dark and the darkness seems light.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Umbral Harbinger

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (A)

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (B)

Description: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.
Flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
Name: Sinister Aspirant (C)

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 horror and Shadowed gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you fail, take 2 horror.
Name: Shadowed

Description: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 damage and Accosted gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, take 2 damage.
Name: Accosted

Description: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy in play with the highest evade. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror. If the investigators possess more clues than the cult, or if it is act 3, resolve this revelation ability a second time.
Name: Light Out of Void

Description: Shift - Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw 1 of those cards and shuffle the rest back into your deck. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #21-F30 / Subject Class: Red / Key is a trapezohedron-shaped crystal of unknown mineral, roughly 19 cm in length, impervious to both matter and light.
Name: The Twisted Antiprism

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: X. X is the number of enemies in the shadows (max 3).
[cultist]: 4. If you fail, put a decoy into play at your location, flip it over, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location facedown.
[tablet]: 3. If you fail, set each non-weakness card committed to this test aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[elder_thing]: 1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, either take 1 damage or treat this token's modifier as 3.
Name: Dancing Mad

Description: Forced If there are 5 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 3 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Flavor: A gentle patter of rain gives the moonless night a somber, moody ambience. Distant music and conversation drift on the wind, accompanied by a light drizzle.
Name: Silence Speaks

Description: Forced If there are 4 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 2 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Flavor: Being hunted by the Coterie was bad enough; now you worry any random object you pass on the street, or even the sky itself, could simply swallow you whole, never to be seen or heard from again.
Name: Easy Prey

Description: Forced If there are 3 [per_investigator] or more set-aside hollows: Choose and remove 1 [per_investigator] of them from the game and place 1 doom on this agenda. This effect may cause this agenda to advance.
Flavor: The city is alive. Not alive in its usual sense - music and revelry and glamor - but truly, disturbingly alive. The streets shift under your feet, walls undulating as though breathing, windows glaring at you from afar. Sweat beads on your forehead. Is this all real? Or just paranoia?
Name: A Betrayal of Eyes

Description: [action]: Resign. "The deal's off!" You leave Desi and his crew to their fate. Forced - If Desiderio Delgado lvarez leaves play: Set him aside, out of play. Each investigator takes 1 horror.
Flavor: You and Desi are looking into the disappearances taking place in Havana. It has to be the work of the creatures you were investigating back in London. But they haven't been forgotten yet - maybe there is a way to bring them back?
Name: False Step (v. I)

Description: [reaction] When an investigator would resolve an enemy's concealed X keyword, spend X clues, as a group: Spawn it engaged with that investigator instead. [action]: Resign. You leave Desi and his crew to their fate. Objective - If there are no enemies in the shadows, investigators may spend the requisite clues to advance.
Flavor: Wait - what in the world just happened? That entity touched Desi and assumed his form. Is that what has been happening to Desi's crew? You have to find him before it finishes the job!
Name: False Colors (v. I)

Description: Forced At the end of the enemy phase: Deal X total damage to investigators at Caf辿 Luna, divided as they wish. X is the number of enemies in the shadows. [reaction] After a [[Coterie]] enemy takes any amount of damage: Discover half that many clues at Caf辿 Luna (rounded down).
Flavor: Negotiations didn't go so well after all.
Name: False Step (v. II)

Description: [action] As a group, investigators at your location place clues they control on a [[Coterie]] enemy at your location equal to that enemy's remaining health: Parley. You gain some insight into the situation. Remove all doom from that enemy and automatically evade it. [action]: Resign. "I thought we had a deal!" You get out of the city while you still can. Objective Discover why your contacts are after you. If there are 4 [per_investigator] total clues among enemies in play, advance.
Flavor: Desi and his crew are pursuing and attacking you everywhere you go! But why?
Name: False Colors (v. II)

Description: Each copy of Desiderio Delgado lvarez loses concealed X, loses hunter, gains aloof, and gains the following ability: "[action]: Parley. Check the Campaign Log. If the cell knows Desi's past, you ask a question only he can answer. Look at the other side of this enemy." Objective If either copy of Desiderio Delgado lvarez is defeated, advance. (Do not look at its other side.)
Flavor: You arrive just in time to see two exact replicas of Desiderio embroiled in a deadly battle for the fate of his identity. In the midst of this chaos, it's impossible to tell which is which. There is no time to study their mannerisms. You have to act!
Name: False Light

Flavor: Desi's bar offers a variety of drinks and a rich, wild nightlife for both locals and tourists from the States looking to escape the tight grip of Prohibition... or, at least, it used to, before he and his guns shot the place to hell. What in the world is going on here?
Name: Caf辿 Luna

Description: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at El Malec坦n: Expose another concealed mini-card at El Malec坦n. (Group limit once per round.)
Flavor: A patter of drizzling rain sets a somber mood as you scour the Malec坦n for any trace of Desi's crew.
Name: El Malec坦n

Description: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Jardines de la Tropical by 3 or more: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it. Forced After you fail by 3 or more while investigating Jardines de la Tropical: Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Name: Jardines de la Tropical

Description: [fast] During your turn, spend 2 resources: Reduce Gran Teatro de La Habana's shroud by 2 until the end of your turn. (Limit once per turn.)
Name: Gran Teatro de La Habana

Description: [action]: Investigate. Instead of discovering clues, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at Miramar Yacht Club. For every 2 points you succeed by, look at the revealed side of an additional concealed mini-card at Miramar Yacht Club.
Flavor: Desi's crew sure know how to live it up.
Name: Miramar Yacht Club

Description: [fast] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at Plaza Hotel or at a connecting location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Plaza Hotel

Description: Alert. Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Retaliate. Desiderio Delgado lvarez gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced When Desiderio Delgado lvarez takes damage during act 1 or 2: Instead, automatically evade him. [reaction] After Desiderio Delgado lvarez is evaded by 2 or more and there is another copy of him at your location, that copy deals this one 2 damage.
Name: Desiderio Delgado lvarez

Description: Alert. Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Retaliate. Desiderio Delgado lvarez gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced When Desiderio Delgado lvarez takes damage during act 1 or 2: Instead, automatically evade him. [reaction] After Desiderio Delgado lvarez is evaded by 2 or more and there is another copy of him at your location, that copy deals this one 2 damage.
Name: Desiderio Delgado lvarez

Description: Revelation Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset you control and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow (if you cannot, take 2 horror instead).
Flavor: A false facsimile? Or a paradimensional plot?
Name: Body Snatched

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: X. X is the number of [[Hazard]] treacheries in play.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[tablet]: 2 (-5 instead if Void Chimera is at your location).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
Name: On Thin Ice

Flavor: The prospector's journal described a horrifying predator. Some call the thing stalking the woods a beast, some call it a spirit, and others know it as a shapeshifter. Describing the thing seems to fill each witness with a primal, unspeakable terror.
Name: Lost and Forgotten

Flavor: As you explore the region, you cannot shake the feeling that you are being watched. It as though a thousand eyes are staring directly at you... or perhaps through you. The surrounding forest is filled with a deafening silence.
Name: Eyes of the Void

Flavor: The landscape around you is being actively devoured, stolen from existence and memory. A feeling of numbness spreads through you as you stare at the fading wilderness. An uncanny sense that you are losing your grip on reality nags at the edge of your mind.
Name: Annihilation

Description: Objective Only investigators at the Condemned Gold Mine may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
Flavor: Thorne may have a head start in their search for the Sable Glass, but you have something they don't: Rhett Landry's journal. If you can reach the prospector's gold mine before the Coterie, you may be able to keep the Key out of their hands.
Name: Quest for the Sable Glass

Description: [action] If your location has the [[Wilderness]] trait and investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 resource on your location, as a scouting report. (Limit 1 scouting report per [[Wilderness]] location.) Objective - You may advance at the end of any round. (Hint: You will lure out the predator when you advance. Advance when you believe you are prepared.)
Flavor: Thorne said they were trying to track the predator in these woods. Although the beast leaves no trace, you can surely scout the surrounding area before luring it out.
Name: If It Bleeds...

Description: Objective After Void Chimera (True Form) is exposed, advance the act.
Flavor: The shifting, chimeric form of the paradimensional beast flits in and out of view. It is playing games with you, much like a cat plays with a mouse. If you can expose its true form, perhaps you can turn the game on its head and banish it once and for all.
Name: Prowling Nightmare

Description: The location where Void Chimera (True Form) was exposed is connected to Outsiders' Lair (but not vice versa.) Objective If Void Chimera (True Form) is defeated, advance the act.
Flavor: Your prey has trapped you in its own lair. The alien beast unveils itself in all its otherworldly grandeur, looming over you in myriad, amorphous forms.
Name: Last Stand

Description: [action]: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it. (Limit once per round.) [action]: Resign. "I thought Alaska was supposed to be nice this time of year!"
Name: Anchorage

Description: [reaction] When an investigator at Fairbanks draws a [[Hazard]] treachery: Spend 2 resources to cancel that treachery's effects and discard it.
Flavor:
All around me I sensed a queer coldness in the demeanor of my neighbors, my friends.
 - Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
Name: Fairbanks

Description: Forced - After you enter Mountain Stream: Test [intellect] or [agility] (1). If you fail, take 1 damage. Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Mountain Stream: Put the 3 set-aside Outer Wilderness locations into play adjacent to it.
Flavor: Crossing the cracking ice is incredibly dangerous, but you have little other choice.
Name: Mountain Stream

Description: Forced - After an investigator at this location reveals a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol during a skill test they are performing: They must either choose and discard 1 card from their hand, or take 1 horror.
Name: Frozen Lake

Description: The first [[Hazard]] treachery revealed by an investigator at this location each round gains surge.
Flavor: The silence of the vast listening forest stole forward and enveloped them. - Algernon Blackwood, The Wendigo
Name: Isolated Road

Description: [action]: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)
Flavor: While hardly large enough to qualify as a town, this small settlement feels like a bastion of comfort after days on end of trying wilderness.
Name: Forgotten Outpost

Description: Forced - When you reveal Hunter's Lodge: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to talk the hunter down. If you fail, take 1 damage. Forced - When a [[Monster]] enemy enters this location: Deal 1 damage to it.
Flavor: And here you thought the Outsiders were the dangerous ones.
Name: Hunter's Lodge

Description: [action]: Reveal 1 random chaos token from the chaos bag plus 1 additional token for each depletion token on Condemned Gold Mine. If you did not reveal any [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbols in this way, gain 4 resources and place 1 resource (from the token pool) on Condemned Gold Mine, as a depletion token.
Name: Condemned Gold Mine

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Thorne gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After a [[Hazard]] treachery is drawn: Thorne shifts each of their attached keys. Forced - When Thorne is defeated: If The Sable Glass is attached to Thorne, attach it to any investigator, under that investigator's control.
Name: Thorne

Description: Concealed 4. Massive. You cannot expose any concealed mini-cards while one of Void Chimera's other forms is in play. Forced - After you expose one of Void Chimera's decoys: Find the set-aside version of Void Chimera with the matching subtitle and spawn it at your location.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Patrol ([[Wilderness]] location with the most investigators). Retaliate. Void Chimera (Fellbeak) gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
Flavor: The beast's exquisite plumage is quite literally stunning.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Alert. Hunter. Void Chimera (Earsplitter) gets +1 [per_investigator] health.
Flavor: The beast's carapace rattles with an unsettling hiss. While much of the sound lies beyond the scope of your hearing, its eerie resonance shakes you to your core.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) attacks you: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow, and heal damage from Void Chimera (Gorefeaster) equal to that hollow's printed cost.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Void Chimera (Fellhound) gets +1 [per_investigator] health. While you are attacking or attempting to evade Void Chimera (Fellhound), if you own any set-aside hollows, it gains alert and retaliate.
Name: Void Chimera

Description: Hunter. Retaliate. Spawn - Nearest [[Wilderness]] location. Ravenous Grizzly cannot enter non-[[Wilderness]] locations. While Ravenous Grizzly is moving, it skips over connecting non-[[Wilderness]] locations.
Name: Ravenous Grizzly

Description: Revelation - Put Cracking Ice into play next to the agenda deck. Then, if there are 3 or more copies of Cracking Ice next to the agenda deck, discard them all and each investigator at a [[Wilderness]] location tests [agility] (4). Each investigator who fails must take 1 damage, take 1 horror, or lose 1 action for each point they failed by.
Name: Cracking Ice

Description: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you and each asset with health you control takes 1 direct damage.
Flavor: If you hear that soft roar approaching, it's already too late.
Name: Snowslide

Description: Shift - Look at the revealed side of each concealed mini-card at your location (without exposing them). Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #33-K31 / Subject Class: Green / Subject is a warped lens of indeterminate translucent material. Layer appears as window to other layers when viewed through lens.
Name: The Sable Glass

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: 1 (-3 instead if you are at a location with a Key Locus).
[cultist]: 3. If you fail, either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or place 1 doom on the nearest Key Locus or [[Locus Site]] location.
[tablet]: 2. If this is an attack against an enemy with patrol, after this attack, it disengages and resolves its patrol keyword.
[elder_thing]: -2. For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource (max 3).
Name: Dogs of War

Description: Each enemy loses hunter and gains patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). While there are no other Key Locuses in play, The Claret Knight counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities. When checking the doom threshold, doom on cards other than this agenda subtract from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Objective - Defend the Knight! If The Claret Knight is defeated, advance this agenda.
Flavor: The Beast is coming to claim its due...
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. I)

Description: While there are no other Key Locuses in play, The Bourse counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities.
Flavor: You've refused the offer of the Coterie agent who appears to control things in Alexandria, and instead teamed up with a local Foundation operative, Hossam Sirry, who hopes to see the Coterie ousted from the city. With any luck, you can claim the Key here for yourself as well, killing two birds with one stone.
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. II)

Description: While there are no other Key Locuses in play, Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa counts as a Key Locus for the purpose of card abilities.
Flavor: In your pursuit of Alexandria's Key, you are on the trail of the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson, a Coterie member so dangerous and chaotic, even the rest of the Coterie fears its wrath. Its bloody rampage has sent the entire city into a state of terror.
Name: Brewing Catastrophe (v. III)

Description: During the "enemies attack" step of the enemy phase, in addition to their standard attacks, each ready enemy attacks each Key Locus at its location as if it were an engaged investigator. Horror dealt by these attacks is dealt as damage, instead. Objective - Defend the Key and hold out for as long as you can. (The agenda represents how long you must defend it. You will be instructed when to advance.)
Flavor: You've agreed to help The Claret Knight and his enforcers defend his Key from another member of the Coterie - the Beast in a Cowl of Crimson.
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. I)

Description: Objective - If The Claret Knight is defeated, or if an investigator controls The Light of Pharos, advance.
Flavor:
"The Bourse is their base of operations," Agent Sirry summarizes what you know before you put your plan into action. "If we're going to confront the Coterie, we have to first destroy the Key Locuses scattered around the city. Otherwise, we don't stand a chance."
You nod, recalling what the Claret Knight told you earlier. If you can find and destroy these locuses, you can enter The Bourse once more.
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. II)

Description: Objective - If The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson is defeated, or if an investigator controls The Light of Pharos, advance.
Flavor: Somewhere in the city, the Beast dwells in its lair, sending its devotees to the streets to spill blood and kidnap victims to feast upon. If you are to stop this bloodbath, you'll have to first destroy the Key Locuses scattered around the city which protect the Beast's lair. Only then can you retrieve the Key it has stolen and drive the Beast from Alexandria.
Name: Rabbits Who Run (v. III)

Description:
Unless The Claret Knight is the only Key Locus in play, enemies cannot enter The Bourse (if an enemy would spawn here, spawn it at a connecting location instead).
[action] Investigators at The Bourse spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove 1 doom from any location or from an asset you control. Any player may trigger this ability.
Name: The Bourse

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group, to place 1 resource on the Light of Pharos. Then, if there are 3 resources on the Light of Pharos, choose an investigator at this location to take control of it.
Name: The Bourse

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, gain 4 resources. You may reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you do, gain 2 fewer resources if you succeed. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: The Bourse

Description:
While you are at Windsor Palace Hotel...
- ...if there is a Key Locus here, increase the cost of each [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you play by 1.
- ...if there is no Key Locus here, reduce the cost of each [[Item]] or [[Ally]] asset you play by 1.
Name: Windsor Palace Hotel

Description: [reaction] When you would draw exactly 1 card from your deck while you are at Victoria College: Instead, look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 to draw, and shuffle the other back into your deck. (Limit once per round.)
Name: Victoria College

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Qaitbay Citadel: You cannot discover clues or expose concealed mini-cards at Qaitbay Citadel for the remainder of the round.
Name: Qaitbay Citadel

Description: Forced - After The Corniche is successfully investigated: Increase the difficulty of each other test performed at The Corniche this round by 2.
Name: The Corniche

Description: Forced - When you fight an enemy while at Zen'et el Settat: You must either spend 1 action or increase that enemy's fight by 2 for this attack.
Name: Zen'et el Settat

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, investigators at this location may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to place 1 resource on the Light of Pharos. Then, if there are 3 resources on the Light of Pharos, choose an investigator at this location to take control of it.
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: [action]: Test [willpower] (6). If you succeed, automatically evade The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson (regardless of its current location). (Group limit once per game.)
Flavor: The interior of the necropolis is covered in scorch marks and lined with streaks of dried blood. What in the hell happend here....?
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, draw 3 cards. You may reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you do, draw 1 fewer card if you succeed. (Group limit once per round.)
Name: Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa

Description: You may attack Key Locus as if it were an enemy with 4 fight. [action] Spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to Key Locus. Forced - If Key Locus is defeated: Add it to the victory display.
Name: Key Locus

Description: Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Claret Knight's location, if he is ready: He shifts each of his attached keys.
Flavor: "I do not involve myself in the matters of mice."
Name: The Claret Knight

Description: Patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). Retaliate. Forced - When The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from it, exhaust it, and move it to Catacboms of Kom el Shoqafa, unengaged.
Name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson

Description:
Alert. Hunter. Retaliate.
Scarlet Beast gets +2 fight and -2 evade while it is at a [[Locus Site]] location.
Flavor: A creature of crimson, fueled by blood and instinct. It snarls and eyes you as one might a delicious meal.
Name: Scarlet Beast

Description: Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with a Key Locus). Spawn - Nearest location with a Key Locus. While Coterie Provocateur is ready, investigators at its location cannot attack anything with a title other than Coterie Provocateur.
Name: Coterie Provocateur

Description: Revelation - Attach Locus Pulse to the nearest location with a Key Locus. Each investigator at that location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Forced - If there is no Key Locus at attached location: Discard Locus Pulse.
Name: Locus Pulse

Description: Shift - Play a card from your hand, at -3 cost. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.
Flavor: File #38-N31 / Subject Class: Yellow / Subject is a crystalline container filled with rippling liquid of unknown origin. Key emits sapphire light and is warm to the touch.
Name: The Light of Pharos

Description:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: X. X is half the number of charges on The Shade Reaper, rounded up (X cannot be greater than 6).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail by 2 or more, place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper.
[tablet]: 1. If you are at a location with a [[Geist]] enemy, reveal an additional chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. You may place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper to treat this token's modifier as 0 instead.
Name: Shades of Suffering

Flavor: The city buzzes with spiritual activity. Empty halls resound with footsteps, phantom knocks, voiceless whispers. Some deep pain in this city longs to be known. A wordless dread fills the silence and pervades every moment.
Name: Painful History

Description: If there is only one investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold. Forced - When you engage Tzu San Niang: Investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group. If they cannot, draw the top card of the encounter deck instead. (Hint: When this agenda advances, Tzu San Niang will harvest a nearby spirit if her location is unknown!)
Flavor: The sense that you are not alone grows, and the spirits' wordless screams fill your mind. An oily fog rolls in to choke the streets of Kuala Lumpur in a ghostly aura.
Name: Restless Dead

Description: Each [[Geist]] enemy gain hunter and retaliate and cannot be flipped over. Forced - When doom is placed on this agenda: Remove 1 [[Geist]] enemy from beneath Tzu San Niang and spawn it faceup at her location.
Flavor: Tzu San Niang smiles sweetly as she bears down on you. Behind her, a massive shadow moves of its own accord, writhing in fulminant patterns on the wall. "This will be quick," she coos.
Name: Fear The Reaper

Description: Objective Find Tzu San Niang before the agenda advances. When you engage Tzu San Niang, investigators must spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. If they cannot, return her to the shadows and resolve her concealed keyword.
